He calleth you that He may forgive you your sins and reprieve you unto an appointed term. They said: Ye are but mortals like us, who would fain turn us away from what our fathers used to worship. Then bring some clear warrant.

translations.SAHIH: Their messengers said to them, "We are only men like you, but Allāh confers favor upon whom He wills of His servants. It has never been for us to bring you evidence except by permission of Allāh. And upon Allāh let the believers rely.
translations.PICKTHALL: Their messengers said unto them: We are but mortals like you, but Allah giveth grace unto whom He will of His slaves. It is not ours to bring you a warrant unless by the permission of Allah. In Allah let believers put their trust!

translations.SAHIH: And why should we not rely upon Allāh while He has guided us to our [good] ways. And we will surely be patient against whatever harm you should cause us. And upon Allāh let those who would rely [indeed] rely."
translations.PICKTHALL: How should we not put our trust in Allah when He hath shown us our ways? We surely will endure the hurt ye do us. In Allah let the trusting put their trust.

translations.SAHIH: And those who disbelieved said to their messengers, "We will surely drive you out of our land, or you must return to our religion." So their Lord inspired to them, "We will surely destroy the wrongdoers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who disbelieved said unto their messengers: Verily we will drive you out from our land, unless ye return to our religion. Then their Lord inspired them, (saying): Verily we shall destroy the wrong-doers,

translations.SAHIH: And We will surely cause you to dwell in the land after them. That is for he who fears My position1 and fears My threat."
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily We shall make you to dwell in the land after them. This is for him who feareth My Majesty and feareth My threats.

translations.SAHIH: And they requested decision [i.e., victory from Allāh], and disappointed, [therefore], was every obstinate tyrant.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they sought help (from their Lord) and every froward potentate was bought to naught;

translations.SAHIH: Before him1 is Hell, and he will be given a drink of purulent water.2
translations.PICKTHALL: Hell is before him, and he is made to drink a festering water,

translations.SAHIH: He will gulp it but will hardly [be able to] swallow it. And death will come to him from everywhere, but he is not to die. And before him is a massive punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: Which he sippeth but can hardly swallow, and death cometh unto him from every side while yet he cannot die, and before him is a harsh doom.

translations.SAHIH: The example of those who disbelieve in their Lord is [that] their deeds are like ashes which the wind blows forcefully on a stormy day; they are unable [to keep] from what they earned a [single] thing. That is what is extreme error.
translations.PICKTHALL: A similitude of those who disbelieve in their Lord: Their works are as ashes which the wind bloweth hard upon a stormy day. They have no control of aught that they have earned. That is the extreme failure.

translations.SAHIH: Have you not seen [i.e., considered] that Allāh created the heavens and the earth in truth? If He wills, He can do away with you and produce a new creation.
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou not seen that Allah hath created the heavens and the earth with truth? If He will, He can remove you and bring (in) some new creation;

translations.SAHIH: And that is not difficult for Allāh.
translations.PICKTHALL: And that is no great matter for Allah.

translations.SAHIH: And they will come out [for judgement] before Allāh all together, and the weak will say to those who were arrogant, "Indeed, we were your followers, so can you avail us anything against the punishment of Allāh?" They will say, "If Allāh had guided us, we would have guided you. It is all the same for us whether we show intolerance or are patient: there is for us no place of escape."
translations.PICKTHALL: They all come forth unto their Lord. Then those who were despised say unto those who were scornful: We were unto you a following, can ye then avert from us aught of Allah's doom? They say: Had Allah guided us, we should have guided you. Whether we rage or patiently endure is (now) all one for us; we have no place of refuge.

translations.SAHIH: And Satan will say when the matter has been concluded, "Indeed, Allāh had promised you the promise of truth. And I promised you, but I betrayed you. But I had no authority over you except that I invited you, and you responded to me. So do not blame me; but blame yourselves. I cannot be called to your aid, nor can you be called to my aid. Indeed, I deny your association of me [with Allāh] before.1 Indeed, for the wrongdoers is a painful punishment."
translations.PICKTHALL: And Satan saith, when the matter hath been decided: Lo! Allah promised you a promise of truth; and I promised you, then failed you. And I had no power over you save that I called unto you and ye obeyed me. So blame not, but blame yourselves. I cannot help you, nor can ye help me, Lo! I disbelieved in that which ye before ascribed to me. Lo! for wrong-doers is a painful doom.

translations.SAHIH: And those who believed and did righteous deeds will be admitted to gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein by permission of their Lord; and their greeting therein will be, "Peace!"
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who believed and did good works are made to enter Gardens underneath which rivers flow, therein abiding by permission of their Lord, their greeting therein: Peace!

translations.SAHIH: Have you not considered how Allāh presents an example, [making] a good word like a good tree, whose root is firmly fixed and its branches [high] in the sky?
translations.PICKTHALL: Seest thou not how Allah coineth a similitude: A goodly saying, as a goodly tree, its root set firm, its branches reaching into heaven,

translations.SAHIH: It produces its fruit all the time, by permission of its Lord. And Allāh presents examples for the people that perhaps they will be reminded.
translations.PICKTHALL: Giving its fruit at every season by permission of its Lord? Allah coineth the similitudes for mankind in order that they may reflect.

translations.SAHIH: And the example of a bad word is like a bad tree, uprooted from the surface of the earth, not having any stability.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the similitude of a bad saying is as a bad tree, uprooted from upon the earth, possessing no stability.

translations.SAHIH: Allāh keeps firm those who believe, with the firm word,1 in worldly life and in the Hereafter.2 And Allāh sends astray the wrongdoers. And Allāh does what He wills.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah confirmeth those who believe by a firm saying in the life of the world and in the Hereafter, and Allah sendeth wrong-doers astray. And Allah doeth what He will.

translations.SAHIH: Have you not considered those who exchanged the favor of Allāh for disbelief1 and settled their people [in] the home of ruin?
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou not seen those who gave the grace of Allah in exchange for thanklessness and led their people down to the Abode of Loss,

translations.SAHIH: [It is] Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the settlement.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Even to) hell? They are exposed thereto. A hapless end!

translations.SAHIH: And they have attributed to Allāh equals to mislead [people] from His way. Say, "Enjoy yourselves, for indeed, your destination is the Fire."
translations.PICKTHALL: And they set up rivals to Allah that they may mislead (men) from His way. Say: Enjoy life (while ye may) for lo! your journey's end will be the Fire.

translations.SAHIH: [O Muḥammad], tell My servants who have believed to establish prayer and spend from what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, before a Day comes in which there will be no exchange [i.e., ransom], nor any friendships.
translations.PICKTHALL: Tell My bondmen who believe to establish worship and spend of that which We have given them, secretly and publicly, before a day cometh wherein there will be neither traffick nor befriending.

translations.SAHIH: It is Allāh who created the heavens and the earth and sent down rain from the sky and produced thereby some fruits as provision for you and subjected for you1 the ships to sail through the sea by His command and subjected for you the rivers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah is He Who created the heavens and the earth, and causeth water to descend from the sky, thereby producing fruits as food for you, and maketh the ships to be of service unto you, that they may run upon the sea at His command, and hath made of service unto you the rivers;

translations.SAHIH: And He subjected for you the sun and the moon, continuous [in orbit], and subjected for you the night and the day.
translations.PICKTHALL: And maketh the sun and the moon, constant in their courses, to be of service unto you, and hath made of service unto you the night and the day.

translations.SAHIH: And He gave you from all you asked of Him.1 And if you should count the favor [i.e., blessings] of Allāh, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, mankind is [generally] most unjust and ungrateful.2
translations.PICKTHALL: And He giveth you of all ye ask of Him, and if ye would count the bounty of Allah ye cannot reckon it. Lo! man is verily a wrong-doer, an ingrate.

translations.SAHIH: And [mention, O Muḥammad], when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this city [i.e., Makkah] secure and keep me and my sons away from worshipping idols.
translations.PICKTHALL: And when Abraham said: My Lord! Make safe this territory, and preserve me and my sons from serving idols.

translations.SAHIH: My Lord, indeed they have led astray many among the people. So whoever follows me - then he is of me;1 and whoever disobeys me - indeed, You are [yet] Forgiving and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: My Lord! Lo! they have led many of mankind astray. But whoso followeth me, he verily is of me. And whoso disobeyeth me - Still Thou art Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: Our Lord, I have settled some of my descendants in an uncultivated valley near Your sacred House, our Lord, that they may establish prayer. So make hearts among the people incline toward them and provide for them from the fruits that they might be grateful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Our Lord! Lo! I have settled some of my posterity in an uncultivable valley near unto Thy holy House, our Lord! that they may establish proper worship; so incline some hearts of men that they may yearn toward them, and provide Thou them with fruits in order that they may be thankful.

translations.SAHIH: Our Lord, indeed You know what we conceal and what we declare, and nothing is hidden from Allāh on the earth or in the heaven.
translations.PICKTHALL: Our Lord! Lo! Thou knowest that which we hide and that which we proclaim. Nothing in the earth or in the heaven is hidden from Allah.

translations.SAHIH: Praise to Allāh, who has granted to me in old age Ishmael and Isaac. Indeed, my Lord is the Hearer of supplication.
translations.PICKTHALL: Praise be to Allah Who hath given me, in my old age, Ishmael and Isaac! Lo! my Lord is indeed the Hearer of Prayer.

translations.SAHIH: My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [many] from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.
translations.PICKTHALL: My Lord! Make me to establish proper worship, and some of my posterity (also); our Lord! and accept my prayer.

translations.SAHIH: Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers the Day the account is established."
translations.PICKTHALL: Our Lord! Forgive me and my parents and believers on the day when the account is cast.

translations.SAHIH: And never think that Allāh is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them [i.e., their account] for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror].
translations.PICKTHALL: Deem not that Allah is unaware of what the wicked do. He but giveth them a respite till a day when eyes will stare (in terror),

translations.SAHIH: Racing ahead, their heads raised up, their glance does not come back to them,1 and their hearts are void.
translations.PICKTHALL: As they come hurrying on in fear, their heads upraised, their gaze returning not to them, and their hearts as air.

translations.SAHIH: And, [O Muḥammad], warn the people of a Day when the punishment will come to them and those who did wrong will say, "Our Lord, delay us for a short term; we will answer Your call and follow the messengers." [But it will be said], "Had you not sworn, before, that for you there would be no cessation?1
translations.PICKTHALL: And warn mankind of a day when the doom will come upon them, and those who did wrong will say: Our Lord! Reprieve us for a little while. We will obey Thy call and will follow the messengers. (It will be answered): Did ye not swear before that there would be no end for you?

translations.SAHIH: And you lived among the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, and it had become clear to you how We dealt with them. And We presented for you [many] examples."
translations.PICKTHALL: And (have ye not) dwelt in the dwellings of those who wronged themselves (of old) and (hath it not) become plain to you how We dealt with them and made examples for you?

translations.SAHIH: And they had planned their plan, but with Allāh is [recorded] their plan, even if their plan had been [sufficient] to do away with the mountains.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Verily they have plotted their plot, and their plot is with Allah, though their plot were one whereby the mountains should be moved.

translations.SAHIH: So never think that Allāh will fail in His promise to His messengers. Indeed, Allāh is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.1
translations.PICKTHALL: So think not that Allah will fail to keep His promise to His messengers. Lo! Allah is Mighty, Able to Requite (the wrong).

translations.SAHIH: [It will be] on the Day the earth will be replaced by another earth, and the heavens [as well], and they [i.e., all creatures] will come out before Allāh, the One, the Prevailing,
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when the earth will be changed to other than the earth, and the heavens (also will be changed) and they will come forth unto Allah, the One, the Almighty,

translations.SAHIH: And you will see the criminals that Day bound together in irons,
translations.PICKTHALL: Thou wilt see the guilty on that day linked together in chains,

translations.SAHIH: Their garments of liquid pitch and their faces covered by the Fire
translations.PICKTHALL: Their raiment of pitch, and the Fire covering their faces,

translations.SAHIH: So that Allāh will recompense every soul for what it earned. Indeed, Allāh is swift in account.
translations.PICKTHALL: That Allah may repay each soul what it hath earned. Lo! Allah is swift at reckoning.

translations.SAHIH: This [Qur’ān] is notification for the people that they may be warned thereby and that they may know that He is but one God and that those of understanding will be reminded.
translations.PICKTHALL: This is a clear message for mankind in order that they may be warned thereby, and that they may know that He is only One Allah, and that men of understanding may take heed.

translations.SAHIH: Alif, Lām, Rā.1 These are the verses of the Book and a clear Qur’ān [i.e., recitation].
translations.PICKTHALL: Alif. Lam. Ra. These are verses of the Scripture and a plain Reading.

translations.SAHIH: Perhaps those who disbelieve will wish1 that they had been Muslims.
translations.PICKTHALL: It may be that those who disbelieve wish ardently that they were Muslims.

translations.SAHIH: Let them eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted by [false] hope, for they are going to know.
translations.PICKTHALL: Let them eat and enjoy life, and let (false) hope beguile them. They will come to know!

translations.SAHIH: And We did not destroy any city but that for it was a known decree.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We destroyed no township but there was a known decree for it.

translations.SAHIH: No nation will precede its term, nor will they remain thereafter.
translations.PICKTHALL: No nation can outstrip its term nor can they lag behind.

translations.SAHIH: And they say, "O you upon whom the message has been sent down, indeed you are mad.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And they say: O thou unto whom the Reminder is revealed, lo! thou art indeed a madman!

translations.SAHIH: Why do you not bring us the angels, if you should be among the truthful?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Why bringest thou not angels unto us, if thou art of the truthful?

translations.SAHIH: We do not send down the angels except with truth;1 and they [i.e., the disbelievers] would not then be reprieved.
translations.PICKTHALL: We send not down the angels save with the Fact, and in that case (the disbelievers) would not be tolerated.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it is We who sent down the message [i.e., the Qur’ān], and indeed, We will be its guardian.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We, even We, reveal the Reminder, and lo! We verily are its Guardian.

translations.SAHIH: And We had certainly sent [messengers] before you, [O Muḥammad], among the sects of the former peoples.
translations.PICKTHALL: We verily sent (messengers) before thee among the factions of the men of old.

translations.SAHIH: And no messenger would come to them except that they ridiculed him.
translations.PICKTHALL: And never came there unto them a messenger but they did mock him.

translations.SAHIH: Thus do We insert it [i.e., denial] into the hearts of the criminals.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus do We make it traverse the hearts of the guilty:

translations.SAHIH: They will not believe in it, while there has already occurred the precedent of the former peoples.
translations.PICKTHALL: They believe not therein, though the example of the men of old hath gone before.

translations.SAHIH: And [even] if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they continued therein to ascend,
translations.PICKTHALL: And even if We opened unto them a gate of heaven and they kept mounting through it,

translations.SAHIH: They would say, "Our eyes have only been dazzled. Rather, we are a people affected by magic."
translations.PICKTHALL: They would say: Our sight is wrong - nay, but we are folk bewitched.

translations.SAHIH: And We have placed within the heaven great stars and have beautified it for the observers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily in the heaven we have set mansions of the stars, and We have beautified it for beholders.

translations.SAHIH: And We have protected it from every devil expelled [from the mercy of Allāh]
translations.PICKTHALL: And We have guarded it from every outcast devil,

translations.SAHIH: Except one who steals a hearing and is pursued by a clear burning flame.
translations.PICKTHALL: Save him who stealeth the hearing, and them doth a clear flame pursue.

translations.SAHIH: And the earth - We have spread it and cast therein firmly set mountains and caused to grow therein [something] of every well-balanced thing.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the earth have We spread out, and placed therein firm hills, and caused each seemly thing to grow therein.

translations.SAHIH: And We have made for you therein means of living and [for] those for whom you are not providers.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And we have given unto you livelihoods therein, and unto those for whom ye provide not.

translations.SAHIH: And there is not a thing but that with Us are its depositories, and We do not send it down except according to a known [i.e., specified] measure.
translations.PICKTHALL: And there is not a thing but with Us are the stores thereof. And we send it not down save in appointed measure.

translations.SAHIH: And We have sent the fertilizing winds1 and sent down water from the sky and given you drink from it. And you are not its retainers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We send the winds fertilising, and cause water to descend from the sky, and give it you to drink. It is not ye who are the holders of the store thereof.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritor.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! and it is We, even We, Who quicken and give death, and We are the Inheritor.

translations.SAHIH: And We have already known the preceding [generations] among you, and We have already known the later [ones to come].
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily We know the eager among you and verily We know the laggards.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, your Lord will gather them; indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! thy Lord will gather them together. Lo! He is Wise, Aware.

translations.SAHIH: And We did certainly create man out of clay from an altered black mud.
translations.PICKTHALL: Verily We created man of potter's clay of black mud altered,

translations.SAHIH: And the jinn We created before from scorching fire.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the jinn did We create aforetime of essential fire.

translations.SAHIH: And [mention, O Muḥammad], when your Lord said to the angels, "I will create a human being out of clay from an altered black mud.
translations.PICKTHALL: And (remember) when thy Lord said unto the angels: Lo! I am creating a mortal out of potter's clay of black mud altered,

translations.SAHIH: And when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul,1 then fall down to him in prostration."
translations.PICKTHALL: So, when I have made him and have breathed into him of My Spirit, do ye fall down, prostrating yourselves unto him.

translations.SAHIH: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely,
translations.PICKTHALL: So the angels fell prostrate, all of them together

translations.SAHIH: Except Iblees;1 he refused to be with those who prostrated.
translations.PICKTHALL: Save Iblis. He refused to be among the prostrate.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "O Iblees, what is [the matter] with you that you are not with those who prostrate?"
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: O Iblis! What aileth thee that thou art not among the prostrate?

translations.SAHIH: He said, "Never would I prostrate to a human whom You created out of clay from an altered black mud."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: I am not one to prostrate myself unto a mortal whom Thou hast created out of potter's clay of black mud altered!

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "Then depart from it,1 for indeed, you are expelled.
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Then go thou forth from hence, for lo! thou art outcast.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, upon you is the curse until the Day of Recompense."
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! the curse shall be upon thee till the Day of Judgment.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: My Lord! Reprieve me till the day when they are raised.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Then lo! thou art of those reprieved

translations.SAHIH: Until the Day of the time well-known."
translations.PICKTHALL: Till the Day of appointed time.

translations.SAHIH: [Iblees] said, "My Lord, because You have put me in error, I will surely make [disobedience] attractive to them [i.e., mankind] on earth, and I will mislead them all
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: My Lord! Because Thou hast sent me astray, I verily shall adorn the path of error for them in the earth, and shall mislead them every one,

translations.SAHIH: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."
translations.PICKTHALL: Save such of them as are Thy perfectly devoted slaves.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "This is a path [of return] to Me [that is] straight.
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: This is a right course incumbent upon Me:

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, My servants - no authority will you have over them, except those who follow you of the deviators.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! as for My slaves, thou hast no power over any of them save such of the froward as follow thee,

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, Hell is the promised place for them all.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! for all such, hell will be the promised place.

translations.SAHIH: It has seven gates; for every gate is of them [i.e., Satan's followers] a portion designated."
translations.PICKTHALL: It hath seven gates, and each gate hath an appointed portion.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, the righteous will be within gardens and springs,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who ward off (evil) are among gardens and watersprings.

translations.SAHIH: [Having been told], "Enter it in peace, safe [and secure]."
translations.PICKTHALL: (And it is said unto them): Enter them in peace, secure.

translations.SAHIH: And We will remove whatever is in their breasts of resentment,1 [so they will be] brothers, on thrones facing each other.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We remove whatever rancour may be in their breasts. As brethren, face to face, (they rest) on couches raised.

translations.SAHIH: No fatigue will touch them therein, nor from it will they [ever] be removed.
translations.PICKTHALL: Toil cometh not unto them there, nor will they be expelled from thence.

translations.SAHIH: [O Muḥammad], inform My servants that it is I who am the Forgiving, the Merciful,
translations.PICKTHALL: Announce, (O Muhammad) unto My slaves that verily I am the Forgiving, the Merciful,

translations.SAHIH: And that it is My punishment which is the painful punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: And that My doom is the dolorous doom.

translations.SAHIH: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,
translations.PICKTHALL: And tell them of Abraham's guests,

translations.SAHIH: When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." [Abraham] said, "Indeed, we are fearful [i.e., apprehensive] of you."
translations.PICKTHALL: (How) when they came in unto him, and said: Peace. He said: Lo! we are afraid of you.

translations.SAHIH: [The angels] said, "Fear not. Indeed, we give you good tidings of a learned boy."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Be not afraid! Lo! we bring thee good tidings of a boy possessing wisdom.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "Have you given me good tidings although old age has come upon me? Then of what [wonder] do you inform?"
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Bring ye me good tidings (of a son) when old age hath overtaken me? Of what then can ye bring good tidings?

translations.SAHIH: They said, "We have given you good tidings in truth, so do not be of the despairing."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: We bring thee good tidings in truth. So be not thou of the despairing.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except for those astray?"
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: And who despaireth of the mercy of his Lord save those who are astray?

translations.SAHIH: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: And afterward what is your business, O ye messengers (of Allah)?

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals,
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: We have been sent unto a guilty folk,

translations.SAHIH: Except the family of Lot; indeed, we will save them all
translations.PICKTHALL: (All) save the family of Lot. Them we shall deliver every one,

translations.SAHIH: Except his wife." We [i.e., Allāh] decreed that she is of those who remain behind.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Except his wife, of whom We had decreed that she should be of those who stay behind.

translations.SAHIH: And when the messengers came to the family of Lot,
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the messengers came unto the family of Lot,

translations.SAHIH: He said, "Indeed, you are people unknown."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Lo! ye are folk unknown (to me).

translations.SAHIH: They said, "But we have come to you with that about which they were disputing,
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Nay, but we bring thee that concerning which they keep disputing,

translations.SAHIH: And we have come to you with truth, and indeed, we are truthful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And bring thee the Truth, and lo! we are truth-tellers.

translations.SAHIH: So set out with your family during a portion of the night and follow behind them and let not anyone among you look back and continue on to where you are commanded."
translations.PICKTHALL: So travel with thy household in a portion of the night, and follow thou their backs. Let none of you turn round, but go whither ye are commanded.

translations.SAHIH: And We conveyed to him [the decree] of that matter: that those [sinners] would be eliminated by early morning.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We made plain the case to him, that the root of them (who did wrong) was to be cut at early morn.

translations.SAHIH: And the people of the city came rejoicing.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And the people of the city came, rejoicing at the news (of new arrivals).

translations.SAHIH: [Lot] said, "Indeed, these are my guests, so do not shame me.
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Lo! they are my guests. Affront me not!

translations.SAHIH: And fear Allāh and do not disgrace me."
translations.PICKTHALL: And keep your duty to Allah, and shame me not!

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Have we not forbidden you from [protecting] people?"
translations.PICKTHALL: They said; Have we not forbidden you from (entertaining) anyone?

translations.SAHIH: [Lot] said, "These are my daughters1 - if you would be doers [of lawful marriage]."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Here are my daughters, if ye must be doing (so).

translations.SAHIH: By your life, [O Muḥammad], indeed they were, in their intoxication, wandering blindly.
translations.PICKTHALL: By thy life (O Muhammad) they moved blindly in the frenzy of approaching death.

translations.SAHIH: So the shriek1 seized them at sunrise.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then the (Awful) Cry overtook them at the sunrise.

translations.SAHIH: And We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of hard clay.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We utterly confounded them, and We rained upon them stones of heated clay.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed in that are signs for those who discern.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! therein verily are portents for those who read the signs.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, they [i.e., those cities] are [situated] on an established road.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! it is upon a road still uneffaced.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! therein is indeed a portent for believers.

translations.SAHIH: And the companions of the thicket [i.e., the people of Madyan] were [also] wrongdoers,
translations.PICKTHALL: And the dwellers in the wood indeed were evil-doers.

translations.SAHIH: So We took retribution from them, and indeed, both [cities] are on a clear highway.
translations.PICKTHALL: So we took vengeance on them; and lo! they both are on a high-road plain to see.

translations.SAHIH: And certainly did the companions of al-Ḥijr1 [i.e., the Thamūd] deny the messengers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the dwellers in Al-Hijr denied (Our) messengers.

translations.SAHIH: And We gave them Our signs, but from them they were turning away.
translations.PICKTHALL: And we gave them Our revelations, but they were averse to them.

translations.SAHIH: And they used to carve from the mountains, houses, feeling secure.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they used to hew out dwellings from the hills, (wherein they dwelt) secure.

translations.SAHIH: But the shriek seized them at early morning,
translations.PICKTHALL: But the (Awful) Cry overtook them at the morning hour,

translations.SAHIH: So nothing availed them [from] what they used to earn.
translations.PICKTHALL: And that which they were wont to count as gain availed them not.

translations.SAHIH: And We have not created the heavens and earth and that between them except in truth. And indeed, the Hour is coming; so forgive with gracious forgiveness.
translations.PICKTHALL: We created not the heavens and the earth and all that is between them save with truth, and lo! the Hour is surely coming. So forgive, (O Muhammad), with a gracious forgiveness.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, your Lord - He is the Knowing Creator.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! Thy Lord! He is the All-Wise Creator.

translations.SAHIH: And We have certainly given you, [O Muḥammad], seven of the often repeated [verses]1 and the great Qur’ān.
translations.PICKTHALL: We have given thee seven of the oft-repeated (verses) and the great Qur'an.

translations.SAHIH: Do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [certain] categories of them [i.e., the disbelievers], and do not grieve over them. And lower your wing [i.e., show kindness] to the believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Strain not thine eyes toward that which We cause some wedded pairs among them to enjoin, and be not grieved on their account, and lower thy wing (in tenderness) for the believers.

translations.SAHIH: And say, "Indeed, I am the clear warner" -
translations.PICKTHALL: And say: Lo! I, even I, am a plain warner,

translations.SAHIH: Just as We had revealed [scriptures] to the separators1
translations.PICKTHALL: Such as We send down for those who make division,

translations.SAHIH: Who have made the Qur’ān into portions.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who break the Qur'an into parts.

translations.SAHIH: So by your Lord, We will surely question them all
translations.PICKTHALL: Them, by thy Lord, We shall question, every one,

translations.SAHIH: About what they used to do.
translations.PICKTHALL: Of what they used to do.

translations.SAHIH: Then declare what you are commanded1 and turn away from the polytheists.2
translations.PICKTHALL: So proclaim that which thou art commanded, and withdraw from the idolaters.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We are sufficient for you against the mockers
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We defend thee from the scoffers,

translations.SAHIH: Who make [equal] with Allāh another deity. But they are going to know.
translations.PICKTHALL: Who set some other god along with Allah. But they will come to know.

translations.SAHIH: And We already know that your breast is constrained by what they say.
translations.PICKTHALL: Well know We that thy bosom is oppressed by what they say,

translations.SAHIH: So exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord and be of those who prostrate [to Him].
translations.PICKTHALL: But hymn the praise of thy Lord, and be of those who make prostration (unto Him).

translations.SAHIH: And worship your Lord until there comes to you the certainty [i.e., death].
translations.PICKTHALL: And serve thy Lord till the Inevitable cometh unto thee.

translations.SAHIH: The command of Allāh is coming,1 so be not impatient for it. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
translations.PICKTHALL: The commandment of Allah will come to pass, so seek not ye to hasten it. Glorified and Exalted be He above all that they associate (with Him).

translations.SAHIH: He sends down the angels, with the inspiration [i.e., revelation] of His command, upon whom He wills of His servants, [telling them], "Warn that there is no deity except Me; so fear Me."
translations.PICKTHALL: He sendeth down the angels with the Spirit of His command unto whom He will of His bondmen, (saying): Warn mankind that there is no Allah save Me, so keep your duty unto Me.

translations.SAHIH: He created the heavens and earth in truth. High is He above what they associate with Him.
translations.PICKTHALL: He hath created the heavens and the earth with truth. High be He Exalted above all that they associate (with Him).

translations.SAHIH: He created man from a sperm-drop; then at once1 he is a clear adversary.
translations.PICKTHALL: He hath created man from a drop of fluid, yet behold! he is an open opponent.

translations.SAHIH: And the grazing livestock He has created for you; in them is warmth1 and [numerous] benefits, and from them you eat.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the cattle hath He created, whence ye have warm clothing and uses, and whereof ye eat;

translations.SAHIH: And for you in them is [the enjoyment of] beauty when you bring them in [for the evening] and when you send them out [to pasture].
translations.PICKTHALL: And wherein is beauty for you, when ye bring them home, and when ye take them out to pasture.

translations.SAHIH: And they carry your loads to a land you could not have reached except with difficulty to yourselves. Indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they bear your loads for you unto a land ye could not reach save with great trouble to yourselves. Lo! your Lord is Full of Pity, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: And [He created] the horses, mules and donkeys for you to ride and [as] adornment. And He creates that which you do not know.
translations.PICKTHALL: And horses and mules and asses (hath He created) that ye may ride them, and for ornament. And He createth that which ye know not.

translations.SAHIH: And upon Allāh1 is the direction of the [right] way, and among them [i.e., the various paths] are those deviating. And if He willed, He could have guided you all.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Allah's is the direction of the way, and some (roads) go not straight. And had He willed He would have led you all aright.

translations.SAHIH: It is He who sends down rain from the sky; from it is drink and from it is foliage in which you pasture [animals].
translations.PICKTHALL: He it is Who sendeth down water from the sky, whence ye have drink, and whence are trees on which ye send your beasts to pasture.

translations.SAHIH: He causes to grow for you thereby the crops, olives, palm trees, grapevines, and of all the fruits. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therewith He causeth crops to grow for you, and the olive and the date-palm and grapes and all kinds of fruit. Lo! herein is indeed a portent for people who reflect.

translations.SAHIH: And He has subjected for you the night and day and the sun and moon, and the stars are subjected by His command. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.
translations.PICKTHALL: And He hath constrained the night and the day and the sun and the moon to be of service unto you, and the stars are made subservient by His command. Lo! herein indeed are portents for people who have sense.

translations.SAHIH: And [He has subjected] whatever He multiplied for you on the earth of varying colors. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who remember.
translations.PICKTHALL: And whatsoever He hath created for you in the earth of divers hues, lo! therein is indeed a portent for people who take heed.

translations.SAHIH: And it is He who subjected the sea for you to eat from it tender meat and to extract from it ornaments which you wear. And you see the ships plowing through it, and [He subjected it] that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And He it is Who hath constrained the sea to be of service that ye eat fresh meat from thence, and bring forth from thence ornaments which ye wear. And thou seest the ships ploughing it that ye (mankind) may seek of His bounty and that haply ye may give thanks.

translations.SAHIH: And He has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it shift with you, and [made] rivers and roads, that you may be guided,
translations.PICKTHALL: And He hath cast into the earth firm hills that it quake not with you, and streams and roads that ye may find a way.

translations.SAHIH: And landmarks. And by the stars they are [also] guided.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And landmarks (too), and by the star they find a way.

translations.SAHIH: Then is He who creates like one who does not create? So will you not be reminded?
translations.PICKTHALL: Is He then Who createth as him who createth not? Will ye not then remember?

translations.SAHIH: And if you should count the favors of Allāh, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And if ye would count the favour of Allah ye cannot reckon it. Lo! Allah is indeed Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh knows what you conceal and what you declare.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Allah knoweth that which ye keep hidden and that which ye proclaim.

translations.SAHIH: And those they invoke other than Allāh create nothing, and they [themselves] are created.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those unto whom they cry beside Allah created naught, but are themselves created.

translations.SAHIH: They are [in fact] dead,1 not alive, and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected.
translations.PICKTHALL: (They are) dead, not living. And they know not when they will be raised.

translations.SAHIH: Your god is one God. But those who do not believe in the Hereafter - their hearts are disapproving, and they are arrogant.
translations.PICKTHALL: Your Allah is One Allah. But as for those who believe not in the Hereafter their hearts refuse to know, for they are proud.

translations.SAHIH: Assuredly, Allāh knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He does not like the arrogant.
translations.PICKTHALL: Assuredly Allah knoweth that which they keep hidden and that which they proclaim. Lo! He loveth not the proud.

translations.SAHIH: And when it is said to them, "What has your Lord sent down?" they say, "Legends of the former peoples,"
translations.PICKTHALL: And when it is said unto them: What hath your Lord revealed? they say: (Mere) fables of the men of old,

translations.SAHIH: That they may bear their own burdens [i.e., sins] in full on the Day of Resurrection and some of the burdens of those whom they misguide without [i.e., by lack of] knowledge. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.
translations.PICKTHALL: That they may bear their burdens undiminished on the Day of Resurrection, with somewhat of the burdens of those whom they mislead without knowledge. Ah! evil is that which they bear!

translations.SAHIH: Those before them had already plotted, but Allāh came at [i.e., uprooted] their building from the foundations, so the roof fell upon them from above them,1 and the punishment came to them from where they did not perceive.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those before them plotted, so Allah struck at the foundations of their building, and then the roof fell down upon them from above them, and the doom came on them whence they knew not;

translations.SAHIH: Then on the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and say, "Where are My 'partners' for whom you used to oppose [the believers]?" Those who were given knowledge will say, "Indeed disgrace, this Day, and evil are upon the disbelievers" -
translations.PICKTHALL: Then on the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and will say: Where are My partners, for whose sake ye opposed (My guidance)? Those who have been given knowledge will say: Disgrace this day and evil are upon the disbelievers,

translations.SAHIH: The ones whom the angels take in death [while] wronging themselves,1 and [who] then offer submission, [saying], "We were not doing any evil." But, yes! Indeed, Allāh is Knowing of what you used to do.
translations.PICKTHALL: Whom the angels cause to die while they are wronging themselves. Then will they make full submission (saying): We used not to do any wrong. Nay! Surely Allah is Knower of what ye used to do.

translations.SAHIH: So enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein, and how wretched is the residence of the arrogant.
translations.PICKTHALL: So enter the gates of hell, to dwell therein for ever. Woeful indeed will be the lodging of the arrogant.

translations.SAHIH: And it will be said to those who feared Allāh, "What did your Lord send down?" They will say, "[That which is] good." For those who do good in this world is good; and the home of the Hereafter is better. And how excellent is the home of the righteous -
translations.PICKTHALL: And it is said unto those who ward off (evil): What hath your Lord revealed? They say: Good. For those who do good in this world there is a good (reward) and the home of the Hereafter will be better. Pleasant indeed will be the home of those who ward off (evil) -

translations.SAHIH: Gardens of perpetual residence, which they will enter, beneath which rivers flow. They will have therein whatever they wish. Thus does Allāh reward the righteous -
translations.PICKTHALL: Gardens of Eden which they enter, underneath which rivers flow, wherein they have what they will. Thus Allah repayeth those who ward off (evil),

translations.SAHIH: The ones whom the angels take in death, [being] good and pure; [the angels] will say, "Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise for what you used to do."
translations.PICKTHALL: Those whom the angels cause to die (when they are) good. They say: Peace be unto you! Enter the Garden because of what ye used to do.

translations.SAHIH: Do they [i.e., the disbelievers] await except that the angels should come to them or there comes the command of your Lord? Thus did those do before them. And Allāh wronged them not, but they had been wronging themselves.
translations.PICKTHALL: Await they aught say that the angels should come unto them or thy Lord's command should come to pass? Even so did those before them. Allah wronged them not, but they did wrong themselves,

translations.SAHIH: So they were struck by the evil consequences of what they did and were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
translations.PICKTHALL: So that the evils of what they did smote them, and that which they used to mock surrounded them.

translations.SAHIH: And those who associate others with Allāh say, "If Allāh had willed, we would not have worshipped anything other than Him, neither we nor our fathers, nor would we have forbidden anything through other than Him." Thus did those do before them. So is there upon the messengers except [the duty of] clear notification?
translations.PICKTHALL: And the idolaters say: Had Allah willed, we had not worshipped aught beside Him, we and our fathers, nor had we forbidden aught without (command from) Him. Even so did those before them. Are the messengers charged with aught save plain conveyance (of the message)?

translations.SAHIH: And We certainly sent into every nation a messenger, [saying], "Worship Allāh and avoid ṭāghūt."1 And among them were those whom Allāh guided, and among them were those upon whom error was [deservedly] decreed. So proceed [i.e., travel] through the earth and observe how was the end of the deniers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily We have raised in every nation a messenger, (proclaiming): Serve Allah and shun false gods. Then some of them (there were) whom Allah guided, and some of them (there were) upon whom error had just hold. Do but travel in the land and see the nature of the consequence for the deniers!

translations.SAHIH: [Even] if you should strive for their guidance, [O Muḥammad], indeed, Allāh does not guide those He sends astray,1 and they will have no helpers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Even if thou (O Muhammad) desirest their right guidance, still Allah assuredly will not guide him who misleadeth. Such have no helpers.

translations.SAHIH: And they swear by Allāh their strongest oaths [that] Allāh will not resurrect one who dies. But yes - [it is] a true promise [binding] upon Him, but most of the people do not know.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they swear by Allah their most binding oaths (that) Allah will not raise up him who dieth. Nay, but it is a promise (binding) upon Him in truth, but most of mankind know not,

translations.SAHIH: [It is] so He will make clear to them [the truth of] that wherein they differ and so those who have disbelieved may know that they were liars.
translations.PICKTHALL: That He may explain unto them that wherein they differ, and that those who disbelieved may know that they were liars.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, Our word to a thing when We intend it is but that We say to it, "Be," and it is.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Our word unto a thing, when We intend it, is only that We say unto it: Be! and it is.

translations.SAHIH: And those who emigrated for [the cause of] Allāh after they had been wronged - We will surely settle them in this world in a good place; but the reward of the Hereafter is greater, if only they could know.
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who became fugitives for the cause of Allah after they had been oppressed, We verily shall give them goodly lodging in the world, and surely the reward of the Hereafter is greater, if they but knew;

translations.SAHIH: [They are] those who endured patiently and upon their Lord relied.
translations.PICKTHALL: Such as are steadfast and put their trust in Allah.

translations.SAHIH: And We sent not before you except men to whom We revealed [Our message]. So ask the people of the message [i.e., former scriptures] if you do not know.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We sent not (as Our messengers) before thee other than men whom We inspired - Ask the followers of the Remembrance if ye know not! -

translations.SAHIH: [We sent them] with clear proofs and written ordinances. And We revealed to you the message [i.e., the Qur’ān] that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them and that they might give thought.
translations.PICKTHALL: With clear proofs and writings; and We have revealed unto thee the Remembrance that thou mayst explain to mankind that which hath been revealed for them, and that haply they may reflect.

translations.SAHIH: Then, do those who have planned evil deeds feel secure that Allāh will not cause the earth to swallow them or that the punishment will not come upon them from where they do not perceive?
translations.PICKTHALL: Are they who plan ill-deeds then secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them, or that the doom will not come on them whence they know not?

translations.SAHIH: Or that He would not seize them during their [usual] activity, and they could not cause failure [i.e., escape from Him]?
translations.PICKTHALL: Or that He will not seize them in their going to and fro so that there be no escape for them?

translations.SAHIH: Or that He would not seize them gradually [in a state of dread]?1 But indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.2
translations.PICKTHALL: Or that He will not seize them with a gradual wasting? Lo! thy Lord is indeed Full of Pity, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: Have they not considered what things Allāh has created? Their shadows incline to the right and to the left, prostrating to Allāh, while they [i.e., those creations] are humble.
translations.PICKTHALL: Have they not observed all things that Allah hath created, how their shadows incline to the right and to the left, making prostration unto Allah, and they are lowly?

translations.SAHIH: And to Allāh prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth of creatures, and the angels [as well], and they are not arrogant.
translations.PICKTHALL: And unto Allah maketh prostration whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth of living creatures, and the angels (also) and they are not proud.

translations.SAHIH: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.
translations.PICKTHALL: They fear their Lord above them, and do what they are bidden.

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh has said, "Do not take for yourselves two1 deities. He [i.e., Allāh] is but one God, so fear only Me."
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah hath said: Choose not two gods. There is only One Allah. So of Me, Me only, be in awe.

translations.SAHIH: And to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him is [due] worship constantly. Then is it other than Allāh that you fear?
translations.PICKTHALL: Unto Him belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth, and religion is His for ever. Will ye then fear any other than Allah?

translations.SAHIH: And whatever you have of favor - it is from Allāh. Then when adversity touches you, to Him you cry for help.
translations.PICKTHALL: And whatever of comfort ye enjoy, it is from Allah. Then, when misfortune reacheth you, unto Him ye cry for help.

translations.SAHIH: Then when He removes the adversity from you, at once a party of you associates others with their Lord
translations.PICKTHALL: And afterward, when He hath rid you of the misfortune, behold! a set of you attribute partners to their Lord,

translations.SAHIH: So they will deny what We have given them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you are going to know.
translations.PICKTHALL: So as to deny that which We have given them. Then enjoy life (while ye may), for ye will come to know.

translations.SAHIH: And they assign to what they do not know1 [i.e., false deities] a portion of that which We have provided them. By Allāh, you will surely be questioned about what you used to invent.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they assign a portion of that which We have given them unto what they know not. By Allah! but ye will indeed be asked concerning (all) that ye used to invent.

translations.SAHIH: And they attribute to Allāh daughters1 - exalted is He - and for them is what they desire [i.e., sons].
translations.PICKTHALL: And they assign unto Allah daughters - Be He Glorified! - and unto themselves what they desire;

translations.SAHIH: And when one of them is informed of [the birth of] a female, his face becomes dark, and he suppresses grief.
translations.PICKTHALL: When if one of them receiveth tidings of the birth of a female, his face remaineth darkened, and he is wroth inwardly.

translations.SAHIH: He hides himself from the people because of the ill of which he has been informed. Should he keep it in humiliation or bury it in the ground? Unquestionably, evil is what they decide.
translations.PICKTHALL: He hideth himself from the folk because of the evil of that whereof he hath had tidings, (asking himself): Shall he keep it in contempt, or bury it beneath the dust. Verily evil is their judgment.

translations.SAHIH: For those who do not believe in the Hereafter is the description [i.e., an attribute] of evil;1 and for Allāh is the highest attribute. And He is Exalted in Might, the Wise.
translations.PICKTHALL: For those who believe not in the Hereafter is an evil similitude, and Allah's is the Sublime Similitude. He is the Mighty, the Wise.

translations.SAHIH: And if Allāh were to impose blame on the people for their wrongdoing, He would not have left upon it [i.e., the earth] any creature, but He defers them for a specified term. And when their term has come, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it].
translations.PICKTHALL: If Allah were to take mankind to task for their wrong-doing, he would not leave hereon a living creature, but He reprieveth them to an appointed term, and when their term cometh they cannot put (it) off an hour nor (yet) advance (it).

translations.SAHIH: And they attribute to Allāh that which they dislike [i.e., daughters], and their tongues assert the lie that they will have the best [from Him]. Assuredly, they will have the Fire, and they will be [therein] neglected.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And they assign unto Allah that which they (themselves) dislike, and their tongues expound the lie that the better portion will be theirs. Assuredly theirs will be the Fire, and they will be abandoned.

translations.SAHIH: By Allāh, We did certainly send [messengers] to nations before you, but Satan made their deeds attractive to them. And he is their [i.e., the disbelievers] ally today [as well], and they will have a painful punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: By Allah, We verily sent messengers unto the nations before thee, but the devil made their deeds fairseeming unto them. So he is their patron this day, and theirs will be a painful doom.

translations.SAHIH: And We have not revealed to you the Book, [O Muḥammad], except for you to make clear to them that wherein they have differed and as guidance and mercy for a people who believe.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We have revealed the Scripture unto thee only that thou mayst explain unto them that wherein they differ, and (as) a guidance and a mercy for a people who believe.

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh has sent down rain from the sky and given life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who listen.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah sendeth down water from the sky and therewith reviveth the earth after her death. Lo! herein is indeed a portent for a folk who hear.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, for you in grazing livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies - between excretion and blood - pure milk, palatable to drinkers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! in the cattle there is a lesson for you. We give you to drink of that which is in their bellies, from betwixt the refuse and the blood, pure milk palatable to the drinkers.

translations.SAHIH: And from the fruits of the palm trees and grapevines you take intoxicant and good provision.1 Indeed in that is a sign for a people who reason.
translations.PICKTHALL: And of the fruits of the date-palm, and grapes, whence ye derive strong drink and (also) good nourishment. Lo! therein is indeed a portent for people who have sense.

translations.SAHIH: And your Lord inspired to the bee, "Take for yourself among the mountains, houses [i.e., hives], and among the trees and [in] that which they construct.
translations.PICKTHALL: And thy Lord inspired the bee, saying: Choose thou habitations in the hills and in the trees and in that which they thatch;

translations.SAHIH: Then eat from all the fruits1 and follow the ways of your Lord laid down [for you]." There emerges from their bellies a drink, varying in colors, in which there is healing for people. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then eat of all fruits, and follow the ways of thy Lord, made smooth (for thee). There cometh forth from their bellies a drink divers of hues, wherein is healing for mankind. Lo! herein is indeed a portent for people who reflect.

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh created you; then He will take you in death. And among you is he who is reversed to the most decrepit [old] age so that he will not know, after [having had] knowledge, a thing. Indeed, Allāh is Knowing and Competent.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Allah createth you, then causeth you to die, and among you is he who is brought back to the most abject stage of life, so that he knoweth nothing after (having had) knowledge. Lo! Allah is Knower, Powerful.

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh has favored some of you over others in provision. But those who were favored [i.e., given more] would not hand over their provision to those whom their right hands possess [i.e., slaves] so they would be equal to them therein.1 Then is it the favor of Allāh they reject?
translations.PICKTHALL: And Allah hath favoured some of you above others in provision. Now those who are more favoured will by no means hand over their provision to those (slaves) whom their right hands possess, so that they may be equal with them in respect thereof. Is it then the grace of Allah that they deny?

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh has made for you from yourselves mates and has made for you from your mates sons and grandchildren and has provided for you from the good things. Then in falsehood do they believe and in the favor of Allāh they disbelieve?
translations.PICKTHALL: And Allah hath given you wives of your own kind, and hath given you, from your wives, sons and grandsons, and hath made provision of good things for you. Is it then in vanity that they believe and in the grace of Allah that they disbelieve?

translations.SAHIH: And they worship besides Allāh that which does not possess for them [the power of] provision from the heavens and the earth at all, and [in fact], they are unable.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they worship beside Allah that which owneth no provision whatsoever for them from the heavens or the earth, nor have they (whom they worship) any power.

translations.SAHIH: So do not assert similarities to Allāh.1 Indeed, Allāh knows and you do not know.
translations.PICKTHALL: So coin not similitudes for Allah. Lo! Allah knoweth; ye know not.

translations.SAHIH: Allāh presents an example: a slave [who is] owned and unable to do a thing and he to whom We have provided from Us good provision, so he spends from it secretly and publicly. Can they be equal? Praise to Allāh! But most of them do not know.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah coineth a similitude: (on the one hand) a (mere) chattel slave, who hath control of nothing, and (on the other hand) one on whom we have bestowed a fair provision from Us, and he spendeth thereof secretly and openly. Are they equal? Praise be to Allah! But most of them know not.

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh presents an example of two men, one of them dumb and unable to do a thing, while he is a burden to his guardian. Wherever he directs him, he brings no good. Is he equal to one who commands justice, while he is on a straight path?
translations.PICKTHALL: And Allah coineth a similitude: Two men, one of them dumb, having control of nothing, and he is a burden on his owner; whithersoever he directeth him to go, he bringeth no good. Is he equal with one who enjoineth justice and followeth a straight path (of conduct)?

translations.SAHIH: And to Allāh belongs the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And the command for the Hour is not but as a glance of the eye or even nearer. Indeed, Allāh is over all things competent.
translations.PICKTHALL: And unto Allah belongeth the Unseen of the heavens and the earth, and the matter of the Hour (of Doom) is but as a twinkling of the eye, or it is nearer still. Lo! Allah is Able to do all things.

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh has extracted you from the wombs of your mothers not knowing a thing, and He made for you hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect] that perhaps you would be grateful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Allah brought you forth from the wombs of your mothers knowing nothing, and gave you hearing and sight and hearts that haply ye might give thanks.

translations.SAHIH: Do they not see the birds controlled in the atmosphere of the sky? None holds them up except Allāh. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
translations.PICKTHALL: Have they not seen the birds obedient in mid-air? None holdeth them save Allah. Lo! herein, verily, are portents for a people who believe.

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh has made for you from your homes a place of rest and made for you from the hides of the animals tents which you find light on your day of travel and your day of encampment; and from their wool, fur and hair is furnishing and enjoyment [i.e., provision] for a time.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Allah hath given you in your houses an abode, and hath given you (also), of the hides of cattle, houses which ye find light (to carry) on the day of migration and on the day of pitching camp; and of their wool and their fur and their hair, caparison and comfort for a while.

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh has made for you, from that which He has created, shadows [i.e., shade] and has made for you from the mountains, shelters and has made for you garments which protect you from the heat and garments [i.e., coats of mail] which protect you from your [enemy in] battle. Thus does He complete His favor upon you that you might submit [to Him].
translations.PICKTHALL: And Allah hath given you, of that which He hath created, shelter from the sun; and hath given you places of refuge in the mountains, and hath given you coats to ward off the heat from you, and coats (of armour) to save you from your own foolhardiness. Thus doth He perfect His favour unto you, in order that ye may surrender (unto Him).

translations.SAHIH: But if they turn away, [O Muḥammad] - then only upon you is [responsibility for] clear notification.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then, if they turn away, thy duty (O Muhammad) is but plain conveyance (of the message).

translations.SAHIH: They recognize the favor of Allāh; then they deny it. And most of them are disbelievers.
translations.PICKTHALL: They know the favour of Allah and then deny it. Most of them are ingrates.

translations.SAHIH: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect from every nation a witness [i.e., their prophet]. Then it will not be permitted to the disbelievers [to apologize or make excuses], nor will they be asked to appease [Allāh].
translations.PICKTHALL: And (bethink you of) the day when we raise up of every nation a witness, then there is no leave for disbelievers, nor are they allowed to make amends.

translations.SAHIH: And when those who wronged see the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.
translations.PICKTHALL: And when those who did wrong behold the doom, it will not be made light for them, nor will they be reprieved.

translations.SAHIH: And when those who associated others with Allāh see their "partners," they will say, "Our Lord, these are our partners [to You] whom we used to invoke [in worship] besides You." But they will throw at them the statement, "Indeed, you are liars."
translations.PICKTHALL: And when those who ascribed partners to Allah behold those partners of theirs, they will say: Our Lord! these are our partners unto whom we used to cry instead of Thee. But they will fling to them the saying: Lo! ye verily are liars!

translations.SAHIH: And they will impart to Allāh that Day [their] submission, and lost from them is what they used to invent.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they proffer unto Allah submission on that day, and all that they used to invent hath failed them.

translations.SAHIH: Those who disbelieved and averted [others] from the way of Allāh - We will increase them in punishment over [their] punishment for what corruption they were causing.
translations.PICKTHALL: For those who disbelieve and debar (men) from the way of Allah, We add doom to doom because they wrought corruption,

translations.SAHIH: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect among every nation a witness over them from themselves [i.e., their prophet]. And We will bring you, [O Muḥammad], as a witness over these [i.e., your nation]. And We have sent down to you the Book as clarification for all things and as guidance and mercy and good tidings for the Muslims.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And (bethink you of) the day when We raise in every nation a witness against them of their own folk, and We bring thee (Muhammad) as a witness against these. And We reveal the Scripture unto thee as an exposition of all things, and a guidance and a mercy and good tidings for those who have surrendered (to Allah).

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, Allāh orders justice and good conduct and giving [help] to relatives and forbids immorality and bad conduct and oppression. He admonishes you that perhaps you will be reminded.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! Allah enjoineth justice and kindness, and giving to kinsfolk, and forbiddeth lewdness and abomination and wickedness. He exhorteth you in order that ye may take heed.

translations.SAHIH: And fulfill the covenant of Allāh when you have taken it, [O believers], and do not break oaths after their confirmation while you have made Allāh, over you, a security [i.e., witness]. Indeed, Allāh knows what you do.
translations.PICKTHALL: Fulfil the covenant of Allah when ye have covenanted, and break not your oaths after the asseveration of them, and after ye have made Allah surety over you. Lo! Allah knoweth what ye do.

translations.SAHIH: And do not be like she who untwisted her spun thread after it was strong [by] taking your oaths as [means of] deceit between you because one community is more plentiful [in number or wealth] than another community.1 Allāh only tries you thereby. And He will surely make clear to you on the Day of Resurrection that over which you used to differ.
translations.PICKTHALL: And be not like unto her who unravelleth the thread, after she hath made it strong, to thin filaments, making your oaths a deceit between you because of a nation being more numerous than (another) nation. Allah only trieth you thereby, and He verily will explain to you on the Day of Resurrection that wherein ye differed.

translations.SAHIH: And if Allāh had willed, He could have made you [of] one religion, but He sends astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills.1 And you will surely be questioned about what you used to do.
translations.PICKTHALL: Had Allah willed He could have made you (all) one nation, but He sendeth whom He will astray and guideth whom He will, and ye will indeed be asked of what ye used to do.

translations.SAHIH: And do not take your oaths as [means of] deceit between you, lest a foot slip after it was [once] firm, and you would taste evil [in this world] for what [people] you diverted from the way of Allāh,1 and you would have [in the Hereafter] a great punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: Make not your oaths a deceit between you, lest a foot should slip after being firmly planted and ye should taste evil forasmuch as ye debarred (men) from the way of Allah, and yours should be an awful doom.

translations.SAHIH: And do not exchange the covenant of Allāh for a small price. Indeed, what is with Allāh is best for you, if only you could know.
translations.PICKTHALL: And purchase not a small gain at the price of Allah's covenant. Lo! that which Allah hath is better for you, if ye did but know.

translations.SAHIH: Whatever you have will end, but what Allāh has is lasting. And We will surely give those who were patient their reward according to the best of what they used to do.
translations.PICKTHALL: That which ye have wasteth away, and that which Allah hath remaineth. And verily We shall pay those who are steadfast a recompense in proportion to the best of what they used to do.

translations.SAHIH: Whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - We will surely cause him to live a good life, and We will surely give them their reward [in the Hereafter] according to the best of what they used to do.
translations.PICKTHALL: Whosoever doeth right, whether male or female, and is a believer, him verily we shall quicken with good life, and We shall pay them a recompense in proportion to the best of what they used to do.

translations.SAHIH: So when you recite the Qur’ān, [first] seek refuge in Allāh from Satan, the expelled [from His mercy].
translations.PICKTHALL: And when thou recitest the Qur'an, seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, there is for him no authority over those who have believed and rely upon their Lord.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! he hath no power over those who believe and put trust in their Lord.

translations.SAHIH: His authority is only over those who take him as an ally and those who through him associate others with Allāh.
translations.PICKTHALL: His power is only over those who make a friend of him, and those who ascribe partners unto Him (Allah).

translations.SAHIH: And when We substitute a verse in place of a verse - and Allāh is most knowing of what He sends down - they say, "You, [O Muḥammad], are but an inventor [of lies]." But most of them do not know.
translations.PICKTHALL: And when We put a revelation in place of (another) revelation, - and Allah knoweth best what He revealeth - they say: Lo! thou art but inventing. Most of them know not.

translations.SAHIH: Say, [O Muḥammad], "The Pure Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] has brought it down from your Lord in truth to make firm those who believe and as guidance and good tidings to the Muslims."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: The holy Spirit hath delivered it from thy Lord with truth, that it may confirm (the faith of) those who believe, and as guidance and good tidings for those who have surrendered (to Allah).

translations.SAHIH: And We certainly know that they say, "It is only a human being who teaches him [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ)]." The tongue of the one they refer to is foreign,1 and this [recitation, i.e., Qur’ān] is [in] a clear Arabic language.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We know well that they say: Only a man teacheth him. The speech of him at whom they falsely hint is outlandish, and this is clear Arabic speech.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those who do not believe in the verses of Allāh - Allāh will not guide them, and for them is a painful punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who disbelieve the revelations of Allah, Allah guideth them not and theirs will be a painful doom.

translations.SAHIH: They only invent falsehood who do not believe in the verses of Allāh, and it is those who are the liars.
translations.PICKTHALL: Only they invent falsehood who believe not Allah's revelations, and (only) they are the liars.

translations.SAHIH: Whoever disbelieves in [i.e., denies] Allāh after his belief...1 except for one who is forced [to renounce his religion] while his heart is secure in faith. But those who [willingly] open their breasts to disbelief, upon them is wrath from Allāh, and for them is a great punishment;
translations.PICKTHALL: Whoso disbelieveth in Allah after his belief - save him who is forced thereto and whose heart is still content with the Faith - but whoso findeth ease in disbelief: On them is wrath from Allah. Theirs will be an awful doom.

translations.SAHIH: That is because they preferred the worldly life over the Hereafter and that Allāh does not guide the disbelieving people.
translations.PICKTHALL: That is because they have chosen the life of the world rather than the Hereafter, and because Allah guideth not the disbelieving folk.

translations.SAHIH: Those are the ones over whose hearts and hearing and vision Allāh has sealed, and it is those who are the heedless.
translations.PICKTHALL: Such are they whose hearts and ears and eyes Allah hath sealed. And such are the heedless.

translations.SAHIH: Assuredly, it is they, in the Hereafter, who will be the losers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Assuredly in the Hereafter they are the losers.

translations.SAHIH: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who emigrated after they had been compelled [to say words of disbelief] and thereafter fought [for the cause of Allāh] and were patient - indeed, your Lord, after that, is Forgiving and Merciful
translations.PICKTHALL: Then lo! thy Lord - for those who became fugitives after they had been persecuted, and then fought and were steadfast - lo! thy Lord afterward is (for them) indeed Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: On the Day when every soul will come disputing [i.e., pleading] for itself, and every soul will be fully compensated for what it did, and they will not be wronged [i.e., treated unjustly].
translations.PICKTHALL: On the Day when every soul will come pleading for itself, and every soul will be repaid what it did, and they will not be wronged.

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh presents an example: a city [i.e., Makkah] which was safe and secure, its provision coming to it in abundance from every location, but it denied the favors of Allāh. So Allāh made it taste the envelopment of hunger and fear for what they had been doing.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah coineth a similitude: a township that dwelt secure and well content, its provision coming to it in abundance from every side, but it disbelieved in Allah's favours, so Allah made it experience the garb of dearth and fear because of what they used to do.

translations.SAHIH: And there had certainly come to them a Messenger from among themselves, but they denied him; so punishment overtook them while they were wrongdoers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily there had come unto them a messenger from among them, but they had denied him, and so the torment seized them while they were wrong-doers.

translations.SAHIH: Then eat of what Allāh has provided for you [which is] lawful and good. And be grateful for the favor of Allāh, if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.
translations.PICKTHALL: So eat of the lawful and good food which Allah hath provided for you, and thank the bounty of your Lord if it is Him ye serve.

translations.SAHIH: He has only forbidden to you dead animals,1 blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allāh. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit] - then indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: He hath forbidden for you only carrion and blood and swineflesh and that which hath been immolated in the name of any other than Allah; but he who is driven thereto, neither craving nor transgressing, lo! then Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: And do not say about what your tongues assert of untruth, "This is lawful and this is unlawful," to invent falsehood about Allāh. Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allāh will not succeed.
translations.PICKTHALL: And speak not, concerning that which your own tongues qualify (as clean or unclean), the falsehood: "This is lawful, and this is forbidden," so that ye invent a lie against Allah. Lo! those who invent a lie against Allah will not succeed.

translations.SAHIH: [It is but] a brief enjoyment, and they will have a painful punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: A brief enjoyment (will be theirs); and theirs a painful doom.

translations.SAHIH: And to those who are Jews We have prohibited that which We related to you before.1 And We did not wrong them [thereby], but they were wronging themselves.
translations.PICKTHALL: And unto those who are Jews We have forbidden that which We have already related unto thee. And We wronged them not, but they were wont to wrong themselves.

translations.SAHIH: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who have done wrong out of ignorance and then repent after that and correct themselves - indeed, your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then lo! thy Lord - for those who do evil in ignorance and afterward repent and amend - lo! (for them) thy Lord is afterward indeed Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, Abraham was a [comprehensive] leader,1 devoutly obedient to Allāh, inclining toward truth, and he was not of those who associate others with Allāh.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! Abraham was a nation obedient to Allah, by nature upright, and he was not of the idolaters;

translations.SAHIH: [He was] grateful for His favors. He [i.e., Allāh] chose him and guided him to a straight path.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thankful for His bounties; He chose him and He guided him unto a straight path.

translations.SAHIH: And We gave him good in this world, and indeed, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We gave him good in the world, and in the Hereafter he is among the righteous.

translations.SAHIH: Then We revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], to follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth; and he was not of those who associate with Allāh.
translations.PICKTHALL: And afterward We inspired thee (Muhammad, saying): Follow the religion of Abraham, as one by nature upright. He was not of the idolaters.

translations.SAHIH: The sabbath was only appointed for those who differed over it. And indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
