translations.PICKTHALL: That is their reward: hell, because they disbelieved, and made a jest of Our revelations and Our messengers.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - they will have the Gardens of Paradise1 as a lodging,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who believe and do good works, theirs are the Gardens of Paradise for welcome,

translations.SAHIH: Wherein they abide eternally. They will not desire from it any transfer.
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherein they will abide, with no desire to be removed from thence.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "If the sea were ink for [writing] the words1 of my Lord, the sea would be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even if We brought the like of it in [continual] supplement."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Though the sea became ink for the Words of my Lord, verily the sea would be used up before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even though We brought the like thereof to help.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "I am only a man like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is one God. So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: I am only a mortal like you. My Lord inspireth in me that your Allah is only One Allah. And whoever hopeth for the meeting with his Lord, let him do righteous work, and make none sharer of the worship due unto his Lord.

translations.SAHIH: Kāf, Hā, Yā, ʿAyn, Ṣād.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Kaf. Ha. Ya. A'in. Sad.

translations.SAHIH: [This is] a mention of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah
translations.PICKTHALL: A mention of the mercy of thy Lord unto His servant Zachariah.

translations.SAHIH: When he called to his Lord a private call [i.e., supplication].
translations.PICKTHALL: When he cried unto his Lord a cry in secret,

translations.SAHIH: He said, "My Lord, indeed my bones have weakened, and my head has filled1 with white, and never have I been in my supplication to You, my Lord, unhappy [i.e., disappointed].
translations.PICKTHALL: Saying: My Lord! Lo! the bones of me wax feeble and my head is shining with grey hair, and I have never been unblest in prayer to Thee, my Lord.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, I fear the successors1 after me, and my wife has been barren, so give me from Yourself an heir
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! I fear my kinsfolk after me, since my wife is barren. Oh, give me from Thy presence a successor

translations.SAHIH: Who will inherit me1 and inherit from the family of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, pleasing [to You]."
translations.PICKTHALL: Who shall inherit of me and inherit (also) of the house of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, acceptable (unto Thee).

translations.SAHIH: [He was told],1 "O Zechariah, indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be John. We have not assigned to any before [this] name."
translations.PICKTHALL: (It was said unto him): O Zachariah! Lo! We bring thee tidings of a son whose name is John; we have given the same name to none before (him).

translations.SAHIH: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?"
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: My Lord! How can I have a son when my wife is barren and I have reached infirm old age?

translations.SAHIH: [An angel] said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing.'"
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: So (it will be). Thy Lord saith: It is easy for Me, even as I created thee before, when thou wast naught.

translations.SAHIH: [Zechariah] said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights, [being] sound."1
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: My Lord! Appoint for me some token. He said: Thy token is that thou, with no bodily defect, shalt not speak unto mankind three nights.

translations.SAHIH: So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt [Allāh] in the morning and afternoon.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then he came forth unto his people from the sanctuary, and signified to them: Glorify your Lord at break of day and fall of night.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh said], "O John, take the Scripture [i.e., adhere to it] with determination." And We gave him judgement [while yet] a boy
translations.PICKTHALL: (And it was said unto his son): O John! Hold fast the Scripture. And we gave him wisdom when a child,

translations.SAHIH: And affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allāh
translations.PICKTHALL: And compassion from Our presence, and purity; and he was devout,

translations.SAHIH: And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant.
translations.PICKTHALL: And dutiful toward his parents. And he was not arrogant, rebellious.

translations.SAHIH: And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is raised alive.
translations.PICKTHALL: Peace on him the day he was born, and the day he dieth and the day he shall be raised alive!

translations.SAHIH: And mention, [O Muḥammad], in the Book [the story of] Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east.
translations.PICKTHALL: And make mention of Mary in the Scripture, when she had withdrawn from her people to a chamber looking East,

translations.SAHIH: And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen. Then We sent to her Our Angel [i.e., Gabriel], and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.
translations.PICKTHALL: And had chosen seclusion from them. Then We sent unto her Our Spirit and it assumed for her the likeness of a perfect man.

translations.SAHIH: She said, "Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Merciful from you, [so leave me], if you should be fearing of Allāh."
translations.PICKTHALL: She said: Lo! I seek refuge in the Beneficent One from thee, if thou art Allah-fearing.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you [news of] a pure boy [i.e., son]."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: I am only a messenger of thy Lord, that I may bestow on thee a faultless son.

translations.SAHIH: She said, "How can I have a boy while no man has touched me and I have not been unchaste?"
translations.PICKTHALL: She said: How can I have a son when no mortal hath touched me, neither have I been unchaste?

translations.SAHIH: He said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to the people and a mercy from Us. And it is a matter [already] decreed.'"
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: So (it will be). Thy Lord saith: It is easy for Me. And (it will be) that We may make of him a revelation for mankind and a mercy from Us, and it is a thing ordained.

translations.SAHIH: So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a remote place.
translations.PICKTHALL: And she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a far place.

translations.SAHIH: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, "Oh, I wish I had died before this and was in oblivion, forgotten."
translations.PICKTHALL: And the pangs of childbirth drove her unto the trunk of the palm-tree. She said: Oh, would that I had died ere this and had become a thing of naught, forgotten!

translations.SAHIH: But he1 called her from below her, "Do not grieve; your Lord has provided beneath you a stream.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then (one) cried unto her from below her, saying: Grieve not! Thy Lord hath placed a rivulet beneath thee,

translations.SAHIH: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.
translations.PICKTHALL: And shake the trunk of the palm-tree toward thee, thou wilt cause ripe dates to fall upon thee.

translations.SAHIH: So eat and drink and be contented. And if you see from among humanity anyone, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention, so I will not speak today to [any] man.'"
translations.PICKTHALL: So eat and drink and be consoled. And if thou meetest any mortal, say: Lo! I have vowed a fast unto the Beneficent, and may not speak this day to any mortal.

translations.SAHIH: Then she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, "O Mary, you have certainly done a thing unprecedented.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then she brought him to her own folk, carrying him. They said: O Mary! Thou hast come with an amazing thing.

translations.SAHIH: O sister [i.e., descendant] of Aaron, your father was not a man of evil, nor was your mother unchaste."
translations.PICKTHALL: O sister of Aaron! Thy father was not a wicked man nor was thy mother a harlot.

translations.SAHIH: So she pointed to him. They said, "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle a child?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Then she pointed to him. They said: How can we talk to one who is in the cradle, a young boy?

translations.SAHIH: [Jesus] said, "Indeed, I am the servant of Allāh. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet.
translations.PICKTHALL: He spake: Lo! I am the slave of Allah. He hath given me the Scripture and hath appointed me a Prophet,

translations.SAHIH: And He has made me blessed wherever I am and has enjoined upon me prayer and zakāh as long as I remain alive
translations.PICKTHALL: And hath made me blessed wheresoever I may be, and hath enjoined upon me prayer and almsgiving so long as I remain alive,

translations.SAHIH: And [made me] dutiful to my mother, and He has not made me a wretched tyrant.
translations.PICKTHALL: And (hath made me) dutiful toward her who bore me, and hath not made me arrogant, unblest.

translations.SAHIH: And peace is on me the day I was born and the day I will die and the day I am raised alive."
translations.PICKTHALL: Peace on me the day I was born, and the day I die, and the day I shall be raised alive!

translations.SAHIH: That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the word of truth about which they are in dispute.
translations.PICKTHALL: Such was Jesus, son of Mary: (this is) a statement of the truth concerning which they doubt.

translations.SAHIH: It is not [befitting] for Allāh to take a son; exalted is He!1 When He decrees an affair, He only says to it, "Be," and it is.
translations.PICKTHALL: It befitteth not (the Majesty of) Allah that He should take unto Himself a son. Glory be to Him! When He decreeth a thing, He saith unto it only: Be! and it is.

translations.SAHIH: [Jesus said], "And indeed, Allāh is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is a straight path."
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! Allah is my Lord and your Lord. So serve Him. That is the right path.

translations.SAHIH: Then the factions differed [concerning Jesus] from among them, so woe to those who disbelieved - from the scene of a tremendous Day.
translations.PICKTHALL: The sects among them differ: but woe unto the disbelievers from the meeting of an awful Day.

translations.SAHIH: How [clearly] they will hear and see the Day they come to Us, but the wrongdoers today are in clear error.
translations.PICKTHALL: See and hear them on the Day they come unto Us! yet the evil-doers are to-day in error manifest.

translations.SAHIH: And warn them, [O Muḥammad], of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be concluded;1 and [yet], they are in [a state of] heedlessness, and they do not believe.
translations.PICKTHALL: And warn them of the Day of anguish when the case hath been decided. Now they are in a state of carelessness, and they believe not.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it is We who will inherit the earth and whoever is on it, and to Us they will be returned.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We, only We, inherit the earth and all who are thereon, and unto Us they are returned.

translations.SAHIH: And mention in the Book [the story of] Abraham. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.
translations.PICKTHALL: And make mention (O Muhammad) in the Scripture of Abraham. Lo! he was a saint, a prophet.

translations.SAHIH: [Mention] when he said to his father, "O my father, why do you worship that which does not hear and does not see and will not benefit you at all?
translations.PICKTHALL: When he said unto his father: O my father! Why worshippest thou that which heareth not nor seeth, nor can in aught avail thee?

translations.SAHIH: O my father, indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you, so follow me; I will guide you to an even path.
translations.PICKTHALL: O my father! Lo! there hath come unto me of knowledge that which came not unto thee. So follow me, and I will lead thee on a right path.

translations.SAHIH: O my father, do not worship [i.e., obey] Satan. Indeed Satan has ever been, to the Most Merciful, disobedient.
translations.PICKTHALL: O my father! Serve not the devil. Lo! the devil is a rebel unto the Beneficent.

translations.SAHIH: O my father, indeed I fear that there will touch you a punishment from the Most Merciful so you would be to Satan a companion [in Hellfire]."
translations.PICKTHALL: O my father! Lo! I fear lest a punishment from the Beneficent overtake thee so that thou become a comrade of the devil.

translations.SAHIH: [His father] said, "Have you no desire for my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will surely stone you, so avoid me a prolonged time."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Rejectest thou my gods, O Abraham? If thou cease not, I shall surely stone thee. Depart from me a long while!

translations.SAHIH: [Abraham] said, "Peace [i.e., safety] will be upon you.1 I will ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Indeed, He is ever gracious to me.
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Peace be unto thee! I shall ask forgiveness of my Lord for thee. Lo! He was ever gracious unto me.

translations.SAHIH: And I will leave you and those you invoke other than Allāh and will invoke1 my Lord. I expect that I will not be in invocation to my Lord unhappy [i.e., disappointed]."
translations.PICKTHALL: I shall withdraw from you and that unto which ye pray beside Allah, and I shall pray unto my Lord. It may be that, in prayer unto my Lord, I shall not be unblest.

translations.SAHIH: So when he had left them and those they worshipped other than Allāh, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each [of them] We made a prophet.
translations.PICKTHALL: So, when he had withdrawn from them and that which they were worshipping beside Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob. Each of them We made a prophet.

translations.SAHIH: And We gave them of Our mercy, and We made for them a mention [i.e., reputation] of high honor.
translations.PICKTHALL: And we gave them of Our mercy, and assigned to them a high and true renown.

translations.SAHIH: And mention in the Book, Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And make mention in the Scripture of Moses. Lo! he was chosen, and he was a messenger (of Allah), a prophet.

translations.SAHIH: And We called him from the side of the mount1 at [his] right and brought him near, confiding [to him].
translations.PICKTHALL: We called him from the right slope of the Mount, and brought him nigh in communion.

translations.SAHIH: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron as a prophet.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We bestowed upon him of Our mercy his brother Aaron, a prophet (likewise).

translations.SAHIH: And mention in the Book, Ishmael. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger and a prophet.
translations.PICKTHALL: And make mention in the Scripture of Ishmael. Lo! he was a keeper of his promise, and he was a messenger (of Allah), a prophet.

translations.SAHIH: And he used to enjoin on his people prayer and zakāh and was to his Lord pleasing [i.e., accepted by Him].
translations.PICKTHALL: He enjoined upon his people worship and almsgiving, and was acceptable in the sight of his Lord.

translations.SAHIH: And mention in the Book, Idrees. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.
translations.PICKTHALL: And make mention in the Scripture of Idris. Lo! he was a saint, a prophet;

translations.SAHIH: And We raised him to a high station.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We raised him to high station.

translations.SAHIH: Those were the ones upon whom Allāh bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel [i.e., Jacob], and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping.
translations.PICKTHALL: These are they unto whom Allah showed favour from among the prophets, of the seed of Adam and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and from among those whom We guided and chose. When the revelations of the Beneficent were recited unto them, they fell down, adoring and weeping.

translations.SAHIH: But there came after them successors [i.e., later generations] who neglected prayer and pursued desires; so they are going to meet evil1 -
translations.PICKTHALL: Now there hath succeeded them a later generation whom have ruined worship and have followed lusts. But they will meet deception.

translations.SAHIH: Except those who repent, believe and do righteousness; for those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged at all.
translations.PICKTHALL: Save him who shall repent and believe and do right. Such will enter the Garden, and they will not be wronged in aught -

translations.SAHIH: [Therein are] gardens of perpetual residence which the Most Merciful has promised His servants in the unseen. Indeed, His promise has ever been eminent.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Gardens of Eden, which the Beneficent hath promised to His slaves in the unseen. Lo! His promise is ever sure of fulfilment -

translations.SAHIH: They will not hear therein any ill speech - only [greetings of] peace - and they will have their provision therein, morning and afternoon.
translations.PICKTHALL: They hear therein no idle talk, but only Peace; and therein they have food for morn and evening.

translations.SAHIH: That is Paradise, which We give as inheritance to those of Our servants who were fearing of Allāh.
translations.PICKTHALL: Such is the Garden which We cause the devout among Our bondmen to inherit.

translations.SAHIH: [Gabriel said],1 "And we [angels] descend not except by the order of your Lord. To Him belongs that before us and that behind us and what is in between. And never is your Lord forgetful -
translations.PICKTHALL: We (angels) come not down save by commandment of thy Lord. Unto Him belongeth all that is before us and all that is behind us and all that is between those two, and thy Lord was never forgetful -

translations.SAHIH: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them - so worship Him and have patience for His worship. Do you know of any similarity to Him?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them! Therefor, worship thou Him and be thou steadfast in His service. Knowest thou one that can be named along with Him?

translations.SAHIH: And man [i.e., the disbeliever] says, "When I have died, am I going to be brought forth alive?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And man saith: When I am dead, shall I forsooth be brought forth alive?

translations.SAHIH: Does man not remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?
translations.PICKTHALL: Doth not man remember that We created him before, when he was naught?

translations.SAHIH: So by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will bring them to be present around Hell upon their knees.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And, by thy Lord, verily We shall assemble them and the devils, then We shall bring them, crouching, around hell.

translations.SAHIH: Then We will surely extract from every sect those of them who were worst against the Most Merciful in insolence.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We shall pluck out from every sect whichever of them was most stubborn in rebellion to the Beneficent.

translations.SAHIH: Then, surely it is We who are most knowing of those most worthy of burning therein.
translations.PICKTHALL: And surely We are Best Aware of those most worthy to be burned therein.

translations.SAHIH: And there is none of you except he will come to it.1 This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed.
translations.PICKTHALL: There is not one of you but shall approach it. That is a fixed ordinance of thy Lord.

translations.SAHIH: Then We will save those who feared Allāh and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We shall rescue those who kept from evil, and leave the evil-doers crouching there.

translations.SAHIH: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Which of [our] two parties is best in position and best in association?"1
translations.PICKTHALL: And when Our clear revelations are recited unto them, those who disbelieve say unto those who believe: Which of the two parties (yours or ours) is better in position, and more imposing as an army?

translations.SAHIH: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them who were better in possessions and [outward] appearance?
translations.PICKTHALL: How many a generation have We destroyed before them, who were more imposing in respect of gear and outward seeming!

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Whoever is in error - let the Most Merciful extend for him an extension [in wealth and time] until, when they see that which they were promised - either punishment [in this world] or the Hour [of resurrection] - they will come to know who is worst in position and weaker in soldiers."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: As for him who is in error, the Beneficent will verily prolong his span of life until, when they behold that which they were promised, whether it be punishment (in the world), or the Hour (of doom), they will know who is worse in position and who is weaker as an army.

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh increases those who were guided, in guidance, and the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord1 for reward and better for recourse.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah increaseth in right guidance those who walk aright, and the good deeds which endure are better in thy Lord's sight for reward, and better for resort.

translations.SAHIH: Then, have you seen he who disbelieved in Our verses and said, "I will surely be given wealth and children [in the next life]"?
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou seen him who disbelieveth in Our revelations and saith: Assuredly I shall be given wealth and children?

translations.SAHIH: Has he looked into the unseen, or has he taken from the Most Merciful a promise?
translations.PICKTHALL: Hath he perused the Unseen, or hath he made a pact with the Beneficent?

translations.SAHIH: No! We will record what he says and extend [i.e., increase] for him from the punishment extensively.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but We shall record that which he saith and prolong for him a span of torment.

translations.SAHIH: And We will inherit him [in] what he mentions,1 and he will come to Us alone.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We shall inherit from him that whereof he spake, and he will come unto Us, alone (without his wealth and children).

translations.SAHIH: And they have taken besides Allāh [false] deities that they would be for them [a source of] honor.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they have chosen (other) gods beside Allah that they may be a power for them.

translations.SAHIH: No! They [i.e., those "gods"] will deny their worship of them and will be against them opponents [on the Day of Judgement].
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but they will deny their worship of them, and become opponents unto them.

translations.SAHIH: Do you not see that We have sent the devils upon the disbelievers, inciting them [to evil] with [constant] incitement?
translations.PICKTHALL: Seest thou not that We have set the devils on the disbelievers to confound them with confusion?

translations.SAHIH: So be not impatient over them. We only count out [i.e., allow] to them a [limited] number.1
translations.PICKTHALL: So make no haste against them (O Muhammad). We do but number unto them a sum (of days).

translations.SAHIH: On the Day We will gather the righteous to the Most Merciful as a delegation
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when We shall gather the righteous unto the Beneficent, a goodly company.

translations.SAHIH: And will drive the criminals to Hell in thirst
translations.PICKTHALL: And drive the guilty unto hell, a weary herd,

translations.SAHIH: None will have [power of] intercession except he who had taken from the Most Merciful a covenant.1
translations.PICKTHALL: They will have no power of intercession, save him who hath made a covenant with his Lord.

translations.SAHIH: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken [for Himself] a son."
translations.PICKTHALL: And they say: The Beneficent hath taken unto Himself a son.

translations.SAHIH: You have done an atrocious thing.
translations.PICKTHALL: Assuredly ye utter a disastrous thing

translations.SAHIH: The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation
translations.PICKTHALL: Whereby almost the heavens are torn, and the earth is split asunder and the mountains fall in ruins,

translations.SAHIH: That they attribute to the Most Merciful a son.
translations.PICKTHALL: That ye ascribe unto the Beneficent a son,

translations.SAHIH: And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son.
translations.PICKTHALL: When it is not meet for (the Majesty of) the Beneficent that He should choose a son.

translations.SAHIH: There is no one in the heavens and earth but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant.
translations.PICKTHALL: There is none in the heavens and the earth but cometh unto the Beneficent as a slave.

translations.SAHIH: He has enumerated them and counted them a [full] counting.
translations.PICKTHALL: Verily He knoweth them and numbereth them with (right) numbering.

translations.SAHIH: And all of them are coming to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone.
translations.PICKTHALL: And each one of them will come unto Him on the Day of Resurrection, alone.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who believe and do good works, the Beneficent will appoint for them love.

translations.SAHIH: So, [O Muḥammad], We have only made it [i.e., the Qur’ān] easy in your tongue [i.e., the Arabic language] that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous and warn thereby a hostile people.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We make (this Scripture) easy in thy tongue, (O Muhammad) only that thou mayst bear good tidings therewith unto those who ward off (evil), and warn therewith the froward folk.

translations.SAHIH: And how many have We destroyed before them of generations? Do you perceive of them anyone or hear from them a sound?
translations.PICKTHALL: And how many a generation before them have We destroyed! Canst thou (Muhammad) see a single man of them, or hear from them the slightest sound?

translations.SAHIH: Ṭā, Hā.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Ta. Ha.

translations.SAHIH: We have not sent down to you the Qur’ān that you be distressed
translations.PICKTHALL: We have not revealed unto thee (Muhammad) this Qur'an that thou shouldst be distressed,

translations.SAHIH: But only as a reminder for those who fear [Allāh] -
translations.PICKTHALL: But as a reminder unto him who feareth,

translations.SAHIH: A revelation from He who created the earth and highest heavens,
translations.PICKTHALL: A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the high heavens,

translations.SAHIH: The Most Merciful [who is] above the Throne established.1
translations.PICKTHALL: The Beneficent One, Who is established on the Throne.

translations.SAHIH: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth and what is between them and what is under the soil.
translations.PICKTHALL: Unto Him belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth, and whatsoever is between them, and whatsoever is beneath the sod.

translations.SAHIH: And if you speak aloud - then indeed, He knows the secret and what is [even] more hidden.
translations.PICKTHALL: And if thou speakest aloud, then lo! He knoweth the secret (thought) and (that which is yet) more hidden.

translations.SAHIH: Allāh - there is no deity except Him. To Him belong the best names.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah! There is no Allah save Him. His are the most beautiful names.

translations.SAHIH: And has the story of Moses reached you? -
translations.PICKTHALL: Hath there come unto thee the story of Moses?

translations.SAHIH: When he saw a fire and said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire; perhaps I can bring you a torch or find at the fire some guidance."
translations.PICKTHALL: When he saw a fire and said unto his folk: Lo! Wait! I see a fire afar off. Peradventure I may bring you a brand therefrom or may find guidance at the fire.

translations.SAHIH: And when he came to it, he was called, "O Moses,
translations.PICKTHALL: And when he reached it, he was called by name: O Moses!

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, I am your Lord, so remove your sandals. Indeed, you are in the blessed valley of Ṭuwā.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! I, even I, am thy Lord, So take off thy shoes, for lo! thou art in the holy valley of Tuwa.

translations.SAHIH: And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed [to you].
translations.PICKTHALL: And I have chosen thee, so hearken unto that which is inspired.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, I am Allāh. There is no deity except Me, so worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! I, even I, am Allah, There is no Allah save Me. So serve Me and establish worship for My remembrance.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, the Hour is coming - I almost conceal it1 - so that every soul may be recompensed according to that for which it strives.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! the Hour is surely coming. But I will to keep it hidden, that every soul may be rewarded for that which it striveth (to achieve).

translations.SAHIH: So do not let one avert you from it1 who does not believe in it and follows his desire, for you [then] would perish.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor, let not him turn thee aside from (the thought of) it who believeth not therein but followeth his own desire, lest thou perish.

translations.SAHIH: And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And what is that in thy right hand, O Moses?

translations.SAHIH: He said, "It is my staff; I lean upon it, and I bring down leaves for my sheep and I have therein other uses."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: This is my staff whereon I lean, and wherewith I bear down branches for my sheep, and wherein I find other uses.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "Throw it down, O Moses."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Cast it down, O Moses!

translations.SAHIH: So he threw it down, and thereupon it was a snake, moving swiftly.
translations.PICKTHALL: So he cast it down, and lo! it was a serpent, gliding.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "Seize it and fear not; We will return it to its former condition.
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Grasp it and fear not. We shall return it to its former state.

translations.SAHIH: And draw in your hand to your side; it will come out white without disease - another sign,
translations.PICKTHALL: And thrust thy hand within thine armpit, it will come forth white without hurt. (That will be) another token.

translations.SAHIH: That We may show you [some] of Our greater signs.
translations.PICKTHALL: That We may show thee (some) of Our greater portents,

translations.SAHIH: Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed [i.e., tyrannized]."
translations.PICKTHALL: Go thou unto Pharaoh! Lo! he hath transgressed (the bounds).

translations.SAHIH: [Moses] said, "My Lord, expand [i.e., relax] for me my breast [with assurance]
translations.PICKTHALL: (Moses) said: My Lord! relieve my mind

translations.SAHIH: And ease for me my task
translations.PICKTHALL: And ease my task for me;

translations.SAHIH: And untie the knot from my tongue
translations.PICKTHALL: And loose a knot from my tongue,

translations.SAHIH: That they may understand my speech.
translations.PICKTHALL: That they may understand my saying.

translations.SAHIH: And appoint for me a minister [i.e., assistant] from my family -
translations.PICKTHALL: Appoint for me a henchman from my folk,

translations.SAHIH: Aaron, my brother.
translations.PICKTHALL: Aaron, my brother.

translations.SAHIH: Increase through him my strength
translations.PICKTHALL: Confirm my strength with him

translations.SAHIH: And let him share my task
translations.PICKTHALL: And let him share my task,

translations.SAHIH: That we may exalt You much
translations.PICKTHALL: That we may glorify Thee much

translations.SAHIH: And remember You much.
translations.PICKTHALL: And much remember Thee.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, You are of us ever Seeing."
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! Thou art ever Seeing us.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "You have been granted your request, O Moses.
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Thou art granted thy request, O Moses.

translations.SAHIH: And We had already conferred favor upon you another time,
translations.PICKTHALL: And indeed, another time, already We have shown thee favour,

translations.SAHIH: When We inspired to your mother what We inspired,
translations.PICKTHALL: When we inspired in thy mother that which is inspired,

translations.SAHIH: [Saying], 'Cast him into the chest and cast it into the river, and the river will throw it onto the bank; there will take him an enemy to Me and an enemy to him.' And I bestowed upon you love from Me1 that you would be brought up under My eye [i.e., observation and care].
translations.PICKTHALL: Saying: Throw him into the ark, and throw it into the river, then the river shall throw it on to the bank, and there an enemy to Me and an enemy to him shall take him. And I endued thee with love from Me that thou mightest be trained according to My will,

translations.SAHIH: [And We favored you] when your sister went and said, 'Shall I direct you to someone who will be responsible for him?' So We restored you to your mother that she might be content and not grieve. And you killed someone,1 but We saved you from retaliation and tried you with a [severe] trial. And you remained [some] years among the people of Madyan. Then you came [here] at the decreed time, O Moses.
translations.PICKTHALL: When thy sister went and said: Shall I show you one who will nurse him? and we restored thee to thy mother that her eyes might be refreshed and might not sorrow. And thou didst kill a man and We delivered thee from great distress, and tried thee with a heavy trial. And thou didst tarry years among the folk of Midian. Then camest thou (hither) by (My) providence, O Moses,

translations.SAHIH: And I produced you for Myself.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And I have attached thee to Myself.

translations.SAHIH: Go, you and your brother, with My signs and do not slacken in My remembrance.
translations.PICKTHALL: Go, thou and thy brother, with My tokens, and be not faint in remembrance of Me.

translations.SAHIH: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.
translations.PICKTHALL: Go, both of you, unto Pharaoh. Lo! he hath transgressed (the bounds).

translations.SAHIH: And speak to him with gentle speech that perhaps he may be reminded or fear [Allāh]."
translations.PICKTHALL: And speak unto him a gentle word, that peradventure he may heed or fear.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Our Lord, indeed we are afraid that he will hasten [punishment] against us or that he will transgress."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Our Lord! Lo! we fear that he may be beforehand with us or that he may play the tyrant.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "Fear not. Indeed, I am with you both; I hear and I see.
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Fear not. Lo! I am with you twain, Hearing and Seeing.

translations.SAHIH: So go to him and say, 'Indeed, we are messengers of your Lord, so send with us the Children of Israel and do not torment them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And peace1 will be upon he who follows the guidance.
translations.PICKTHALL: So go ye unto him and say: Lo! we are two messengers of thy Lord. So let the children of Israel go with us, and torment them not. We bring thee a token from thy Lord. And peace will be for him who followeth right guidance.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it has been revealed to us that the punishment will be upon whoever denies and turns away.'"
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! it hath been revealed unto us that the doom will be for him who denieth and turneth away.

translations.SAHIH: [Pharaoh] said, "So who is the Lord of you two, O Moses?"
translations.PICKTHALL: (Pharaoh) said: Who then is the Lord of you twain, O Moses?

translations.SAHIH: He said, "Our Lord is He who gave each thing its form and then guided [it]."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Our Lord is He Who gave unto everything its nature, then guided it aright.

translations.SAHIH: [Pharaoh] said, "Then what is the case of the former generations?"
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: What then is the state of the generations of old?

translations.SAHIH: [Moses] said, "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a record. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a Record. My Lord neither erreth nor forgetteth,

translations.SAHIH: [It is He] who has made for you the earth as a bed [spread out] and inserted therein for you roadways and sent down from the sky, rain and produced thereby categories of various plants.
translations.PICKTHALL: Who hath appointed the earth as a bed and hath threaded roads for you therein and hath sent down water from the sky and thereby We have brought forth divers kinds of vegetation,

translations.SAHIH: Eat [therefrom] and pasture your livestock. Indeed in that are signs for those of intelligence.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Saying): Eat ye and feed your cattle. Lo! herein verily are portents for men of thought.

translations.SAHIH: From it [i.e., the earth] We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will extract you another time.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thereof We created you, and thereunto We return you, and thence We bring you forth a second time.

translations.SAHIH: And We certainly showed him [i.e., Pharaoh] Our signs - all of them - but he denied and refused.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We verily did show him all Our tokens, but he denied them and refused.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Hast come to drive us out from our land by thy magic, O Moses?

translations.SAHIH: Then we will surely bring you magic like it, so make between us and you an appointment, which we will not fail to keep and neither will you, in a place assigned."1
translations.PICKTHALL: But we surely can produce for thee magic the like thereof; so appoint a tryst between us and you, which neither we nor thou shall fail to keep, at a place convenient (to us both).

translations.SAHIH: [Moses] said, "Your appointment is on the day of the festival when the people assemble at mid-morning."1
translations.PICKTHALL: (Moses) said: Your tryst shall be the day of the feast, and let the people assemble when the sun hath risen high.

translations.SAHIH: So Pharaoh went away, put together his plan, and then came [to Moses].
translations.PICKTHALL: Then Pharaoh went and gathered his strength, then came (to the appointed tryst).

translations.SAHIH: Moses said to them [i.e., the magicians summoned by Pharaoh], "Woe to you! Do not invent a lie against Allāh or He will exterminate you with a punishment; and he has failed who invents [such falsehood]."
translations.PICKTHALL: Moses said unto them: Woe unto you! Invent not a lie against Allah, lest He extirpate you by some punishment. He who lieth faileth miserably.

translations.SAHIH: So they disputed over their affair among themselves and concealed their private conversation.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then they debated one with another what they must do, and they kept their counsel secret.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Indeed, these are two magicians who want to drive you out of your land with their magic and do away with your most exemplary way [i.e., religion or tradition].
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Lo! these are two wizards who would drive you out from your country by their magic, and destroy your best traditions;

translations.SAHIH: So resolve upon your plan and then come [forward] in line. And he has succeeded today who overcomes."
translations.PICKTHALL: So arrange your plan, and come in battle line. Whoso is uppermost this day will be indeed successful.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "O Moses, either you throw or we will be the first to throw."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: O Moses! Either throw first, or let us be the first to throw?

translations.SAHIH: He said, "Rather, you throw." And suddenly their ropes and staffs seemed to him from their magic that they were moving [like snakes].
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Nay, do ye throw! Then lo! their cords and their staves, by their magic, appeared to him as though they ran.

translations.SAHIH: And he sensed within himself apprehension, did Moses.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Moses conceived a fear in his mind.

translations.SAHIH: We [i.e., Allāh] said, "Fear not. Indeed, it is you who are superior.
translations.PICKTHALL: We said: Fear not! Lo! thou art the higher.

translations.SAHIH: And throw what is in your right hand; it will swallow up what they have crafted. What they have crafted is but the trick of a magician, and the magician will not succeed wherever he is."
translations.PICKTHALL: Throw that which is in thy right hand! It will eat up that which they have made. Lo! that which they have made is but a wizard's artifice, and a wizard shall not be successful to whatever point (of skill) he may attain.

translations.SAHIH: So the magicians fell down in prostration.1 They said, "We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."
translations.PICKTHALL: Then the wizards were (all) flung down prostrate, crying: We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.

translations.SAHIH: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed him [i.e., Moses] before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and you will surely know which of us is more severe in [giving] punishment and more enduring."
translations.PICKTHALL: (Pharaoh) said: Ye put faith in him before I give you leave. Lo! he is your chief who taught you magic. Now surely I shall cut off your hands and your feet alternately, and I shall crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and ye shall know for certain which of us hath sterner and more lasting punishment.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Never will we prefer you over what has come to us of clear proofs and [over] He who created us.1 So decree whatever you are to decree. You can only decree for this worldly life.
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: We choose thee not above the clear proofs that have come unto us, and above Him Who created us. So decree what thou wilt decree. Thou wilt end for us only this life of the world.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, we have believed in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and what you compelled us [to do] of magic. And Allāh is better and more enduring."1
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! we believe in our Lord, that He may forgive us our sins and the magic unto which thou didst force us. Allah is better and more lasting.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, whoever comes to his Lord as a criminal - indeed, for him is Hell; he will neither die therein nor live.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! whoso cometh guilty unto his Lord, verily for him is hell. There he will neither die nor live.

translations.SAHIH: But whoever comes to Him as a believer having done righteous deeds - for those will be the highest degrees [in position]:
translations.PICKTHALL: But whoso cometh unto Him a believer, having done good works, for such are the high stations;

translations.SAHIH: Gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. And that is the reward of one who purifies himself.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Gardens of Eden underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide for ever. That is the reward of him who groweth.

translations.SAHIH: And We had inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants and strike for them a dry path through the sea; you will not fear being overtaken [by Pharaoh] nor be afraid [of drowning]."
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily We inspired Moses, saying: Take away My slaves by night and strike for them a dry path in the sea, fearing not to be overtaken, neither being afraid (of the sea).

translations.SAHIH: So Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers, and there covered them from the sea that which covered them,1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then Pharaoh followed them with his hosts and there covered them that which did cover them of the sea.

translations.SAHIH: And Pharaoh led his people astray and did not guide [them].
translations.PICKTHALL: And Pharaoh led his folk astray, he did not guide them.

translations.SAHIH: O Children of Israel, We delivered you from your enemy, and We made an appointment with you1 at the right side of the mount, and We sent down to you manna and quails,
translations.PICKTHALL: O Children of Israel! We delivered you from your enemy, and we made a covenant with you on the holy mountain's side, and sent down on you the manna and the quails,

translations.SAHIH: [Saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you and do not transgress [or oppress others] therein, lest My anger should descend upon you. And he upon whom My anger descends has certainly fallen [i.e., perished]."
translations.PICKTHALL: (Saying): Eat of the good things wherewith We have provided you, and transgress not in respect thereof lest My wrath come upon you: and he on whom My wrath cometh, he is lost indeed.

translations.SAHIH: But indeed, I am the Perpetual Forgiver of whoever repents and believes and does righteousness and then continues in guidance.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! verily I am Forgiving toward him who repenteth and believeth and doeth good, and afterward walketh aright.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh said], "And what made you hasten from your people, O Moses?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And (it was said): What hath made thee hasten from thy folk, O Moses?

translations.SAHIH: He said, "They are close upon my tracks, and I hastened to You, my Lord, that You be pleased."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: They are close upon my track. I hastened unto Thee, my Lord, that Thou mightest be well pleased.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "But indeed, We have tried your people after you [departed], and the Sāmirī1 has led them astray."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Lo! We have tried thy folk in thine absence, and As-Samiri hath misled them.

translations.SAHIH: So Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved.1 He said, "O my people, did your Lord not make you a good promise?2 Then, was the time [of its fulfillment] too long for you, or did you wish that wrath from your Lord descend upon you, so you broke your promise [of obedience] to me?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Then Moses went back unto his folk, angry and sad. He said: O my people! Hath not your Lord promised you a fair promise? Did the time appointed then appear too long for you, or did ye wish that wrath from your Lord should come upon you, that ye broke tryst with me?

translations.SAHIH: They said, "We did not break our promise to you by our will, but we were made to carry burdens from the ornaments of the people [of Pharaoh], so we threw them [into the fire], and thus did the Sāmirī throw."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: We broke not tryst with thee of our own will, but we were laden with burdens of ornaments of the folk, then cast them (in the fire), for thus As-Samiri proposed.

translations.SAHIH: And he extracted for them [the statue of] a calf which had a lowing sound, and they said, "This is your god and the god of Moses, but he forgot."
translations.PICKTHALL: Then he produced for them a calf, of saffron hue, which gave forth a lowing sound. And they cried: This is your god and the god of Moses, but he hath forgotten.

translations.SAHIH: Did they not see that it could not return to them any speech [i.e., response] and that it did not possess for them any harm or benefit?
translations.PICKTHALL: See they not, then, that it returneth no saying unto them and possesseth for them neither hurt nor use?

translations.SAHIH: And Aaron had already told them before [the return of Moses], "O my people, you are only being tested by it, and indeed, your Lord is the Most Merciful, so follow me and obey my order."
translations.PICKTHALL: And Aaron indeed had told them beforehand: O my people! Ye are but being seduced therewith, for lo! your Lord is the Beneficent, so follow me and obey my order.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "We will never cease being devoted to it [i.e., the calf] until Moses returns to us."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: We shall by no means cease to be its votaries till Moses return unto us.

translations.SAHIH: [Moses] said, "O Aaron, what prevented you, when you saw them going astray,
translations.PICKTHALL: He (Moses) said: O Aaron! What held thee back when thou didst see them gone astray,

translations.SAHIH: From following me? Then have you disobeyed my order?"
translations.PICKTHALL: That thou followedst me not? Hast thou then disobeyed my order?

translations.SAHIH: [Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, do not seize [me] by my beard or by my head. Indeed, I feared that you would say, 'You caused division among the Children of Israel, and you did not observe [or await] my word.'"
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: O son of my mother! Clutch not my beard nor my head! I feared lest thou shouldst say: Thou hast caused division among the Children of Israel, and hast not waited for my word.

translations.SAHIH: [Moses] said, "And what is your case, O Sāmirī?"
translations.PICKTHALL: (Moses) said: And what hast thou to say, O Samiri?

translations.SAHIH: He said, "I saw what they did not see, so I took a handful [of dust] from the track of the messenger1 and threw it,2 and thus did my soul entice me."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: I perceived what they perceive not, so I seized a handful from the footsteps of the messenger, and then threw it in. Thus my soul commended to me.

translations.SAHIH: [Moses] said, "Then go. And indeed, it is [decreed] for you in [this] life to say, 'No contact.'1 And indeed, you have an appointment [in the Hereafter] you will not fail to keep. And look at your 'god' to which you remained devoted. We will surely burn it and blow it [i.e., its ashes] into the sea with a blast.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Moses) said: Then go! and lo! in this life it is for thee to say: Touch me not! and lo! there is for thee a tryst thou canst not break. Now look upon thy god of which thou hast remained a votary. Verily we will burn it and will scatter its dust over the sea.

translations.SAHIH: Your god is only Allāh, except for whom there is no deity. He has encompassed all things in knowledge."
translations.PICKTHALL: Your Allah is only Allah, than Whom there is no other Allah. He embraceth all things in His knowledge.

translations.SAHIH: Thus, [O Muḥammad], We relate to you from the news of what has preceded. And We have certainly given you from Us a message [i.e., the Qur’ān].
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus relate We unto thee (Muhammad) some tidings of that which happened of old, and We have given thee from Our presence a reminder.

translations.SAHIH: Whoever turns away from it - then indeed, he will bear on the Day of Resurrection a burden [i.e., great sin],
translations.PICKTHALL: Whoso turneth away from it, he verily will bear a burden on the Day of Resurrection,

translations.SAHIH: [Abiding] eternally therein,1 and evil it is for them on the Day of Resurrection as a load -
translations.PICKTHALL: Abiding under it - an evil burden for them on the Day of Resurrection,

translations.SAHIH: The Day the Horn will be blown. And We will gather the criminals, that Day, blue-eyed.1
translations.PICKTHALL: The day when the Trumpet is blown. On that day we assemble the guilty white-eyed (with terror),

translations.SAHIH: They will murmur among themselves, "You remained not but ten [days in the world]."
translations.PICKTHALL: Murmuring among themselves: Ye have tarried but ten (days).

translations.SAHIH: We are most knowing of what they say when the best of them in manner [i.e., wisdom or speech] will say, "You remained not but one day."
translations.PICKTHALL: We are Best Aware of what they utter when their best in conduct say: Ye have tarried but a day.

translations.SAHIH: And they ask you about the mountains, so say, "My Lord will blow them away with a blast.1
translations.PICKTHALL: They will ask thee of the mountains (on that day). Say: My Lord will break them into scattered dust.

translations.SAHIH: And He will leave it [i.e., the earth] a level plain;
translations.PICKTHALL: And leave it as an empty plain,

translations.SAHIH: You will not see therein a depression or an elevation."
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherein thou seest neither curve nor ruggedness.

translations.SAHIH: That Day, they [i.e., everyone] will follow [the call of] the Caller1 [with] no deviation therefrom, and [all] voices will be stilled before the Most Merciful, so you will not hear except a whisper [of footsteps].
translations.PICKTHALL: On that day they follow the summoner who deceiveth not, and voices are hushed for the Beneficent, and thou hearest but a faint murmur.

translations.SAHIH: That Day, no intercession will benefit except [that of] one to whom the Most Merciful has given permission and has accepted his word.
translations.PICKTHALL: On that day no intercession availeth save (that of) him unto whom the Beneficent hath given leave and whose word He accepteth.

translations.SAHIH: He [i.e., Allāh] knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them,1 but they do not encompass it [i.e., what He knows] in knowledge.
translations.PICKTHALL: He knoweth (all) that is before them and (all) that is behind them, while they cannot compass it in knowledge.

translations.SAHIH: And [all] faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Self-Sustaining.1 And he will have failed who carries injustice.2
translations.PICKTHALL: And faces humble themselves before the Living, the Eternal. And he who beareth (a burden of) wrongdoing is indeed a failure (on that day).

translations.SAHIH: But he who does of righteous deeds while he is a believer - he will neither fear injustice nor deprivation.
translations.PICKTHALL: And he who hath done some good works, being a believer, he feareth not injustice nor begrudging (of his wage).

translations.SAHIH: And thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur’ān1 and have diversified therein the warnings that perhaps they will avoid [sin] or it would cause them remembrance.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus we have revealed it as a Lecture in Arabic, and have displayed therein certain threats, that peradventure they may keep from evil or that it may cause them to take heed.

translations.SAHIH: So high [above all] is Allāh, the Sovereign,1 the Truth.2 And, [O Muḥammad], do not hasten with [recitation of] the Qur’ān before its revelation is completed to you, and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge."
translations.PICKTHALL: Then exalted be Allah, the True King! And hasten not (O Muhammad) with the Qur'an ere its revelation hath been perfected unto thee, and say: My Lord! Increase me in knowledge.

translations.SAHIH: And We had already taken a promise from Adam before, but he forgot; and We found not in him determination.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily We made a covenant of old with Adam, but he forgot, and We found no constancy in him.

translations.SAHIH: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except Iblees;1 he refused.
translations.PICKTHALL: And when We said unto the angels: Fall prostrate before Adam, they fell prostrate (all) save Iblis; he refused.

translations.SAHIH: So We said, "O Adam, indeed this is an enemy to you and to your wife. Then let him not remove you from Paradise so you would suffer.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor we said: O Adam! This is an enemy unto thee and unto thy wife, so let him not drive you both out of the Garden so that thou come to toil.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it is [promised] for you not to be hungry therein or be unclothed.
translations.PICKTHALL: It is (vouchsafed) unto thee that thou hungerest not therein nor art naked,

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, you will not be thirsty therein or be hot from the sun."
translations.PICKTHALL: And that thou thirstest not therein nor art exposed to the sun's heat.

translations.SAHIH: Then Satan whispered to him; he said, "O Adam, shall I direct you to the tree of eternity and possession that will not deteriorate?"
translations.PICKTHALL: But the devil whispered to him, saying: O Adam! Shall I show thee the tree of immortality and power that wasteth not away?

translations.SAHIH: And they [i.e., Adam and his wife] ate of it, and their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And Adam disobeyed his Lord and erred.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then they twain ate thereof, so that their shame became apparent unto them, and they began to hide by heaping on themselves some of the leaves of the Garden. And Adam disobeyed his Lord, so went astray.

translations.SAHIH: Then his Lord chose him and turned to him in forgiveness and guided [him].
translations.PICKTHALL: Then his Lord chose him, and relented toward him, and guided him.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "Descend from it [i.e., Paradise] - all, [your descendants] being enemies to one another. And if there should come to you guidance from Me - then whoever follows My guidance will neither go astray [in the world] nor suffer [in the Hereafter].
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Go down hence, both of you, one of you a foe unto the other. But when there come unto you from Me a guidance, then whoso followeth My guidance, he will not go astray nor come to grief.

translations.SAHIH: And whoever turns away from My remembrance - indeed, he will have a depressed [i.e., difficult] life, and We will gather [i.e., raise] him on the Day of Resurrection blind."
translations.PICKTHALL: But he who turneth away from remembrance of Me, his will be a narrow life, and I shall bring him blind to the assembly on the Day of Resurrection.

translations.SAHIH: He will say, "My Lord, why have you raised me blind while I was [once] seeing?"
translations.PICKTHALL: He will say: My Lord! Wherefor hast Thou gathered me (hither) blind, when I was wont to see?

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] will say, "Thus did Our signs come to you, and you forgot [i.e., disregarded] them; and thus will you this Day be forgotten."
translations.PICKTHALL: He will say: So (it must be). Our revelations came unto thee but thou didst forget them. In like manner thou art forgotten this Day.

translations.SAHIH: And thus do We recompense he who transgressed and did not believe in the signs of his Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and more enduring.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus do We reward him who is prodigal and believeth not the revelations of his Lord; and verily the doom of the Hereafter will be sterner and more lasting.

translations.SAHIH: Then, has it not become clear to them how many generations We destroyed before them as they walk among their dwellings? Indeed in that are signs for those of intelligence.
translations.PICKTHALL: Is it not a guidance for them (to know) how many a generation We destroyed before them, amid whose dwellings they walk? Lo! therein verily are signs for men of thought.

translations.SAHIH: And if not for a word1 that preceded from your Lord, it [i.e., punishment] would have been an obligation [due immediately],2 and [if not for] a specified term [decreed].
translations.PICKTHALL: And but for a decree that had already gone forth from thy Lord, and a term already fixed, the judgment would have been inevitable (in this world).

translations.SAHIH: So be patient over what they say and exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting; and during periods of the night [exalt Him] and at the ends of the day, that you may be satisfied.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor (O Muhammad), bear with what they say, and celebrate the praise of thy Lord ere the rising of the sun and ere the going down thereof. And glorify Him some hours of the night and at the two ends of the day, that thou mayst find acceptance.

translations.SAHIH: And do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [some] categories of them, [its being but] the splendor of worldly life by which We test them. And the provision of your Lord is better and more enduring.
translations.PICKTHALL: And strain not thine eyes toward that which We cause some wedded pairs among them to enjoy, the flower of the life of the world, that We may try them thereby. The provision of thy Lord is better and more lasting.

translations.SAHIH: And enjoin prayer upon your family [and people] and be steadfast therein. We ask you not for provision; We provide for you, and the [best] outcome is for [those of] righteousness.
translations.PICKTHALL: And enjoin upon thy people worship, and be constant therein. We ask not of thee a provision: We provided for thee. And the sequel is for righteousness.

translations.SAHIH: And they say, "Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?" Has there not come to them evidence of what was in the former scriptures?1
translations.PICKTHALL: And they say: If only he would bring us a miracle from his Lord! Hath there not come unto them the proof of what is in the former scriptures?

translations.SAHIH: And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before him,1 they would have said, "Our Lord, why did You not send to us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses [i.e., teachings] before we were humiliated and disgraced?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And if we had destroyed them with some punishment before it, they would assuredly have said: Our Lord! If only Thou hadst sent unto us a messenger, so that we might have followed Thy revelations before we were (thus) humbled and disgraced!

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Each [of us] is waiting;1 so wait. For you will know who are the companions of the sound path and who is guided."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Each is awaiting; so await ye! Ye will come to know who are the owners of the path of equity, and who is right.

translations.SAHIH: [The time of] their account has approached for the people, while they are in heedlessness turning away.
translations.PICKTHALL: Their reckoning draweth nigh for mankind, while they turn away in heedlessness.

translations.SAHIH: No mention [i.e., revelation] comes to them anew from their Lord except that they listen to it while they are at play
translations.PICKTHALL: Never cometh there unto them a new reminder from their Lord but they listen to it while they play,

translations.SAHIH: With their hearts distracted. And those who do wrong conceal their private conversation, [saying], "Is this [Prophet] except a human being like you? So would you approach magic while you are aware [of it]?"
translations.PICKTHALL: With hearts preoccupied. And they confer in secret. The wrong-doers say: Is this other than a mortal like you? Will ye then succumb to magic when ye see (it)?

translations.SAHIH: He [the Prophet (ﷺ)] said, "My Lord knows whatever is said throughout the heaven and earth, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing."
translations.PICKTHALL: He saith: My Lord knoweth what is spoken in the heaven and the earth. He is the Hearer, the Knower.

translations.SAHIH: But they say, "[The revelation is but] a mixture of false dreams; rather, he has invented it; rather, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign just as the previous [messengers] were sent [with miracles]."
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, say they, (these are but) muddled dreams; nay, he hath but invented it; nay, he is but a poet. Let him bring us a portent even as those of old (who were Allah's messengers) were sent (with portents).

translations.SAHIH: Not a [single] city which We destroyed believed before them,1 so will they believe?
translations.PICKTHALL: Not a township believed of those which We destroyed before them (though We sent them portents): would they then believe?

translations.SAHIH: And We sent not before you, [O Muḥammad], except men to whom We revealed [the message], so ask the people of the message [i.e., former scriptures] if you do not know.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We sent not (as Our messengers) before thee other than men, whom We inspired. Ask the followers of the Reminder if ye know not?

translations.SAHIH: And We did not make them [i.e., the prophets] forms not eating food,1 nor were they immortal [on earth].
translations.PICKTHALL: We gave them not bodies that would not eat food, nor were they immortals.

translations.SAHIH: Then1 We fulfilled for them the promise, and We saved them and whom We willed and destroyed the transgressors.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then we fulfilled the promise unto them. So we delivered them and whom We would, and We destroyed the prodigals.

translations.SAHIH: We have certainly sent down to you a Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] in which is your mention.1 Then will you not reason?
translations.PICKTHALL: Now We have revealed unto you a Scripture wherein is your Reminder. Have ye then no sense?

translations.SAHIH: And how many a city which was unjust1 have We shattered and produced after it another people.
translations.PICKTHALL: How many a community that dealt unjustly have We shattered, and raised up after them another folk!

translations.SAHIH: And when they [i.e., its inhabitants] perceived Our punishment, at once they fled from it.
translations.PICKTHALL: And, when they felt Our might, behold them fleeing from it!

translations.SAHIH: [Some angels said], "Do not flee but return to where you were given luxury and to your homes - perhaps you will be questioned."1
translations.PICKTHALL: (But it was said unto them): Flee not, but return to that (existence) which emasculated you and to your dwellings, that ye may be questioned.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "O woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
translations.PICKTHALL: They cried: Alas for us! we were wrong-doers.

translations.SAHIH: And that declaration of theirs did not cease until We made them [as] a harvest [mowed down], extinguished [like a fire].
translations.PICKTHALL: And this their crying ceased not till We made them as reaped corn, extinct.

translations.SAHIH: And We did not create the heaven and earth and that between them in play.
translations.PICKTHALL: We created not the heaven and the earth and all that is between them in play.

translations.SAHIH: Had We intended to take a diversion,1 We could have taken it from [what is] with Us - if [indeed] We were to do so.
translations.PICKTHALL: If We had wished to find a pastime, We could have found it in Our presence - if We ever did.

translations.SAHIH: Rather, We dash the truth upon falsehood, and it destroys it,1 and thereupon it departs. And for you is destruction from that which you describe.2
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but We hurl the true against the false, and it doth break its head and lo! it vanisheth. And yours will be woe for that which ye ascribe (unto Him).

translations.SAHIH: To Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those near Him [i.e., the angels] are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, nor do they tire.
translations.PICKTHALL: Unto Him belongeth whosoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those who dwell in His presence are not too proud to worship Him, nor do they weary;

translations.SAHIH: They exalt [Him] night and day [and] do not slacken.
translations.PICKTHALL: They glorify (Him) night and day; they flag not.

translations.SAHIH: Or have they [i.e., men] taken for themselves gods from the earth who resurrect [the dead]?
translations.PICKTHALL: Or have they chosen gods from the earth who raise the dead?

translations.SAHIH: Had there been within them [i.e., the heavens and earth] gods besides Allāh, they both would have been ruined. So exalted is Allāh, Lord of the Throne, above what they describe.
translations.PICKTHALL: If there were therein gods beside Allah, then verily both (the heavens and the earth) had been disordered. Glorified be Allah, the Lord of the Throne, from all that they ascribe (unto Him).

translations.SAHIH: He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.
translations.PICKTHALL: He will not be questioned as to that which He doeth, but they will be questioned.

translations.SAHIH: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say, [O Muḥammad], "Produce your proof. This [Qur’ān] is the message for those with me and the message of those before me."1 But most of them do not know the truth, so they are turning away.
translations.PICKTHALL: Or have they chosen other gods beside Him? say: Bring your proof (of their godhead). This is the Reminder of those with me and those before me, but most of them know not the Truth and so they are averse.

translations.SAHIH: And We sent not before you any messenger except We revealed to him that, "There is no deity except Me, so worship Me."
translations.PICKTHALL: And We sent no messenger before thee but We inspired him, (saying): There is no Allah save Me (Allah), so worship Me.

translations.SAHIH: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken a son." Exalted is He! Rather, they1 are [but] honored servants.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they say: The Beneficent hath taken unto Himself a son. Be He Glorified! Nay, but (those whom they call sons) are honoured slaves;

translations.SAHIH: They cannot precede Him in word, and they act by His command.
translations.PICKTHALL: They speak not until He hath spoken, and they act by His command.

translations.SAHIH: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them,1 and they cannot intercede except on behalf of one whom He approves. And they, from fear of Him, are apprehensive.
translations.PICKTHALL: He knoweth what is before them and what is behind them, and they cannot intercede except for him whom He accepteth, and they quake for awe of Him.

translations.SAHIH: And whoever of them should say, "Indeed, I am a god besides Him" - that one We would recompense with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And one of them who should say: Lo! I am a god beside Him, that one We should repay with hell. Thus We Repay wrong-doers.

translations.SAHIH: Have those who disbelieved not considered that the heavens and the earth were a joined entity, and then We separated them and made from water every living thing? Then will they not believe?
translations.PICKTHALL: Have not those who disbelieve known that the heavens and the earth were of one piece, then We parted them, and we made every living thing of water? Will they not then believe?

translations.SAHIH: And We placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We made therein [mountain] passes [as] roads that they might be guided.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We have placed in the earth firm hills lest it quake with them, and We have placed therein ravines as roads that haply they may find their way.

translations.SAHIH: And We made the sky a protected ceiling, but they, from its signs,1 are turning away.
translations.PICKTHALL: And we have made the sky a roof withheld (from them). Yet they turn away from its portents.

translations.SAHIH: And it is He who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon; all [heavenly bodies] in an orbit are swimming.
translations.PICKTHALL: And He it is Who created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon. They float, each in an orbit.

translations.SAHIH: And We did not grant to any man before you eternity [on earth]; so if you die - would they be eternal?
translations.PICKTHALL: We appointed immortality for no mortal before thee. What! if thou diest, can they be immortal!

translations.SAHIH: Every soul will taste death. And We test you with evil and with good as trial; and to Us you will be returned.
translations.PICKTHALL: Every soul must taste of death, and We try you with evil and with good, for ordeal. And unto Us ye will be returned.

translations.SAHIH: And when those who disbelieve see you, [O Muḥammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one who mentions [i.e., insults] your gods?" And they are, at the mention of the Most Merciful, disbelievers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And when those who disbelieve behold thee, they but choose thee out for mockery, (saying): Is this he who maketh mention of your gods? And they would deny all mention of the Beneficent.

translations.SAHIH: Man was created of haste [i.e., impatience]. I will show you My signs [i.e., vengeance], so do not impatiently urge Me.
translations.PICKTHALL: Man is made of haste. I shall show you My portents, but ask Me not to hasten.

translations.SAHIH: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And they say: When will this promise (be fulfilled), if ye are truthful?

translations.SAHIH: If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not avert the Fire from their faces or from their backs and they will not be aided...1
translations.PICKTHALL: If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not be able to drive off the fire from their faces and from their backs, and they will not be helped!

translations.SAHIH: Rather, it will come to them unexpectedly and bewilder them, and they will not be able to repel it, nor will they be reprieved.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but it will come upon them unawares so that it will stupefy them, and they will be unable to repel it, neither will they be reprieved.

translations.SAHIH: And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
translations.PICKTHALL: Messengers before thee, indeed, were mocked, but that whereat they mocked surrounded those who scoffed at them.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Who can protect you at night or by day from the Most Merciful?" But they are, from the remembrance of their Lord, turning away.
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Who guardeth you in the night or in the day from the Beneficent? Nay, but they turn away from mention of their Lord!

translations.SAHIH: Or do they have gods to defend them other than Us? They are unable [even] to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us.
translations.PICKTHALL: Or have they gods who can shield them from Us? They cannot help themselves nor can they be defended from Us.

translations.SAHIH: But, [on the contrary], We have provided good things for these [disbelievers] and their fathers until life was prolonged for them. Then do they not see that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders?1 Is it they who will overcome?
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but We gave these and their fathers ease until life grew long for them. See they not how we aim to the land, reducing it of its outlying parts? Can they then be the victors?

translations.SAHIH: Say, "I only warn you by revelation." But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (O Muhammad, unto mankind): I warn you only by the Inspiration. But the deaf hear not the call when they are warned.

translations.SAHIH: And if [as much as] a whiff of the punishment of your Lord should touch them, they would surely say, "O woe to us! Indeed, we have been wrongdoers."
translations.PICKTHALL: And if a breath of thy Lord's punishment were to touch them, they assuredly would say: Alas for us! Lo! we were wrong-doers.

translations.SAHIH: And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be treated unjustly at all. And if there is [even] the weight of a mustard seed,1 We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as accountant.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We set a just balance for the Day of Resurrection so that no soul is wronged in aught. Though it be of the weight of a grain of mustard seed, We bring it. And We suffice for reckoners.

translations.SAHIH: And We had already given Moses and Aaron the criterion and a light and a reminder1 for the righteous
translations.PICKTHALL: And We verily gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion (of right and wrong) and a light and a Reminder for those who keep from evil,

translations.SAHIH: Who fear their Lord unseen,1 while they are of the Hour apprehensive.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who fear their Lord in secret and who dread the Hour (of doom).

translations.SAHIH: And this [Qur’ān] is a blessed message which We have sent down. Then are you with it unacquainted?1
translations.PICKTHALL: This is a blessed Reminder that we have revealed: Will ye then reject it?

translations.SAHIH: And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before,1 and We were of him well-Knowing
translations.PICKTHALL: And We verily gave Abraham of old his proper course, and We were Aware of him,

translations.SAHIH: When he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are devoted?"
translations.PICKTHALL: When he said unto his father and his folk: What are these images unto which ye pay devotion?

translations.SAHIH: They said, "We found our fathers worshippers of them."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: We found our fathers worshippers of them.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "You were certainly, you and your fathers, in manifest error."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Verily ye and your fathers were in plain error.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Have you come to us with truth, or are you of those who jest?"
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Bringest thou unto us the truth, or art thou some jester?

translations.SAHIH: He said, "[No], rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who created them, and I, to that, am of those who testify.
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them; and I am of those who testify unto that.

translations.SAHIH: And [I swear] by Allāh, I will surely plan against your idols after you have turned and gone away."
translations.PICKTHALL: And, by Allah, I shall circumvent your idols after ye have gone away and turned your backs.

translations.SAHIH: So he made them into fragments, except a large one among them, that they might return to it [and question].
translations.PICKTHALL: Then he reduced them to fragments, all save the chief of them, that haply they might have recourse to it.
