translations.SAHIH: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Who hath done this to our gods? Surely it must be some evil-doer.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "We heard a young man mention them who is called Abraham."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: We heard a youth make mention of them, who is called Abraham.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they may testify."1
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Then bring him (hither) before the people's eyes that they may testify.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham?"
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Is it thou who hast done this to our gods, O Abraham?

translations.SAHIH: He said, "Rather, this - the largest of them - did it, so ask them, if they should [be able to] speak."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: But this, their chief hath done it. So question them, if they can speak.

translations.SAHIH: So they returned to [blaming] themselves and said [to each other], "Indeed, you are the wrongdoers."
translations.PICKTHALL: Then gathered they apart and said: Lo! ye yourselves are the wrong-doers.

translations.SAHIH: Then they reversed themselves,1 [saying], "You have already known that these do not speak!"
translations.PICKTHALL: And they were utterly confounded, and they said: Well thou knowest that these speak not.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "Then do you worship instead of Allāh that which does not benefit you at all or harm you?
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Worship ye then instead of Allah that which cannot profit you at all, nor harm you?

translations.SAHIH: Uff1 to you and to what you worship instead of Allāh. Then will you not use reason?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Fie on you and all that ye worship instead of Allah! Have ye then no sense?

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Burn him and support your gods - if you are to act."
translations.PICKTHALL: They cried: Burn him and stand by your gods, if ye will be doing.

translations.SAHIH: We [i.e., Allāh] said, "O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham."
translations.PICKTHALL: We said: O fire, be coolness and peace for Abraham,

translations.SAHIH: And they intended for him a plan [i.e., harm], but We made them the greatest losers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they wished to set a snare for him, but We made them the greater losers.

translations.SAHIH: And We delivered him and Lot to the land which We had blessed for the worlds [i.e., peoples].
translations.PICKTHALL: And We rescued him and Lot (and brought them) to the land which We have blessed for (all) peoples.

translations.SAHIH: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in addition, and all [of them] We made righteous.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We bestowed upon him Isaac, and Jacob as a grandson. Each of them We made righteous.

translations.SAHIH: And We made them leaders guiding by Our command. And We inspired to them the doing of good deeds, establishment of prayer, and giving of zakāh; and they were worshippers of Us.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We made them chiefs who guide by Our command, and We inspired in them the doing of good deeds and the right establishment of worship and the giving of alms, and they were worshippers of Us (alone).

translations.SAHIH: And to Lot We gave judgement and knowledge, and We saved him from the city that was committing wicked deeds. Indeed, they were a people of evil, defiantly disobedient.
translations.PICKTHALL: And unto Lot we gave judgment and knowledge, and We delivered him from the community that did abominations. Lo! they were folk of evil, lewd.

translations.SAHIH: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed, he was of the righteous.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We brought him in unto Our mercy. Lo! he was of the righteous.

translations.SAHIH: And [mention] Noah, when he called [to Allāh]1 before [that time], so We responded to him and saved him and his family from the great affliction [i.e., the flood].
translations.PICKTHALL: And Noah, when he cried of old, We heard his prayer and saved him and his household from the great affliction.

translations.SAHIH: And We aided [i.e., saved] him from the people who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a people of evil, so We drowned them, all together.
translations.PICKTHALL: And delivered him from the people who denied Our revelations. Lo! they were folk of evil, therefor did We drown them all.

translations.SAHIH: And [mention] David and Solomon, when they judged concerning the field - when the sheep of a people overran it [at night],1 and We were witness to their judgement.
translations.PICKTHALL: And David and Solomon, when they gave judgment concerning the field, when people's sheep had strayed and browsed therein by night; and We were witnesses to their judgment.

translations.SAHIH: And We gave understanding of it [i.e., the case] to Solomon, and to each [of them] We gave judgement and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains to exalt [Us], along with David and [also] the birds. And We were doing [that].1
translations.PICKTHALL: And We made Solomon to understand (the case); and unto each of them We gave judgment and knowledge. And we subdued the hills and the birds to hymn (His) praise along with David. We were the doers (thereof).

translations.SAHIH: And We taught him the fashioning of coats of armor to protect you from your [enemy in] battle. So will you then be grateful?
translations.PICKTHALL: And We taught him the art of making garments (of mail) to protect you in your daring. Are ye then thankful?

translations.SAHIH: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind, blowing forcefully, proceeding by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And We are ever, of all things, Knowing.
translations.PICKTHALL: And unto Solomon (We subdued) the wind in its raging. It set by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And of everything We are Aware.

translations.SAHIH: And of the devils [i.e., jinn] were those who dived for him and did work other than that. And We were of them a guardian.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And of the evil ones (subdued We unto him) some who dived (for pearls) for him and did other work, and We were warders unto them.

translations.SAHIH: And [mention] Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, adversity has touched me, and You are the most merciful of the merciful."
translations.PICKTHALL: And Job, when he cried unto his Lord, (saying): Lo! adversity afflicteth me, and Thou art Most Merciful of all who show mercy.

translations.SAHIH: So We responded to him and removed what afflicted him of adversity. And We gave him [back] his family and the like thereof with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for the worshippers [of Allāh].
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We heard his prayer and removed that adversity from which he suffered, and We gave him his household (that he had lost) and the like thereof along with them, a mercy from Our store, and a remembrance for the worshippers;

translations.SAHIH: And [mention] Ishmael and Idrees and Dhul-Kifl; all were of the patient.
translations.PICKTHALL: And (mention) Ishmael, and Idris, and Dhu'l-Kifl. All were of the steadfast.

translations.SAHIH: And We admitted them into Our mercy. Indeed, they were of the righteous.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We brought them in unto Our mercy. Lo! they are among the righteous.

translations.SAHIH: And [mention] the man of the fish [i.e., Jonah], when he went off in anger1 and thought that We would not decree [anything] upon him.2 And he called out within the darknesses,3 "There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers."
translations.PICKTHALL: And (mention) Dhu'n-Nun, when he went off in anger and deemed that We had no power over him, but he cried out in the darkness, saying: There is no Allah save Thee. Be Thou Glorified! Lo! I have been a wrong-doer.

translations.SAHIH: So We responded to him and saved him from the distress. And thus do We save the believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then we heard his prayer and saved him from the anguish. Thus we save believers.

translations.SAHIH: And [mention] Zechariah, when he called to his Lord, "My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir], while You are the best of inheritors."
translations.PICKTHALL: And Zachariah, when he cried unto his Lord: My Lord! Leave me not childless, though Thou art the Best of inheritors.

translations.SAHIH: So We responded to him, and We gave to him John, and amended for him his wife. Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate1 Us in hope and fear, and they were to Us humbly submissive.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We heard his prayer, and bestowed upon him John, and adjusted his wife (to bear a child) for him. Lo! they used to vie one with the other in good deeds, and they cried unto Us in longing and in fear, and were submissive unto Us.

translations.SAHIH: And [mention] the one who guarded her chastity [i.e., Mary], so We blew into her [garment] through Our angel [i.e., Gabriel], and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds.
translations.PICKTHALL: And she who was chaste, therefor We breathed into her (something) of Our Spirit and made her and her son a token for (all) peoples.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed this, your religion, is one religion,1 and I am your Lord, so worship Me.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.

translations.SAHIH: And [yet] they divided their affair [i.e., that of their religion] among themselves,1 [but] all to Us will return.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they have broken their religion (into fragments) among them, (yet) all are returning unto Us.

translations.SAHIH: So whoever does righteous deeds while he is a believer - no denial will there be for his effort,1 and indeed We [i.e., Our angels], of it, are recorders.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then whoso doeth some good works and is a believer, there will be no rejection of his effort. Lo! We record (it) for him.

translations.SAHIH: And it is prohibited to [the people of] a city which We have destroyed that they will [ever] return1
translations.PICKTHALL: And there is a ban upon any community which We have destroyed: that they shall not return.

translations.SAHIH: Until when [the dam of] Gog and Magog has been opened and they, from every elevation, descend
translations.PICKTHALL: Until, when Gog and Magog are let loose, and they hasten out of every mound,

translations.SAHIH: And [when] the true promise [i.e., the resurrection] has approached; then suddenly the eyes of those who disbelieved will be staring [in horror, while they say], "O woe to us; we had been unmindful of this; rather, we were wrongdoers."
translations.PICKTHALL: And the True Promise draweth nigh; then behold them, staring wide (in terror), the eyes of those who disbelieve! (They say): Alas for us! We (lived) in forgetfulness of this. Ah, but we were wrong-doers!

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, you [disbelievers] and what you worship other than Allāh are the firewood of Hell. You will be coming to [enter] it.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! ye (idolaters) and that which ye worship beside Allah are fuel of hell. Thereunto ye will come.

translations.SAHIH: Had these [false deities] been [actual] gods, they would not have come to it, but all are eternal therein.
translations.PICKTHALL: If these had been gods they would not have come thither, but all will abide therein.

translations.SAHIH: For them therein is heavy sighing, and they therein will not hear.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therein wailing is their portion, and therein they hear not.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those for whom the best [reward] has preceded from Us - they are from it far removed.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those unto whom kindness hath gone forth before from Us, they will be far removed from thence.

translations.SAHIH: They will not hear its sound, while they are, in that which their souls desire, abiding eternally.
translations.PICKTHALL: They will not hear the slightest sound thereof, while they abide in that which their souls desire.

translations.SAHIH: They will not be grieved by the greatest terror,1 and the angels will meet them, [saying], "This is your Day which you have been promised" -
translations.PICKTHALL: The Supreme Horror will not grieve them, and the angels will welcome them, (saying): This is your Day which ye were promised;

translations.SAHIH: The Day when We will fold the heaven like the folding of a [written] sheet for the records. As We began the first creation, We will repeat it. [That is] a promise binding upon Us. Indeed, We will do it.1
translations.PICKTHALL: The Day when We shall roll up the heavens as a recorder rolleth up a written scroll. As We began the first creation, We shall repeat it. (It is) a promise (binding) upon Us. Lo! We are to perform it.

translations.SAHIH: And We have already written in the book [of Psalms]1 after the [previous] mention2 that the land [of Paradise] is inherited by My righteous servants.
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily we have written in the Scripture, after the Reminder: My righteous slaves will inherit the earth:

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, in this [Qur’ān] is notification for a worshipping people.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! there is a plain statement for folk who are devout.

translations.SAHIH: And We have not sent you, [O Muḥammad], except as a mercy to the worlds.
translations.PICKTHALL: We sent thee not save as a mercy for the peoples.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "It is only revealed to me that your god is but one God; so will you be Muslims [in submission to Him]?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: It is only inspired in me that your Allah is One Allah. Will ye then surrender (unto Him)?

translations.SAHIH: But if they turn away, then say, "I have announced to [all of] you equally.1 And I know not whether near or far is that which you are promised.
translations.PICKTHALL: But if they are averse, then say: I have warned you all alike, although I know not whether nigh or far is that which ye are promised.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, He knows what is declared of speech, and He knows what you conceal.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! He knoweth that which is said openly, and that which ye conceal.

translations.SAHIH: And I know not; perhaps it1 is a trial for you and enjoyment for a time."
translations.PICKTHALL: And I know not but that this may be a trial for you, and enjoyment for a while.

translations.SAHIH: [The Prophet (ﷺ)] has said, "My Lord, judge [between us] in truth. And our Lord is the Most Merciful, the one whose help is sought against that which you describe."1
translations.PICKTHALL: He saith: My Lord! Judge Thou with truth. Our Lord is the Beneficent, Whose help is to be implored against that which ye ascribe (unto Him).

translations.SAHIH: O mankind, fear your Lord. Indeed, the convulsion of the [final] Hour is a terrible thing.
translations.PICKTHALL: O mankind! Fear your Lord. Lo! the earthquake of the Hour (of Doom) is a tremendous thing.

translations.SAHIH: On the Day you see it every nursing mother will be distracted from that [child] she was nursing, and every pregnant woman will abort her pregnancy, and you will see the people [appearing] intoxicated while they are not intoxicated; but the punishment of Allāh is severe.
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when ye behold it, every nursing mother will forget her nursling and every pregnant one will be delivered of her burden, and thou (Muhammad) wilt see mankind as drunken, yet they will not be drunken, but the Doom of Allah will be strong (upon them).

translations.SAHIH: And of the people is he who disputes about Allāh without knowledge and follows every rebellious devil.
translations.PICKTHALL: Among mankind is he who disputeth concerning Allah without knowledge, and followeth each froward devil;

translations.SAHIH: It has been decreed for him [i.e., every devil] that whoever turns to him - he will misguide him and will lead him to the punishment of the Blaze.
translations.PICKTHALL: For him it is decreed that whoso taketh him for friend, he verily will mislead him and will guide him to the punishment of the Flame.

translations.SAHIH: O people, if you should be in doubt about the Resurrection, then [consider that] indeed, We created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot, and then from a lump of flesh, formed and unformed1 - that We may show you.2 And We settle in the wombs whom We will for a specified term, then We bring you out as a child, and then [We develop you] that you may reach your [time of] maturity. And among you is he who is taken in [early] death, and among you is he who is returned to the most decrepit [old] age so that he knows, after [once having] knowledge, nothing. And you see the earth barren, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and swells and grows [something] of every beautiful kind.
translations.PICKTHALL: O mankind! if ye are in doubt concerning the Resurrection, then lo! We have created you from dust, then from a drop of seed, then from a clot, then from a little lump of flesh shapely and shapeless, that We may make (it) clear for you. And We cause what We will to remain in the wombs for an appointed time, and afterward We bring you forth as infants, then (give you growth) that ye attain your full strength. And among you there is he who dieth (young), and among you there is he who is brought back to the most abject time of life, so that, after knowledge, he knoweth naught. And thou (Muhammad) seest the earth barren, but when We send down water thereon, it doth thrill and swell and put forth every lovely kind (of growth).

translations.SAHIH: That is because Allāh is the True Reality and because He gives life to the dead and because He is over all things competent
translations.PICKTHALL: That is because Allah, He is the Truth and because He quickeneth the dead, and because He is Able to do all things;

translations.SAHIH: And [that they may know] that the Hour is coming - no doubt about it - and that Allāh will resurrect those in the graves.
translations.PICKTHALL: And because the Hour will come, there is no doubt thereof; and because Allah will raise those who are in the graves.

translations.SAHIH: And of the people is he who disputes about Allāh without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening book [from Him],
translations.PICKTHALL: And among mankind is he who disputeth concerning Allah without knowledge or guidance or a scripture giving light,

translations.SAHIH: Twisting his neck [in arrogance] to mislead [people] from the way of Allāh. For him in the world is disgrace, and We will make him taste on the Day of Resurrection the punishment of the Burning Fire [while it is said],
translations.PICKTHALL: Turning away in pride to beguile (men) from the way of Allah. For him in this world is ignominy, and on the Day of Resurrection We make him taste the doom of burning.

translations.SAHIH: "That is for what your hands have put forth and because Allāh is not ever unjust to [His] servants."
translations.PICKTHALL: (And unto him it will be said): This is for that which thy two hands have sent before, and because Allah is no oppressor of His slaves.

translations.SAHIH: And of the people is he who worships Allāh on an edge.1 If he is touched by good, he is reassured by it; but if he is struck by trial, he turns on his face [to unbelief]. He has lost [this] world and the Hereafter. That is what is the manifest loss.
translations.PICKTHALL: And among mankind is he who worshippeth Allah upon a narrow marge so that if good befalleth him he is content therewith, but if a trial befalleth him, he falleth away utterly. He loseth both the world and the Hereafter. That is the sheer loss.

translations.SAHIH: He invokes instead of Allāh that which neither harms him nor benefits him. That is what is the extreme error.
translations.PICKTHALL: He calleth, beside Allah, unto that which hurteth him not nor benefiteth him. That is the far error.

translations.SAHIH: He invokes one whose harm is closer than his benefit - how wretched the protector and how wretched the associate.
translations.PICKTHALL: He calleth unto him whose harm is nearer than his benefit; verily an evil patron and verily an evil friend!

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, Allāh will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. Indeed, Allāh does what He intends.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! Allah causeth those who believe and do good works to enter Gardens underneath which rivers flow. Lo! Allah doth what He intendeth.

translations.SAHIH: Whoever should think that Allāh will not support him [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)] in this world and the Hereafter - let him extend a rope to the ceiling, then cut off [his breath],1 and let him see: will his effort remove that which enrages [him]?
translations.PICKTHALL: Whoso is wont to think (through envy) that Allah will not give him (Muhammad) victory in the world and the Hereafter (and is enraged at the thought of his victory), let him stretch a rope up to the roof (of his dwelling), and let him hang himself. Then let him see whether his strategy dispelleth that whereat he rageth!.

translations.SAHIH: And thus have We sent it [i.e., the Qur’ān] down as verses of clear evidence and because Allāh guides whom He intends.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus We reveal it as plain revelations, and verily Allah guideth whom He will.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those who have believed and those who were Jews and the Sabeans and the Christians and the Magians and those who associated with Allāh - Allāh will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed Allāh is, over all things, Witness.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who believe (this revelation), and those who are Jews, and the Sabaeans and the Christians and the Magians and the idolaters - Lo! Allah will decide between them on the Day of Resurrection. Lo! Allah is Witness over all things.

translations.SAHIH: Do you not see [i.e., know] that to Allāh prostrates whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth and the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the moving creatures and many of the people? But upon many the punishment has been justified.1 And he whom Allāh humiliates - for him there is no bestower of honor. Indeed, Allāh does what He wills.
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou not seen that unto Allah payeth adoration whosoever is in the heavens and whosoever is in the earth, and the sun, and the moon, and the stars, and the hills, and the trees, and the beasts, and many of mankind, while there are many unto whom the doom is justly due. He whom Allah scorneth, there is none to give him honour. Lo! Allah doeth what He will.

translations.SAHIH: These1 are two adversaries who have disputed over their Lord. But those who disbelieved will have cut out for them garments of fire. Poured upon their heads will be scalding water
translations.PICKTHALL: These twain (the believers and the disbelievers) are two opponents who contend concerning their Lord. But as for those who disbelieve, garments of fire will be cut out for them; boiling fluid will be poured down on their heads,

translations.SAHIH: By which is melted that within their bellies and [their] skins.
translations.PICKTHALL: Whereby that which is in their bellies, and their skins too, will be melted;

translations.SAHIH: And for [striking] them are maces of iron.
translations.PICKTHALL: And for them are hooked rods of iron.

translations.SAHIH: Every time they want to get out of it [i.e., Hellfire] from anguish, they will be returned to it, and [it will be said], "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire!"
translations.PICKTHALL: Whenever, in their anguish, they would go forth from thence they are driven back therein and (it is said unto them): Taste the doom of burning.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, Allāh will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearl, and their garments therein will be silk.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! Allah will cause those who believe and do good works to enter Gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will be allowed armlets of gold, and pearls, and their raiment therein will be silk.

translations.SAHIH: And they had been guided [in worldly life] to good speech, and they were guided to the path of the Praiseworthy.
translations.PICKTHALL: They are guided unto gentle speech; they are guided unto the path of the Glorious One.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those who have disbelieved and avert [people] from the way of Allāh and [from] al-Masjid al-Ḥarām, which We made for the people - equal are the resident therein and one from outside - and [also] whoever intends [a deed] therein1 of deviation [in religion] by wrongdoing - We will make him taste of a painful punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who disbelieve and bar (men) from the way of Allah and from the Inviolable Place of Worship, which We have appointed for mankind together, the dweller therein and the nomad: whosoever seeketh wrongful partiality therein, him We shall cause to taste a painful doom.

translations.SAHIH: And [mention, O Muḥammad], when We designated for Abraham the site of the House, [saying], "Do not associate anything with Me and purify My House for those who perform ṭawāf1 and those who stand [in prayer] and those who bow and prostrate.
translations.PICKTHALL: And (remember) when We prepared for Abraham the place of the (holy) House, saying: Ascribe thou no thing as partner unto Me, and purify My House for those who make the round (thereof) and those who stand and those who bow and make prostration.

translations.SAHIH: And proclaim to the people the ḥajj [pilgrimage]; they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every distant pass -
translations.PICKTHALL: And proclaim unto mankind the pilgrimage. They will come unto thee on foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every deep ravine,

translations.SAHIH: That they may witness [i.e., attend] benefits for themselves and mention the name of Allāh on known [i.e., specific] days over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals.1 So eat of them and feed the miserable and poor.
translations.PICKTHALL: That they may witness things that are of benefit to them, and mention the name of Allah on appointed days over the beast of cattle that He hath bestowed upon them. Then eat thereof and feed therewith the poor unfortunate.

translations.SAHIH: Then let them end their untidiness and fulfill their vows and perform ṭawāf around the ancient House."
translations.PICKTHALL: Then let them make an end of their unkemptness and pay their vows and go around the ancient House.

translations.SAHIH: That [has been commanded], and whoever honors the sacred ordinances of Allāh - it is best for him in the sight of his Lord. And permitted to you are the grazing livestock, except what is recited to you.1 So avoid the uncleanliness of idols and avoid false statement,
translations.PICKTHALL: That (is the command). And whoso magnifieth the sacred things of Allah, it will be well for him in the sight of his Lord. The cattle are lawful unto you save that which hath been told you. So shun the filth of idols, and shun lying speech,

translations.SAHIH: Inclining [only] to Allāh, not associating [anything] with Him. And he who associates with Allāh - it is as though he had fallen from the sky and was snatched by the birds or the wind carried him down into a remote place.
translations.PICKTHALL: Turning unto Allah (only), not ascribing partners unto Him; for whoso ascribeth partners unto Allah, it is as if he had fallen from the sky and the birds had snatched him or the wind had blown him to a far-off place.

translations.SAHIH: That [is so]. And whoever honors the symbols [i.e., rites] of Allāh - indeed, it is from the piety of hearts.
translations.PICKTHALL: That (is the command). And whoso magnifieth the offerings consecrated to Allah, it surely is from devotion of the hearts,

translations.SAHIH: For you therein [i.e., the animals marked for sacrifice] are benefits for a specified term;1 then their place of sacrifice is at the ancient House.2
translations.PICKTHALL: Therein are benefits for you for an appointed term; and afterward they are brought for sacrifice unto the ancient House.

translations.SAHIH: And for every [religious] community We have appointed a rite [of sacrifice]1 that they may mention the name of Allāh over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. For your god is one God, so to Him submit. And, [O Muḥammad], give good tidings to the humble [before their Lord]
translations.PICKTHALL: And for every nation have We appointed a ritual, that they may mention the name of Allah over the beast of cattle that He hath given them for food; and your god is One God, therefor surrender unto Him. And give good tidings (O Muhammad) to the humble,

translations.SAHIH: Who, when Allāh is mentioned, their hearts are fearful, and [to] the patient over what has afflicted them, and the establishers of prayer and those who spend from what We have provided them.
translations.PICKTHALL: Whose hearts fear when Allah is mentioned, and the patient of whatever may befall them, and those who establish worship and who spend of that We have bestowed on them.

translations.SAHIH: And the camels and cattle We have appointed for you as among the symbols [i.e., rites] of Allāh; for you therein is good. So mention the name of Allāh upon them when lined up [for sacrifice]; and when they are [lifeless] on their sides, then eat from them and feed the needy [who does not seek aid] and the beggar. Thus have We subjected them to you that you may be grateful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the camels! We have appointed them among the ceremonies of Allah. Therein ye have much good. So mention the name of Allah over them when they are drawn up in lines. Then when their flanks fall (dead), eat thereof and feed the beggar and the suppliant. Thus have We made them subject unto you, that haply ye may give thanks.

translations.SAHIH: Their meat will not reach Allāh, nor will their blood, but what reaches Him is piety from you. Thus have We subjected them to you that you may glorify Allāh for that [to] which He has guided you; and give good tidings to the doers of good.
translations.PICKTHALL: Their flesh and their food reach not Allah, but the devotion from you reacheth Him. Thus have We made them subject unto you that ye may magnify Allah that He hath guided you. And give good tidings (O Muhammad) to the good.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, Allāh defends those who have believed. Indeed, Allāh does not like everyone treacherous and ungrateful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! Allah defendeth those who are true. Lo! Allah loveth not each treacherous ingrate.

translations.SAHIH: Permission [to fight] has been given to those who are being fought,1 because they were wronged. And indeed, Allāh is competent to give them victory.
translations.PICKTHALL: Sanction is given unto those who fight because they have been wronged; and Allah is indeed Able to give them victory;

translations.SAHIH: [They are] those who have been evicted from their homes without right - only because they say, "Our Lord is Allāh." And were it not that Allāh checks the people, some by means of others, there would have been demolished monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques in which the name of Allāh is much mentioned [i.e., praised]. And Allāh will surely support those who support Him [i.e., His cause]. Indeed, Allāh is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who have been driven from their homes unjustly only because they said: Our Lord is Allah - For had it not been for Allah's repelling some men by means of others, cloisters and churches and oratories and mosques, wherein the name of Allah is oft mentioned, would assuredly have been pulled down. Verily Allah helpeth one who helpeth Him. Lo! Allah is Strong, Almighty -

translations.SAHIH: [And they are] those who, if We give them authority in the land, establish prayer and give zakāh and enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong. And to Allāh belongs the outcome of [all] matters.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who, if We give them power in the land, establish worship and pay the poor-due and enjoin kindness and forbid iniquity. And Allah's is the sequel of events.

translations.SAHIH: And if they deny you, [O Muḥammad] - so, before them, did the people of Noah and ʿAad and Thamūd deny [their prophets],
translations.PICKTHALL: If they deny thee (Muhammad), even so the folk of Noah, and (the tribes of) A'ad and Thamud, before thee, denied (Our messengers);

translations.SAHIH: And the people of Abraham and the people of Lot.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the folk of Abraham and the folk of Lot;

translations.SAHIH: And the inhabitants of Madyan. And Moses was denied, so I prolonged enjoyment for the disbelievers; then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My reproach.
translations.PICKTHALL: (And) the dwellers in Midian. And Moses was denied; but I indulged the disbelievers a long while, then I seized them, and how (terrible) was My abhorrence!

translations.SAHIH: And how many a city did We destroy while it was committing wrong - so it is [now] fallen into ruin1 - and [how many] an abandoned well and [how many] a lofty palace.2
translations.PICKTHALL: How many a township have We destroyed while it was sinful, so that it lieth (to this day) in ruins, and (how many) a deserted well and lofty tower!

translations.SAHIH: So have they not traveled through the earth and have hearts by which to reason and ears by which to hear? For indeed, it is not eyes that are blinded, but blinded are the hearts which are within the breasts.
translations.PICKTHALL: Have they not travelled in the land, and have they hearts wherewith to feel and ears wherewith to hear? For indeed it is not the eyes that grow blind, but it is the hearts, which are within the bosoms, that grow blind.

translations.SAHIH: And they urge you to hasten the punishment. But Allāh will never fail in His promise. And indeed, a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of those which you count.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they will bid thee hasten on the Doom, and Allah faileth not His promise, but lo! a Day with Allah is as a thousand years of what ye reckon.

translations.SAHIH: And for how many a city did I prolong enjoyment while it was committing wrong. Then I seized it, and to Me is the [final] destination.
translations.PICKTHALL: And how many a township did I suffer long though it was sinful! Then I grasped it. Unto Me is the return.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "O people, I am only to you a clear warner."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: O mankind! I am only a plain warner unto you.

translations.SAHIH: And those who have believed and done righteous deeds - for them is forgiveness and noble provision.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who believe and do good works, for them is pardon and a rich provision;

translations.SAHIH: But the ones who strove against Our verses, [seeking] to cause failure1 - those are the companions of Hellfire.
translations.PICKTHALL: While those who strive to thwart Our revelations, such are rightful owners of the Fire.

translations.SAHIH: And We did not send before you any messenger or prophet except that when he spoke [or recited], Satan threw into it [some misunderstanding]. But Allāh abolishes that which Satan throws in; then Allāh makes precise His verses.1 And Allāh is Knowing and Wise.
translations.PICKTHALL: Never sent We a messenger or a prophet before thee but when He recited (the message) Satan proposed (opposition) in respect of that which he recited thereof. But Allah abolisheth that which Satan proposeth. Then Allah establisheth His revelations. Allah is Knower, Wise;

translations.SAHIH: [That is] so He may make what Satan throws in [i.e., asserts] a trial for those within whose hearts is disease1 and those hard of heart. And indeed, the wrongdoers are in extreme dissension.
translations.PICKTHALL: That He may make that which the devil proposeth a temptation for those in whose hearts is a disease, and those whose hearts are hardened - Lo! the evil-doers are in open schism -

translations.SAHIH: And so those who were given knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord and [therefore] believe in it, and their hearts humbly submit to it. And indeed is Allāh the Guide of those who have believed to a straight path.
translations.PICKTHALL: And that those who have been given knowledge may know that it is the truth from thy Lord, so that they may believe therein and their hearts may submit humbly unto Him. Lo! Allah verily is guiding those who believe unto a right path.

translations.SAHIH: But those who disbelieve will not cease to be in doubt of it until the Hour comes upon them unexpectedly or there comes to them the punishment of a barren Day.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who disbelieve will not cease to be in doubt thereof until the Hour come upon them unawares, or there come unto them the doom of a disastrous day.

translations.SAHIH: [All] sovereignty that Day is for Allāh;1 He will judge between them. So they who believed and did righteous deeds will be in the Gardens of Pleasure.
translations.PICKTHALL: The Sovereignty on that day will be Allah's, He will judge between them. Then those who believed and did good works will be in Gardens of Delight,

translations.SAHIH: And they who disbelieved and denied Our signs - for those there will be a humiliating punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: While those who disbelieved and denied Our revelations, for them will be a shameful doom.

translations.SAHIH: And those who emigrated for the cause of Allāh and then were killed or died - Allāh will surely provide for them a good provision. And indeed, it is Allāh who is the best of providers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who fled their homes for the cause of Allah and then were slain or died, Allah verily will provide for them a good provision. Lo! Allah, He verily is Best of all who make provision.

translations.SAHIH: He will surely cause them to enter an entrance with which they will be pleased, and indeed, Allāh is Knowing and Forbearing.
translations.PICKTHALL: Assuredly He will cause them to enter by an entry that they will love. Lo! Allah verily is Knower, Indulgent.

translations.SAHIH: That [is so]. And whoever responds [to injustice] with the equivalent of that with which he was harmed and then is tyrannized - Allāh will surely aid him. Indeed, Allāh is Pardoning and Forgiving.1
translations.PICKTHALL: That (is so). And whoso hath retaliated with the like of that which he was made to suffer and then hath (again) been wronged, Allah will succour him. Lo! Allah verily is Mild, Forgiving.

translations.SAHIH: That1 is because Allāh causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and because Allāh is Hearing and Seeing.
translations.PICKTHALL: That is because Allah maketh the night to pass into the day and maketh the day to pass into the night, and because Allah is Hearer, Seer.

translations.SAHIH: That is because Allāh is the True Reality, and that which they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because Allāh is the Most High, the Grand.
translations.PICKTHALL: That is because Allah, He is the True, and that whereon they call instead of Him, it is the false, and because Allah, He is the High, the Great.

translations.SAHIH: Do you not see that Allāh has sent down rain from the sky and the earth becomes green? Indeed, Allāh is Subtle1 and Aware.2
translations.PICKTHALL: Seest thou not how Allah sendeth down water from the sky and then the earth becometh green upon the morrow? Lo! Allah is Subtile, Aware.

translations.SAHIH: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. And indeed, Allāh is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
translations.PICKTHALL: Unto Him belongeth all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth. Lo! Allah, He verily is the Absolute, the Owner of Praise.

translations.SAHIH: Do you not see that Allāh has subjected to you whatever is on the earth and the ships which run through the sea by His command? And He restrains the sky from falling upon the earth, unless by His permission. Indeed Allāh, to the people, is Kind and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou not seen how Allah hath made all that is in the earth subservient unto you? And the ship runneth upon the sea by His command, and He holdeth back the heaven from falling on the earth unless by His leave. Lo! Allah is, for mankind, Full of Pity, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: And He is the one who gave you life; then He causes you to die and then will [again] give you life. Indeed, mankind is ungrateful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And He it is Who gave you life, then He will cause you to die, and then will give you life (again). Lo! man is verily an ingrate.

translations.SAHIH: For every [religious] community We have appointed rites which they perform. So, [O Muḥammad], let them [i.e., the disbelievers] not contend with you over the matter but invite [them] to your Lord. Indeed, you are upon straight guidance.
translations.PICKTHALL: Unto each nation have We given sacred rites which they are to perform; so let them not dispute with thee of the matter, but summon thou unto thy Lord. Lo! thou indeed followest right guidance.

translations.SAHIH: And if they dispute with you, then say, "Allāh is most knowing of what you do.
translations.PICKTHALL: And if they wrangle with thee, say: Allah is Best Aware of what ye do.

translations.SAHIH: Allāh will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which you used to differ."
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning that wherein ye used to differ.

translations.SAHIH: Do you not know that Allāh knows what is in the heaven and earth? Indeed, that is in a Record.1 Indeed that, for Allāh, is easy.
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou not known that Allah knoweth all that is in the heaven and the earth? Lo! it is in a record. Lo! that is easy for Allah.

translations.SAHIH: And they worship besides Allāh that for which He has not sent down authority and that of which they have no knowledge. And there will not be for the wrongdoers any helper.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they worship instead of Allah that for which He hath sent down no warrant, and that whereof they have no knowledge. For evil-doers there is no helper.

translations.SAHIH: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, you recognize in the faces of those who disbelieve disapproval. They are almost on the verge of assaulting those who recite to them Our verses. Say, "Then shall I inform you of [what is] worse than that?1 [It is] the Fire which Allāh has promised those who disbelieve, and wretched is the destination."
translations.PICKTHALL: And when Our revelations are recited unto them, thou knowest the denial in the faces of those who disbelieve; they all but attack those who recite Our revelations unto them. Say: Shall I proclaim unto you worse than that? The Fire! Allah hath promised it for those who disbelieve. A hapless journey's end!

translations.SAHIH: O people, an example is presented, so listen to it. Indeed, those you invoke besides Allāh will never create [as much as] a fly, even if they gathered together for it [i.e., that purpose]. And if the fly should steal from them a [tiny] thing, they could not recover it from him. Weak are the pursuer and pursued.1
translations.PICKTHALL: O mankind! A similitude is coined, so pay ye heed to it: Lo! those on whom ye call beside Allah will never create a fly though they combine together for the purpose. And if the fly took something from them, they could not rescue it from it. So weak are (both) the seeker and the sought!

translations.SAHIH: They have not appraised Allāh with true appraisal.1 Indeed, Allāh is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
translations.PICKTHALL: They measure not Allah His rightful measure. Lo! Allah is Strong, Almighty.

translations.SAHIH: Allāh chooses from the angels messengers and from the people. Indeed, Allāh is Hearing and Seeing.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah chooseth from the angels messengers, and (also) from mankind. Lo! Allah is Hearer, Seer.

translations.SAHIH: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them.1 And to Allāh will be returned [all] matters.
translations.PICKTHALL: He knoweth all that is before them and all that is behind them, and unto Allah all things are returned. $$A

translations.SAHIH: O you who have believed, bow and prostrate and worship your Lord and do good - that you may succeed.
translations.PICKTHALL: O ye who believe! Bow down and prostrate yourselves, and worship your Lord, and do good, that haply ye may prosper.

translations.SAHIH: And strive for Allāh with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you and has not placed upon you in the religion any difficulty. [It is] the religion of your father, Abraham. He [i.e., Allāh] named you "Muslims" before [in former scriptures] and in this [revelation] that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people. So establish prayer and give zakāh and hold fast to Allāh. He is your protector; and excellent is the protector, and excellent is the helper.
translations.PICKTHALL: And strive for Allah with the endeavour which is His right. He hath chosen you and hath not laid upon you in religion any hardship; the faith of your father Abraham (is yours). He hath named you Muslims of old time and in this (Scripture), that the messenger may be a witness against you, and that ye may be witnesses against mankind. So establish worship, pay the poor-due, and hold fast to Allah. He is your Protecting friend. A blessed Patron and a blessed Helper!

translations.SAHIH: Certainly will the believers have succeeded:
translations.PICKTHALL: Successful indeed are the believers

translations.SAHIH: They who are during their prayer humbly intent
translations.PICKTHALL: Who are humble in their prayers,

translations.SAHIH: And they who turn away from ill speech
translations.PICKTHALL: And who shun vain conversation,

translations.SAHIH: And they who are observant of zakāh
translations.PICKTHALL: And who are payers of the poor-due;

translations.SAHIH: And they who guard their private parts
translations.PICKTHALL: And who guard their modesty -

translations.SAHIH: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess,1 for indeed, they will not be blamed -
translations.PICKTHALL: Save from their wives or the (slaves) that their right hands possess, for then they are not blameworthy,

translations.SAHIH: But whoever seeks beyond that, then those are the transgressors -
translations.PICKTHALL: But whoso craveth beyond that, such are transgressors -

translations.SAHIH: And they who are to their trusts and their promises attentive
translations.PICKTHALL: And who are shepherds of their pledge and their covenant,

translations.SAHIH: And they who carefully maintain their prayers -
translations.PICKTHALL: And who pay heed to their prayers.

translations.SAHIH: Those are the inheritors
translations.PICKTHALL: These are the heirs

translations.SAHIH: Who will inherit al-Firdaus.1 They will abide therein eternally.
translations.PICKTHALL: Who will inherit paradise. There they will abide.

translations.SAHIH: And certainly did We create man from an extract of clay.
translations.PICKTHALL: Verily We created man from a product of wet earth;

translations.SAHIH: Then We placed him as a sperm-drop1 in a firm lodging [i.e., the womb].
translations.PICKTHALL: Then placed him as a drop (of seed) in a safe lodging;

translations.SAHIH: Then We made the sperm-drop into a clinging clot, and We made the clot into a lump [of flesh], and We made [from] the lump, bones, and We covered the bones with flesh; then We developed him into another creation. So blessed is Allāh, the best of creators.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then fashioned We the drop a clot, then fashioned We the clot a little lump, then fashioned We the little lump bones, then clothed the bones with flesh, and then produced it as another creation. So blessed be Allah, the Best of creators!

translations.SAHIH: Then indeed, after that you are to die.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then lo! after that ye surely die.

translations.SAHIH: Then indeed you, on the Day of Resurrection, will be resurrected.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then lo! on the Day of Resurrection ye are raised (again).

translations.SAHIH: And We have created above you seven layered heavens, and never have We been of [Our] creation unaware.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We have created above you seven paths, and We are never unmindful of creation.

translations.SAHIH: And We have sent down rain from the sky in a measured amount and settled it in the earth. And indeed, We are Able to take it away.
translations.PICKTHALL: And we send down from the sky water in measure, and We give it lodging in the earth, and lo! We are Able to withdraw it.

translations.SAHIH: And We brought forth for you thereby gardens of palm trees and grapevines in which for you are abundant fruits and from which you eat.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We produce for you therewith gardens of date-palms and grapes, wherein is much fruit for you and whereof ye eat;

translations.SAHIH: And [We brought forth] a tree issuing from Mount Sinai which produces oil and food [i.e., olives] for those who eat.
translations.PICKTHALL: And a tree that springeth forth from Mount Sinai that groweth oil and relish for the eaters.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, for you in livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from that which is in their bellies, and for you in them are numerous benefits, and from them you eat.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! in the cattle there is verily a lesson for you. We give you to drink of that which is in their bellies, and many uses have ye in them, and of them do ye eat;

translations.SAHIH: And upon them and on ships you are carried.
translations.PICKTHALL: And on them and on the ship ye are carried.

translations.SAHIH: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, "O my people, worship Allāh; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And We verily sent Noah unto his folk, and he said: O my people! Serve Allah. Ye have no other Allah save Him. Will ye not ward off (evil)?

translations.SAHIH: But the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, "This is not but a man like yourselves who wishes to take precedence over you; and if Allāh had willed [to send a messenger], He would have sent down angels. We have not heard of this among our forefathers.
translations.PICKTHALL: But the chieftains of his folk, who disbelieved, said: This is only a mortal like you who would make himself superior to you. Had Allah willed, He surely could have sent down angels. We heard not of this in the case of our fathers of old.

translations.SAHIH: He is not but a man possessed with madness, so wait concerning him for a time."
translations.PICKTHALL: He is only a man in whom is a madness, so watch him for a while.

translations.SAHIH: [Noah] said, "My Lord, support me because they have denied me."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: My Lord! Help me because they deny me.

translations.SAHIH: So We inspired to him, "Construct the ship under Our observation and Our inspiration, and when Our command comes and the oven overflows,1 put into it [i.e., the ship] from each [creature] two mates and your family, except him for whom the decree [of destruction] has proceeded. And do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are to be drowned.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We inspired in him, saying: Make the ship under Our eyes and Our inspiration. Then, when Our command cometh and the oven gusheth water, introduce therein of every (kind) two spouses, and thy household save him thereof against whom the Word hath already gone forth. And plead not with Me on behalf of those who have done wrong. Lo! they will be drowned.

translations.SAHIH: And when you have boarded the ship, you and those with you, then say, 'Praise to Allāh who has saved us from the wrongdoing people.'
translations.PICKTHALL: And when thou art on board the ship, thou and whoso is with thee, then say: Praise be to Allah Who hath saved us from the wrongdoing folk!

translations.SAHIH: And say, 'My Lord, let me land at a blessed landing place, and You are the best to accommodate [us].'"
translations.PICKTHALL: And say: My Lord! Cause me to land at a blessed landing-place, for Thou art Best of all who bring to land.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed in that are signs, and indeed, We are ever testing [Our servants].
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! herein verily are portents, for lo! We are ever putting (mankind) to the test.

translations.SAHIH: Then We produced after them a generation of others.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then, after them, We brought forth another generation;

translations.SAHIH: And We sent among them a messenger1 from themselves, [saying], "Worship Allāh; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And we sent among them a messenger of their own, saying: Serve Allah, Ye have no other Allah save Him. Will ye not ward off (evil)?

translations.SAHIH: And the eminent among his people who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter while We had given them luxury in the worldly life said, "This is not but a man like yourselves. He eats of that from which you eat and drinks of what you drink.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the chieftains of his folk, who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter, and whom We had made soft in the life of the world, said: This is only a mortal like you, who eateth of that whereof ye eat and drinketh of that ye drink.

translations.SAHIH: And if you should obey a man like yourselves, indeed, you would then be losers.
translations.PICKTHALL: If ye were to obey a mortal like yourselves, then, lo! ye surely would be losers.

translations.SAHIH: Does he promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones that you will be brought forth [once more]?
translations.PICKTHALL: Doth he promise you that you, when ye are dead and have become dust and bones, will (again) be brought forth?

translations.SAHIH: How far, how far, is that which you are promised.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Begone, begone, with that which ye are promised!

translations.SAHIH: It [i.e., life] is not but our worldly life - we die and live, but we will not be resurrected.
translations.PICKTHALL: There is naught but our life of the world; we die and we live, and we shall not be raised (again).

translations.SAHIH: He is not but a man who has invented a lie about Allāh, and we will not believe him."
translations.PICKTHALL: He is only a man who hath invented a lie about Allah. We are not going to put faith in him.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "My Lord, support me because they have denied me."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: My Lord! Help me because they deny me.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "After a little, they will surely become regretful."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: In a little while they surely will become repentant.

translations.SAHIH: So the shriek1 seized them in truth,2 and We made them as [plant] stubble. Then away with the wrongdoing people.
translations.PICKTHALL: So the (Awful) Cry overtook them rightfully, and We made them like as wreckage (that a torrent hurleth). A far removal for wrongdoing folk!

translations.SAHIH: Then We produced after them other generations.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then after them We brought forth other generations.

translations.SAHIH: No nation will precede its time [of termination], nor will they remain [thereafter].
translations.PICKTHALL: No nation can outstrip its term, nor yet postpone it.

translations.SAHIH: Then We sent Our messengers in succession. Every time there came to a nation its messenger, they denied him, so We made them follow one another [to destruction], and We made them narrations.1 So away with a people who do not believe.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We sent our messengers one after another. Whenever its messenger came unto a nation they denied him; so We caused them to follow one another (to disaster) and We made them bywords. A far removal for folk who believe not!

translations.SAHIH: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a clear authority1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our tokens and a clear warrant

translations.SAHIH: To Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were arrogant and were a haughty people.
translations.PICKTHALL: Unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they scorned (them) and they were despotic folk.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Should we believe two men like ourselves while their people are for us in servitude?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And they said: Shall we put faith in two mortals like ourselves, and whose folk are servile unto us?

translations.SAHIH: So they denied them and were of those destroyed.
translations.PICKTHALL: So they denied them, and became of those who were destroyed.

translations.SAHIH: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture that perhaps they1 would be guided.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We verily gave Moses the Scripture, that haply they might go aright.

translations.SAHIH: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign and sheltered them within a high ground having level [areas] and flowing water.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a portent, and We gave them refuge on a height, a place of flocks and watersprings.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh said], "O messengers, eat from the good foods and work righteousness. Indeed I, of what you do, am Knowing.
translations.PICKTHALL: O ye messengers! Eat of the good things, and do right. Lo! I am Aware of what ye do.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed this, your religion, is one religion,1 and I am your Lord, so fear Me."
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! this your religion is one religion and I am your Lord, so keep your duty unto Me.

translations.SAHIH: But they [i.e., the people] divided their religion among them into portions [i.e., sects] - each faction, in what it has,1 rejoicing.
translations.PICKTHALL: But they (mankind) have broken their religion among them into sects, each group rejoicing in its tenets.

translations.SAHIH: So leave them in their confusion for a time.
translations.PICKTHALL: So leave them in their error till a time.

translations.SAHIH: Do they think that what We extend to them of wealth and children
translations.PICKTHALL: Think they that in the wealth and sons wherewith We provide them

translations.SAHIH: Is [because] We hasten for them good things? Rather, they do not perceive.1
translations.PICKTHALL: We hasten unto them with good things? Nay, but they perceive not.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, they who are apprehensive from fear of their Lord
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who go in awe for fear of their Lord.

translations.SAHIH: And they who believe in the signs of their Lord
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who believe in the revelations of their Lord,

translations.SAHIH: And they who do not associate anything with their Lord
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who ascribe not partners unto their Lord,

translations.SAHIH: And they who give what they give while their hearts are fearful1 because they will be returning to their Lord -
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who give that which they give with hearts afraid because they are about to return unto their Lord,

translations.SAHIH: It is those who hasten to good deeds, and they outstrip [others] therein.
translations.PICKTHALL: These race for the good things, and they shall win them in the race.

translations.SAHIH: And We charge no soul except [with that within] its capacity, and with Us is a record which speaks with truth; and they will not be wronged.
translations.PICKTHALL: And we task not any soul beyond its scope, and with Us is a Record which speaketh the truth, and they will not be wronged.

translations.SAHIH: But their hearts are covered with confusion over this, and they have [evil] deeds besides that [i.e., disbelief] which they are doing,
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but their hearts are in ignorance of this (Qur'an), and they have other works, besides, which they are doing;

translations.SAHIH: Until when We seize their affluent ones with punishment,1 at once they are crying [to Allāh] for help.
translations.PICKTHALL: Till when We grasp their luxurious ones with the punishment, behold! they supplicate.

translations.SAHIH: Do not cry out today. Indeed, by Us you will not be helped.
translations.PICKTHALL: Supplicate not this day! Assuredly ye will not be helped by Us.

translations.SAHIH: My verses had already been recited to you, but you were turning back on your heels.
translations.PICKTHALL: My revelations were recited unto you, but ye used to turn back on your heels,

translations.SAHIH: In arrogance regarding it,1 conversing by night, speaking evil.
translations.PICKTHALL: In scorn thereof. Nightly did ye rave together.

translations.SAHIH: Then have they not reflected over the word [i.e., the Qur’ān], or has there come to them that which had not come to their forefathers?
translations.PICKTHALL: Have they not pondered the Word, or hath that come unto them which came not unto their fathers of old?

translations.SAHIH: Or did they not know their Messenger, so they are toward him disacknowledging?
translations.PICKTHALL: Or know they not their messenger, and so reject him?

translations.SAHIH: Or do they say, "In him is madness"? Rather, he brought them the truth, but most of them, to the truth, are averse.
translations.PICKTHALL: Or say they: There is a madness in him? Nay, but he bringeth them the Truth; and most of them are haters of the Truth.

translations.SAHIH: But if the Truth [i.e., Allāh] had followed their inclinations, the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them would have been ruined. Rather, We have brought them their message,1 but they, from their message, are turning away.
translations.PICKTHALL: And if the Truth had followed their desires, verily the heavens and the earth and whosoever is therein had been corrupted. Nay, We have brought them their Reminder, but from their Reminder they now turn away.

translations.SAHIH: Or do you, [O Muḥammad], ask them for payment? But the reward of your Lord is best, and He is the best of providers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Or dost thou ask of them (O Muhammad) any tribute? But the bounty of thy Lord is better, for He is Best of all who make provision.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, you invite them to a straight path.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! thou summonest them indeed unto a straight path.

translations.SAHIH: But indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviating from the path.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! those who believe not in the Hereafter are indeed astray from the path.

translations.SAHIH: And even if We gave them mercy and removed what was upon them of affliction, they would persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.
translations.PICKTHALL: Though We had mercy on them and relieved them of the harm afflicting them, they still would wander blindly on in their contumacy.

translations.SAHIH: And We had gripped them with suffering [as a warning], but they did not yield to their Lord, nor did they humbly supplicate, [and will continue thus]
translations.PICKTHALL: Already have We grasped them with punishment, but they humble not themselves unto their Lord, nor do they pray,

translations.SAHIH: Until when We have opened before them a door of severe punishment, immediately they will be therein in despair.
translations.PICKTHALL: Until, when We open for them the gate of extreme punishment, behold! they are aghast thereat.

translations.SAHIH: And it is He who produced for you hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect]; little are you grateful.
translations.PICKTHALL: He it is Who hath created for you ears and eyes and hearts. Small thanks give ye!

translations.SAHIH: And it is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.
translations.PICKTHALL: And He it is Who hath sown you broadcast in the earth, and unto Him ye will be gathered.

translations.SAHIH: And it is He who gives life and causes death, and His is the alternation of the night and the day. Then will you not reason?
translations.PICKTHALL: And He it is Who giveth life and causeth death, and His is the difference of night and day. Have ye then no sense?

translations.SAHIH: Rather,1 they say like what the former peoples said.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but they say the like of that which said the men of old;

translations.SAHIH: They said, "When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
translations.PICKTHALL: They say: When we are dead and have become (mere) dust and bones, shall we then, forsooth, be raised again?

translations.SAHIH: We have been promised this, we and our forefathers, before; this is not but legends of the former peoples."
translations.PICKTHALL: We were already promised this, we and our forefathers. Lo! this is naught but fables of the men of old.

translations.SAHIH: Say, [O Muḥammad], "To whom belongs the earth and whoever is in it, if you should know?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Unto Whom (belongeth) the earth and whosoever is therein, if ye have knowledge?

translations.SAHIH: They will say, "To Allāh." Say, "Then will you not remember?"
translations.PICKTHALL: They will say: Unto Allah. Say: Will ye not then remember?

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Who is Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Great Throne?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Who is Lord of the seven heavens, and Lord of the Tremendous Throne?

translations.SAHIH: They will say, "[They belong] to Allāh." Say, "Then will you not fear Him?"
translations.PICKTHALL: They will say: Unto Allah (all that belongeth). Say: Will ye not then keep duty (unto Him)?

translations.SAHIH: Say, "In whose hand is the realm of all things - and He protects while none can protect against Him - if you should know?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: In Whose hand is the dominion over all things and He protecteth, while against Him there is no protection, if ye have knowledge?

translations.SAHIH: They will say, "[All belongs] to Allāh." Say, "Then how are you deluded?"
translations.PICKTHALL: They will say: Unto Allah (all that belongeth). Say: How then are ye bewitched?

translations.SAHIH: Rather, We have brought them the truth, and indeed they are liars.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but We have brought them the Truth, and lo! they are liars.

translations.SAHIH: Allāh has not taken any son, nor has there ever been with Him any deity. [If there had been], then each deity would have taken what it created, and some of them would have [sought to] overcome others. Exalted is Allāh above what they describe [concerning Him].
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah hath not chosen any son, nor is there any god along with Him; else would each god have assuredly championed that which he created, and some of them would assuredly have overcome others. Glorified be Allah above all that they allege.

translations.SAHIH: [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, so high is He above what they associate [with Him].
translations.PICKTHALL: Knower of the Invisible and the Visible! and Exalted be He over all that they ascribe as partners (unto Him)!

translations.SAHIH: Say, [O Muḥammad], "My Lord, if You should show me that which they are promised,
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: My Lord! If Thou shouldst show me that which they are promised.

translations.SAHIH: My Lord, then do not place me among the wrongdoing people."
translations.PICKTHALL: My Lord! then set me not among the wrongdoing folk.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, We are Able to show you what We have promised them.
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily We are Able to show thee that which We have promised them.

translations.SAHIH: Repel, by [means of] what is best, [their] evil. We are most knowing of what they describe.
translations.PICKTHALL: Repel evil with that which is better. We are Best Aware of that which they allege.

translations.SAHIH: And say, "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the incitements of the devils,
translations.PICKTHALL: And say: My Lord! I seek refuge in Thee from suggestions of the evil ones,

translations.SAHIH: And I seek refuge in You, my Lord, lest they be present with me."
translations.PICKTHALL: And I seek refuge in Thee, my Lord, lest they be present with me,

translations.SAHIH: [For such is the state of the disbelievers] until, when death comes to one of them, he says, "My Lord, send me back
translations.PICKTHALL: Until, when death cometh unto one of them, he saith: My Lord! Send me back,

translations.SAHIH: That I might do righteousness in that which I left behind."1 No! It is only a word he is saying; and behind them is a barrier until the Day they are resurrected.
translations.PICKTHALL: That I may do right in that which I have left behind! But nay! It is but a word that he speaketh; and behind them is a barrier until the day when they are raised.

translations.SAHIH: So when the Horn is blown, no relationship will there be among them that Day, nor will they ask about one another.
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the trumpet is blown there will be no kinship among them that day, nor will they ask of one another.

translations.SAHIH: And those whose scales are heavy [with good deeds] - it is they who are the successful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then those whose scales are heavy, they are the successful.

translations.SAHIH: But those whose scales are light - those are the ones who have lost their souls, [being] in Hell, abiding eternally.
translations.PICKTHALL: And those whose scales are light are those who lose their souls, in hell abiding.

translations.SAHIH: The Fire will sear their faces, and they therein will have taut smiles.1
translations.PICKTHALL: The fire burneth their faces, and they are glum therein.

translations.SAHIH: [It will be said], "Were not My verses recited to you and you used to deny them?"
translations.PICKTHALL: (It will be said): Were not My revelations recited unto you, and then ye used to deny them?

translations.SAHIH: They will say, "Our Lord, our wretchedness overcame us, and we were a people astray.
translations.PICKTHALL: They will say: Our Lord! Our evil fortune conquered us, and we were erring folk.

translations.SAHIH: Our Lord, remove us from it, and if we were to return [to evil], we would indeed be wrongdoers."
translations.PICKTHALL: Our Lord! Oh, bring us forth from hence! If we return (to evil) then indeed we shall be wrong-doers.

translations.SAHIH: He will say, "Remain despised therein and do not speak to Me.
translations.PICKTHALL: He saith: Begone therein, and speak not unto Me.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, there was a party of My servants who said, 'Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful.'
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! there was a party of My slaves who said: Our Lord! We believe, therefor forgive us and have mercy on us for Thou art Best of all who show mercy;

translations.SAHIH: But you took them in mockery to the point that they made you forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them.
translations.PICKTHALL: But ye chose them for a laughing-stock until they caused you to forget remembrance of Me, while ye laughed at them.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, I have rewarded them this Day for their patient endurance - that they are the attainers [of success]."
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! I have rewarded them this day forasmuch as they were steadfast in that they, even they, are the triumphant.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] will say, "How long did you remain on earth in number of years?"
translations.PICKTHALL: He will say: How long tarried ye in the earth, counting by years?

translations.SAHIH: They will say, "We remained a day or part of a day; ask those who enumerate."
translations.PICKTHALL: They will say: We tarried by a day or part of a day. Ask of those who keep count!

translations.SAHIH: He will say, "You stayed not but a little - if only you had known.
translations.PICKTHALL: He will say: Ye tarried but a little if ye only knew.

translations.SAHIH: Then did you think that We created you uselessly and that to Us you would not be returned?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Deemed ye then that We had created you for naught, and that ye would not be returned unto Us?

translations.SAHIH: So exalted is Allāh, the Sovereign,1 the Truth;2 there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Noble Throne.
translations.PICKTHALL: Now Allah be Exalted, the True King! There is no Allah save Him, the Lord of the Throne of Grace.

translations.SAHIH: And whoever invokes besides Allāh another deity for which he has no proof - then his account is only with his Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed.
translations.PICKTHALL: He who crieth unto any other god along with Allah hath no proof thereof. His reckoning is only with his Lord. Lo! disbelievers will not be successful.

translations.SAHIH: And, [O Muḥammad], say, "My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the best of the merciful."
translations.PICKTHALL: And (O Muhammad) say: My Lord! Forgive and have mercy, for Thou art Best of all who show mercy.

translations.SAHIH: [This is] a sūrah which We have sent down and made [that within it] obligatory and revealed therein verses of clear evidence that you might remember.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Here is) a surah which We have revealed and enjoined, and wherein We have revealed plain tokens, that haply ye may take heed.

translations.SAHIH: The [unmarried] woman or [unmarried] man found guilty of sexual intercourse1 - lash each one of them with a hundred lashes,2 and do not be taken by pity for them in the religion [i.e., law] of Allāh,3 if you should believe in Allāh and the Last Day. And let a group of the believers witness their punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: The adulterer and the adulteress, scourge ye each one of them (with) a hundred stripes. And let not pity for the twain withhold you from obedience to Allah, if ye believe in Allah and the Last Day. And let a party of believers witness their punishment.

translations.SAHIH: The fornicator does not marry except a [female] fornicator or polytheist, and none marries her except a fornicator1 or a polytheist, and that [i.e., marriage to such persons] has been made unlawful to the believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: The adulterer shall not marry save an adulteress or an idolatress, and the adulteress none shall marry save an adulterer or an idolater. All that is forbidden unto believers.

translations.SAHIH: And those who accuse chaste women and then do not produce four witnesses - lash them with eighty lashes and do not accept from them testimony ever after. And those are the defiantly disobedient,
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who accuse honourable women but bring not four witnesses, scourge them (with) eighty stripes and never (afterward) accept their testimony - They indeed are evil-doers -

translations.SAHIH: Except for those who repent thereafter and reform, for indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Save those who afterward repent and make amends. (For such) lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: And those who accuse their wives [of adultery] and have no witnesses except themselves - then the witness of one of them1 [shall be] four testimonies [swearing] by Allāh that indeed, he is of the truthful.
translations.PICKTHALL: As for those who accuse their wives but have no witnesses except themselves; let the testimony of one of them be four testimonies, (swearing) by Allah that he is of those who speak the truth;

translations.SAHIH: And the fifth [oath will be] that the curse of Allāh be upon him if he should be of the liars.
translations.PICKTHALL: And yet a fifth, invoking the curse of Allah on him if he is of those who lie.

translations.SAHIH: But it will prevent punishment from her if she gives four testimonies [swearing] by Allāh that indeed, he is of the liars.
translations.PICKTHALL: And it shall avert the punishment from her if she bear witness before Allah four times that the thing he saith is indeed false,

translations.SAHIH: And the fifth [oath will be] that the wrath of Allāh be upon her if he was of the truthful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And a fifth (time) that the wrath of Allah be upon her if he speaketh truth.

translations.SAHIH: And if not for the favor of Allāh upon you and His mercy...1 and because Allāh is Accepting of Repentance and Wise.
translations.PICKTHALL: And had it not been for the grace of Allah and His mercy unto you, and that Allah is Clement, Wise, (ye had been undone).

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those who came with falsehood1 are a group among you. Do not think it bad for you; rather, it is good for you. For every person among them is what [punishment] he has earned from the sin, and he who took upon himself the greater portion thereof2 - for him is a great punishment [i.e., Hellfire].
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! they who spread the slander are a gang among you. Deem it not a bad thing for you; nay, it is good for you. Unto every man of them (will be paid) that which he hath earned of the sin; and as for him among them who had the greater share therein, his will be an awful doom.

translations.SAHIH: Why, when you heard it, did not the believing men and believing women think good of themselves [i.e., one another] and say, "This is an obvious falsehood"?
translations.PICKTHALL: Why did not the believers, men and women, when ye heard it, think good of their own own folk, and say: It is a manifest untruth?

translations.SAHIH: Why did they [who slandered] not produce for it four witnesses? And when they do not produce the witnesses, then it is they, in the sight of Allāh, who are the liars.
translations.PICKTHALL: Why did they not produce four witnesses? Since they produce not witnesses, they verily are liars in the sight of Allah.

translations.SAHIH: And if it had not been for the favor of Allāh upon you and His mercy in this world and the Hereafter, you would have been touched for that [lie] in which you were involved by a great punishment
translations.PICKTHALL: Had it not been for the grace of Allah and His mercy unto you in the world and the Hereafter an awful doom had overtaken you for that whereof ye murmured.

translations.SAHIH: When you received it with your tongues1 and said with your mouths that of which you had no knowledge and thought it was insignificant while it was, in the sight of Allāh, tremendous.
translations.PICKTHALL: When ye welcomed it with your tongues, and uttered with your mouths that whereof ye had no knowledge, ye counted it a trifle. In the sight of Allah it is very great.

translations.SAHIH: And why, when you heard it, did you not say, "It is not for us to speak of this. Exalted are You, [O Allāh]; this is a great slander"?
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherefor, when ye heard it, said ye not: It is not for us to speak of this. Glory be to Thee (O Allah)! This is awful calumny.
