translations.SAHIH: Allāh warns you against returning to the likes of this [conduct], ever, if you should be believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah admonisheth you that ye repeat not the like thereof ever, if ye are (in truth) believers.

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh makes clear to you the verses [i.e., His rulings], and Allāh is Knowing and Wise.
translations.PICKTHALL: And He expoundeth unto you the revelations. Allah is Knower, Wise.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those who like that immorality1 should be spread [or publicized] among those who have believed will have a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. And Allāh knows2 and you do not know.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who love that slander should be spread concerning those who believe, theirs will be a painful punishment in the world and the Hereafter. Allah knoweth. Ye know not.

translations.SAHIH: And if it had not been for the favor of Allāh upon you and His mercy...1 and because Allāh is Kind and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Had it not been for the grace of Allah and His mercy unto you, and that Allah is Clement, Merciful, (ye had been undone).

translations.SAHIH: O you who have believed, do not follow the footsteps of Satan. And whoever follows the footsteps of Satan - indeed, he enjoins immorality and wrongdoing. And if not for the favor of Allāh upon you and His mercy, not one of you would have been pure, ever, but Allāh purifies whom He wills, and Allāh is Hearing and Knowing.
translations.PICKTHALL: O ye who believe! Follow not the footsteps of the devil. Unto whomsoever followeth the footsteps of the devil, lo! he commandeth filthiness and wrong. Had it not been for the grace of Allah and His mercy unto you, not one of you would ever have grown pure. But Allah causeth whom He will to grow. And Allah is Hearer, Knower.

translations.SAHIH: And let not those of virtue among you and wealth swear not to give [aid] to their relatives and the needy and the emigrants for the cause of Allāh, and let them pardon and overlook. Would you not like that Allāh should forgive you? And Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And let not those who possess dignity and ease among you swear not to give to the near of kin and to the needy, and to fugitives for the cause of Allah. Let them forgive and show indulgence. Yearn ye not that Allah may forgive you? Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those who [falsely] accuse chaste, unaware and believing women are cursed in this world and the Hereafter; and they will have a great punishment
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! as for those who traduce virtuous, believing women (who are) careless, cursed are they in the world and the Hereafter. Theirs will be an awful doom

translations.SAHIH: On a Day when their tongues, their hands and their feet will bear witness against them as to what they used to do.
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when their tongues and their hands and their feet testify against them as to what they used to do,

translations.SAHIH: That Day, Allāh will pay them in full their true [i.e., deserved] recompense, and they will know that it is Allāh who is the manifest Truth [i.e., perfect in justice].
translations.PICKTHALL: On that day Allah will pay them their just due, and they will know that Allah, He is the Manifest Truth.

translations.SAHIH: Evil words are for evil men, and evil men are [subjected] to evil words. And good words are for good men, and good men are [an object] of good words.1 Those [good people] are declared innocent of what they [i.e., slanderers] say. For them is forgiveness and noble provision.
translations.PICKTHALL: Vile women are for vile men, and vile men for vile women. Good women are for good men, and good men for good women; such are innocent of that which people say: For them is pardon and a bountiful provision.

translations.SAHIH: O you who have believed, do not enter houses other than your own houses until you ascertain welcome and greet1 their inhabitants. That is best for you; perhaps you will be reminded [i.e., advised].
translations.PICKTHALL: O ye who believe! Enter not houses other than your own without first announcing your presence and invoking peace upon the folk thereof. That is better for you, that ye may be heedful.

translations.SAHIH: And if you do not find anyone therein, do not enter them until permission has been given you. And if it is said to you, "Go back,"1 then go back; it is purer for you. And Allāh is Knowing of what you do.
translations.PICKTHALL: And if ye find no-one therein, still enter not until permission hath been given. And if it be said unto you: Go away again, then go away, for it is purer for you. Allah knoweth what ye do.

translations.SAHIH: There is no blame upon you for entering houses not inhabited in which there is convenience1 for you. And Allāh knows what you reveal and what you conceal.
translations.PICKTHALL: (It is) no sin for you to enter uninhabited houses wherein is comfort for you. Allah knoweth what ye proclaim and what ye hide.

translations.SAHIH: Tell the believing men to reduce [some] of their vision1 and guard their private parts.2 That is purer for them. Indeed, Allāh is [fully] Aware of what they do.
translations.PICKTHALL: Tell the believing men to lower their gaze and be modest. That is purer for them. Lo! Allah is aware of what they do.

translations.SAHIH: And tell the believing women to reduce [some] of their vision1 and guard their private parts and not expose their adornment2 except that which [necessarily] appears thereof3 and to wrap [a portion of] their headcovers over their chests and not expose their adornment [i.e., beauty] except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their women, that which their right hands possess [i.e., slaves], or those male attendants having no physical desire,4 or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they conceal of their adornment. And turn to Allāh in repentance, all of you, O believers, that you might succeed.
translations.PICKTHALL: And tell the believing women to lower their gaze and be modest, and to display of their adornment only that which is apparent, and to draw their veils over their bosoms, and not to reveal their adornment save to their own husbands or fathers or husbands' fathers, or their sons or their husbands' sons, or their brothers or their brothers' sons or sisters' sons, or their women, or their slaves, or male attendants who lack vigour, or children who know naught of women's nakedness. And let them not stamp their feet so as to reveal what they hide of their adornment. And turn unto Allah together, O believers, in order that ye may succeed.

translations.SAHIH: And marry the unmarried among you and the righteous among your male slaves and female slaves. If they should be poor, Allāh will enrich them from His bounty, and Allāh is all-Encompassing and Knowing.
translations.PICKTHALL: And marry such of you as are solitary and the pious of your slaves and maid-servants. If they be poor, Allah will enrich them of His bounty. Allah is of ample means, Aware.

translations.SAHIH: But let them who find not [the means for] marriage abstain [from sexual relations] until Allāh enriches them from His bounty. And those who seek a contract [for eventual emancipation] from among whom your right hands possess1 - then make a contract with them if you know there is within them goodness and give them from the wealth of Allāh which He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution, if they desire chastity, to seek [thereby] the temporary interests of worldly life. And if someone should compel them, then indeed, Allāh is [to them], after their compulsion, Forgiving and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And let those who cannot find a match keep chaste till Allah give them independence by His grace. And such of your slaves as seek a writing (of emancipation), write it for them if ye are aware of aught of good in them, and bestow upon them of the wealth of Allah which He hath bestowed upon you. Force not your slave-girls to whoredom that ye may seek enjoyment of the life of the world, if they would preserve their chastity. And if one force them, then (unto them), after their compulsion, lo! Allah will be Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: And We have certainly sent down to you distinct verses1 and examples from those who passed on before you and an admonition for those who fear Allāh.
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily We have sent down for you revelations that make plain, and the example of those who passed away before you. An admonition unto those who ward off (evil).

translations.SAHIH: Allāh is the Light1 of the heavens and the earth. The example of His light2 is like a niche within which is a lamp;3 the lamp is within glass, the glass as if it were a pearly [white] star lit from [the oil of] a blessed olive tree, neither of the east nor of the west, whose oil would almost glow even if untouched by fire. Light upon light. Allāh guides to His light whom He wills. And Allāh presents examples for the people, and Allāh is Knowing of all things.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The similitude of His light is as a niche wherein is a lamp. The lamp is in a glass. The glass is as it were a shining star. (This lamp is) kindled from a blessed tree, an olive neither of the East nor of the West, whose oil would almost glow forth (of itself) though no fire touched it. Light upon light. Allah guideth unto His light whom He will. And Allah speaketh to mankind in allegories, for Allah is Knower of all things.

translations.SAHIH: [Such niches are] in houses [i.e., mosques] which Allāh has ordered to be raised and that His name be mentioned [i.e., praised] therein; exalting Him within them in the morning and the evenings1
translations.PICKTHALL: (This lamp is found) in houses which Allah hath allowed to be exalted and that His name shall be remembered therein. Therein do offer praise to Him at morn and evening.

translations.SAHIH: [Are] men whom neither commerce nor sale distracts from the remembrance of Allāh and performance of prayer and giving of zakāh. They fear a Day in which the hearts and eyes will [fearfully] turn about -
translations.PICKTHALL: Men whom neither merchandise nor sale beguileth from remembrance of Allah and constancy in prayer and paying to the poor their due; who fear a day when hearts and eyeballs will be overturned;

translations.SAHIH: That Allāh may reward them [according to] the best of what they did and increase them from His bounty. And Allāh gives provision to whom He wills without account [i.e., limit].
translations.PICKTHALL: That Allah may reward them with the best of what they did, and increase reward for them of His bounty. Allah giveth blessings without stint to whom He will.

translations.SAHIH: But those who disbelieved - their deeds are like a mirage in a lowland which a thirsty one thinks is water until, when he comes to it, he finds it is nothing but finds Allāh before him, and He will pay him in full his due; and Allāh is swift in account.
translations.PICKTHALL: As for those who disbelieve, their deeds are as a mirage in a desert. The thirsty one supposeth it to be water till he cometh unto it and findeth it naught, and findeth, in the place thereof, Allah Who payeth him his due; and Allah is swift at reckoning.

translations.SAHIH: Or [they are] like darknesses within an unfathomable sea which is covered by waves, upon which are waves, over which are clouds - darknesses, some of them upon others. When one puts out his hand [therein], he can hardly see it. And he to whom Allāh has not granted light - for him there is no light.
translations.PICKTHALL: Or as darkness on a vast, abysmal sea. There covereth him a wave, above which is a wave, above which is a cloud. Layer upon layer of darkness. When he holdeth out his hand he scarce can see it. And he for whom Allah hath not appointed light, for him there is no light.

translations.SAHIH: Do you not see that Allāh is exalted by whomever is within the heavens and the earth and [by] the birds with wings spread [in flight]? Each [of them] has known his [means of] prayer and exalting [Him], and Allāh is Knowing of what they do.
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou not seen that Allah, He it is Whom all who are in the heavens and the earth praise, and the birds in their flight? Of each He knoweth verily the worship and the praise; and Allah is Aware of what they do.

translations.SAHIH: And to Allāh belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to Allāh is the destination.
translations.PICKTHALL: And unto Allah belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, and unto Allah is the journeying.

translations.SAHIH: Do you not see that Allāh drives clouds? Then He brings them together; then He makes them into a mass, and you see the rain emerge from within it. And He sends down from the sky, mountains [of clouds] within which is hail, and He strikes with it whom He wills and averts it from whom He wills. The flash of its lightning almost takes away the eyesight.
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou not seen how Allah wafteth the clouds, then gathereth them, then maketh them layers, and thou seest the rain come forth from between them; He sendeth down from the heaven mountains wherein is hail, and smiteth therewith whom He will, and averteth it from whom He will. The flashing of His lightning all but snatcheth away the sight.

translations.SAHIH: Allāh alternates the night and the day. Indeed in that is a lesson for those who have vision.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah causeth the revolution of the day and the night. Lo! herein is indeed a lesson for those who see.

translations.SAHIH: Allāh has created every [living] creature from water. And of them are those that move on their bellies, and of them are those that walk on two legs, and of them are those that walk on four. Allāh creates what He wills. Indeed, Allāh is over all things competent.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah hath created every animal of water. Of them is (a kind) that goeth upon its belly and (a kind) that goeth upon two legs and (a kind) that goeth upon four. Allah createth what He will. Lo! Allah is Able to do all things.

translations.SAHIH: We have certainly sent down distinct verses. And Allāh guides whom He wills to a straight path.
translations.PICKTHALL: Verily We have sent down revelations and explained them. Allah guideth whom He will unto a straight path.

translations.SAHIH: But they [i.e., the hypocrites] say, "We have believed in Allāh and in the Messenger, and we obey"; then a party of them turns away after that. And those are not believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they say: We believe in Allah and the messenger, and we obey; then after that a faction of them turn away. Such are not believers.

translations.SAHIH: And when they are called to [the words of] Allāh and His Messenger to judge between them, at once a party of them turns aside [in refusal].
translations.PICKTHALL: And when they appeal unto Allah and His messenger to judge between them, lo! a faction of them are averse;

translations.SAHIH: But if the right is theirs, they come to him in prompt obedience.
translations.PICKTHALL: But if right had been with them they would have come unto him willingly.

translations.SAHIH: Is there disease in their hearts? Or have they doubted? Or do they fear that Allāh will be unjust to them, or His Messenger? Rather, it is they who are the wrongdoers [i.e., the unjust].
translations.PICKTHALL: Is there in their hearts a disease, or have they doubts, or fear they lest Allah and His messenger should wrong them in judgment? Nay, but such are evil-doers.

translations.SAHIH: The only statement of the [true] believers when they are called to Allāh and His Messenger to judge between them is that they say, "We hear and we obey." And those are the successful.
translations.PICKTHALL: The saying of (all true) believers when they appeal unto Allah and His messenger to judge between them is only that they say: We hear and we obey. And such are the successful.

translations.SAHIH: And whoever obeys Allāh and His Messenger and fears Allāh and is conscious of Him - it is those who are the attainers.
translations.PICKTHALL: He who obeyeth Allah and His messenger, and feareth Allah, and keepeth duty (unto Him): such indeed are the victorious.

translations.SAHIH: And they swear by Allāh their strongest oaths that if you ordered them, they would go forth [in Allāh's cause]. Say, "Do not swear. [Such] obedience is known.1 Indeed, Allāh is [fully] Aware of that which you do."
translations.PICKTHALL: They swear by Allah solemnly that, if thou order them, they will go forth. Say: Swear not; known obedience (is better). Lo! Allah is Informed of what ye do.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Obey Allāh and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon him is only that [duty] with which he has been charged, and upon you is that with which you have been charged. And if you obey him, you will be [rightly] guided. And there is not upon the Messenger except the [responsibility for] clear notification."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Obey Allah and obey the messenger. But if ye turn away, then (it is) for him (to do) only that wherewith he hath been charged, and for you (to do) only that wherewith ye have been charged. If ye obey him, ye will go aright. But the messenger hath no other charge than to convey (the message) plainly.

translations.SAHIH: Allāh has promised those who have believed among you and done righteous deeds that He will surely grant them succession [to authority] upon the earth just as He granted it to those before them and that He will surely establish for them [therein] their religion which He has preferred for them and that He will surely substitute for them, after their fear, security, [for] they worship Me, not associating anything with Me. But whoever disbelieves1 after that - then those are the defiantly disobedient.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah hath promised such of you as believe and do good work that He will surely make them to succeed (the present rulers) in the earth even as He caused those who were before them to succeed (others); and that He will surely establish for them their religion which He hath approved for them, and will give them in exchange safety after their fear. They serve Me. They ascribe no thing as partner unto Me. Those who disbelieve henceforth, they are the miscreants.

translations.SAHIH: And establish prayer and give zakāh and obey the Messenger - that you may receive mercy.
translations.PICKTHALL: Establish worship and pay the poor-due and obey the messenger, that haply ye may find mercy.

translations.SAHIH: Never think that the disbelievers are causing failure [to Allāh] upon the earth. Their refuge will be the Fire - and how wretched the destination.
translations.PICKTHALL: Think not that the disbelievers can escape in the land. Fire will be their home - a hapless journey's end!

translations.SAHIH: O you who have believed, let those whom your right hands possess and those who have not [yet] reached puberty among you ask permission of you [before entering] at three times: before the dawn prayer and when you put aside your clothing [for rest] at noon and after the night prayer. [These are] three times of privacy1 for you. There is no blame upon you nor upon them beyond these [periods], for they continually circulate among you - some of you, among others. Thus does Allāh make clear to you the verses [i.e., His ordinances]; and Allāh is Knowing and Wise.
translations.PICKTHALL: O ye who believe! Let your slaves, and those of you who have not come to puberty, ask leave of you at three times (before they come into your presence): Before the prayer of dawn, and when ye lay aside your raiment for the heat of noon, and after the prayer of night. Three times of privacy for you. It is no sin for them or for you at other times, when some of you go round attendant upon others (if they come into your presence without leave). Thus Allah maketh clear the revelations for you. Allah is Knower, Wise.

translations.SAHIH: And when the children among you reach puberty, let them ask permission [at all times] as those before them have done. Thus does Allāh make clear to you His verses; and Allāh is Knowing and Wise.
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the children among you come to puberty then let them ask leave even as those before them used to ask it. Thus Allah maketh clear His revelations for you. Allah is Knower, Wise.

translations.SAHIH: And women of post-menstrual age who have no desire for marriage - there is no blame upon them for putting aside their outer garments [but] not displaying adornment. But to modestly refrain [from that] is better for them. And Allāh is Hearing and Knowing.
translations.PICKTHALL: As for women past child-bearing, who have no hope of marriage, it is no sin for them if they discard their (outer) clothing in such a way as not to show adornment. But to refrain is better for them. Allah is Hearer, Knower.

translations.SAHIH: There is not upon the blind [any] constraint nor upon the lame constraint nor upon the ill constraint nor upon yourselves when you eat from your [own] houses or the houses of your fathers or the houses of your mothers or the houses of your brothers or the houses of your sisters or the houses of your father's brothers or the houses of your father's sisters or the houses of your mother's brothers or the houses of your mother's sisters or [from houses] whose keys you possess or [from the house] of your friend. There is no blame upon you whether you eat together or separately. But when you enter houses, give greetings of peace1 upon each other - a greeting from Allāh, blessed and good. Thus does Allāh make clear to you the verses [of ordinance] that you may understand.
translations.PICKTHALL: No blame is there upon the blind nor any blame upon the lame nor any blame upon the sick nor on yourselves if ye eat from your houses, or the houses of your fathers, or the houses of your mothers, or the houses of your brothers, or the houses of your sisters, or the houses of your fathers' brothers, or the houses of your fathers' sisters, or the houses of your mothers' brothers, or the houses of your mothers' sisters, or (from that) whereof ye hold the keys, or (from the house) of a friend. No sin shall it be for you whether ye eat together or apart. But when ye enter houses, salute one another with a greeting from Allah, blessed and sweet. Thus Allah maketh clear His revelations for you, that haply ye may understand.

translations.SAHIH: The believers are only those who believe in Allāh and His Messenger and, when they are [meeting] with him for a matter of common interest, do not depart until they have asked his permission. Indeed, those who ask your permission, [O Muḥammad] - those are the ones who believe in Allāh and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission due to something of their affairs, then give permission to whom you will among them and ask forgiveness for them of Allāh. Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: They only are the true believers who believe in Allah and His messenger and, when they are with him on some common errand, go not away until they have asked leave of him. Lo! those who ask leave of thee, those are they who believe in Allah and His messenger. So, if they ask thy leave for some affair of theirs, give leave to whom thou wilt of them, and ask for them forgiveness of Allah. Lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: Do not make [your] calling of the Messenger among yourselves as the call of one of you to another. Already Allāh knows those of you who slip away, concealed by others. So let those beware who dissent from his [i.e., the Prophet's] order,1 lest fitnah2 strike them or a painful punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: Make not the calling of the messenger among you as your calling one of another. Allah knoweth those of you who steal away, hiding themselves. And let those who conspire to evade orders beware lest grief or painful punishment befall them.

translations.SAHIH: Unquestionably, to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Already He knows that upon which you [stand]1 and [knows] the Day2 when they will be returned to Him and He will inform them of what they have done. And Allāh is Knowing of all things.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! verily unto Allah belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth. He knoweth your condition. And (He knoweth) the Day when they are returned unto Him so that He may inform them of what they did. Allah is Knower of all things.

translations.SAHIH: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion upon His Servant that he may be to the worlds a warner -
translations.PICKTHALL: Blessed is He Who hath revealed unto His slave the Criterion (of right and wrong), that he may be a warner to the peoples.

translations.SAHIH: He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and who has not taken a son and has not had a partner in dominion and has created each thing and determined it with [precise] determination.
translations.PICKTHALL: He unto Whom belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, He hath chosen no son nor hath He any partner in the Sovereignty. He hath created everything and hath meted out for it a measure.

translations.SAHIH: But they have taken besides Him gods which create nothing, while they are created, and possess not for themselves any harm or benefit and possess not [power to cause] death or life or resurrection.
translations.PICKTHALL: Yet they choose beside Him other gods who create naught but are themselves created, and possess not hurt nor profit for themselves, and possess not death nor life, nor power to raise the dead.

translations.SAHIH: And those who disbelieve say, "This [Qur’ān] is not except a falsehood he invented, and another people assisted him in it." But they have committed an injustice and a lie.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who disbelieve say: This is naught but a lie that he hath invented, and other folk have helped him with it, so that they have produced a slander and a lie.

translations.SAHIH: And they say, "Legends of the former peoples which he has written down, and they are dictated to him morning and afternoon."
translations.PICKTHALL: And they say: Fables of the men of old which he hath had written down so that they are dictated to him morn and evening.

translations.SAHIH: Say, [O Muḥammad], "It has been revealed by He who knows [every] secret within the heavens and the earth. Indeed, He is ever Forgiving and Merciful."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): He who knoweth the secret of the heavens and the earth hath revealed it. Lo! He ever is Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: And they say, "What is this messenger that eats food and walks in the markets? Why was there not sent down to him an angel so he would be with him a warner?
translations.PICKTHALL: And they say: What aileth this messenger (of Allah) that he eateth food and walketh in the markets? Why is not an angel sent down unto him, to be a warner with him.

translations.SAHIH: Or [why is not] a treasure presented to him [from heaven], or does he [not] have a garden from which he eats?" And the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."
translations.PICKTHALL: Or (why is not) treasure thrown down unto him, or why hath he not a paradise from whence to eat? And the evil-doers say: Ye are but following a man bewitched.

translations.SAHIH: Look how they strike for you comparisons;1 but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.
translations.PICKTHALL: See how they coin similitudes for thee, so that they are all astray and cannot find a road!

translations.SAHIH: Blessed is He who, if He willed, could have made for you [something] better than that - gardens beneath which rivers flow - and could make for you palaces.
translations.PICKTHALL: Blessed is He Who, if He will, will assign thee better than (all) that - Gardens underneath which rivers flow - and will assign thee mansions.

translations.SAHIH: But they have denied the Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a Blaze.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but they deny (the coming of) the Hour, and for those who deny (the coming of) the Hour We have prepared a flame.

translations.SAHIH: When it [i.e., the Hellfire] sees them from a distant place, they will hear its fury and roaring.
translations.PICKTHALL: When it seeth them from afar, they hear the crackling and the roar thereof.

translations.SAHIH: And when they are thrown into a narrow place therein bound in chains, they will cry out thereupon for destruction.
translations.PICKTHALL: And when they are flung into a narrow place thereof, chained together, they pray for destruction there.

translations.SAHIH: [They will be told], "Do not cry this Day for one destruction but cry for much destruction."
translations.PICKTHALL: Pray not that day for one destruction, but pray for many destructions!

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Is that better or the Garden of Eternity which is promised to the righteous? It will be for them a reward and destination.
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Is that (doom) better or the Garden of Immortality which is promised unto those who ward off (evil)? It will be their reward and journey's end.

translations.SAHIH: For them therein is whatever they wish, [while] abiding eternally. It is ever upon your Lord a promise [worthy to be] requested.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Therein abiding, they have all that they desire. It is for thy Lord a promise that must be fulfilled.

translations.SAHIH: And [mention] the Day He will gather them and that which they worship besides Allāh and will say, "Did you mislead these, My servants, or did they [themselves] stray from the way?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And on the day when He will assemble them and that which they worship instead of Allah and will say: Was it ye who misled these my slaves or did they (themselves) wander from the way?

translations.SAHIH: They will say, "Exalted are You! It was not for us to take besides You any allies [i.e., protectors]. But You provided comforts for them and their fathers until they forgot the message and became a people ruined."
translations.PICKTHALL: They will say: Be Thou Glorified! it was not for us to choose any protecting friends beside thee; but Thou didst give them and their fathers ease till they forgot the warning and became lost folk.

translations.SAHIH: So they will deny you, [disbelievers], in what you say,1 and you cannot avert [punishment] or [find] help. And whoever commits injustice2 among you - We will make him taste a great punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus they will give you the lie regarding what ye say, then ye can neither avert (the doom) nor obtain help. And whoso among you doeth wrong, We shall make him taste great torment.

translations.SAHIH: And We did not send before you, [O Muḥammad], any of the messengers except that they ate food and walked in the markets. And We have made some of you [people] as trial for others - will you have patience? And ever is your Lord, Seeing.
translations.PICKTHALL: We never sent before thee any messengers but lo! they verily ate food and walked in the markets. And We have appointed some of you a test for others: Will ye be steadfast? And thy Lord is ever Seer.

translations.SAHIH: And those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Why were not angels sent down to us, or [why] do we [not] see our Lord?" They have certainly become arrogant within themselves1 and [become] insolent with great insolence.
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who look not for a meeting with Us say: Why are angels not sent down unto us and (Why) do we not see our Lord! Assuredly they think too highly of themselves and are scornful with great pride.

translations.SAHIH: The day they see the angels1 - no good tidings will there be that day for the criminals, and [the angels] will say, "Prevented and inaccessible."2
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when they behold the angels, on that day there will be no good tidings for the guilty; and they will cry: A forbidding ban!

translations.SAHIH: And We will approach [i.e., regard]1 what they have done of deeds and make them as dust dispersed.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We shall turn unto the work they did and make it scattered motes.

translations.SAHIH: The companions of Paradise, that Day, are [in] a better settlement and better resting place.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who have earned the Garden on that day will be better in their home and happier in their place of noonday rest;

translations.SAHIH: And [mention] the Day when the heaven will split open with [emerging] clouds,1 and the angels will be sent down in successive descent.
translations.PICKTHALL: A day when the heaven with the clouds will be rent asunder and the angels will be sent down, a grand descent.

translations.SAHIH: True sovereignty, that Day, is for the Most Merciful. And it will be upon the disbelievers a difficult Day.
translations.PICKTHALL: The Sovereignty on that day will be the True (Sovereignty) belonging to the Beneficent One, and it will be a hard day for disbelievers.

translations.SAHIH: And the Day the wrongdoer will bite on his hands [in regret] he will say, "Oh, I wish I had taken with the Messenger a way.1
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when the wrong-doer gnaweth his hands, he will say: Ah, would that I had chosen a way together with the messenger (of Allah)!

translations.SAHIH: Oh, woe to me! I wish I had not taken that one1 as a friend.
translations.PICKTHALL: Alas for me! Ah, would that I had never taken such an one for friend!

translations.SAHIH: He led me away from the remembrance1 after it had come to me. And ever is Satan, to man, a deserter."2
translations.PICKTHALL: He verily led me astray from the Reminder after it had reached me. Satan was ever man's deserter in the hour of need.

translations.SAHIH: And the Messenger has said, "O my Lord, indeed my people have taken this Qur’ān as [a thing] abandoned."1
translations.PICKTHALL: And the messenger saith: O my Lord! Lo! mine own folk make this Qur'an of no account.

translations.SAHIH: And thus have We made for every prophet an enemy from among the criminals. But sufficient is your Lord as a guide and a helper.
translations.PICKTHALL: Even so have We appointed unto every prophet an opponent from among the guilty; but Allah sufficeth for a Guide and Helper.

translations.SAHIH: And those who disbelieve say, "Why was the Qur’ān not revealed to him all at once?" Thus [it is] that We may strengthen thereby your heart. And We have spaced it distinctly.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who disbelieve say: Why is the Qur'an not revealed unto him all at once? (It is revealed) thus that We may strengthen thy heart therewith; and We have arranged it in right order.

translations.SAHIH: And they do not come to you with an example [i.e., argument] except that We bring you the truth and the best explanation.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they bring thee no similitude but We bring thee the Truth (as against it), and better (than their similitude) as argument.

translations.SAHIH: The ones who are gathered on their faces to Hell - those are the worst in position and farthest astray in [their] way.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who will be gathered on their faces unto hell: such are worse in plight and further from the right road.

translations.SAHIH: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture and appointed with him his brother Aaron as an assistant.
translations.PICKTHALL: We verily gave Moses the Scripture and placed with him his brother Aaron as henchman.

translations.SAHIH: And We said, "Go both of you to the people who have denied Our signs." Then We destroyed them with [complete] destruction.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We said: Go together unto the folk who have denied Our revelations. Then We destroyed them, a complete destruction.

translations.SAHIH: And the people of Noah - when they denied the messengers,1 We drowned them, and We made them for mankind a sign. And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Noah's folk, when they denied the messengers, We drowned them and made of them a portent for mankind. We have prepared a painful doom for evil-doers.

translations.SAHIH: And [We destroyed] ʿAad and Thamūd and the companions of the well1 and many generations between them.
translations.PICKTHALL: And (the tribes of) A'ad and Thamud, and the dwellers in Ar-Rass, and many generations in between.

translations.SAHIH: And for each We presented examples [as warnings], and each We destroyed with [total] destruction.
translations.PICKTHALL: Each (of them) We warned by examples, and each (of them) We brought to utter ruin.

translations.SAHIH: And they have already come upon the town which was showered with a rain of evil [i.e., stones]. So have they not seen it? But they are not expecting resurrection.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And indeed they have passed by the township whereon was rained the fatal rain. Can it be that they have not seen it? Nay, but they hope for no resurrection.

translations.SAHIH: And when they see you, [O Muḥammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one whom Allāh has sent as a messenger?
translations.PICKTHALL: And when they see thee (O Muhammad) they treat thee only as a jest (saying): Is this he whom Allah sendeth as a messenger?

translations.SAHIH: He almost would have misled us from our gods had we not been steadfast in [worship of] them." But they are going to know, when they see the punishment, who is farthest astray in [his] way.
translations.PICKTHALL: He would have led us far away from our gods if we had not been staunch to them. They will know, when they behold the doom, who is more astray as to the road.

translations.SAHIH: Have you seen the one who takes as his god his own desire? Then would you be responsible for him?
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou seen him who chooseth for his god his own lust? Wouldst thou then be guardian over him?

translations.SAHIH: Or do you think that most of them hear or reason? They are not except like livestock.1 Rather, they are [even] more astray in [their] way.
translations.PICKTHALL: Or deemest thou that most of them hear or understand? They are but as the cattle - nay, but they are farther astray?

translations.SAHIH: Have you not considered your Lord - how He extends the shadow, and if He willed, He could have made it stationary? Then We made the sun for it an indication.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou not seen how thy Lord hath spread the shade - And if He willed He could have made it still - then We have made the sun its pilot;

translations.SAHIH: Then We [retract and] hold it with Us for a brief grasp.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We withdraw it unto Us, a gradual withdrawal?

translations.SAHIH: And it is He who has made the night for you as clothing1 and sleep [a means for] rest and has made the day a resurrection.2
translations.PICKTHALL: And He it is Who maketh night a covering for you, and sleep repose, and maketh day a resurrection.

translations.SAHIH: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy [i.e., rainfall], and We send down from the sky pure water
translations.PICKTHALL: And He it is Who sendeth the winds, glad tidings heralding His mercy, and We send down purifying water from the sky,

translations.SAHIH: That We may bring to life thereby a dead land and give it as drink to those We created of numerous livestock and men.
translations.PICKTHALL: That We may give life thereby to a dead land, and We give many beasts and men that We have created to drink thereof.

translations.SAHIH: And We have certainly distributed it among them that they might be reminded,1 but most of the people refuse except disbelief.
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily We have repeated it among them that they may remember, but most of mankind begrudge aught save ingratitude.

translations.SAHIH: And if We had willed, We could have sent into every city a warner.1
translations.PICKTHALL: If We willed, We could raise up a warner in every village.

translations.SAHIH: So do not obey the disbelievers, and strive against them with it [i.e., the Qur’ān] a great striving.
translations.PICKTHALL: So obey not the disbelievers, but strive against them herewith with a great endeavour.

translations.SAHIH: And it is He who has released [simultaneously] the two seas [i.e., bodies of water], one fresh and sweet and one salty and bitter, and He placed between them a barrier and prohibiting partition.
translations.PICKTHALL: And He it is Who hath given independence to the two seas (though they meet); one palatable, sweet, and the other saltish, bitter; and hath set a bar and a forbidding ban between them.

translations.SAHIH: And it is He who has created from water [i.e., semen] a human being and made him [a relative by] lineage and marriage. And ever is your Lord competent [concerning creation].
translations.PICKTHALL: And He it is Who hath created man from water, and hath appointed for him kindred by blood and kindred by marriage; for thy Lord is ever Powerful.

translations.SAHIH: But they worship rather than Allāh that which does not benefit them or harm them, and the disbeliever is ever, against his Lord, an assistant [to Satan].
translations.PICKTHALL: Yet they worship instead of Allah that which can neither benefit them nor hurt them. The disbeliever was ever a partisan against his Lord.

translations.SAHIH: And We have not sent you, [O Muḥammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We have sent thee (O Muhammad) only as a bearer of good tidings and a warner.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "I do not ask of you for it any payment - only that whoever wills might take to his Lord a way."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: I ask of you no reward for this, save that whoso will may choose a way unto his Lord.

translations.SAHIH: And rely upon the Ever-Living who does not die, and exalt [Allāh] with His praise. And sufficient is He to be, with the sins of His servants, [fully] Aware -
translations.PICKTHALL: And trust thou in the Living One Who dieth not, and hymn His praise. He sufficeth as the Knower of His bondmen's sins,

translations.SAHIH: He who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days and then established Himself above the Throne1 - the Most Merciful, so ask about Him one well informed [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ)].
translations.PICKTHALL: Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six Days, then He mounted the Throne. The Beneficent! Ask anyone informed concerning Him!

translations.SAHIH: And when it is said to them, "Prostrate to the Most Merciful," they say, "And what is the Most Merciful? Should we prostrate to that which you order us?" And it increases them in aversion.
translations.PICKTHALL: And when it is said unto them: Prostrate to the Beneficent! they say: And what is the Beneficent? Are we to prostrate to whatever thou (Muhammad) biddest us? And it increaseth aversion in them.

translations.SAHIH: Blessed is He who has placed in the sky great stars and placed therein a [burning] lamp and luminous moon.
translations.PICKTHALL: Blessed be He Who hath placed in the heaven mansions of the stars, and hath placed therein a great lamp and a moon giving light!

translations.SAHIH: And it is He who has made the night and the day in succession for whoever desires to remember or desires gratitude.
translations.PICKTHALL: And He it is Who hath appointed night and day in succession, for him who desireth to remember, or desireth thankfulness.

translations.SAHIH: And the servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth easily,1 and when the ignorant address them [harshly], they say [words of] peace,2
translations.PICKTHALL: The (faithful) slaves of the Beneficent are they who walk upon the earth modestly, and when the foolish ones address them answer: Peace;

translations.SAHIH: And those who spend [part of] the night to their Lord prostrating and standing [in prayer]
translations.PICKTHALL: And who spend the night before their Lord, prostrate and standing,

translations.SAHIH: And those who say, "Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell. Indeed, its punishment is ever adhering;
translations.PICKTHALL: And who say: Our Lord! Avert from us the doom of hell; lo! the doom thereof is anguish;

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it is evil as a settlement and residence."
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! it is wretched as abode and station;

translations.SAHIH: And [they are] those who, when they spend, do so not excessively or sparingly but are ever, between that, [justly] moderate
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who, when they spend, are neither prodigal nor grudging; and there is ever a firm station between the two;

translations.SAHIH: And those who do not invoke1 with Allāh another deity or kill the soul which Allāh has forbidden [to be killed], except by right, and do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse. And whoever should do that will meet a penalty.
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who cry not unto any other god along with Allah, nor take the life which Allah hath forbidden save in (course of) justice, nor commit adultery - and whoso doeth this shall pay the penalty;

translations.SAHIH: Multiplied for him is the punishment on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein humiliated -
translations.PICKTHALL: The doom will be doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein disdained for ever;

translations.SAHIH: Except for those who repent, believe and do righteous work. For them Allāh will replace their evil deeds with good. And ever is Allāh Forgiving and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Save him who repenteth and believeth and doth righteous work; as for such, Allah will change their evil deeds to good deeds. Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: And he who repents and does righteousness does indeed turn to Allāh with [accepted] repentance.
translations.PICKTHALL: And whosoever repenteth and doeth good, he verily repenteth toward Allah with true repentance -

translations.SAHIH: And [they are] those who do not testify to falsehood, and when they pass near ill speech, they pass by with dignity.
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who will not witness vanity, but when they pass near senseless play, pass by with dignity.

translations.SAHIH: And those who, when reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall upon them deaf and blind.
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who, when they are reminded of the revelations of their Lord, fall not deaf and blind thereat.

translations.SAHIH: And those who say, "Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes1 and make us a leader [i.e., example] for the righteous."
translations.PICKTHALL: And who say: Our Lord! Vouchsafe us comfort of our wives and of our offspring, and make us patterns for (all) those who ward off (evil).

translations.SAHIH: Those will be awarded the Chamber1 for what they patiently endured, and they will be received therein with greetings and [words of] peace,
translations.PICKTHALL: They will be awarded the high place forasmuch as they were steadfast, and they will meet therein with welcome and the ward of peace,

translations.SAHIH: Abiding eternally therein. Good is the settlement and residence.
translations.PICKTHALL: Abiding there for ever. Happy is it as abode and station!

translations.SAHIH: Say, "What would my Lord care for you if not for your supplication?"1 For you [disbelievers] have denied, so it [i.e., your denial] is going to be adherent.2
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (O Muhammad, unto the disbelievers): My Lord would not concern Himself with you but for your prayer. But now ye have denied (the Truth), therefor there will be judgment.

translations.SAHIH: Ṭā, Seen, Meem.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Ta. Sin. Mim.

translations.SAHIH: These are the verses of the clear Book.
translations.PICKTHALL: These are revelations of the Scripture that maketh plain.

translations.SAHIH: Perhaps, [O Muḥammad], you would kill yourself with grief that they will not be believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: It may be that thou tormentest thyself (O Muhammad) because they believe not.

translations.SAHIH: If We willed, We could send down to them from the sky a sign for which their necks would remain humbled.1
translations.PICKTHALL: If We will, We can send down on them from the sky a portent so that their necks would remain bowed before it.

translations.SAHIH: And no mention [i.e., revelation] comes to them anew from the Most Merciful except that they turn away from it.
translations.PICKTHALL: Never cometh there unto them a fresh reminder from the Beneficent One, but they turn away from it.

translations.SAHIH: For they have already denied, but there will come to them the news of that which they used to ridicule.
translations.PICKTHALL: Now they have denied (the Truth); but there will come unto them tidings of that whereat they used to scoff.

translations.SAHIH: Did they not look at the earth - how much We have produced therein from every noble kind?
translations.PICKTHALL: Have they not seen the earth, how much of every fruitful kind We make to grow therein?

translations.SAHIH: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! herein is indeed a portent; yet most of them are not believers.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: And [mention] when your Lord called Moses, [saying], "Go to the wrongdoing people -
translations.PICKTHALL: And when thy Lord called Moses, saying: Go unto the wrongdoing folk,

translations.SAHIH: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear Allāh?"
translations.PICKTHALL: The folk of Pharaoh. Will they not ward off (evil)?

translations.SAHIH: He said, "My Lord, indeed I fear that they will deny me
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: My Lord! Lo! I fear that they will deny me,

translations.SAHIH: And that my breast will tighten and my tongue will not be fluent, so send for Aaron.
translations.PICKTHALL: And I shall be embarrassed, and my tongue will not speak plainly, therefor send for Aaron (to help me).

translations.SAHIH: And they have upon me a [claim due to] sin, so I fear that they will kill me."
translations.PICKTHALL: And they have a crime against me, so I fear that they will kill me.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "No. Go both of you with Our signs; indeed, We are with you, listening.
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Nay, verily. So go ye twain with Our tokens. Lo! We shall be with you, Hearing.

translations.SAHIH: Go to Pharaoh and say, 'We are the messengers1 of the Lord of the worlds,
translations.PICKTHALL: And come together unto Pharaoh and say: Lo! we bear a message of the Lord of the Worlds,

translations.SAHIH: [Commanded to say], "Send with us the Children of Israel."'"
translations.PICKTHALL: (Saying): Let the Children of Israel go with us.

translations.SAHIH: [Pharaoh] said, "Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you remained among us for years of your life?
translations.PICKTHALL: (Pharaoh) said (unto Moses): Did we not rear thee among us as a child? And thou didst dwell many years of thy life among us,

translations.SAHIH: And [then] you did your deed which you did,1 and you were of the ungrateful."
translations.PICKTHALL: And thou didst that thy deed which thou didst, and thou wast one of the ingrates.

translations.SAHIH: [Moses] said, "I did it, then, while I was of those astray [i.e., ignorant].
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: I did it then, when I was of those who are astray.

translations.SAHIH: So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me judgement [i.e., wisdom and prophet hood] and appointed me [as one] of the messengers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then I fled from you when I feared you, and my Lord vouchsafed me a command and appointed me (of the number) of those sent (by Him).

translations.SAHIH: And is this a favor of which you remind me - that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And this is the past favour wherewith thou reproachest me: that thou hast enslaved the Children of Israel.

translations.SAHIH: Said Pharaoh, "And what is the Lord of the worlds?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Pharaoh said: And what is the Lord of the Worlds?

translations.SAHIH: [Moses] said, "The Lord of the heavens and earth and that between them, if you should be convinced."
translations.PICKTHALL: (Moses) said: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if ye had but sure belief.

translations.SAHIH: [Pharaoh] said to those around him, "Do you not hear?"
translations.PICKTHALL: (Pharaoh) said unto those around him: Hear ye not?

translations.SAHIH: [Moses] said, "Your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers.

translations.SAHIH: [Pharaoh] said,1 "Indeed, your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad."
translations.PICKTHALL: (Pharaoh) said: Lo! your messenger who hath been sent unto you is indeed a madman!

translations.SAHIH: [Moses] said, "Lord of the east and the west and that between them, if you were to reason."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Lord of the East and the West and all that is between them, if ye did but understand.

translations.SAHIH: [Pharaoh] said, "If you take a god other than me, I will surely place you among those imprisoned."
translations.PICKTHALL: (Pharaoh) said: If thou choosest a god other than me, I assuredly shall place thee among the prisoners.

translations.SAHIH: [Moses] said, "Even if I brought you something [i.e., proof] manifest?"
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Even though I show thee something plain?

translations.SAHIH: [Pharaoh] said, "Then bring it, if you should be of the truthful."
translations.PICKTHALL: (Pharaoh) said: Produce it then, if thou art of the truthful!

translations.SAHIH: So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then he flung down his staff and it became a serpent manifest,

translations.SAHIH: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white for the observers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And he drew forth his hand and lo! it was white to the beholders.

translations.SAHIH: [Pharaoh] said to the eminent ones around him, "Indeed, this is a learned magician.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Pharaoh) said unto the chiefs about him: Lo! this is verily a knowing wizard,

translations.SAHIH: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic, so what do you advise?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Who would drive you out of your land by his magic. Now what counsel ye?

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Put him off, (him) and his brother, and send into the cities summoners

translations.SAHIH: Who will bring you every learned, skilled magician."
translations.PICKTHALL: Who shall bring unto thee every knowing wizard.

translations.SAHIH: So the magicians were assembled for the appointment of a well-known day.1
translations.PICKTHALL: So the wizards were gathered together at a set time on a day appointed.

translations.SAHIH: And it was said to the people, "Will you congregate.
translations.PICKTHALL: And it was said unto the people: Are ye (also) gathering?

translations.SAHIH: That we might follow the magicians if they are the predominant?"
translations.PICKTHALL: (They said): Aye, so that we may follow the wizards if they are the winners.

translations.SAHIH: And when the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, "Is there indeed for us a reward if we are the predominant?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the wizards came they said unto Pharaoh: Will there surely be a reward for us if we are the winners?

translations.SAHIH: He said, "Yes, and indeed, you will then be of those near [to me]."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Aye, and ye will then surely be of those brought near (to me).

translations.SAHIH: Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you will throw."
translations.PICKTHALL: Moses said unto them: Throw what ye are going to throw!

translations.SAHIH: So they threw their ropes and their staffs and said, "By the might of Pharaoh, indeed it is we who are predominant."
translations.PICKTHALL: Then they threw down their cords and their staves and said: By Pharaoh's might, lo! we verily are the winners.

translations.SAHIH: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it devoured what they falsified.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then Moses threw his staff and lo! it swallowed that which they did falsely show.

translations.SAHIH: So the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allāh].
translations.PICKTHALL: And the wizards were flung prostrate,

translations.SAHIH: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,
translations.PICKTHALL: Crying: We believe in the Lord of the Worlds,

translations.SAHIH: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
translations.PICKTHALL: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.

translations.SAHIH: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed him [i.e., Moses] before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic, but you are going to know. I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you all."
translations.PICKTHALL: (Pharaoh) said: Ye put your faith in him before I give you leave. Lo! he doubtless is your chief who taught you magic! But verily ye shall come to know. Verily I will cut off your hands and your feet alternately, and verily I will crucify you every one.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "No harm. Indeed, to our Lord we will return.
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: It is no hurt, for lo! unto our Lord we shall return.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, we aspire that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we were the first of the believers."
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! we ardently hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we are the first of the believers.

translations.SAHIH: And We inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants; indeed, you will be pursued."
translations.PICKTHALL: And We inspired Moses, saying: Take away My slaves by night, for ye will be pursued.

translations.SAHIH: Then Pharaoh sent among the cities gatherers1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then Pharaoh sent into the cities summoners,

translations.SAHIH: [And said], "Indeed, those are but a small band,
translations.PICKTHALL: (Who said): Lo! these indeed are but a little troop,

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, they are enraging us,
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! they are offenders against us.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, we are a cautious society..."
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! we are a ready host.

translations.SAHIH: So We removed them from gardens and springs
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus did We take them away from gardens and watersprings,

translations.SAHIH: And treasures and honorable station1 -
translations.PICKTHALL: And treasures and a fair estate.

translations.SAHIH: Thus. And We caused to inherit it the Children of Israel.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus (were those things taken from them) and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit them.

translations.SAHIH: So they pursued them at sunrise.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they overtook them at sunrise.

translations.SAHIH: And when the two companies saw one another, the companions of Moses said, "Indeed, we are to be overtaken!"
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the two hosts saw each other, those with Moses said: Lo! we are indeed caught.

translations.SAHIH: [Moses] said, "No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Nay, verily! for lo! my Lord is with me. He will guide me.

translations.SAHIH: Then We inspired to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea," and it parted, and each portion was like a great towering mountain.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We inspired Moses, saying: Smite the sea with thy staff. And it parted, and each part was as a mountain vast.

translations.SAHIH: And We advanced thereto the others [i.e., the pursuers].
translations.PICKTHALL: Then brought We near the others to that place.

translations.SAHIH: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We saved Moses and those with him, every one;

translations.SAHIH: Then We drowned the others.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We drowned the others.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo, thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: And recite to them the news of Abraham,
translations.PICKTHALL: Recite unto them the story of Abraham:

translations.SAHIH: When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"
translations.PICKTHALL: When he said unto his father and his folk: What worship ye?

translations.SAHIH: They said, "We worship idols and remain to them devoted."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: We worship idols, and are ever devoted unto them.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "Do they hear you when you supplicate?
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Do they hear you when ye cry?

translations.SAHIH: Or do they benefit you, or do they harm?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Or do they benefit or harm you?

translations.SAHIH: They said, "But we found our fathers doing thus."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Nay, but we found our fathers acting on this wise.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "Then do you see what you have been worshipping,
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: See now that which ye worship,

translations.SAHIH: You and your ancient forefathers?
translations.PICKTHALL: Ye and your forefathers!

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, they are enemies to me, except the Lord of the worlds,1
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! they are (all) an enemy unto me, save the Lord of the Worlds,

translations.SAHIH: Who created me, and He [it is who] guides me.
translations.PICKTHALL: Who created me, and He doth guide me,

translations.SAHIH: And it is He who feeds me and gives me drink.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Who feedeth me and watereth me.

translations.SAHIH: And when I am ill, it is He who cures me
translations.PICKTHALL: And when I sicken, then He healeth me,

translations.SAHIH: And who will cause me to die and then bring me to life
translations.PICKTHALL: And Who causeth me to die, then giveth me life (again),

translations.SAHIH: And who I aspire that He will forgive me my sin on the Day of Recompense."
translations.PICKTHALL: And Who, I ardently hope, will forgive me my sin on the Day of Judgment.

translations.SAHIH: [And he said], "My Lord, grant me authority and join me with the righteous.
translations.PICKTHALL: My Lord! Vouchsafe me wisdom and unite me to the righteous.

translations.SAHIH: And grant me a mention [i.e., reputation] of honor among later generations.
translations.PICKTHALL: And give unto me a good report in later generations.

translations.SAHIH: And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure.
translations.PICKTHALL: And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Delight,

translations.SAHIH: And forgive my father. Indeed, he has been of those astray.
translations.PICKTHALL: And forgive my father. Lo! he is of those who err.

translations.SAHIH: And do not disgrace me on the Day they are [all] resurrected -
translations.PICKTHALL: And abase me not on the day when they are raised,

translations.SAHIH: The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children
translations.PICKTHALL: The day when wealth and sons avail not (any man)

translations.SAHIH: But only one who comes to Allāh with a sound heart."
translations.PICKTHALL: Save him who bringeth unto Allah a whole heart.

translations.SAHIH: And Paradise will be brought near [that Day] to the righteous.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the Garden will be brought nigh for those who ward off (evil).

translations.SAHIH: And Hellfire will be brought forth for the deviators,
translations.PICKTHALL: And hell will appear plainly to the erring.

translations.SAHIH: And it will be said to them, "Where are those you used to worship
translations.PICKTHALL: And it will be said unto them: Where is (all) that ye used to worship

translations.SAHIH: Other than Allāh? Can they help you or help themselves?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Instead of Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?

translations.SAHIH: So they will be overturned into it [i.e., Hellfire], they and the deviators
translations.PICKTHALL: Then will they be hurled therein, they and the seducers

translations.SAHIH: And the soldiers of Iblees, all together.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the hosts of Iblis, together.

translations.SAHIH: They will say while they dispute therein,
translations.PICKTHALL: And they will say, when they are quarrelling therein:

translations.SAHIH: "By Allāh, we were indeed in manifest error
translations.PICKTHALL: By Allah, of a truth we were in error manifest

translations.SAHIH: When we equated you with the Lord of the worlds.
translations.PICKTHALL: When we made you equal with the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.SAHIH: And no one misguided us except the criminals.
translations.PICKTHALL: It was but the guilty who misled us.

translations.SAHIH: So now we have no intercessors
translations.PICKTHALL: Now we have no intercessors

translations.SAHIH: And not a devoted friend.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nor any loving friend.

translations.SAHIH: Then if we only had a return [to the world] and could be of the believers..."1
translations.PICKTHALL: Oh, that we had another turn (on earth), that we might be of the believers!

translations.SAHIH: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers!

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo, thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: The people of Noah denied the messengers1
translations.PICKTHALL: Noah's folk denied the messengers (of Allah),

translations.SAHIH: When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
translations.PICKTHALL: When their brother Noah said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

translations.SAHIH: So fear Allāh and obey me.
translations.PICKTHALL: So keep your duty to Allah, and obey me.

translations.SAHIH: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
translations.PICKTHALL: And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.SAHIH: So fear Allāh and obey me."
translations.PICKTHALL: So keep your duty to Allah, and obey me.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Should we believe you while you are followed by the lowest [class of people]?"
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Shall we put faith in thee, when the lowest (of the people) follow thee?

translations.SAHIH: He said, "And what is my knowledge of what they used to do?
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: And what knowledge have I of what they may have been doing (in the past)?

translations.SAHIH: Their account is only upon my Lord, if you [could] perceive.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! their reckoning is my Lord's concern, if ye but knew;

translations.SAHIH: And I am not one to drive away the believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And I am not (here) to repulse believers.

translations.SAHIH: I am only a clear warner."
translations.PICKTHALL: I am only a plain warner.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will surely be of those who are stoned."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: If thou cease not, O Noah, thou wilt surely be among those stoned (to death).

translations.SAHIH: He said, "My Lord, indeed my people have denied me.
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: My Lord! Lo! my own folk deny me.

translations.SAHIH: Then judge between me and them with decisive judgement and save me and those with me of the believers."
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor judge Thou between us, a (conclusive) judgment, and save me and those believers who are with me.

translations.SAHIH: So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.

translations.SAHIH: Then We drowned thereafter the remaining ones.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then afterward We drowned the others.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo, thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: ʿAad denied the messengers
translations.PICKTHALL: (The tribe of) A'ad denied the messengers (of Allah).

translations.SAHIH: When their brother Hūd said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
translations.PICKTHALL: When their brother Hud said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

translations.SAHIH: So fear Allāh and obey me.
translations.PICKTHALL: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.

translations.SAHIH: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
translations.PICKTHALL: And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.SAHIH: Do you construct on every elevation a sign,1 amusing yourselves,
translations.PICKTHALL: Build ye on every high place a monument for vain delight?

translations.SAHIH: And take for yourselves constructions [i.e., palaces and fortresses] that you might abide eternally?
translations.PICKTHALL: And seek ye out strongholds, that haply ye may last for ever?

translations.SAHIH: And when you strike, you strike as tyrants.
translations.PICKTHALL: And if ye seize by force, seize ye as tyrants?

translations.SAHIH: So fear Allāh and obey me.
translations.PICKTHALL: Rather keep your duty to Allah, and obey me.

translations.SAHIH: And fear He who provided you with that which you know,
translations.PICKTHALL: Keep your duty toward Him Who hath aided you with (the good things) that ye know,

translations.SAHIH: Provided you with grazing livestock and children
translations.PICKTHALL: Hath aided you with cattle and sons.

translations.SAHIH: And gardens and springs.
translations.PICKTHALL: And gardens and watersprings.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! I fear for you the retribution of an awful day.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "It is all the same to us whether you advise or are not of the advisors.
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: It is all one to us whether thou preachest or art not of those who preach;

translations.SAHIH: This is not but the custom of the former peoples,
translations.PICKTHALL: This is but a fable of the men of old,

translations.SAHIH: And we are not to be punished."
translations.PICKTHALL: And we shall not be doomed.

translations.SAHIH: And they denied him, so We destroyed them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they denied him; therefor We destroyed them. Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: Thamūd denied the messengers
translations.PICKTHALL: (The tribe of) Thamud denied the messengers (of Allah)

translations.SAHIH: When their brother Ṣāliḥ said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
translations.PICKTHALL: When their brother Salih said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

translations.SAHIH: So fear Allāh and obey me.
translations.PICKTHALL: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.

translations.SAHIH: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
translations.PICKTHALL: And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.SAHIH: Will you be left in what is here, secure [from death],
translations.PICKTHALL: Will ye be left secure in that which is here before us,

translations.SAHIH: Within gardens and springs
translations.PICKTHALL: In gardens and watersprings.

translations.SAHIH: And fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit?
translations.PICKTHALL: And tilled fields and heavy-sheathed palm-trees,

translations.SAHIH: And you carve out of the mountains, homes, with skill.
translations.PICKTHALL: Though ye hew out dwellings in the mountain, being skilful?

translations.SAHIH: So fear Allāh and obey me.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor keep your duty to Allah and obey me,

translations.SAHIH: And do not obey the order of the transgressors,
translations.PICKTHALL: And obey not the command of the prodigal,

translations.SAHIH: Who cause corruption in the land and do not amend."
translations.PICKTHALL: Who spread corruption in the earth, and reform not.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Thou art but one of the bewitched;

translations.SAHIH: You are but a man like ourselves, so bring a sign, if you should be of the truthful."
translations.PICKTHALL: Thou art but a mortal like us. So bring some token if thou art of the truthful.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "This is a she-camel.1 For her is a [time of] drink, and for you is a [time of] drink, [each] on a known day.
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: (Behold) this she-camel. She hath the right to drink (at the well), and ye have the right to drink, (each) on an appointed day.

translations.SAHIH: And do not touch her with harm, lest you be seized by the punishment of a terrible day."
translations.PICKTHALL: And touch her not with ill lest there come on you the retribution of an awful day.

translations.SAHIH: But they hamstrung her and so became regretful.
translations.PICKTHALL: But they hamstrung her, and then were penitent.

translations.SAHIH: And the punishment seized them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: So the retribution came on them. Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: The people of Lot denied the messengers
translations.PICKTHALL: The folk of Lot denied the messengers (of Allah),

translations.SAHIH: When their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
translations.PICKTHALL: When their brother Lot said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

translations.SAHIH: So fear Allāh and obey me.
translations.PICKTHALL: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.

translations.SAHIH: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
translations.PICKTHALL: And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.SAHIH: Do you approach males among the worlds1
translations.PICKTHALL: What! Of all creatures do ye come unto the males,

translations.SAHIH: And leave what your Lord has created for you as mates? But you are a people transgressing."
translations.PICKTHALL: And leave the wives your Lord created for you? Nay, but ye are froward folk.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will surely be of those evicted."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: If thou cease not, O Lot, thou wilt soon be of the outcast.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "Indeed, I am, toward your deed, of those who detest [it].
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: I am in truth of those who hate your conduct.

translations.SAHIH: My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequence of] what they do."
translations.PICKTHALL: My Lord! Save me and my household from what they do.

translations.SAHIH: So We saved him and his family, all,
translations.PICKTHALL: So We saved him and his household, every one,

translations.SAHIH: Except an old woman1 among those who remained behind.
translations.PICKTHALL: Save an old woman among those who stayed behind.

translations.SAHIH: Then We destroyed the others.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then afterward We destroyed the others.

translations.SAHIH: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We rained on them a rain. And dreadful is the rain of those who have been warned.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: The companions of the thicket [i.e., the people of Madyan] denied the messengers
translations.PICKTHALL: The dwellers in the wood (of Midian) denied the messengers (of Allah),

translations.SAHIH: When Shuʿayb said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
translations.PICKTHALL: When Shu'eyb said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

translations.SAHIH: So fear Allāh and obey me.
translations.PICKTHALL: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.

translations.SAHIH: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
translations.PICKTHALL: And I ask of you no wage for it; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.SAHIH: Give full measure and do not be of those who cause loss.
translations.PICKTHALL: Give full measure, and be not of those who give less (than the due).

translations.SAHIH: And weigh with an even [i.e., honest] balance.
translations.PICKTHALL: And weigh with the true balance.

translations.SAHIH: And do not deprive people of their due and do not commit abuse on earth, spreading corruption.
translations.PICKTHALL: Wrong not mankind in their goods, and do not evil, making mischief, in the earth.

translations.SAHIH: And fear He who created you and the former creation."1
