We certainly know what We have made obligatory upon them concerning their wives and those their right hands possess, [but this is for you] in order that there will be upon you no discomfort [i.e., difficulty]. And ever is Allāh Forgiving and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: O Prophet! Lo! We have made lawful unto thee thy wives unto whom thou hast paid their dowries, and those whom thy right hand possesseth of those whom Allah hath given thee as spoils of war, and the daughters of thine uncle on the father's side and the daughters of thine aunts on the father's side, and the daughters of thine uncle on the mother's side and the daughters of thine aunts on the mother's side who emigrated with thee, and a believing woman if she give herself unto the Prophet and the Prophet desire to ask her in marriage - a privilege for thee only, not for the (rest of) believers - We are Aware of that which We enjoined upon them concerning their wives and those whom their right hands possess - that thou mayst be free from blame, for Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: You, [O Muḥammad], may put aside whom you will of them1 or take to yourself whom you will. And any that you desire of those [wives] from whom you had [temporarily] separated - there is no blame upon you [in returning her]. That is more suitable that they should be content and not grieve and that they should be satisfied with what you have given them - all of them. And Allāh knows what is in your hearts. And ever is Allāh Knowing and Forbearing.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thou canst defer whom thou wilt of them and receive unto thee whom thou wilt, and whomsoever thou desirest of those whom thou hast set aside (temporarily), it is no sin for thee (to receive her again); that is better; that they may be comforted and not grieve, and may all be pleased with what thou givest them. Allah knoweth what is in your hearts (O men), and Allah is ever Forgiving, Clement.

translations.SAHIH: Not lawful to you, [O Muḥammad], are [any additional] women after [this], nor [is it] for you to exchange them for [other] wives, even if their beauty were to please you, except what your right hand possesses. And ever is Allāh, over all things, an Observer.1
translations.PICKTHALL: It is not allowed thee to take (other) women henceforth, nor that thou shouldst change them for other wives even though their beauty pleased thee, save those whom thy right hand possesseth. And Allah is ever Watcher over all things.

translations.SAHIH: O you who have believed, do not enter the houses of the Prophet except when you are permitted for a meal, without awaiting its readiness. But when you are invited, then enter; and when you have eaten, disperse without seeking to remain for conversation. Indeed, that [behavior] was troubling the Prophet, and he is shy of [dismissing] you. But Allāh is not shy of the truth. And when you ask [his wives] for something, ask them from behind a partition. That is purer for your hearts and their hearts. And it is not [conceivable or lawful] for you to harm the Messenger of Allāh or to marry his wives after him, ever. Indeed, that would be in the sight of Allāh an enormity.
translations.PICKTHALL: O Ye who believe! Enter not the dwellings of the Prophet for a meal without waiting for the proper time, unless permission be granted you. But if ye are invited, enter, and, when your meal is ended, then disperse. Linger not for conversation. Lo! that would cause annoyance to the Prophet, and he would be shy of (asking) you (to go); but Allah is not shy of the truth. And when ye ask of them (the wives of the Prophet) anything, ask it of them from behind a curtain. That is purer for your hearts and for their hearts. And it is not for you to cause annoyance to the messenger of Allah, nor that ye should ever marry his wives after him. Lo! that in Allah's sight would be an enormity.

translations.SAHIH: Whether you reveal a thing or conceal it, indeed Allāh is ever, of all things, Knowing.
translations.PICKTHALL: Whether ye divulge a thing or keep it hidden, lo! Allah is ever Knower of all things.

translations.SAHIH: There is no blame upon them [i.e., women] concerning their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their brothers' sons or their sisters' sons or their women or those their right hands possess [i.e., slaves].1 And fear Allāh. Indeed Allāh is ever, over all things, Witness.
translations.PICKTHALL: It is no sin for them (thy wives) to converse freely) with their fathers, or their sons, or their brothers, or their brothers' sons, or the sons of their sisters or of their own women, or their slaves. O women! Keep your duty to Allah. Lo! Allah is ever Witness over all things.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, Allāh confers blessing upon the Prophet, and His angels [ask Him to do so]. O you who have believed, ask [Allāh to confer] blessing upon him and ask [Allāh to grant him] peace.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! Allah and His angels shower blessings on the Prophet. O ye who believe! Ask blessings on him and salute him with a worthy salutation.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those who abuse Allāh and His Messenger - Allāh has cursed them in this world and the Hereafter and prepared for them a humiliating punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who malign Allah and His messenger, Allah hath cursed them in the world and the Hereafter, and hath prepared for them the doom of the disdained.

translations.SAHIH: And those who harm believing men and believing women for [something] other than what they have earned [i.e., deserved] have certainly borne upon themselves a slander and manifest sin.
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who malign believing men and believing women undeservedly, they bear the guilt of slander and manifest sin.

translations.SAHIH: O Prophet, tell your wives and your daughters and the women of the believers to bring down over themselves [part] of their outer garments.1 That is more suitable that they will be known2 and not be abused. And ever is Allāh Forgiving and Merciful.3
translations.PICKTHALL: O Prophet! Tell thy wives and thy daughters and the women of the believers to draw their cloaks close round them (when they go abroad). That will be better, so that they may be recognised and not annoyed. Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is disease1 and those who spread rumors in al-Madīnah do not cease, We will surely incite you against them; then they will not remain your neighbors therein except for a little,
translations.PICKTHALL: If the hypocrites, and those in whose hearts is a disease, and the alarmists in the city do not cease, We verily shall urge thee on against them, then they will be your neighbours in it but a little while.

translations.SAHIH: Accursed wherever they are found, [being] seized and massacred completely.
translations.PICKTHALL: Accursed, they will be seized wherever found and slain with a (fierce) slaughter.

translations.SAHIH: [This is] the established way of Allāh with those who passed on before; and you will not find in the way of Allāh any change.
translations.PICKTHALL: That was the way of Allah in the case of those who passed away of old; thou wilt not find for the way of Allah aught of power to change.

translations.SAHIH: People ask you concerning the Hour. Say, "Knowledge of it is only with Allāh. And what may make you perceive? Perhaps the Hour is near."
translations.PICKTHALL: Men ask thee of the Hour. Say: The knowledge of it is with Allah only. What can convey (the knowledge) unto thee? It may be that the Hour is nigh.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, Allāh has cursed the disbelievers and prepared for them a Blaze.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! Allah hath cursed the disbelievers, and hath prepared for them a flaming fire,

translations.SAHIH: Abiding therein forever, they will not find a protector or a helper.
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherein they will abide for ever. They will find (then) no protecting friend nor helper.

translations.SAHIH: The Day their faces will be turned about in the Fire, they will say, "How we wish we had obeyed Allāh and obeyed the Messenger."
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when their faces are turned over in the Fire, they say: Oh, would that we had obeyed Allah and had obeyed His messenger!

translations.SAHIH: And they will say, "Our Lord, indeed we obeyed our masters and our dignitaries,1 and they led us astray from the [right] way.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they say: Our Lord! Lo! we obeyed our princes and great men, and they misled us from the Way.

translations.SAHIH: Our Lord, give them double the punishment and curse them with a great curse."
translations.PICKTHALL: Our Lord! Oh, give them double torment and curse them with a mighty curse.

translations.SAHIH: O you who have believed, be not like those who abused Moses; then Allāh cleared him of what they said. And he, in the sight of Allāh, was distinguished.
translations.PICKTHALL: O ye who believe! Be not as those who slandered Moses, but Allah proved his innocence of that which they alleged, and he was well esteemed in Allah's sight.

translations.SAHIH: O you who have believed, fear Allāh and speak words of appropriate justice.
translations.PICKTHALL: O ye who believe! Guard your duty to Allah, and speak words straight to the point;

translations.SAHIH: He will [then] amend for you your deeds and forgive you your sins. And whoever obeys Allāh and His Messenger has certainly attained a great attainment.
translations.PICKTHALL: He will adjust your works for you and will forgive you your sins. Whosoever obeyeth Allah and His messenger, he verily hath gained a signal victory.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We offered the Trust1 to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, and they declined to bear it and feared it; but man [undertook to] bear it. Indeed, he was unjust and ignorant.2
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We offered the trust unto the heavens and the earth and the hills, but they shrank from bearing it and were afraid of it. And man assumed it. Lo! he hath proved a tyrant and a fool.

translations.SAHIH: [It1 was] so that Allāh may punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women and the men and women who associate others with Him and that Allāh may accept repentance from the believing men and believing women. And ever is Allāh Forgiving and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: So Allah punisheth hypocritical men and hypocritical women, and idolatrous men and idolatrous women. But Allah pardoneth believing men and believing women, and Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: [All] praise is [due] to Allāh, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and to Him belongs [all] praise in the Hereafter. And He is the Wise, the Aware.
translations.PICKTHALL: Praise be to Allah, unto Whom belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth. His is the praise in the Hereafter, and He is the Wise, the Aware.

translations.SAHIH: He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein. And He is the Merciful, the Forgiving.
translations.PICKTHALL: He knoweth that which goeth into the earth and that which cometh forth from it, and that descendeth from the heaven and that which ascendeth into it. He is the Merciful, the Forgiving.

translations.SAHIH: But those who disbelieve say, "The Hour will not come to us." Say, "Yes, by my Lord, it will surely come to you. [Allāh is] the Knower of the unseen." Not absent from Him is an atom's weight1 within the heavens or within the earth or [what is] smaller than that or greater, except that it is in a clear register -
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who disbelieve say: The Hour will never come unto us. Say: Nay, by my Lord, but it is coming unto you surely. (He is) the Knower of the Unseen. Not an atom's weight, or less than that or greater, escapeth Him in the heavens or in the earth, but it is in a clear Record,

translations.SAHIH: That He may reward those who believe and do righteous deeds. Those will have forgiveness and noble provision.
translations.PICKTHALL: That He may reward those who believe and do good works. For them is pardon and a rich provision.

translations.SAHIH: But those who strive against Our verses [seeking] to cause failure1 - for them will be a painful punishment of foul nature.
translations.PICKTHALL: But those who strive against Our revelations, challenging (Us), theirs will be a painful doom of wrath.

translations.SAHIH: And those who have been given knowledge see that what is revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, and it guides to the path of the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who have been given knowledge see that what is revealed unto thee from thy Lord is the truth and leadeth unto the path of the Mighty, the Owner of Praise.

translations.SAHIH: But those who disbelieve say, "Shall we direct you to a man who will inform you [that] when you have disintegrated in complete disintegration, you will [then] be [recreated] in a new creation?
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who disbelieve say: Shall we show you a man who will tell you (that) when ye have become dispersed in dust with most complete dispersal still, even then, ye will be created anew?

translations.SAHIH: Has he invented about Allāh a lie or is there in him madness?" Rather, they who do not believe in the Hereafter will be in the punishment and [are in] extreme error.
translations.PICKTHALL: Hath he invented a lie concerning Allah, or is there in him a madness? Nay, but those who disbelieve in the Hereafter are in torment and far error.

translations.SAHIH: Then, do they not look at what is before them and what is behind them of the heaven and earth? If We should will, We could cause the earth to swallow them or [could] let fall upon them fragments from the sky. Indeed in that is a sign for every servant turning back [to Allāh].
translations.PICKTHALL: Have they not observed what is before them and what is behind them of the sky and the earth? If We will, We can make the earth swallow them, or cause obliteration from the sky to fall on them. Lo! herein surely is a portent for every slave who turneth (to Allah) repentant.

translations.SAHIH: And We certainly gave David from Us bounty. [We said], "O mountains, repeat [Our] praises with him, and the birds [as well]." And We made pliable for him iron,
translations.PICKTHALL: And assuredly We gave David grace from Us, (saying): O ye hills and birds, echo his psalms of praise! And We made the iron supple unto him,

translations.SAHIH: [Commanding him], "Make full coats of mail and calculate [precisely] the links, and work [all of you] righteousness. Indeed I, of what you do, am Seeing."
translations.PICKTHALL: Saying: Make thou long coats of mail and measure the links (thereof). And do ye right. Lo! I am Seer of what ye do.

translations.SAHIH: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind - its morning [journey was that of] a month - and its afternoon [journey was that of] a month, and We made flow for him a spring of [liquid] copper. And among the jinn were those who worked for him by the permission of his Lord. And whoever deviated among them from Our command - We will make him taste of the punishment of the Blaze.
translations.PICKTHALL: And unto Solomon (We gave) the wind, whereof the morning course was a month's journey and the evening course a month's journey, and We caused the fount of copper to gush forth for him, and (We gave him) certain of the jinn who worked before him by permission of his Lord. And such of them as deviated from Our command, them We caused to taste the punishment of flaming Fire.

translations.SAHIH: They made for him what he willed of elevated chambers,1 statues,2 bowls like reservoirs, and stationary kettles. [We said], "Work, O family of David, in gratitude." And few of My servants are grateful.
translations.PICKTHALL: They made for him what he willed: synagogues and statues, basins like wells and boilers built into the ground. Give thanks, O House of David! Few of My bondmen are thankful.

translations.SAHIH: And when We decreed for him [i.e., Solomon] death, nothing indicated to them [i.e., the jinn] his death except a creature of the earth eating his staff.1 But when he fell, it became clear to the jinn that if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in humiliating punishment.2
translations.PICKTHALL: And when We decreed death for him, nothing showed his death to them save a creeping creature of the earth which gnawed away his staff. And when he fell the jinn saw clearly how, if they had known the Unseen, they would not have continued in despised toil.

translations.SAHIH: There was for [the tribe of] Saba’ in their dwelling place a sign: two [fields of] gardens on the right and on the left. [They were told], "Eat from the provisions of your Lord and be grateful to Him. A good land [have you], and a forgiving Lord."
translations.PICKTHALL: There was indeed a sign for Sheba in their dwelling-place: Two gardens on the right hand and the left (as who should say): Eat of the provision of your Lord and render thanks to Him. A fair land and an indulgent Lord!

translations.SAHIH: But they turned away [refusing], so We sent upon them the flood of the dam,1 and We replaced their two [fields of] gardens with gardens of bitter fruit, tamarisks and something of sparse lote trees.
translations.PICKTHALL: But they were froward, so We sent on them the flood of 'Iram, and in exchange for their two gardens gave them two gardens bearing bitter fruit, the tamarisk and here and there a lote-tree.

translations.SAHIH: [By] that We repaid them because they disbelieved. And do We [thus] repay except the ungrateful?
translations.PICKTHALL: This We awarded them because of their ingratitude. Punish We ever any save the ingrates?

translations.SAHIH: And We placed between them and the cities which We had blessed1 [many] visible cities. And We determined between them the [distances of] journey,2 [saying], "Travel between them by night or by day in safety."
translations.PICKTHALL: And We set, between them and the towns which We had blessed, towns easy to be seen, and We made the stage between them easy, (saying): Travel in them safely both by night and day.

translations.SAHIH: But [insolently] they said, "Our Lord, lengthen the distance between our journeys," and wronged themselves, so We made them narrations1 and dispersed them in total dispersion. Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.
translations.PICKTHALL: But they said: Our Lord! Make the stage between our journeys longer. And they wronged themselves, therefore We made them bywords (in the land) and scattered them abroad, a total scattering. Lo! herein verily are portents for each steadfast, grateful (heart).

translations.SAHIH: And Iblees had already confirmed through them1 his assumption,2 so they followed him, except for a party of believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Satan indeed found his calculation true concerning them, for they follow him, all save a group of true believers.

translations.SAHIH: And he had over them no authority except [it was decreed] that We might make evident who believes in the Hereafter from who is thereof in doubt. And your Lord, over all things, is Guardian.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And he had no warrant whatsoever against them, save that We would know him who believeth in the Hereafter from him who is in doubt thereof; and thy Lord (O Muhammad) taketh note of all things.

translations.SAHIH: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Invoke those you claim [as deities] besides Allāh." They do not possess an atom's weight [of ability] in the heavens or on the earth, and they do not have therein any partnership [with Him], nor is there for Him from among them any assistant.
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (O Muhammad): Call upon those whom ye set up beside Allah! They possess not an atom's weight either in the heavens or in the earth, nor have they any share in either, nor hath He an auxiliary among them.

translations.SAHIH: And intercession does not benefit with Him except for one whom He permits. [And those wait] until, when terror is removed from their hearts,1 they will say [to one another], "What has your Lord said?" They will say, "The truth." And He is the Most High, the Grand.
translations.PICKTHALL: No intercession availeth with Him save for him whom He permitteth. Yet, when fear is banished from their hearts, they say: What was it that your Lord said? They say: The Truth. And He is the Sublime, the Great.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Who provides for you from the heavens and the earth?" Say, "Allāh. And indeed, we or you are either upon guidance or in clear error."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Who giveth you provision from the sky and the earth? Say: Allah, Lo! we or you assuredly are rightly guided or in error manifest.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "You will not be asked about what we committed, and we will not be asked about what you do."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Ye will not be asked of what we committed, nor shall we be asked of what ye do.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Our Lord will bring us together; then He will judge between us in truth. And He is the Knowing Judge."1
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Our Lord will bring us all together, then He will judge between us with truth. He is the All-knowing Judge.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Show me those whom you have attached to Him as partners. No! Rather, He [alone] is Allāh, the Exalted in Might, the Wise."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Show me those whom ye have joined unto Him as partners. Nay (ye dare not)! For He is Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.

translations.SAHIH: And We have not sent you except comprehensively1 to mankind as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. But most of the people do not know.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We have not sent thee (O Muhammad) save as a bringer of good tidings and a warner unto all mankind; but most of mankind know not.

translations.SAHIH: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And they say: When is this promise (to be fulfilled) if ye are truthful?

translations.SAHIH: Say, "For you is the appointment of a Day [when] you will not remain thereafter an hour, nor will you precede [it]."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (O Muhammad): Yours is the promise of a Day which ye cannot postpone nor hasten by an hour.

translations.SAHIH: And those who disbelieve say, "We will never believe in this Qur’ān nor in that before it." But if you could see when the wrongdoers are made to stand before their Lord, refuting each others' words...1 Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "If not for you, we would have been believers."
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who disbelieve say: We believe not in this Qur'an nor in that which was before it; but oh, if thou couldst see, when the wrong-doers are brought up before their Lord, how they cast the blame one to another; how those who were despised (in the earth) say unto those who were proud: But for you, we should have been believers.

translations.SAHIH: Those who were arrogant will say to those who were oppressed, "Did we avert you from guidance after it had come to you? Rather, you were criminals."
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who were proud say unto those who were despised: Did we drive you away from the guidance after it had come unto you? Nay, but ye were guilty.

translations.SAHIH: Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "Rather, [it was your] conspiracy of night and day when you were ordering us to disbelieve in Allāh and attribute to Him equals." But they will [all] confide regret when they see the punishment; and We will put shackles on the necks of those who disbelieved. Will they be recompensed except for what they used to do?
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who were despised say unto those who were proud: Nay but (it was your) scheming night and day, when ye commanded us to disbelieve in Allah and set up rivals unto Him. And they are filled with remorse when they behold the doom; and We place carcans on the necks of those who disbelieved. Are they requited aught save what they used to do?

translations.SAHIH: And We did not send into a city any warner except that its affluent said, "Indeed we, in that with which you were sent, are disbelievers."
translations.PICKTHALL: And We sent not unto any township a warner, but its pampered ones declared: Lo! we are disbelievers in that wherewith ye have been sent.

translations.SAHIH: And they1 said, "We are more [than the believers] in wealth and children, and we are not to be punished."
translations.PICKTHALL: And they say: We are more (than you) in wealth and children. We are not the punished!

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Indeed, my Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it], but most of the people do not know."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (O Muhammad): Lo! my Lord enlargeth the provision for whom He will and narroweth it (for whom He will). But most of mankind know not.

translations.SAHIH: And it is not your wealth or your children that bring you nearer to Us in position, but it is [by being] one who has believed and done righteousness. For them there will be the double reward for what they did, and they will be in the upper chambers [of Paradise], safe [and secure].
translations.PICKTHALL: And it is not your wealth nor your children that will bring you near unto Us, but he who believeth and doeth good (he draweth near). As for such, theirs will be twofold reward for what they did and they will dwell secure in lofty halls.

translations.SAHIH: And the ones who strive against Our verses to cause [them] failure1 - those will be brought into the punishment [to remain].
translations.PICKTHALL: And as for those who strive against Our revelations, challenging, they will be brought to the doom.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Indeed, my Lord extends provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts [it] for him. But whatever thing you spend [in His cause] - He will compensate it; and He is the best of providers."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Lo! my Lord enlargeth the provision for whom He will of His bondmen, and narroweth (it) for him. And whatsoever ye spend (for good) He replaceth it. And He is the Best of Providers.

translations.SAHIH: And [mention] the Day when He will gather them all and then say to the angels, "Did these [people] used to worship you?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And on the day when He will gather them all together, He will say unto the angels: Did these worship you?

translations.SAHIH: They will say, "Exalted are You! You, [O Allāh], are our benefactor excluding [i.e., not] them. Rather, they used to worship the jinn; most of them were believers in them."
translations.PICKTHALL: They will say: Be Thou Glorified. Thou (alone) art our Guardian, not them! Nay, but they worshipped the jinn; most of them were believers in them.

translations.SAHIH: But today [i.e., the Day of Judgement] you do not hold for one another [the power of] benefit or harm, and We will say to those who wronged, "Taste the punishment of the Fire, which you used to deny."
translations.PICKTHALL: That day ye will possess no use nor hurt one for another. And We shall say unto those who did wrong: Taste the doom of the Fire which ye used to deny.

translations.SAHIH: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, they say, "This is not but a man who wishes to avert you from that which your fathers were worshipping." And they say, "This is not except a lie invented." And those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them, "This is not but obvious magic."
translations.PICKTHALL: And if Our revelations are recited unto them in plain terms, they say: This is naught else than a man who would turn you away from what your fathers used to worship; and they say: This is naught else than an invented lie. Those who disbelieve say of the truth when it reacheth them: This is naught else than mere magic.

translations.SAHIH: And We had not given them any scriptures which they could study, and We had not sent to them before you, [O Muḥammad], any warner.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We have given them no scriptures which they study, nor sent We unto them, before thee, any warner.

translations.SAHIH: And those before them denied, and they [i.e., the people of Makkah] have not attained a tenth of what We had given them. But they [i.e., the former peoples] denied My messengers, so how [terrible] was My reproach.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those before them denied, and these have not attained a tithe of that which We bestowed on them (of old); yet they denied My messengers. How intense then was My abhorrence (of them)!

translations.SAHIH: Say, "I only advise you of one [thing] - that you stand for Allāh, [seeking truth] in pairs and individually, and then give thought." There is not in your companion any madness. He is only a warner to you before a severe punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): I exhort you unto one thing only: that ye awake, for Allah's sake, by twos and singly, and then reflect: There is no madness in your comrade. He is naught else than a warner unto you in face of a terrific doom.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Whatever payment I might have asked of you - it is yours. My payment is only from Allāh, and He is, over all things, Witness."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Whatever reward I might have asked of you is yours. My reward is the affair of Allah only. He is Witness over all things.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Indeed, my Lord projects the truth, Knower of the unseen."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Lo! my Lord hurleth the truth. (He is) the Knower of Things Hidden.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "The truth has come, and falsehood can neither begin [anything] nor repeat [it]."1
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: The Truth hath come, and falsehood showeth not its face and will not return.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "If I should err, I would only err against myself. But if I am guided, it is by what my Lord reveals to me. Indeed, He is Hearing and near."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: If I err, I err only to my own loss, and if I am rightly guided it is because of that which my Lord hath revealed unto me. Lo! He is Hearer, Nigh.

translations.SAHIH: And if you could see1 when they are terrified but there is no escape, and they will be seized from a place nearby.
translations.PICKTHALL: Couldst thou but see when they are terrified with no escape, and are seized from near at hand,

translations.SAHIH: And they will [then] say, "We believe in it!" But how for them will be the taking1 [of faith] from a place far away?2
translations.PICKTHALL: And say: We (now) believe therein. But how can they reach (faith) from afar off,

translations.SAHIH: And they had already disbelieved in it before and would assault1 the unseen from a place far away.2
translations.PICKTHALL: When they disbelieved in it of yore. They aim at the unseen from afar off.

translations.SAHIH: And prevention will be placed between them and what they desire,1 as was done with their kind before. Indeed, they were in disquieting doubt [i.e., denial].
translations.PICKTHALL: And a gulf is set between them and that which they desire, as was done for people of their kind of old. Lo! they were in hopeless doubt.

translations.SAHIH: [All] praise is [due] to Allāh, Creator of the heavens and the earth, [who] made the angels messengers having wings, two or three or four. He increases in creation what He wills. Indeed, Allāh is over all things competent.
translations.PICKTHALL: Praise be to Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth, Who appointeth the angels messengers having wings two, three and four. He multiplieth in creation what He will. Lo! Allah is Able to do all things.

translations.SAHIH: Whatever Allāh grants to people of mercy - none can withhold it; and whatever He withholds - none can release it thereafter. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
translations.PICKTHALL: That which Allah openeth unto mankind of mercy none can withhold it; and that which He withholdeth none can release thereafter. He is the Mighty, the Wise.

translations.SAHIH: O mankind, remember the favor of Allāh upon you. Is there any creator other than Allāh who provides for you from the heaven and earth? There is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded?
translations.PICKTHALL: O mankind! Remember Allah's grace toward you! Is there any creator other than Allah who provideth for you from the sky and the earth? There is no Allah save Him. Whither then are ye turned?

translations.SAHIH: And if they deny you, [O Muḥammad] - already were messengers denied before you. And to Allāh are returned [all] matters.
translations.PICKTHALL: And if they deny thee, (O Muhammad), messengers (of Allah) were denied before thee. Unto Allah all things are brought back.

translations.SAHIH: O mankind, indeed the promise of Allāh is truth, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about Allāh by the Deceiver [i.e., Satan].
translations.PICKTHALL: O mankind! Lo! the promise of Allah is true. So let not the life of the world beguile you, and let not the (avowed) beguiler beguile you with regard to Allah.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, Satan is an enemy to you; so take him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be among the companions of the Blaze.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! the devil is an enemy for you, so treat him as an enemy. He only summoneth his faction to be owners of the flaming Fire.

translations.SAHIH: Those who disbelieve will have a severe punishment, and those who believe and do righteous deeds will have forgiveness and great reward.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who disbelieve, theirs will be an awful doom; and those who believe and do good works, theirs will be forgiveness and a great reward.

translations.SAHIH: Then is one to whom the evil of his deed has been made attractive so he considers it good [like one rightly guided]? For indeed, Allāh sends astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. So do not let yourself perish over them in regret. Indeed, Allāh is Knowing of what they do.
translations.PICKTHALL: Is he, the evil of whose deeds is made fairseeming unto him so that he deemeth it good, (other than Satan's dupe)? Allah verily sendeth whom He will astray, and guideth whom He will; so let not thy soul expire in sighings for them. Lo! Allah is Aware of what they do!

translations.SAHIH: And it is Allāh who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds, and We drive them to a dead land and give life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Thus is the resurrection.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Allah it is Who sendeth the winds and they raise a cloud; then We lead it unto a dead land and revive therewith the earth after its death. Such is the Resurrection.

translations.SAHIH: Whoever desires honor [through power] - then to Allāh belongs all honor.1 To Him ascends good speech, and righteous work raises it.2 But they who plot evil deeds will have a severe punishment, and the plotting of those - it will perish.
translations.PICKTHALL: Whoso desireth power (should know that) all power belongeth to Allah. Unto Him good words ascend, and the pious deed doth He exalt; but those who plot iniquities, theirs will be an awful doom; and the plotting of such (folk) will come to naught.

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop; then He made you mates. And no female conceives nor does she give birth except with His knowledge. And no aged person is granted [additional] life nor is his lifespan lessened but that it is in a register. Indeed, that for Allāh is easy.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah created you from dust, then from a little fluid, then He made you pairs (the male and female). No female beareth or bringeth forth save with His knowledge. And no-one groweth old who groweth old, nor is aught lessened of his life, but it is recorded in a Book, Lo! that is easy for Allah.

translations.SAHIH: And not alike are the two seas [i.e., bodies of water]. One is fresh and sweet, palatable for drinking, and one is salty and bitter. And from each you eat tender meat and extract ornaments which you wear, and you see the ships plowing through [them] that you might seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the two seas are not alike: this, fresh, sweet, good to drink, this (other) bitter, salt. And from them both ye eat fresh meat and derive the ornament that ye wear. And thou seest the ship cleaving them with its prow that ye may seek of His bounty, and that haply ye may give thanks.

translations.SAHIH: He causes the night to enter the day, and He causes the day to enter the night and has subjected the sun and the moon - each running [its course] for a specified term. That is Allāh, your Lord; to Him belongs sovereignty. And those whom you invoke other than Him do not possess [as much as] the membrane of a date seed.
translations.PICKTHALL: He maketh the night to pass into the day and He maketh the day to pass into the night. He hath subdued the sun and moon to service. Each runneth unto an appointed term. Such is Allah, your Lord; His is the Sovereignty; and those unto whom ye pray instead of Him own not so much as the white spot on a date-stone.

translations.SAHIH: If you invoke them, they do not hear your supplication; and if they heard, they would not respond to you. And on the Day of Resurrection they will deny your association.1 And none can inform you like [one] Aware [of all matters].
translations.PICKTHALL: If ye pray unto them they hear not your prayer, and if they heard they could not grant it you. On the Day of Resurrection they will disown association with you. None can inform you like Him Who is Aware.

translations.SAHIH: O mankind, you are those in need of Allāh, while Allāh is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
translations.PICKTHALL: O mankind! Ye are the poor in your relation to Allah. And Allah! He is the Absolute, the Owner of Praise.

translations.SAHIH: If He wills, He can do away with you and bring forth a new creation.
translations.PICKTHALL: If He will, He can be rid of you and bring (instead of you) some new creation.

translations.SAHIH: And that is for Allāh not difficult.
translations.PICKTHALL: That is not a hard thing for Allah.

translations.SAHIH: And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And if a heavily laden soul calls [another] to [carry some of] its load, nothing of it will be carried, even if he should be a close relative. You can only warn those who fear their Lord unseen and have established prayer. And whoever purifies himself only purifies himself for [the benefit of] his soul. And to Allāh is the [final] destination.
translations.PICKTHALL: And no burdened soul can bear another's burden, and if one heavy laden crieth for (help with) his load, naught of it will be lifted even though he (unto whom he crieth) be of kin. Thou warnest only those who fear their Lord in secret, and have established worship. He who groweth (in goodness), groweth only for himself, (he cannot by his merit redeem others). Unto Allah is the journeying.

translations.SAHIH: Not equal are the blind and the seeing,
translations.PICKTHALL: The blind man is not equal with the seer;

translations.SAHIH: Nor are the darknesses and the light,
translations.PICKTHALL: Nor is darkness (tantamount to) light;

translations.SAHIH: Nor are the shade and the heat,1
translations.PICKTHALL: Nor is the shadow equal with the sun's full heat;

translations.SAHIH: And not equal are the living and the dead. Indeed, Allāh causes to hear whom He wills, but you cannot make hear those in the graves.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Nor are the living equal with the dead. Lo! Allah maketh whom He will to hear. Thou canst not reach those who are in the graves.

translations.SAHIH: You, [O Muḥammad], are not but a warner.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thou art but a warner.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We have sent you with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And there was no nation but that there had passed within it a warner.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We have sent thee with the Truth, a bearer of glad tidings and a warner; and there is not a nation but a warner hath passed among them.

translations.SAHIH: And if they deny you - then already have those before them denied. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs and written ordinances and with the enlightening Scripture.
translations.PICKTHALL: And if they deny thee, those before them also denied. Their messengers came unto them with clear proofs (of Allah's Sovereignty), and with the Psalms and the Scripture giving light.

translations.SAHIH: Then I seized the ones who disbelieved, and how [terrible] was My reproach.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then seized I those who disbelieved, and how intense was My abhorrence!

translations.SAHIH: Do you not see that Allāh sends down rain from the sky, and We produce thereby fruits of varying colors? And in the mountains are tracts, white and red of varying shades and [some] extremely black.
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou not seen that Allah causeth water to fall from the sky, and We produce therewith fruit of divers hues; and among the hills are streaks white and red, of divers hues, and (others) raven-black;

translations.SAHIH: And among people and moving creatures and grazing livestock are various colors similarly. Only those fear Allāh, from among His servants, who have knowledge. Indeed, Allāh is Exalted in Might and Forgiving.
translations.PICKTHALL: And of men and beasts and cattle, in like manner, divers hues? The erudite among His bondmen fear Allah alone. Lo! Allah is Mighty, Forgiving.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those who recite the Book of Allāh and establish prayer and spend [in His cause] out of what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, [can] expect a transaction [i.e., profit] that will never perish -
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who read the Scripture of Allah, and establish worship, and spend of that which We have bestowed on them secretly and openly, they look forward to imperishable gain,

translations.SAHIH: That He may give them in full their rewards and increase for them of His bounty. Indeed, He is Forgiving and Appreciative.1
translations.PICKTHALL: That He will pay them their wages and increase them of His grace. Lo! He is Forgiving, Responsive.

translations.SAHIH: And that which We have revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], of the Book is the truth, confirming what was before it. Indeed Allāh, of His servants, is Aware and Seeing.
translations.PICKTHALL: As for that which We inspire in thee of the Scripture, it is the Truth confirming that which was (revealed) before it. Lo! Allah is indeed Observer, Seer of His slaves.

translations.SAHIH: Then We caused to inherit the Book those We have chosen of Our servants;1 and among them is he who wrongs himself [i.e., sins], and among them is he who is moderate, and among them is he who is foremost in good deeds by permission of Allāh. That [inheritance] is what is the great bounty.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We gave the Scripture as inheritance unto those whom We elected of Our bondmen. But of them are some who wrong themselves and of them are some who are lukewarm, and of them are some who outstrip (others) through good deeds, by Allah's leave. That is the great favour!

translations.SAHIH: [For them are] gardens of perpetual residence which they will enter. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be silk.
translations.PICKTHALL: Gardens of Eden! They enter them wearing armlets of gold and pearl and their raiment therein is silk.

translations.SAHIH: And they will say, "Praise to Allāh, who has removed from us [all] sorrow. Indeed, our Lord is Forgiving and Appreciative -
translations.PICKTHALL: And they say: Praise be to Allah Who hath put grief away from us. Lo! Our Lord is Forgiving, Bountiful,

translations.SAHIH: He who has settled us in the home of duration [i.e., Paradise] out of His bounty. There touches us not in it any fatigue, and there touches us not in it weariness [of mind]."
translations.PICKTHALL: Who, of His grace, hath installed us in the mansion of eternity, where toil toucheth us not nor can weariness affect us.

translations.SAHIH: And for those who disbelieve will be the fire of Hell. [Death] is not decreed for them1 so they may die, nor will its torment be lightened for them. Thus do We recompense every ungrateful one.
translations.PICKTHALL: But as for those who disbelieve, for them is fire of hell; it taketh not complete effect upon them so that they can die, nor is its torment lightened for them. Thus We punish every ingrate.

translations.SAHIH: And they will cry out therein, "Our Lord, remove us;1 we will do righteousness - other than what we were doing!" But did We not grant you life enough for whoever would remember therein to remember, and the warner had come to you? So taste [the punishment], for there is not for the wrongdoers any helper.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they cry for help there, (saying): Our Lord! Release us; we will do right, not (the wrong) that we used to do. Did not We grant you a life long enough for him who reflected to reflect therein? And the warner came unto you. Now taste (the flavour of your deeds), for evil-doers have no helper.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, Allāh is Knower of the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and earth. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! Allah is the Knower of the Unseen of the heavens and the earth. Lo! He is Aware of the secret of (men's) breasts.

translations.SAHIH: It is He who has made you successors upon the earth. And whoever disbelieves - upon him will be [the consequence of] his disbelief. And the disbelief of the disbelievers does not increase them in the sight of their Lord except in hatred; and the disbelief of the disbelievers does not increase them except in loss.
translations.PICKTHALL: He it is Who hath made you regents in the earth; so he who disbelieveth, his disbelief be on his own head. Their disbelief increaseth for the disbelievers, in their Lord's sight, naught save abhorrence. Their disbelief increaseth for the disbelievers naught save loss.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Have you considered1 your 'partners' whom you invoke besides Allāh? Show me what they have created from the earth, or have they partnership [with Him] in the heavens? Or have We given them a book so they are [standing] on evidence therefrom? [No], rather, the wrongdoers do not promise each other except delusion."2
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Have ye seen your partner-gods to whom ye pray beside Allah? Show me what they created of the earth! Or have they any portion in the heavens? Or have We given them a scripture so they act on clear proof therefrom? Nay, the evil-doers promise one another only to deceive.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, Allāh holds the heavens and the earth, lest they cease. And if they should cease, no one could hold them [in place] after Him. Indeed, He is Forbearing1 and Forgiving.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! Allah graspeth the heavens and the earth that they deviate not, and if they were to deviate there is not one that could grasp them after Him. Lo! He is ever Clement, Forgiving.

translations.SAHIH: And they swore by Allāh their strongest oaths that if a warner came to them, they would be more guided than [any] one of the [previous] nations. But when a warner came to them, it did not increase them except in aversion
translations.PICKTHALL: And they swore by Allah, their most binding oath, that if a warner came unto them they would be more tractable than any of the nations; yet, when a warner came unto them it aroused in them naught save repugnance,

translations.SAHIH: [Due to] arrogance in the land and plotting of evil; but the evil plot does not encompass except its own people. Then do they await except the way [i.e., fate] of the former peoples? But you will never find in the way [i.e., established method] of Allāh any change, and you will never find in the way of Allāh1 any alteration.2
translations.PICKTHALL: (Shown in their) behaving arrogantly in the land and plotting evil; and the evil plot encloseth but the men who make it. Then, can they expect aught save the treatment of the folk of old? Thou wilt not find for Allah's way of treatment any substitute, nor wilt thou find for Allah's way of treatment aught of power to change.

translations.SAHIH: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? And they were greater than them in power. But Allāh is not to be caused failure [i.e., prevented] by anything in the heavens or on the earth. Indeed, He is ever Knowing and Competent.
translations.PICKTHALL: Have they not travelled in the land and seen the nature of the consequence for those who were before them, and they were mightier than these in power? Allah is not such that aught in the heavens or in the earth escapeth Him. Lo! He is the Wise, the Mighty.

translations.SAHIH: And if Allāh were to impose blame on the people for what they have earned, He would not leave upon it [i.e., the earth] any creature. But He defers them for a specified term. And when their time comes, then indeed Allāh has ever been, of His servants, Seeing.
translations.PICKTHALL: If Allah took mankind to task by that which they deserve, He would not leave a living creature on the surface of the earth; but He reprieveth them unto an appointed term, and when their term cometh - then verily (they will know that) Allah is ever Seer of His slaves.

translations.SAHIH: Yā, Seen.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Ya Sin.

translations.SAHIH: By the wise1 Qur’ān,
translations.PICKTHALL: By the wise Qur'an,

translations.SAHIH: Indeed you, [O Muḥammad], are from among the messengers,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! thou art of those sent

translations.SAHIH: On a straight path.
translations.PICKTHALL: On a straight path,

translations.SAHIH: [This is] a revelation of the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,
translations.PICKTHALL: A revelation of the Mighty, the Merciful,

translations.SAHIH: That you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, so they are unaware.
translations.PICKTHALL: That thou mayst warn a folk whose fathers were not warned, so they are heedless.

translations.SAHIH: Already the word [i.e., decree] has come into effect upon most of them, so they do not believe.
translations.PICKTHALL: Already hath the judgment, (for their infidelity) proved true of most of them, for they believe not.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We have put shackles on their necks, and they are to their chins, so they are with heads [kept] aloft.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We have put on their necks carcans reaching unto the chins, so that they are made stiff-necked.

translations.SAHIH: And We have put before them a barrier and behind them a barrier and covered them, so they do not see.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We have set a bar before them and a bar behind them, and (thus) have covered them so that they see not.

translations.SAHIH: And it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not believe.
translations.PICKTHALL: Whether thou warn them or thou warn them not, it is alike for them, for they believe not.

translations.SAHIH: You can only warn one who follows the message and fears the Most Merciful unseen. So give him good tidings of forgiveness and noble reward.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thou warnest only him who followeth the Reminder and feareth the Beneficent in secret. To him bear tidings of forgiveness and a rich reward.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it is We who bring the dead to life and record what they have put forth and what they left behind, and all things We have enumerated in a clear register.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We it is Who bring the dead to life. We record that which they send before (them, and their footprints. And all things We have kept in a clear Register.

translations.SAHIH: And present to them an example: the people of the city, when the messengers came to it -
translations.PICKTHALL: Coin for them a similitude: The people of the city when those sent (from Allah) came unto them;

translations.SAHIH: When We sent to them two but they denied them, so We strengthened [them] with a third, and they said, "Indeed, we are messengers to you."
translations.PICKTHALL: When We sent unto them twain, and they denied them both, so We reinforced them with a third, and they said: Lo! we have been sent unto you.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "You are not but human beings like us, and the Most Merciful has not revealed a thing. You are only telling lies."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Ye are but mortals like unto us. The Beneficent hath naught revealed. Ye do but lie!

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Our Lord knows that we are messengers to you,
translations.PICKTHALL: They answered: Our Lord knoweth that we are indeed sent unto you,

translations.SAHIH: And we are not responsible except for clear notification."
translations.PICKTHALL: And our duty is but plain conveyance (of the message).

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Indeed, we consider you a bad omen. If you do not desist, we will surely stone you, and there will surely touch you, from us, a painful punishment."
translations.PICKTHALL: (The people of the city) said: We augur ill of you. If ye desist not, we shall surely stone you, and grievous torture will befall you at our hands.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Your omen [i.e., fate] is with yourselves. Is it1 because you were reminded? Rather, you are a transgressing people."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Your evil augury be with you! Is it because ye are reminded (of the truth)? Nay, but ye are froward folk!

translations.SAHIH: And there came from the farthest end of the city a man, running. He said, "O my people, follow the messengers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And there came from the uttermost part of the city a man running. He cried: O my people! Follow those who have been sent!

translations.SAHIH: Follow those who do not ask of you [any] payment, and they are [rightly] guided.
translations.PICKTHALL: Follow those who ask of you no fee, and who are rightly guided.

translations.SAHIH: And why should I not worship He who created me and to whom you will be returned?
translations.PICKTHALL: For what cause should I not serve Him Who hath created me, and unto Whom ye will be brought back?

translations.SAHIH: Should I take other than Him [false] deities [while], if the Most Merciful intends for me some adversity, their intercession will not avail me at all, nor can they save me?
translations.PICKTHALL: Shall I take (other) gods in place of Him when, if the Beneficent should wish me any harm, their intercession will avail me naught, nor can they save?

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, I would then be in manifest error.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then truly I should be in error manifest.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, I have believed in your Lord, so listen to me."
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! I have believed in your Lord, so hear me!

translations.SAHIH: It was said, "Enter Paradise."1 He said, "I wish my people could know
translations.PICKTHALL: It was said (unto him): Enter paradise. He said: Would that my people knew

translations.SAHIH: Of how my Lord has forgiven me and placed me among the honored."
translations.PICKTHALL: With what (munificence) my Lord hath pardoned me and made me of the honoured ones!

translations.SAHIH: And We did not send down upon his people after him any soldiers from the heaven, nor would We have done so.
translations.PICKTHALL: We sent not down against his people after him a host from heaven, nor do We ever send.

translations.SAHIH: It was not but one shout,1 and immediately they were extinguished.
translations.PICKTHALL: It was but one Shout, and lo! they were extinct.

translations.SAHIH: How regretful for the servants. There did not come to them any messenger except that they used to ridicule him.
translations.PICKTHALL: Ah, the anguish for the bondmen! Never came there unto them a messenger but they did mock him!

translations.SAHIH: Have they not considered how many generations We destroyed before them - that they to them1 will not return?
translations.PICKTHALL: Have they not seen how many generations We destroyed before them, which indeed returned not unto them;

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, all of them will yet be brought present before Us.
translations.PICKTHALL: But all, without exception, will be brought before Us.

translations.SAHIH: And a sign for them is the dead earth. We have brought it to life and brought forth from it grain, and from it they eat.
translations.PICKTHALL: A token unto them is the dead earth. We revive it, and We bring forth from it grain so that they eat thereof;

translations.SAHIH: And We placed therein gardens of palm trees and grapevines and caused to burst forth therefrom some springs -
translations.PICKTHALL: And We have placed therein gardens of the date-palm and grapes, and We have caused springs of water to gush forth therein,

translations.SAHIH: That they may eat of His fruit.1 And their hands have not produced it,2 so will they not be grateful?
translations.PICKTHALL: That they may eat of the fruit thereof, and their hands made it not. Will they not, then, give thanks?

translations.SAHIH: Exalted is He who created all pairs1 - from what the earth grows and from themselves and from that which they do not know.
translations.PICKTHALL: Glory be to Him Who created all the sexual pairs, of that which the earth groweth, and of themselves, and of that which they know not!

translations.SAHIH: And a sign for them is the night. We remove1 from it the [light of] day, so they are [left] in darkness.
translations.PICKTHALL: A token unto them is night. We strip it of the day, and lo! they are in darkness.

translations.SAHIH: And the sun runs [on course] toward its stopping point. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the sun runneth on unto a resting-place for him. That is the measuring of the Mighty, the Wise.

translations.SAHIH: And the moon - We have determined for it phases, until it returns [appearing] like the old date stalk.
translations.PICKTHALL: And for the moon We have appointed mansions till she return like an old shrivelled palm-leaf.

translations.SAHIH: It is not allowable [i.e., possible] for the sun to reach the moon, nor does the night overtake the day, but each, in an orbit, is swimming.
translations.PICKTHALL: It is not for the sun to overtake the moon, nor doth the night outstrip the day. They float each in an orbit.

translations.SAHIH: And a sign for them is that We carried their forefathers1 in a laden ship.
translations.PICKTHALL: And a token unto them is that We bear their offspring in the laden ship,

translations.SAHIH: And We created for them from the likes of it that which they ride.
translations.PICKTHALL: And have created for them of the like thereof whereon they ride.

translations.SAHIH: And if We should will, We could drown them; then no one responding to a cry would there be for them, nor would they be saved
translations.PICKTHALL: And if We will, We drown them, and there is no help for them, neither can they be saved;

translations.SAHIH: Except as a mercy from Us and provision for a time.
translations.PICKTHALL: Unless by mercy from Us and as comfort for a while.

translations.SAHIH: But when it is said to them, "Beware of what is before you and what is behind you;1 perhaps you will receive mercy..."2
translations.PICKTHALL: When it is said unto them: Beware of that which is before you and that which is behind you, that haply ye may find mercy (they are heedless).

translations.SAHIH: And no sign comes to them from the signs of their Lord except that they are from it turning away.
translations.PICKTHALL: Never came a token of the tokens of their Lord to them, but they did turn away from it!

translations.SAHIH: And when it is said to them, "Spend from that which Allāh has provided for you," those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Should we feed one whom, if Allāh had willed, He would have fed? You are not but in clear error."
translations.PICKTHALL: And when it is said unto them: Spend of that wherewith Allah hath provided you, those who disbelieve say unto those who believe: Shall we feed those whom Allah, if He willed, would feed? Ye are in naught else than error manifest.

translations.SAHIH: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And they say: When will this promise be fulfilled, if ye are truthful?

translations.SAHIH: They do not await except one blast1 which will seize them while they are disputing.
translations.PICKTHALL: They await but one Shout, which will surprise them while they are disputing.

translations.SAHIH: And they will not be able [to give] any instruction, nor to their people can they return.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then they cannot make bequest, nor can they return to their own folk.

translations.SAHIH: And the Horn will be blown;1 and at once from the graves to their Lord they will hasten.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the trumpet is blown and lo! from the graves they hie unto their Lord,

translations.SAHIH: They will say, "O woe to us! Who has raised us up from our sleeping place?" [The reply will be], "This is what the Most Merciful had promised, and the messengers told the truth."
translations.PICKTHALL: Crying: Woe upon us! Who hath raised us from our place of sleep? This is that which the Beneficent did promise, and the messengers spoke truth.

translations.SAHIH: It will not be but one blast, and at once they are all brought present before Us.
translations.PICKTHALL: It is but one Shout, and behold them brought together before Us!

translations.SAHIH: So today [i.e., the Day of Judgement] no soul will be wronged at all, and you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do.
translations.PICKTHALL: This day no soul is wronged in aught; nor are ye requited aught save what ye used to do.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed the companions of Paradise, that Day, will be amused in [joyful] occupation -
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who merit paradise this day are happily employed,

translations.SAHIH: They and their spouses - in shade, reclining on adorned couches.
translations.PICKTHALL: They and their wives, in pleasant shade, on thrones reclining;

translations.SAHIH: For them therein is fruit, and for them is whatever they request [or wish]
translations.PICKTHALL: Theirs the fruit (of their good deeds) and theirs (all) that they ask;

translations.SAHIH: [And] "Peace," a word from a Merciful Lord.
translations.PICKTHALL: The word from a Merciful Lord (for them) is: Peace!

translations.SAHIH: [Then He will say], "But stand apart today, you criminals.1
translations.PICKTHALL: But avaunt ye, O ye guilty, this day!

translations.SAHIH: Did I not enjoin upon you, O children of Adam, that you not worship Satan - [for] indeed, he is to you a clear enemy -
translations.PICKTHALL: Did I not charge you, O ye sons of Adam, that ye worship not the devil - Lo! he is your open foe! -

translations.SAHIH: And that you worship [only] Me? This is a straight path.
translations.PICKTHALL: But that ye worship Me? That was the right path.

translations.SAHIH: And he had already led astray from among you much of creation, so did you not use reason?
translations.PICKTHALL: Yet he hath led astray of you a great multitude. Had ye then no sense?

translations.SAHIH: This is the Hellfire which you were promised.
translations.PICKTHALL: This is hell which ye were promised (if ye followed him).

translations.SAHIH: [Enter to] burn therein today for what you used to deny."1
translations.PICKTHALL: Burn therein this day for that ye disbelieved.

translations.SAHIH: That Day, We will seal over their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify about what they used to earn.
translations.PICKTHALL: This day We seal up their mouths, and their hands speak out to Us and their feet bear witness as to what they used to earn.

translations.SAHIH: And if We willed, We could have obliterated their eyes, and they would race to [find] the path, and how could they see?1
translations.PICKTHALL: And had We willed, We verily could have quenched their eyesight so that they should struggle for the way. Then how could they have seen?

translations.SAHIH: And if We willed, We could have deformed them, [paralyzing them] in their places so they would not be able to proceed, nor could they return.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And had We willed, We verily could have fixed them in their place, making them powerless to go forward or turn back.

translations.SAHIH: And he to whom We grant long life We reverse in creation;1 so will they not understand?
translations.PICKTHALL: He whom we bring unto old age, We reverse him in creation (making him go back to weakness after strength). Have ye then no sense?

translations.SAHIH: And We did not give him [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)] knowledge of poetry, nor is it befitting for him. It is not but a message and a clear Qur’ān
translations.PICKTHALL: And We have not taught him (Muhammad) poetry, nor is it meet for him. This is naught else than a Reminder and a Lecture making plain,

translations.SAHIH: To warn whoever is alive1 and justify the word [i.e., decree] against the disbelievers.
translations.PICKTHALL: To warn whosoever liveth, and that the word may be fulfilled against the disbelievers.

translations.SAHIH: Do they not see that We have created for them from what Our hands1 have made, grazing livestock, and [then] they are their owners?
translations.PICKTHALL: Have they not seen how We have created for them of Our handiwork the cattle, so that they are their owners,

translations.SAHIH: And We have tamed them for them, so some of them they ride, and some of them they eat.
translations.PICKTHALL: And have subdued them unto them, so that some of them they have for riding, some for food?

translations.SAHIH: And for them therein are [other] benefits and drinks, so will they not be grateful?
translations.PICKTHALL: Benefits and (divers) drinks have they from them. Will they not then give thanks?

translations.SAHIH: But they have taken besides Allāh [false] deities that perhaps they would be helped.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they have taken (other) gods beside Allah, in order that they may be helped.

translations.SAHIH: They are not able to help them, and they [themselves] are for them soldiers in attendance.1
translations.PICKTHALL: It is not in their power to help them; but they (the worshippers) are unto them a host in arms.

translations.SAHIH: So let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, We know what they conceal and what they declare.
translations.PICKTHALL: So let not their speech grieve thee (O Muhammad). Lo! We know what they conceal and what proclaim.

translations.SAHIH: Does man not consider that We created him from a [mere] sperm-drop - then at once1 he is a clear adversary?
translations.PICKTHALL: Hath not man seen that We have created him from a drop of seed? Yet lo! he is an open opponent.

translations.SAHIH: And he presents for Us an example1 and forgets his [own] creation. He says, "Who will give life to bones while they are disintegrated?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And he hath coined for Us a similitude, and hath forgotten the fact of his creation, saying: Who will revive these bones when they have rotted away?

translations.SAHIH: Say, "He will give them life who produced them the first time; and He is, of all creation, Knowing."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: He will revive them Who produced them at the first, for He is Knower of every creation,

translations.SAHIH: [It is] He who made for you from the green tree, fire, and then from it you ignite.
translations.PICKTHALL: Who hath appointed for you fire from the green tree, and behold! ye kindle from it.

translations.SAHIH: Is not He who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the likes of them? Yes, [it is so]; and He is the Knowing Creator.
translations.PICKTHALL: Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the like of them? Aye, that He is! for He is the All-Wise Creator,

translations.SAHIH: His command is only when He intends a thing that He says to it, "Be," and it is.
translations.PICKTHALL: But His command, when He intendeth a thing, is only that He saith unto it: Be! and it is.

translations.SAHIH: So exalted is He in whose hand is the realm of all things, and to Him you will be returned.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor Glory be to Him in Whose hand is the dominion over all things! Unto Him ye will be brought back.

translations.SAHIH: By those [angels] lined up in rows
translations.PICKTHALL: By those who set the ranks in battle order

translations.SAHIH: And those who drive [the clouds]
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who drive away (the wicked) with reproof

translations.SAHIH: And those who recite the message,1
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who read (the Word) for a reminder,

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, your God is One,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! thy Lord is surely One;

translations.SAHIH: Lord of the heavens and the earth and that between them and Lord of the sunrises.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Lord of the heavens and of the earth and all that is between them, and Lord of the sun's risings.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We have adorned the nearest heaven with an adornment of stars
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We have adorned the lowest heaven with an ornament, the planets;

translations.SAHIH: And as protection against every rebellious devil
translations.PICKTHALL: With security from every froward devil.

translations.SAHIH: [So] they may not listen to the exalted assembly [of angels] and are pelted from every side,1
translations.PICKTHALL: They cannot listen to the Highest Chiefs for they are pelted from every side,

translations.SAHIH: Repelled; and for them is a constant punishment,
translations.PICKTHALL: Outcast, and theirs is a perpetual torment;

translations.SAHIH: Except one who snatches [some words] by theft, but they are pursued by a burning flame, piercing [in brightness].
translations.PICKTHALL: Save him who snatcheth a fragment, and there pursueth him a piercing flame.

translations.SAHIH: Then inquire of them, [O Muḥammad], "Are they a stronger [or more difficult] creation or those [others] We have created?" Indeed, We created them [i.e., men] from sticky clay.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then ask them (O Muhammad): Are they stronger as a creation, or those (others) whom we have created? Lo! We created them of plastic clay.

translations.SAHIH: But you wonder, while they mock,
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but thou dost marvel when they mock

translations.SAHIH: And when they are reminded, they remember not.
translations.PICKTHALL: And heed not when they are reminded,

translations.SAHIH: And when they see a sign, they ridicule.
translations.PICKTHALL: And seek to scoff when they behold a portent.

translations.SAHIH: And say, "This is not but obvious magic.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they say: Lo! this is mere magic;

translations.SAHIH: When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
translations.PICKTHALL: When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then, forsooth, be raised (again)?

translations.SAHIH: And our forefathers [as well]?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And our forefathers?

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Yes, and you will be [rendered] contemptible."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (O Muhammad): Ye, in truth; and ye will be brought low.

translations.SAHIH: It will be only one shout, and at once they will be observing.
translations.PICKTHALL: There is but one Shout, and lo! they behold,

translations.SAHIH: They will say, "O woe to us! This is the Day of Recompense."
translations.PICKTHALL: And say: Ah, woe for us! This is the Day of Judgment.

translations.SAHIH: [They will be told], "This is the Day of Judgement which you used to deny."
translations.PICKTHALL: This is the Day of Separation, which ye used to deny.

translations.SAHIH: [The angels will be ordered], "Gather those who committed wrong, their kinds,1 and what they used to worship
translations.PICKTHALL: (And it is said unto the angels): Assemble those who did wrong, together with their wives and what they used to worship

translations.SAHIH: Other than Allāh, and guide them to the path of Hellfire
translations.PICKTHALL: Instead of Allah, and lead them to the path to hell;

translations.SAHIH: And stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned."
translations.PICKTHALL: And stop them, for they must be questioned.

translations.SAHIH: [They will be asked], "What is [wrong] with you? Why do you not help each other?"
translations.PICKTHALL: What aileth you that ye help not one another?

translations.SAHIH: But they, that Day, are in surrender.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but this day they make full submission.

translations.SAHIH: And they will approach one another asking [i.e., blaming] each other.
translations.PICKTHALL: And some of them draw near unto others, mutually questioning.

translations.SAHIH: They will say, "Indeed, you used to come at us from the right."1
translations.PICKTHALL: They say: Lo! ye used to come unto us, imposing, (swearing that ye spoke the truth).

translations.SAHIH: They [i.e., the oppressors] will say, "Rather, you [yourselves] were not believers,
translations.PICKTHALL: They answer: Nay, but ye (yourselves) were not believers.

translations.SAHIH: And we had over you no authority, but you were a transgressing people.
translations.PICKTHALL: We had no power over you, but ye were wayward folk.

translations.SAHIH: So the word [i.e., decree] of our Lord has come into effect upon us; indeed, we will taste [punishment].
translations.PICKTHALL: Now the Word of our Lord hath been fulfilled concerning us. Lo! we are about to taste (the doom).

translations.SAHIH: And we led you to deviation; indeed, we were deviators."
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus we misled you. Lo! we were (ourselves) astray.

translations.SAHIH: So indeed they, that Day, will be sharing in the punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then lo! this day they (both) are sharers in the doom.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, that is how We deal with the criminals.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! thus deal We with the guilty.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed they, when it was said to them, "There is no deity but Allāh," were arrogant
translations.PICKTHALL: For when it was said unto them, There is no Allah save Allah, they were scornful

translations.SAHIH: And were saying, "Are we to leave our gods for a mad poet?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And said: Shall we forsake our gods for a mad poet?

translations.SAHIH: Rather, he [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ)] has come with the truth and confirmed the [previous] messengers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but he brought the Truth, and he confirmed those sent (before him).

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, you [disbelievers] will be tasters of the painful punishment,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! (now) verily ye taste the painful doom -

translations.SAHIH: And you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do -
translations.PICKTHALL: Ye are requited naught save what ye did -

translations.SAHIH: But not the chosen servants of Allāh.
translations.PICKTHALL: Save single-minded slaves of Allah;

translations.SAHIH: Those will have a provision determined -
translations.PICKTHALL: For them there is a known provision,

translations.SAHIH: Fruits;1 and they will be honored
translations.PICKTHALL: Fruits. And they will be honoured

translations.SAHIH: In gardens of pleasure
translations.PICKTHALL: In the Gardens of delight,

translations.SAHIH: On thrones facing one another.
translations.PICKTHALL: On couches facing one another;

translations.SAHIH: There will be circulated among them a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring,
translations.PICKTHALL: A cup from a gushing spring is brought round for them,

translations.SAHIH: White and delicious to the drinkers;
translations.PICKTHALL: White, delicious to the drinkers,

translations.SAHIH: No bad effect is there in it, nor from it will they be intoxicated.
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherein there is no headache nor are they made mad thereby.

translations.SAHIH: And with them will be women limiting [their] glances,1 with large, [beautiful] eyes,
translations.PICKTHALL: And with them are those of modest gaze, with lovely eyes,

translations.SAHIH: As if they were [delicate] eggs, well-protected.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Pure) as they were hidden eggs (of the ostrich).

translations.SAHIH: And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.
translations.PICKTHALL: And some of them draw near unto others, mutually questioning.

translations.SAHIH: A speaker among them will say, "Indeed, I had a companion [on earth].
translations.PICKTHALL: A speaker of them saith: Lo! I had a comrade

translations.SAHIH: Who would say, 'Are you indeed of those who believe
translations.PICKTHALL: Who used to say: Art thou in truth of those who put faith (in his words)?

translations.SAHIH: That when we have died and become dust and bones, we will indeed be recompensed?'"
translations.PICKTHALL: Can we, when we are dead and have become mere dust and bones - can we (then) verily be brought to book?

translations.SAHIH: He will say,1 "Would you [care to] look?"
translations.PICKTHALL: He saith: Will ye look?

translations.SAHIH: And he will look and see him1 in the midst of the Hellfire.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then looketh he and seeth him in the depth of hell.

translations.SAHIH: He will say, "By Allāh, you almost ruined me.
translations.PICKTHALL: He saith: By Allah, thou verily didst all but cause my ruin,

translations.SAHIH: If not for the favor of my Lord, I would have been of those brought in [to Hell].
translations.PICKTHALL: And had it not been for the favour of my Lord, I too had been of those haled forth (to doom).

translations.SAHIH: Then, are we not to die
translations.PICKTHALL: Are we then not to die

translations.SAHIH: Except for our first death, and we will not be punished?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Saving our former death, and are we not to be punished?

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, this is the great attainment.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! this is the supreme triumph.

translations.SAHIH: For the like of this let the workers [on earth] work.
translations.PICKTHALL: For the like of this, then, let the workers work.

translations.SAHIH: Is that [i.e., Paradise] a better accommodation or the tree of zaqqūm?
translations.PICKTHALL: Is this better as a welcome, or the tree of Zaqqum?

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We have made it a torment for the wrongdoers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We have appointed it a torment for wrong-doers.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it is a tree issuing from the bottom of the Hellfire,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! it is a tree that springeth in the heart of hell.

translations.SAHIH: Its emerging fruit as if it was heads of the devils.
translations.PICKTHALL: Its crop is as it were the heads of devils

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, they will eat from it and fill with it their bellies.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! they verily must eat thereof, and fill (their) bellies therewith.

translations.SAHIH: Then indeed, they will have after it a mixture of scalding water.
