translations.PICKTHALL: And afterward, lo! thereupon they have a drink of boiling water

translations.SAHIH: Then indeed, their return will be to the Hellfire.
translations.PICKTHALL: And afterward, lo! their return is surely unto hell.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed they found their fathers astray.
translations.PICKTHALL: They indeed found their fathers astray,

translations.SAHIH: So they hastened [to follow] in their footsteps.
translations.PICKTHALL: But they make haste (to follow) in their footsteps.

translations.SAHIH: And there had already strayed before them most of the former peoples,
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily most of the men of old went astray before them,

translations.SAHIH: And We had already sent among them warners.
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily We sent among them warners.

translations.SAHIH: Then look how was the end of those who were warned -
translations.PICKTHALL: Then see the nature of the consequence for those warned,

translations.SAHIH: But not the chosen servants of Allāh.
translations.PICKTHALL: Save single-minded slaves of Allah.

translations.SAHIH: And Noah had certainly called Us, and [We are] the best of responders.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Noah verily prayed unto Us, and gracious was the Hearer of his prayer

translations.SAHIH: And We saved him and his family from the great affliction.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We saved him and his household from the great distress,

translations.SAHIH: And We made his descendants those remaining [on the earth]
translations.PICKTHALL: And made his seed the survivors,

translations.SAHIH: And left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
translations.PICKTHALL: And left for him among the later folk (the salutation):

translations.SAHIH: "Peace upon Noah among the worlds."
translations.PICKTHALL: Peace be unto Noah among the peoples!

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! thus do We reward the good.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! he is one of Our believing slaves.

translations.SAHIH: Then We drowned the others [i.e., disbelievers].
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We did drown the others.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, among his kind was Abraham,
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! of his persuasion verily was Abraham

translations.SAHIH: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart
translations.PICKTHALL: When he came unto his Lord with a whole heart;

translations.SAHIH: [And] when he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?
translations.PICKTHALL: When he said unto his father and his folk: What is it that ye worship?

translations.SAHIH: Is it falsehood [as] gods other than Allāh you desire?
translations.PICKTHALL: Is it a falsehood - gods beside Allah - that ye desire?

translations.SAHIH: Then what is your thought about the Lord of the worlds?"
translations.PICKTHALL: What then is your opinion of the Lord of the Worlds?

translations.SAHIH: And he cast a look at the stars.
translations.PICKTHALL: And he glanced a glance at the stars

translations.SAHIH: And said, "Indeed, I am [about to be] ill."
translations.PICKTHALL: Then said: Lo! I feel sick!

translations.SAHIH: So they turned away from him, departing.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they turned their backs and went away from him.

translations.SAHIH: Then he turned to their gods and said, "Do you not eat?1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then turned he to their gods and said: Will ye not eat?

translations.SAHIH: What is [wrong] with you that you do not speak?".
translations.PICKTHALL: What aileth you that ye speak not?

translations.SAHIH: And he turned upon them a blow with [his] right hand.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then he attacked them, striking with his right hand.

translations.SAHIH: Then they [i.e., the people] came toward him, hastening.
translations.PICKTHALL: And (his people) came toward him, hastening.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "Do you worship that which you [yourselves] carve,
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Worship ye that which ye yourselves do carve

translations.SAHIH: While Allāh created you and that which you do?"
translations.PICKTHALL: When Allah hath created you and what ye make?

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Construct for him a structure [i.e., furnace] and throw him into the burning fire."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Build for him a building and fling him in the red-hotfire.

translations.SAHIH: And they intended for him a plan [i.e., harm], but We made them the most debased.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they designed a snare for him, but We made them the undermost.

translations.SAHIH: And [then] he said, "Indeed, I will go to [where I am ordered by] my Lord; He will guide me.
translations.PICKTHALL: And he said: Lo! I am going unto my Lord Who will guide me.

translations.SAHIH: My Lord, grant me [a child] from among the righteous."
translations.PICKTHALL: My Lord! Vouchsafe me of the righteous.

translations.SAHIH: So We gave him good tidings of a forbearing boy.
translations.PICKTHALL: So We gave him tidings of a gentle son.

translations.SAHIH: And when he reached with him [the age of] exertion,1 he said, "O my son, indeed I have seen in a dream that I [must] sacrifice you, so see what you think." He said, "O my father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if Allāh wills, of the steadfast."
translations.PICKTHALL: And when (his son) was old enough to walk with him, (Abraham) said: O my dear son, I have seen in a dream that I must sacrifice thee. So look, what thinkest thou? He said: O my father! Do that which thou art commanded. Allah willing, thou shalt find me of the steadfast.

translations.SAHIH: And when they had both submitted1 and he put him down upon his forehead,
translations.PICKTHALL: Then, when they had both surrendered (to Allah), and he had flung him down upon his face,

translations.SAHIH: We called to him, "O Abraham,
translations.PICKTHALL: We called unto him: O Abraham!

translations.SAHIH: You have fulfilled the vision." Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thou hast already fulfilled the vision. Lo! thus do We reward the good.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, this was the clear trial.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! that verily was a clear test.

translations.SAHIH: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We ransomed him with a tremendous victim.

translations.SAHIH: And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
translations.PICKTHALL: And We left for him among the later folk (the salutation):

translations.SAHIH: "Peace upon Abraham."
translations.PICKTHALL: Peace be unto Abraham!

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus do We reward the good.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! he is one of Our believing slaves.

translations.SAHIH: And We gave him good tidings of Isaac, a prophet from among the righteous.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And we gave him tidings of the birth of Isaac, a prophet of the righteous.

translations.SAHIH: And We blessed him and Isaac. But among their descendants is the doer of good and the clearly unjust to himself [i.e., sinner].
translations.PICKTHALL: And We blessed him and Isaac. And of their seed are some who do good, and some who plainly wrong themselves.

translations.SAHIH: And We did certainly confer favor upon Moses and Aaron.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We verily gave grace unto Moses and Aaron,

translations.SAHIH: And We saved them and their people from the great affliction,
translations.PICKTHALL: And saved them and their people from the great distress,

translations.SAHIH: And We supported them so it was they who overcame.
translations.PICKTHALL: And helped them so that they became the victors.

translations.SAHIH: And We gave them the explicit Scripture [i.e., the Torah],
translations.PICKTHALL: And We gave them the clear Scripture

translations.SAHIH: And We guided them on the straight path.
translations.PICKTHALL: And showed them the right path.

translations.SAHIH: And We left for them [favorable mention] among later generations:
translations.PICKTHALL: And We left for them among the later folk (the salutation):

translations.SAHIH: "Peace upon Moses and Aaron."
translations.PICKTHALL: Peace be unto Moses and Aaron!

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! thus do We reward the good.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, they were of Our believing servants.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! they are two of Our believing slaves.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, Elias was from among the messengers,
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! Elias was of those sent (to warn),

translations.SAHIH: When he said to his people, "Will you not fear Allāh?
translations.PICKTHALL: When he said unto his folk: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

translations.SAHIH: Do you call upon Baʿl1 and leave the best of creators -
translations.PICKTHALL: Will ye cry unto Baal and forsake the Best of creators,

translations.SAHIH: Allāh, your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah, your Lord and Lord of your forefathers?

translations.SAHIH: And they denied him, so indeed, they will be brought [for punishment],
translations.PICKTHALL: But they denied him, so they surely will be haled forth (to the doom)

translations.SAHIH: Except the chosen servants of Allāh.
translations.PICKTHALL: Save single-minded slaves of Allah.

translations.SAHIH: And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
translations.PICKTHALL: And we left for him among the later folk (the salutation):

translations.SAHIH: "Peace upon Elias."1
translations.PICKTHALL: Peace be unto Elias!

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! thus do We reward the good.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! he is one of our believing slaves.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, Lot was among the messengers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! Lot verily was of those sent (to warn).

translations.SAHIH: [So mention] when We saved him and his family, all,
translations.PICKTHALL: When We saved him and his household, every one,

translations.SAHIH: Except an old woman [i.e., his wife] among those who remained [with the evildoers].
translations.PICKTHALL: Save an old woman among those who stayed behind;

translations.SAHIH: Then We destroyed the others.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We destroyed the others.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, you pass by them in the morning
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! ye verily pass by (the ruin of) them in the morning

translations.SAHIH: And at night. Then will you not use reason?
translations.PICKTHALL: And at night-time; have ye then no sense?

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, Jonah was among the messengers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! Jonah verily was of those sent (to warn)

translations.SAHIH: [Mention] when he ran away to the laden ship.
translations.PICKTHALL: When he fled unto the laden ship,

translations.SAHIH: And he drew lots1 and was among the losers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And then drew lots and was of those rejected;

translations.SAHIH: Then the fish swallowed him, while he was blameworthy.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And the fish swallowed him while he was blameworthy;

translations.SAHIH: And had he not been of those who exalt Allāh,
translations.PICKTHALL: And had he not been one of those who glorify (Allah)

translations.SAHIH: He would have remained inside its belly until the Day they are resurrected.1
translations.PICKTHALL: He would have tarried in its belly till the day when they are raised;

translations.SAHIH: But We threw him onto the open shore while he was ill.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then We cast him on a desert shore while he was sick;

translations.SAHIH: And We caused to grow over him a gourd vine.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And We caused a tree of gourd to grow above him;

translations.SAHIH: And We sent him1 to [his people of] a hundred thousand or more.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We sent him to a hundred thousand (folk) or more

translations.SAHIH: And they believed, so We gave them enjoyment [of life] for a time.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they believed, therefor We gave them comfort for a while.

translations.SAHIH: So inquire of them, [O Muḥammad], "Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons?1
translations.PICKTHALL: Now ask them (O Muhammad): Hath thy Lord daughters whereas they have sons?

translations.SAHIH: Or did We create the angels as females while they were witnesses?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Or created We the angels females while they were present?

translations.SAHIH: Unquestionably, it is out of their [invented] falsehood that they say,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! it is of their falsehood that they say:

translations.SAHIH: "Allāh has begotten," and indeed, they are liars.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah hath begotten. Allah! verily they tell a lie.

translations.SAHIH: Has He chosen daughters over sons?
translations.PICKTHALL: (And again of their falsehood): He hath preferred daughters to sons.

translations.SAHIH: What is [wrong] with you? How do you make judgement?
translations.PICKTHALL: What aileth you? How judge ye?

translations.SAHIH: Then will you not be reminded?
translations.PICKTHALL: Will ye not then reflect?

translations.SAHIH: Or do you have a clear authority?1
translations.PICKTHALL: Or have ye a clear warrant?

translations.SAHIH: Then produce your scripture, if you should be truthful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then produce your writ, if ye are truthful.

translations.SAHIH: And they have made [i.e., claimed] between Him and the jinn a lineage, but the jinn have already known that they [who made such claims] will be brought [to punishment].
translations.PICKTHALL: And they imagine kinship between him and the jinn, whereas the jinn know well that they will be brought before (Him).

translations.SAHIH: Exalted is Allāh above what they describe,
translations.PICKTHALL: Glorified be Allah from that which they attribute (unto Him),

translations.SAHIH: Except the chosen servants of Allāh [who do not share in that sin].
translations.PICKTHALL: Save single-minded slaves of Allah.

translations.SAHIH: So indeed, you [disbelievers] and whatever you worship,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! verily, ye and that which ye worship,

translations.SAHIH: You cannot tempt [anyone] away from Him
translations.PICKTHALL: Ye cannot excite (anyone) against Him.

translations.SAHIH: Except he who is to [enter and] burn in the Hellfire.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Save him who is to burn in hell.

translations.SAHIH: [The angels say],1 "There is not among us any except that he has a known position.2
translations.PICKTHALL: There is not one of us but hath his known position.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, we are those who line up [for prayer].
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! we, even we are they who set the ranks,

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, we are those who exalt Allāh."
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! we, even we are they who hymn His praise

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, they [i.e., the disbelievers] used to say,1
translations.PICKTHALL: And indeed they used to say:

translations.SAHIH: "If we had a message from [those of] the former peoples,
translations.PICKTHALL: If we had but a reminder from the men of old

translations.SAHIH: We would have been the chosen servants of Allāh."
translations.PICKTHALL: We would be single-minded slaves of Allah.

translations.SAHIH: But they disbelieved in it,1 so they are going to know.
translations.PICKTHALL: Yet (now that it is come) they disbelieve therein; but they will come to know.

translations.SAHIH: And Our word [i.e., decree] has already preceded for Our servants, the messengers,
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily Our word went forth of old unto Our bondmen sent (to warn)

translations.SAHIH: [That] indeed, they would be those given victory
translations.PICKTHALL: That they verily would be helped,

translations.SAHIH: And [that] indeed, Our soldiers [i.e., the believers] will be those who overcome.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And that Our host, they verily would be the victors.

translations.SAHIH: So, [O Muḥammad], leave them for a time.
translations.PICKTHALL: So withdraw from them (O Muhammad) awhile,

translations.SAHIH: And see [what will befall] them, for they are going to see.
translations.PICKTHALL: And watch, for they will (soon) see.

translations.SAHIH: Then for Our punishment are they impatient?
translations.PICKTHALL: Would they hasten on Our doom?

translations.SAHIH: But when it descends in their territory, then evil is the morning of those who were warned.
translations.PICKTHALL: But when it cometh home to them, then it will be a hapless morn for those who have been warned.

translations.SAHIH: And leave them for a time.
translations.PICKTHALL: Withdraw from them awhile

translations.SAHIH: And see, for they are going to see.
translations.PICKTHALL: And watch, for they will (soon) see.

translations.SAHIH: Exalted is your Lord, the Lord of might, above what they describe.
translations.PICKTHALL: Glorified be thy Lord, the Lord of Majesty, from that which they attribute (unto Him)

translations.SAHIH: And peace upon the messengers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And peace be unto those sent (to warn).

translations.SAHIH: And praise to Allāh, Lord of the worlds.
translations.PICKTHALL: And praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds!

translations.SAHIH: Ṣād.1 By the Qur’ān containing reminder...2
translations.PICKTHALL: Sad. By the renowned Qur'an,

translations.SAHIH: But those who disbelieve are in pride and dissension.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but those who disbelieve are in false pride and schism.

translations.SAHIH: How many a generation have We destroyed before them, and they [then] called out; but it was not a time for escape.
translations.PICKTHALL: How many a generation We destroyed before them, and they cried out when it was no longer the time for escape!

translations.SAHIH: And they wonder that there has come to them a warner [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)] from among themselves. And the disbelievers say, "This is a magician and a liar.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they marvel that a warner from among themselves hath come unto them, and the disbelievers say: This is a wizard, a charlatan.

translations.SAHIH: Has he made the gods [only] one God? Indeed, this is a curious thing."
translations.PICKTHALL: Maketh he the gods One Allah? Lo! that is an astounding thing.

translations.SAHIH: And the eminent among them went forth, [saying], "Continue, and be patient over [the defense of] your gods. Indeed, this is a thing intended.1
translations.PICKTHALL: The chiefs among them go about, exhorting: Go and be staunch to your gods! Lo! this is a thing designed.

translations.SAHIH: We have not heard of this in the latest religion.1 This is not but a fabrication.
translations.PICKTHALL: We have not heard of this in later religion. This is naught but an invention.

translations.SAHIH: Has the message been revealed to him out of [all of] us?" Rather, they are in doubt about My message. Rather, they have not yet tasted My punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: Hath the reminder been unto him (alone) among us? Nay, but they are in doubt concerning My reminder; nay but they have not yet tasted My doom.

translations.SAHIH: Or do they have the depositories of the mercy of your Lord, the Exalted in Might, the Bestower?1
translations.PICKTHALL: Or are theirs the treasures of the mercy of thy Lord, the Mighty, the Bestower?

translations.SAHIH: Or is theirs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and what is between them? Then let them ascend through [any] ways of access.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Or is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them theirs? Then let them ascend by ropes!

translations.SAHIH: [They are but] soldiers [who will be] defeated there among the companies [of disbelievers].
translations.PICKTHALL: A defeated host are (all) the factions that are there.

translations.SAHIH: The people of Noah denied before them, and [the tribe of] ʿAad and Pharaoh, the owner of stakes,1
translations.PICKTHALL: The folk of Noah before them denied (their messenger) and (so did the tribe of) A'ad, and Pharaoh firmly planted,

translations.SAHIH: And [the tribe of] Thamūd and the people of Lot and the companions of the thicket [i.e., people of Madyan]. Those are the companies.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And (the tribe of) Thamud, and the folk of Lot, and the dwellers in the wood: these were the factions.

translations.SAHIH: Each of them denied the messengers, so My penalty was justified.
translations.PICKTHALL: Not one of them but did deny the messengers, therefor My doom was justified,

translations.SAHIH: And these [disbelievers] await not but one blast [of the Horn]; for it there will be no delay.1
translations.PICKTHALL: These wait for but one Shout, there will be no second thereto.

translations.SAHIH: And they say, "Our Lord, hasten for us our share [of the punishment] before the Day of Account."
translations.PICKTHALL: They say: Our Lord! Hasten on for us our fate before the Day of Reckoning.

translations.SAHIH: Be patient over what they say and remember Our servant, David, the possessor of strength; indeed, he was one who repeatedly turned back [to Allāh].
translations.PICKTHALL: Bear with what they say, and remember Our bondman David, lord of might, Lo! he was ever turning in repentance (toward Allah).

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We subjected the mountains [to praise] with him, exalting [Allāh] in the [late] afternoon and [after] sunrise.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We subdued the hills to hymn the praises (of their Lord) with him at nightfall and sunrise,

translations.SAHIH: And the birds were assembled, all with him repeating [praises].
translations.PICKTHALL: And the birds assembled; all were turning unto Him.

translations.SAHIH: And We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and discernment in speech.
translations.PICKTHALL: We made his kingdom strong and gave him wisdom and decisive speech.

translations.SAHIH: And has there come to you the news of the adversaries, when they climbed over the wall of [his] prayer chamber -
translations.PICKTHALL: And hath the story of the litigants come unto thee? How they climbed the wall into the royal chamber;

translations.SAHIH: When they entered upon David and he was alarmed by them? They said, "Fear not. [We are] two adversaries, one of whom has wronged the other, so judge between us with truth and do not exceed [it] and guide us to the sound path.
translations.PICKTHALL: How they burst in upon David, and he was afraid of them. They said: Be not afraid! (We are) two litigants, one of whom hath wronged the other, therefor judge aright between us; be not unjust; and show us the fair way.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed this, my brother, has ninety-nine ewes, and I have one ewe; so he said, 'Entrust her to me,' and he overpowered me in speech."
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! this my brother hath ninety and nine ewes while I had one ewe; and he said: Entrust it to me, and he conquered me in speech.

translations.SAHIH: [David] said, "He has certainly wronged you in demanding your ewe [in addition] to his ewes. And indeed, many associates oppress one another, except for those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they." And David became certain that We had tried him, and he asked forgiveness of his Lord1 and fell down bowing [in prostration] and turned in repentance [to Allāh].
translations.PICKTHALL: (David) said: He hath wronged thee in demanding thine ewe in addition to his ewes, and lo! many partners oppress one another, save such as believe and do good works, and they are few. And David guessed that We had tried him, and he sought forgiveness of his Lord, and he bowed himself and fell down prostrate and repented.

translations.SAHIH: So We forgave him that; and indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.
translations.PICKTHALL: So We forgave him that; and lo! he had access to Our presence and a happy journey's end.

translations.SAHIH: [We said], "O David, indeed We have made you a successor upon the earth, so judge between the people in truth and do not follow [your own] desire, as it will lead you astray from the way of Allāh." Indeed, those who go astray from the way of Allāh will have a severe punishment for having forgotten the Day of Account.
translations.PICKTHALL: (And it was said unto him): O David! Lo! We have set thee as a viceroy in the earth; therefor judge aright between mankind, and follow not desire that it beguile thee from the way of Allah. Lo! those who wander from the way of Allah have an awful doom, forasmuch as they forgot the Day of Reckoning.

translations.SAHIH: And We did not create the heaven and the earth and that between them aimlessly. That is the assumption of those who disbelieve, so woe to those who disbelieve from the Fire.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We created not the heaven and the earth and all that is between them in vain. That is the opinion of those who disbelieve. And woe unto those who disbelieve, from the Fire!

translations.SAHIH: Or should We treat those who believe and do righteous deeds like corrupters in the land? Or should We treat those who fear Allāh like the wicked?
translations.PICKTHALL: Shall We treat those who believe and do good works as those who spread corruption in the earth; or shall We treat the pious as the wicked?

translations.SAHIH: [This is] a blessed Book which We have revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], that they might reflect upon its verses and that those of understanding would be reminded.
translations.PICKTHALL: (This is) a Scripture that We have revealed unto thee, full of blessing, that they may ponder its revelations, and that men of understanding may reflect.

translations.SAHIH: And to David We gave Solomon. An excellent servant, indeed he was one repeatedly turning back [to Allāh].
translations.PICKTHALL: And We bestowed on David, Solomon. How excellent a slave! Lo! he was ever turning in repentance (toward Allah).

translations.SAHIH: [Mention] when there were exhibited before him in the afternoon the poised [standing] racehorses.
translations.PICKTHALL: When there were shown to him at eventide lightfooted coursers

translations.SAHIH: And he said, "Indeed, I gave preference to the love of good [things] over the remembrance of my Lord until it [i.e., the sun] disappeared into the curtain [of darkness]."
translations.PICKTHALL: And he said: Lo! I have preferred the good things (of the world) to the remembrance of my Lord; till they were taken out of sight behind the curtain.

translations.SAHIH: [He said], "Return them to me," and set about striking1 [their] legs and necks.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Then he said): Bring them back to me, and fell to slashing (with his sword their) legs and necks.

translations.SAHIH: And We certainly tried Solomon and placed on his throne a body;1 then he returned.2
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily We tried Solomon, and set upon his throne a (mere) body. Then did he repent.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom such as will not belong to anyone after me. Indeed, You are the Bestower."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: My Lord! Forgive me and bestow on me sovereignty such as shall not belong to any after me. Lo! Thou art the Bestower.

translations.SAHIH: So We subjected to him the wind blowing by his command, gently, wherever he directed,
translations.PICKTHALL: So We made the wind subservient unto him, setting fair by his command whithersoever he intended.

translations.SAHIH: And [also] the devils [of jinn] - every builder and diver.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the unruly, every builder and diver (made We subservient),

translations.SAHIH: And others bound together in irons.
translations.PICKTHALL: And others linked together in chains,

translations.SAHIH: [We said], "This is Our gift, so grant or withhold without account."
translations.PICKTHALL: (Saying): This is Our gift, so bestow thou, or withhold, without reckoning.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! he hath favour with Us, and a happy journey's end.

translations.SAHIH: And remember Our servant Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, Satan has touched me with hardship and torment."
translations.PICKTHALL: And make mention (O Muhammad) of Our bondman Job, when he cried unto his Lord (saying): Lo! the devil doth afflict me with distress and torment.

translations.SAHIH: [So he was told], "Strike [the ground] with your foot; this is a [spring for a] cool bath and drink."
translations.PICKTHALL: (And it was said unto him): Strike the ground with thy foot. This (spring) is a cool bath and a refreshing drink.

translations.SAHIH: And We granted him his family and a like [number] with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for those of understanding.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We bestowed on him (again) his household and therewith the like thereof, a mercy from Us, and a memorial for men of understanding.

translations.SAHIH: [We said], "And take in your hand a bunch [of grass] and strike with it and do not break your oath."1 Indeed, We found him patient, an excellent servant. Indeed, he was one repeatedly turning back [to Allāh].
translations.PICKTHALL: And (it was said unto him): Take in thine hand a branch and smite therewith, and break not thine oath. Lo! We found him steadfast, how excellent a slave! Lo! he was ever turning in repentance (to his Lord).

translations.SAHIH: And remember Our servants, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob - those of strength and [religious] vision.
translations.PICKTHALL: And make mention of Our bondmen, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, men of parts and vision.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We chose them for an exclusive quality: remembrance of the home [of the Hereafter].
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We purified them with a pure thought, remembrance of the Home (of the Hereafter).

translations.SAHIH: And indeed they are, to Us, among the chosen and outstanding.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! in Our sight they are verily of the elect, the excellent.

translations.SAHIH: And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhul-Kifl, and all are among the outstanding.
translations.PICKTHALL: And make mention of Ishmael and Elisha and Dhu'l-Kifl. All are of the chosen.

translations.SAHIH: This is a reminder. And indeed, for the righteous is a good place of return -
translations.PICKTHALL: This is a reminder. And lo! for those who ward off (evil) is a happy journey's end,

translations.SAHIH: Gardens of perpetual residence, whose doors will be opened to them.
translations.PICKTHALL: Gardens of Eden, whereof the gates are opened for them,

translations.SAHIH: Reclining within them, they will call therein for abundant fruit and drink.
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherein, reclining, they call for plenteous fruit and cool drink (that is) therein.

translations.SAHIH: And with them will be women limiting [their] glances1 and of equal age.
translations.PICKTHALL: And with them are those of modest gaze, companions.

translations.SAHIH: This is what you, [the righteous], are promised for the Day of Account.
translations.PICKTHALL: This it is that ye are promised for the Day of Reckoning.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, this is Our provision; for it there is no depletion.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! this in truth is Our provision, which will never waste away.

translations.SAHIH: This [is so]. But indeed, for the transgressors is an evil place of return -
translations.PICKTHALL: This (is for the righteous). And lo! for the transgressors there with be an evil journey's end,

translations.SAHIH: Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the resting place.
translations.PICKTHALL: Hell, where they will burn, an evil resting-place.

translations.SAHIH: This - so let them taste it - is scalding water and [foul] purulence.
translations.PICKTHALL: Here is a boiling and an ice-cold draught, so let them taste it,

translations.SAHIH: And other [punishments] of its type [in various] kinds.
translations.PICKTHALL: And other (torment) of the kind in pairs (the two extremes)!

translations.SAHIH: [Its inhabitants will say], "This is a company bursting in with you. No welcome for them. Indeed, they will burn in the Fire."
translations.PICKTHALL: Here is an army rushing blindly with you. (Those who are already in the Fire say): No word of welcome for them. Lo! they will roast at the Fire.

translations.SAHIH: They will say, "Nor you! No welcome for you. You, [our leaders], brought this upon us, and wretched is the settlement."
translations.PICKTHALL: They say: Nay, but you (misleaders), for you there is no word of welcome. Ye prepared this for us (by your misleading). Now hapless is the plight.

translations.SAHIH: They will say, "Our Lord, whoever brought this upon us - increase for him double punishment in the Fire."
translations.PICKTHALL: They say: Our Lord! Whoever did prepare this for us, oh, give him double portion of the Fire!

translations.SAHIH: And they will say, "Why do we not see men whom we used to count among the worst?1
translations.PICKTHALL: And they say: What aileth us that we behold not men whom we were wont to count among the wicked?

translations.SAHIH: Is it [because] we took them in ridicule, or has [our] vision turned away from them?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Did we take them (wrongly) for a laughing-stock, or have our eyes missed them?

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, that is truth [i.e., reality] - the quarreling of the people of the Fire.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! that is very truth: the wrangling of the dwellers in the Fire.

translations.SAHIH: Say, [O Muḥammad], "I am only a warner, and there is not any deity except Allāh, the One, the Prevailing,1
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): I am only a warner, and there is no Allah save Allah, the One, the Absolute,

translations.SAHIH: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Exalted in Might,1 the Perpetual Forgiver."2
translations.PICKTHALL: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Mighty, the Pardoning.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "It is great news
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: It is tremendous tidings

translations.SAHIH: From which you turn away.
translations.PICKTHALL: Whence ye turn away!

translations.SAHIH: I had no knowledge of the exalted assembly [of angels] when they were disputing [the creation of Adam].
translations.PICKTHALL: I had no knowledge of the Highest Chiefs when they disputed;

translations.SAHIH: It has not been revealed to me except that I am a clear warner."
translations.PICKTHALL: It is revealed unto me only that I may be a plain warner.

translations.SAHIH: [So mention] when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I am going to create a human being from clay.
translations.PICKTHALL: When thy Lord said unto the angels: Lo! I am about to create a mortal out of mire,

translations.SAHIH: So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul,1 then fall down to him in prostration."
translations.PICKTHALL: And when I have fashioned him and breathed into him of My Spirit, then fall down before him prostrate,

translations.SAHIH: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely,
translations.PICKTHALL: The angels fell down prostrate, every one,

translations.SAHIH: Except Iblees;1 he was arrogant and became among the disbelievers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Saving Iblis; he was scornful and became one of the disbelievers.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "O Iblees, what prevented you from prostrating to that which I created with My hands?1 Were you arrogant [then], or were you [already] among the haughty?"
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: O Iblis! What hindereth thee from falling prostrate before that which I have created with both My hands? Art thou too proud or art thou of the high exalted?

translations.SAHIH: He said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: I am better than him. Thou createdst me of fire, whilst him Thou didst create of clay.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "Then get out of it [i.e., Paradise], for indeed, you are expelled.
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Go forth from hence, for lo! thou art outcast,

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, upon you is My curse until the Day of Recompense."
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! My curse is on thee till the Day of Judgment.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: My Lord! Reprieve me till the day when they are raised.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Lo! thou art of those reprieved

translations.SAHIH: Until the Day of the time well-known."
translations.PICKTHALL: Until the day of the time appointed.

translations.SAHIH: [Iblees] said, "By Your might, I will surely mislead them all.
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: Then, by Thy might, I surely will beguile them every one,

translations.SAHIH: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."
translations.PICKTHALL: Save Thy single-minded slaves among them.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] said, "The truth [is My oath], and the truth I say -
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: The Truth is, and the Truth I speak,

translations.SAHIH: [That] I will surely fill Hell with you and those of them that follow you all together."
translations.PICKTHALL: That I shall fill hell with thee and with such of them as follow thee, together.

translations.SAHIH: Say, [O Muḥammad], "I do not ask you for it [i.e., the Qur’ān] any payment, and I am not of the pretentious.
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (O Muhammad, unto mankind): I ask of you no fee for this, and I am no simulating.

translations.SAHIH: It is but a reminder to the worlds.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! it is naught else than a reminder for all peoples

translations.SAHIH: And you will surely know [the truth of] its information after a time."
translations.PICKTHALL: And ye will come in time to know the truth thereof.

translations.SAHIH: The revelation of the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] is from Allāh, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
translations.PICKTHALL: The revelation of the Scripture is from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We have sent down to you the Book, [O Muḥammad], in truth. So worship Allāh, [being] sincere to Him in religion.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We have revealed the Scripture unto thee (Muhammad) with truth; so worship Allah, making religion pure for Him (only).

translations.SAHIH: Unquestionably, for Allāh is the pure religion.1 And those who take protectors besides Him [say], "We only worship them that they may bring us nearer to Allāh in position." Indeed, Allāh will judge between them concerning that over which they differ. Indeed, Allāh does not guide he who is a liar and [confirmed] disbeliever.
translations.PICKTHALL: Surely pure religion is for Allah only. And those who choose protecting friends beside Him (say): We worship them only that they may bring us near unto Allah. Lo! Allah will judge between them concerning that wherein they differ. Lo! Allah guideth not him who is a liar, an ingrate.

translations.SAHIH: If Allāh had intended to take a son, He could have chosen from what He creates whatever He willed. Exalted is He; He is Allāh, the One, the Prevailing.1
translations.PICKTHALL: If Allah had willed to choose a son, He could have chosen what He would of that which He hath created. Be He Glorified! He is Allah, the One, the Absolute.

translations.SAHIH: He created the heavens and earth in truth. He wraps the night over the day and wraps the day over the night and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. Unquestionably, He is the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver.1
translations.PICKTHALL: He hath created the heavens and the earth with truth. He maketh night to succeed day, and He maketh day to succeed night, and He constraineth the sun and the moon to give service, each running on for an appointed term. Is not He the Mighty, the Forgiver?

translations.SAHIH: He created you from one soul. Then He made from it its mate, and He produced for you from the grazing livestock eight mates.1 He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, within three darknesses.2 That is Allāh, your Lord; to Him belongs dominion. There is no deity except Him, so how are you averted?
translations.PICKTHALL: He created you from one being, then from that (being) He made its mate; and He hath provided for you of cattle eight kinds. He created you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, in a threefold gloom. Such is Allah, your Lord. His is the Sovereignty. There is no Allah save Him. How then are ye turned away?

translations.SAHIH: If you disbelieve - indeed, Allāh is Free from need of you. And He does not approve for His servants disbelief. And if you are grateful, He approves [i.e., likes] it for you; and no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you about what you used to do. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
translations.PICKTHALL: If ye are thankless, yet Allah is Independent of you, though He is not pleased with thanklessness for His bondmen; and if ye are thankful He is pleased therewith for you. No laden soul will bear another's load. Then unto your Lord is your return; and He will tell you what ye used to do. Lo! He knoweth what is in the breasts (of men).

translations.SAHIH: And when adversity touches man, he calls upon his Lord, turning to Him [alone]; then when He bestows on him a favor from Himself, he forgets Him whom he called upon before,1 and he attributes to Allāh equals to mislead [people] from His way. Say, "Enjoy your disbelief for a little; indeed, you are of the companions of the Fire."
translations.PICKTHALL: And when some hurt toucheth man, he crieth unto his Lord, turning unto Him (repentant). Then, when He granteth him a boon from Him he forgetteth that for which he cried unto Him before, and setteth up rivals to Allah that he may beguile (men) from his way. Say (O Muhammad, unto such an one): Take pleasure in thy disbelief a while. Lo! thou art of the owners of the Fire.

translations.SAHIH: Is one who is devoutly obedient during periods of the night, prostrating and standing [in prayer], fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord, [like one who does not]? Say, "Are those who know equal to those who do not know?" Only they will remember [who are] people of understanding.
translations.PICKTHALL: Is he who payeth adoration in the watches of the night, prostrate and standing, bewaring of the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord, (to be accounted equal with a disbeliever)? Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Are those who know equal with those who know not? But only men of understanding will pay heed.

translations.SAHIH: Say,1 "O My servants who have believed, fear your Lord. For those who do good in this world is good, and the earth of Allāh is spacious. Indeed, the patient will be given their reward without account [i.e., limit]."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: O My bondmen who believe! Observe your duty to your Lord. For those who do good in this world there is good, and Allah's earth is spacious. Verily the steadfast will be paid their wages without stint.

translations.SAHIH: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Indeed, I have been commanded to worship Allāh, [being] sincere to Him in religion.
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (O Muhammad): Lo! I am commanded to worship Allah, making religion pure for Him (only).

translations.SAHIH: And I have been commanded to be the first [among you] of the Muslims."
translations.PICKTHALL: And I am commanded to be the first of those who are muslims (surrender unto Him).

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Lo! if I should disobey my Lord, I fear the doom of a tremendous Day.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Allāh [alone] do I worship, sincere to Him in my religion,
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Allah I worship, making my religion pure for Him (only).

translations.SAHIH: So worship what you will besides Him." Say, "Indeed, the losers are the ones who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, that is the manifest loss."
translations.PICKTHALL: Then worship what ye will beside Him. Say: The losers will be those who lose themselves and their housefolk on the Day of Resurrection. Ah, that will be the manifest loss!

translations.SAHIH: They will have canopies [i.e., layers] of fire above them and below them, canopies. By that Allāh threatens [i.e., warns] His servants. O My servants, then fear Me.
translations.PICKTHALL: They have an awning of fire above them and beneath them a dais (of fire). With this doth Allah appal His bondmen. O My bondmen, therefor fear Me!

translations.SAHIH: But those who have avoided ṭāghūt,1 lest they worship it, and turned back to Allāh - for them are good tidings. So give good tidings to My servants
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who put away false gods lest they should worship them and turn to Allah in repentance, for them there are glad tidings. Therefor give good tidings (O Muhammad) to My bondmen

translations.SAHIH: Who listen to speech and follow the best of it. Those are the ones Allāh has guided, and those are people of understanding.
translations.PICKTHALL: Who hear advice and follow the best thereof. Such are those whom Allah guideth, and such are men of understanding.

translations.SAHIH: Then, is one who has deserved the decree of punishment [to be guided]? Then, can you save one who is in the Fire?
translations.PICKTHALL: Is he on whom the word of doom is fulfilled (to be helped), and canst thou (O Muhammad) rescue him who is in the Fire?

translations.SAHIH: But those who have feared their Lord - for them are chambers,1 above them chambers built high, beneath which rivers flow. [This is] the promise of Allāh. Allāh does not fail in [His] promise.
translations.PICKTHALL: But those who keep their duty to their Lord, for them are lofty halls with lofty halls above them, built (for them), beneath which rivers flow. (It is) a promise of Allah. Allah faileth not His promise.

translations.SAHIH: Do you not see that Allāh sends down rain from the sky and makes it flow as springs [and rivers] in the earth; then He produces thereby crops of varying colors; then they dry and you see them turned yellow; then He makes them [scattered] debris. Indeed in that is a reminder for those of understanding.
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou not seen how Allah hath sent down water from the sky and hath caused it to penetrate the earth as watersprings, and afterward thereby produceth crops of divers hues; and afterward they wither and thou seest them turn yellow; then He maketh them chaff. Lo! herein verily is a reminder for men of understanding.

translations.SAHIH: So is one whose breast Allāh has expanded to [accept] Islām and he is upon [i.e., guided by] a light from his Lord [like one whose heart rejects it]? Then woe to those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of Allāh. Those are in manifest error.
translations.PICKTHALL: Is he whose bosom Allah hath expanded for Al-Islam, so that he followeth a light from his Lord, (as he who disbelieveth)? Then woe unto those whose hearts are hardened against remembrance of Allah. Such are in plain error.

translations.SAHIH: Allāh has sent down the best statement: a consistent Book wherein is reiteration. The skins shiver therefrom of those who fear their Lord; then their skins and their hearts relax at the remembrance [i.e., mention] of Allāh. That is the guidance of Allāh by which He guides whom He wills. And one whom Allāh sends astray - for him there is no guide.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah hath (now) revealed the fairest of statements, a Scripture consistent, (wherein promises of reward are) paired (with threats of punishment), whereat doth creep the flesh of those who fear their Lord, so that their flesh and their hearts soften to Allah's reminder. Such is Allah's guidance, wherewith He guideth whom He will. And him whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no guide.

translations.SAHIH: Then is he who will shield with his face1 the worst of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection [like one secure from it]? And it will be said to the wrongdoers, "Taste what you used to earn."
translations.PICKTHALL: Is he then, who will strike his face against the awful doom upon the Day of Resurrection (as he who doeth right)? And it will be said unto the wrong-doers: Taste what ye used to earn.

translations.SAHIH: Those before them denied, and punishment came upon them from where they did not perceive.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those before them denied, and so the doom came on them whence they knew not.

translations.SAHIH: So Allāh made them taste disgrace in worldly life. But the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus Allah made them taste humiliation in the life of the world, and verily the doom of the Hereafter will be greater if they did but know.

translations.SAHIH: And We have certainly presented for the people in this Qur’ān from every [kind of] example - that they might remember.
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily We have coined for mankind in this Qur'an all kinds of similitudes, that haply they may reflect;

translations.SAHIH: [It is] an Arabic Qur’ān, without any deviance1 that they might become righteous.2
translations.PICKTHALL: A Lecture in Arabic, containing no crookedness, that haply they may ward off (evil).

translations.SAHIH: Allāh presents an example: a man [i.e., slave] owned by quarreling partners and another belonging exclusively to one man - are they equal in comparison? Praise be to Allāh! But most of them do not know.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah coineth a similitude: A man in relation to whom are several part-owners, quarrelling, and a man belonging wholly to one man. Are the two equal in similitude? Praise be to Allah! But most of them know not.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, you are to die, and indeed, they are to die.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! thou wilt die, and lo! they will die;

translations.SAHIH: Then indeed you, on the Day of Resurrection, before your Lord, will dispute.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then lo! on the Day of Resurrection, before your Lord ye will dispute.

translations.SAHIH: So who is more unjust than one who lies about Allāh and denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell a residence for the disbelievers?
translations.PICKTHALL: And who doth greater wrong than he who telleth a lie against Allah, and denieth the truth when it reacheth him? Will not the home of disbelievers be in hell?

translations.SAHIH: And the one who has brought the truth [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ)] and [they who] believed in it - those are the righteous.
translations.PICKTHALL: And whoso bringeth the truth and believeth therein - Such are the dutiful.

translations.SAHIH: They will have whatever they desire with their Lord. That is the reward of the doers of good -
translations.PICKTHALL: They shall have what they will of their Lord's bounty. That is the reward of the good:

translations.SAHIH: That Allāh may remove from them the worst of what they did and reward them their due for the best of what they used to do.
translations.PICKTHALL: That Allah will remit from them the worst of what they did, and will pay them for reward the best they used to do.

translations.SAHIH: Is not Allāh sufficient for His Servant [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)]? And [yet], they threaten you with those [they worship] other than Him. And whoever Allāh leaves astray - for him there is no guide.
translations.PICKTHALL: Will not Allah defend His slave? Yet they would frighten thee with those beside Him. He whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no guide.

translations.SAHIH: And whoever Allāh guides - for him there is no misleader. Is not Allāh Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution?
translations.PICKTHALL: And he whom Allah guideth, for him there can be no misleader. Is not Allah Mighty, Able to Requite (the wrong)?

translations.SAHIH: And if you asked them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they would surely say, "Allāh." Say, "Then have you considered1 what you invoke besides Allāh? If Allāh intended me harm, are they removers of His harm; or if He intended me mercy, are they withholders of His mercy?" Say, "Sufficient for me is Allāh; upon Him [alone] rely the [wise] reliers."
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily, if thou shouldst ask them: Who created the heavens and the earth? they will say: Allah. Say: Bethink you then of those ye worship beside Allah, if Allah willed some hurt for me, could they remove from me His hurt; or if He willed some mercy for me, could they restrain His mercy? Say: Allah is my all. In Him do (all) the trusting put their trust.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "O my people, work according to your position, [for] indeed, I am working; and you are going to know
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: O my people! Act in your manner. Lo! I (too) am acting. Thus ye will come to know

translations.SAHIH: To whom will come a torment disgracing him and on whom will descend an enduring punishment."
translations.PICKTHALL: Who it is unto whom cometh a doom that will abase him, and on whom there falleth everlasting doom.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We sent down to you the Book for the people in truth. So whoever is guided - it is for [the benefit of] his soul; and whoever goes astray only goes astray to its detriment. And you are not a manager [i.e., authority] over them.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We have revealed unto thee (Muhammad) the Scripture for mankind with truth. Then whosoever goeth right it is for his soul, and whosoever strayeth, strayeth only to its hurt. And thou art not a warder over them.

translations.SAHIH: Allāh takes the souls at the time of their death, and those that do not die [He takes] during their sleep. Then He keeps those for which He has decreed death and releases the others for a specified term. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah receiveth (men's) souls at the time of their death, and that (soul) which dieth not (yet) in its sleep. He keepeth that (soul) for which He hath ordained death and dismisseth the rest till an appointed term. Lo! herein verily are portents for people who take thought.

translations.SAHIH: Or have they taken other than Allāh as intercessors? Say, "Even though they do not possess [power over] anything, nor do they reason?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Or choose they intercessors other than Allah? Say: What! Even though they have power over nothing and have no intelligence?

translations.SAHIH: Say, "To Allāh belongs [the right to allow] intercession entirely. To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. Then to Him you will be returned."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Unto Allah belongeth all intercession. His is the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. And afterward unto Him ye will be brought back.

translations.SAHIH: And when Allāh is mentioned alone, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter shrink with aversion, but when those [worshipped] other than Him are mentioned, immediately they rejoice.
translations.PICKTHALL: And when Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter are repelled, and when those (whom they worship) beside Him are mentioned, behold! they are glad.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "O Allāh, Creator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, You will judge between your servants concerning that over which they used to differ."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: O Allah! Creator of the heavens and the earth! Knower of the Invisible and the Visible! Thou wilt judge between Thy slaves concerning that wherein they used to differ.

translations.SAHIH: And if those who did wrong had all that is in the earth entirely and the like of it with it, they would [attempt to] ransom themselves thereby from the worst of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection. And there will appear to them from Allāh that which they had not taken into account.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And though those who do wrong possess all that is in the earth, and therewith as much again, they verily will seek to ransom themselves therewith on the Day of Resurrection from the awful doom; and there will appear unto them, from their Lord, that wherewith they never reckoned.

translations.SAHIH: And there will appear to them the evils they had earned, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the evils that they earned will appear unto them, and that whereat they used to scoff will surround them.

translations.SAHIH: And when adversity touches man, he calls upon Us; then when We bestow on him a favor from Us, he says, "I have only been given it because of [my] knowledge." Rather, it is a trial, but most of them do not know.
translations.PICKTHALL: Now when hurt toucheth a man he crieth unto Us, and afterward when We have granted him a boon from Us, he saith: Only by force of knowledge I obtained it. Nay, but it is a test. But most of them know not.

translations.SAHIH: Those before them had already said it, but they were not availed by what they used to earn.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those before them said it, yet (all) that they had earned availed them not;

translations.SAHIH: And the evil consequences of what they earned struck them. And those who have wronged of these [people] will be struck [i.e., afflicted] by the evil consequences of what they earned; and they will not cause failure.1
translations.PICKTHALL: But the evils that they earned smote them; and such of these as do wrong, the evils that they earn will smite them; they cannot escape.

translations.SAHIH: Do they not know that Allāh extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
translations.PICKTHALL: Know they not that Allah enlargeth providence for whom He will, and straiteneth it (for whom He will). Lo! herein verily are portents for people who believe.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of Allāh. Indeed, Allāh forgives all sins.1 Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: O My slaves who have been prodigal to their own hurt! Despair not of the mercy of Allah, Who forgiveth all sins. Lo! He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: And return [in repentance] to your Lord and submit to Him before the punishment comes upon you; then you will not be helped.
translations.PICKTHALL: Turn unto your Lord repentant, and surrender unto Him, before there come unto you the doom, when ye cannot be helped.

translations.SAHIH: And follow the best of what was revealed to you from your Lord [i.e., the Qur’ān] before the punishment comes upon you suddenly while you do not perceive,
translations.PICKTHALL: And follow the better (guidance) of that which is revealed unto you from your Lord, before the doom cometh on you suddenly when ye know not,

translations.SAHIH: Lest a soul should say,1 "Oh, [how great is] my regret over what I neglected in regard to Allāh and that I was among the mockers."
translations.PICKTHALL: Lest any soul should say: Alas, my grief that I was unmindful of Allah, and I was indeed among the scoffers!

translations.SAHIH: Or [lest] it say, "If only Allāh had guided me, I would have been among the righteous."
translations.PICKTHALL: Or should say: If Allah had but guided me I should have been among the dutiful!

translations.SAHIH: Or [lest] it say when it sees the punishment, "If only I had another turn1 so I could be among the doers of good."
translations.PICKTHALL: Or should say, when it seeth the doom: Oh, that I had but a second chance that I might be among the righteous!

translations.SAHIH: But yes, there had come to you My verses, but you denied them and were arrogant, and you were among the disbelievers.
translations.PICKTHALL: (But now the answer will be): Nay, for My revelations came unto thee, but thou didst deny them and wast scornful and wast among the disbelievers.

translations.SAHIH: And on the Day of Resurrection you will see those who lied about Allāh [with] their faces blackened. Is there not in Hell a residence for the arrogant?
translations.PICKTHALL: And on the Day of Resurrection thou (Muhammad) seest those who lied concerning Allah with their faces blackened. Is not the home of the scorners in hell?

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh will save those who feared Him by their attainment;1 no evil will touch them, nor will they grieve.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Allah delivereth those who ward off (evil) because of their deserts. Evil toucheth them not, nor do they grieve.

translations.SAHIH: Allāh is the Creator of all things, and He is, over all things, Disposer of affairs.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah is Creator of all things, and He is Guardian over all things.

translations.SAHIH: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. And they who disbelieve in the verses of Allāh - it is those who are the losers.
translations.PICKTHALL: His are the keys of the heavens and the earth, and they who disbelieve the revelations of Allah - such are they who are the losers.

translations.SAHIH: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Is it other than Allāh that you order me to worship, O ignorant ones?"
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (O Muhammad, to the disbelievers): Do ye bid me serve other than Allah? O ye fools!

translations.SAHIH: And it was already revealed to you and to those before you that if you should associate [anything] with Allāh, your work would surely become worthless, and you would surely be among the losers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily it hath been revealed unto thee as unto those before thee (saying): If thou ascribe a partner to Allah thy work will fail and thou indeed wilt be among the losers.

translations.SAHIH: Rather, worship [only] Allāh and be among the grateful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but Allah must thou serve, and be among the thankful!

translations.SAHIH: They have not appraised Allāh with true appraisal,1 while the earth entirely will be [within] His grip2 on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens will be folded in His right hand.3 Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they esteem not Allah as He hath the right to be esteemed, when the whole earth is His handful on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens are rolled in His right hand. Glorified is He and High Exalted from all that they ascribe as partner (unto Him).

translations.SAHIH: And the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will fall dead except whom Allāh wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing, looking on.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the trumpet is blown, and all who are in the heavens and all who are in the earth swoon away, save him whom Allah willeth. Then it is blown a second time, and behold them standing waiting!

translations.SAHIH: And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the record [of deeds] will be placed, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought, and it will be judged between them in truth, and they will not be wronged.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the earth shineth with the light of her Lord, and the Book is set up, and the prophets and the witnesses are brought, and it is judged between them with truth, and they are not wronged.

translations.SAHIH: And every soul will be fully compensated [for] what it did; and He is most knowing1 of what they do.
translations.PICKTHALL: And each soul is paid in full for what it did. And He is Best Aware of what they do.

translations.SAHIH: And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups until, when they reach it, its gates are opened and its keepers will say, "Did there not come to you messengers from yourselves, reciting to you the verses of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say, "Yes, but the word [i.e., decree] of punishment has come into effect upon the disbelievers."
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who disbelieve are driven unto hell in troops till, when they reach it and the gates thereof are opened, and the warders thereof say unto them: Came there not unto you messengers of your own, reciting unto you the revelations of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this your Day? they say: Yea, verily. But the word of doom of disbelievers is fulfilled.

translations.SAHIH: [To them] it will be said, "Enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein, and wretched is the residence of the arrogant."
translations.PICKTHALL: It is said (unto them): Enter ye the gates of hell to dwell therein. Thus hapless is the journey's end of the scorners.

translations.SAHIH: But those who feared their Lord will be driven to Paradise in groups until, when they reach it while its gates have been opened and its keepers say, "Peace be upon you; you have become pure; so enter it to abide eternally therein," [they will enter].1
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who keep their duty to their Lord are driven unto the Garden in troops till, when they reach it, and the gates thereof are opened, and the warders thereof say unto them: Peace be unto you! Ye are good, so enter ye (the Garden of delight), to dwell therein;

translations.SAHIH: And they will say, "Praise to Allāh, who has fulfilled for us His promise and made us inherit the earth [so] we may settle in Paradise wherever we will. And excellent is the reward of [righteous] workers."
translations.PICKTHALL: They say: Praise be to Allah, Who hath fulfilled His promise unto us and hath made us inherit the land, sojourning in the Garden where we will! So bounteous is the wage of workers.

translations.SAHIH: And you will see the angels surrounding the Throne, exalting [Allāh] with praise of their Lord. And it will be judged between them in truth, and it will be said, "[All] praise to Allāh, Lord of the worlds."
translations.PICKTHALL: And thou (O Muhammad) seest the angels thronging round the Throne, hymning the praises of their Lord. And they are judged aright. And it is said: Praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds!

translations.SAHIH: Ḥā, Meem.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Ha. Mim.

translations.SAHIH: The revelation of the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] is from Allāh, the Exalted in Might, the Knowing,
translations.PICKTHALL: The revelation of the Scripture is from Allah, the Mighty, the Knower,

translations.SAHIH: The forgiver of sin, acceptor of repentance, severe in punishment, owner of abundance. There is no deity except Him; to Him is the destination.
translations.PICKTHALL: The Forgiver of sin, the Accepter of repentance, the Stern in punishment, the Bountiful. There is no Allah save Him. Unto Him is the journeying.

translations.SAHIH: No one disputes concerning the signs of Allāh except those who disbelieve, so be not deceived by their [uninhibited] movement throughout the land.
translations.PICKTHALL: None argue concerning the revelations of Allah save those who disbelieve, so let not their turn of fortune in the land deceive thee (O Muhammad).

translations.SAHIH: The people of Noah denied before them and the [disbelieving] factions after them, and every nation intended [a plot] for their messenger to seize him, and they disputed by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth. So I seized them, and how [terrible] was My penalty.
translations.PICKTHALL: The folk of Noah and the factions after them denied (their messengers) before these, and every nation purposed to seize their messenger and argued falsely, (thinking) thereby to refute the Truth. Then I seized them, and how (awful) was My punishment.

translations.SAHIH: And thus has the word [i.e., decree] of your Lord come into effect upon those who disbelieved that they are companions of the Fire.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus was the word of thy Lord concerning those who disbelieve fulfilled: That they are owners of the Fire.

translations.SAHIH: Those [angels] who carry the Throne and those around it exalt [Allāh] with praise of their Lord and believe in Him and ask forgiveness for those who have believed, [saying], "Our Lord, You have encompassed all things in mercy and knowledge, so forgive those who have repented and followed Your way and protect them from the punishment of Hellfire.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who bear the Throne, and all who are round about it, hymn the praises of their Lord and believe in Him and ask forgiveness for those who believe (saying): Our Lord! Thou comprehendest all things in mercy and knowledge, therefor forgive those who repent and follow Thy way. Ward off from them the punishment of hell.

translations.SAHIH: Our Lord, and admit them to gardens of perpetual residence which You have promised them and whoever was righteous among their forefathers, their spouses and their offspring. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
translations.PICKTHALL: Our Lord! And make them enter the Gardens of Eden which thou hast promised them, with such of their fathers and their wives and their descendants as do right. Lo! Thou, only Thou, art the Mighty, the Wise.

translations.SAHIH: And protect them from the evil consequences [of their deeds]. And he whom You protect from evil consequences that Day - You will have given him mercy. And that is the great attainment."
translations.PICKTHALL: And ward off from them ill-deeds; and he from whom Thou wardest off ill-deeds that day, him verily hast Thou taken into mercy. That is the supreme triumph.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those who disbelieve will be addressed, "The hatred of Allāh for you was [even] greater than your hatred of yourselves [this Day in Hell] when you were invited to faith, but you disbelieved [i.e., refused]."
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! (on that day) those who disbelieve are informed by proclamation: Verily Allah's abhorrence is more terrible than your abhorrence one of another, when ye were called unto the faith but did refuse.

translations.SAHIH: They will say, "Our Lord, You made us lifeless twice and gave us life twice, and we have confessed our sins. So is there to an exit any way?"
translations.PICKTHALL: They say: Our Lord! Twice hast Thou made us die, and twice hast Thou made us live. Now we confess our sins. Is there any way to go out?

translations.SAHIH: [They will be told], "That is because, when Allāh was called upon alone, you disbelieved; but if others were associated with Him, you believed. So the judgement is with Allāh, the Most High, the Grand."
translations.PICKTHALL: (It is said unto them): This is (your plight) because, when Allah only was invoked, ye disbelieved, but when some partner was ascribed to Him ye were believing. But the command belongeth only to Allah, the Sublime, the Majestic.

translations.SAHIH: It is He who shows you His signs and sends down to you from the sky, provision. But none will remember except he who turns back [in repentance].
translations.PICKTHALL: He it is Who showeth you His portents, and sendeth down for you provision from the sky. None payeth heed save him who turneth (unto Him) repentant.

translations.SAHIH: So invoke Allāh, [being] sincere to Him in religion, although the disbelievers dislike it.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor (O believers) pray unto Allah, making religion pure for Him (only), however much the disbelievers be averse -

translations.SAHIH: [He is] the Exalted above [all] degrees, Owner of the Throne; He places the inspiration of His command [i.e., revelation] upon whom He wills of His servants to warn of the Day of Meeting.
translations.PICKTHALL: The Exalter of Ranks, the Lord of the Throne. He causeth the Spirit of His command upon whom He will of His slaves, that He may warn of the Day of Meeting,

translations.SAHIH: The Day they come forth nothing concerning them will be concealed from Allāh. To whom belongs [all] sovereignty this Day? To Allāh, the One, the Prevailing.1
translations.PICKTHALL: The day when they come forth, nothing of them being hidden from Allah. Whose is the Sovereignty this day? It is Allah's, the One, the Almighty.

translations.SAHIH: This Day every soul will be recompensed for what it earned. No injustice today! Indeed, Allāh is swift in account.
translations.PICKTHALL: This day is each soul requited that which it hath earned; no wrong (is done) this day. Lo! Allah is swift at reckoning.

translations.SAHIH: And warn them, [O Muḥammad], of the Approaching Day, when hearts are at the throats, filled [with distress]. For the wrongdoers there will be no devoted friend and no intercessor [who is] obeyed.
translations.PICKTHALL: Warn them (O Muhammad) of the Day of the approaching (doom), when the hearts will be choking the throats, (when) there will be no friend for the wrong-doers, nor any intercessor who will be heard.

translations.SAHIH: He knows that which deceives the eyes and what the breasts conceal.
translations.PICKTHALL: He knoweth the traitor of the eyes, and that which the bosoms hide.

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh judges with truth, while those they invoke1 besides Him judge not with anything. Indeed, Allāh - He is the Hearing, the Seeing.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah judgeth with truth, while those to whom they cry instead of Him judge not at all. Lo! Allah, He is the Hearer, the Seer.

translations.SAHIH: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those who were before them? They were greater than them in strength and in impression on the land, but Allāh seized them for their sins. And they had not from Allāh any protector.
translations.PICKTHALL: Have they not travelled in the land to see the nature of the consequence for those who disbelieved before them? They were mightier than these in power and (in the) traces (which they left behind them) in the earth. Yet Allah seized them for their sins, and they had no protector from Allah.

translations.SAHIH: That was because their messengers were coming to them with clear proofs, but they disbelieved, so Allāh seized them. Indeed, He is Powerful and severe in punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: That was because their messengers kept bringing them clear proofs (of Allah's Sovereignty) but they disbelieved; so Allah seized them. Lo! He is Strong, severe in punishment.

translations.SAHIH: And We did certainly send Moses with Our signs and a clear authority1
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations and a clear warrant

translations.SAHIH: To Pharaoh, Hāmān and Qārūn, but they said, "[He is] a magician and a liar."
translations.PICKTHALL: Unto Pharaoh and Haman and Korah, but they said: A lying sorcerer!

translations.SAHIH: And when he brought them the truth from Us, they said, "Kill the sons of those who have believed with him and keep their women alive." But the plan of the disbelievers is not except in error.
translations.PICKTHALL: And when he brought them the Truth from Our presence, they said: Slay the sons of those who believe with him, and spare their women. But the plot of disbelievers is in naught but error.

translations.SAHIH: And Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Moses and let him call upon his Lord. Indeed, I fear that he will change your religion or that he will cause corruption1 in the land."
translations.PICKTHALL: And Pharaoh said: Suffer me to kill Moses, and let him cry unto his Lord. Lo! I fear that he will alter your religion or that he will cause confusion in the land.

translations.SAHIH: But Moses said, "Indeed, I have sought refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Account."
translations.PICKTHALL: Moses said: Lo! I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every scorner who believeth not in a Day of Reckoning.

translations.SAHIH: And a believing man from the family of Pharaoh who concealed his faith said, "Do you kill a man [merely] because he says, 'My Lord is Allāh' while he has brought you clear proofs from your Lord? And if he should be lying, then upon him is [the consequence of] his lie; but if he should be truthful, there will strike you some of what he promises you. Indeed, Allāh does not guide one who is a transgressor and a liar.
translations.PICKTHALL: And a believing man of Pharaoh's family, who hid his faith, said: Would ye kill a man because he saith: My Lord is Allah, and hath brought you clear proofs from your Lord? If he is lying, then his lie is upon him; and if he is truthful, then some of that wherewith he threateneth you will strike you. Lo! Allah guideth not one who is a prodigal, a liar.

translations.SAHIH: O my people, sovereignty is yours today, [your being] dominant in the land. But who would protect us from the punishment of Allāh if it came to us?" Pharaoh said, "I do not show you except what I see, and I do not guide you except to the way of right conduct."
translations.PICKTHALL: O my people! Yours is the kingdom to-day, ye being uppermost in the land. But who would save us from the wrath of Allah should it reach us? Pharaoh said: I do but show you what I think, and I do but guide you to wise policy.

translations.SAHIH: And he who believed said, "O my people, indeed I fear for you [a fate] like the day of the companies1 -
translations.PICKTHALL: And he who believed said: O my people! Lo! I fear for you a fate like that of the factions (of old);

translations.SAHIH: Like the custom of the people of Noah and of ʿAad and Thamūd and those after them. And Allāh wants no injustice for [His] servants.
translations.PICKTHALL: A plight like that of Noah's folk, and A'ad and Thamud, and those after them, and Allah willeth no injustice for (His) slaves.

translations.SAHIH: And O my people, indeed I fear for you the Day of Calling1 -
translations.PICKTHALL: And, O my people! Lo! I fear for you a Day of Summoning,

translations.SAHIH: The Day you will turn your backs fleeing; there is not for you from Allāh any protector. And whoever Allāh sends astray - there is not for him any guide.
translations.PICKTHALL: A day when ye will turn to flee, having no preserver from Allah: and he whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no guide.

translations.SAHIH: And Joseph had already come to you before with clear proofs, but you remained in doubt of that which he brought to you, until when he died, you said, 'Never will Allāh send a messenger after him.' Thus does Allāh leave astray he who is a transgressor and skeptic."
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily Joseph brought you of old clear proofs, yet ye ceased not to be in doubt concerning what he brought you till, when he died, ye said: Allah will not send any messenger after him. Thus Allah deceiveth him who is a prodigal, a doubter.
