translations.PICKTHALL: When the two Receivers receive (him), seated on the right hand and on the left,

translations.SAHIH: He [i.e., man] utters no word except that with him is an observer prepared [to record].
translations.PICKTHALL: He uttereth no word but there is with him an observer ready.

translations.SAHIH: And the intoxication of death will bring the truth; that is what you were trying to avoid.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the agony of death cometh in truth. (And it is said unto him): This is that which thou wast wont to shun.

translations.SAHIH: And the Horn will be blown. That is the Day of [carrying out] the threat.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the trumpet is blown. This is the threatened Day.

translations.SAHIH: And every soul will come, with it a driver and a witness.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And every soul cometh, along with it a driver and a witness.

translations.SAHIH: [It will be said], "You were certainly in unmindfulness of this, and We have removed from you your cover,1 so your sight, this Day, is sharp."
translations.PICKTHALL: (And unto the evil-doer it is said): Thou wast in heedlessness of this. Now We have removed from thee thy covering, and piercing is thy sight this day.

translations.SAHIH: And his companion, [the angel], will say, "This [record] is what is with me, prepared."
translations.PICKTHALL: And (unto the evil-doer) his comrade saith: This is that which I have ready (as testimony).

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh will say], "Throw into Hell every obstinate disbeliever,
translations.PICKTHALL: (And it is said): Do ye twain hurl to hell each rebel ingrate,

translations.SAHIH: Preventer of good, aggressor, and doubter,
translations.PICKTHALL: Hinderer of good, transgressor, doubter,

translations.SAHIH: Who made [as equal] with Allāh another deity; then throw him into the severe punishment."
translations.PICKTHALL: Who setteth up another god along with Allah. Do ye twain hurl him to the dreadful doom.

translations.SAHIH: His [devil] companion will say, "Our Lord, I did not make him transgress, but he [himself] was in extreme error."
translations.PICKTHALL: His comrade saith: Our Lord! I did not cause him to rebel, but he was (himself) far gone in error.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh] will say, "Do not dispute before Me, while I had already presented to you the threat [i.e., warning].
translations.PICKTHALL: He saith: Contend not in My presence, when I had already proffered unto you the warning.

translations.SAHIH: The word [i.e., decree] will not be changed with Me, and never will I be unjust to the servants."
translations.PICKTHALL: The sentence that cometh from Me cannot be changed, and I am in no wise a tyrant unto the slaves.

translations.SAHIH: On the Day We will say to Hell, "Have you been filled?" and it will say, "Are there some more,"
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when We say unto hell: Art thou filled? and it saith: Can there be more to come?

translations.SAHIH: And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous, not far,
translations.PICKTHALL: And the Garden is brought nigh for those who kept from evil, no longer distant.

translations.SAHIH: [It will be said], "This is what you were promised - for every returner [to Allāh] and keeper [of His covenant].
translations.PICKTHALL: (And it is said): This is that which ye were promised. (It is) for every penitent and heedful one,

translations.SAHIH: Who feared the Most Merciful in the unseen and came with a heart returning [in repentance].
translations.PICKTHALL: Who feareth the Beneficent in secret and cometh with a contrite heart.

translations.SAHIH: Enter it in peace. This is the Day of Eternity."
translations.PICKTHALL: Enter it in peace. This is the day of immortality.

translations.SAHIH: They will have whatever they wish therein, and with Us is more.
translations.PICKTHALL: There they have all that they desire, and there is more with Us.

translations.SAHIH: And how many a generation before them did We destroy who were greater than them in [striking] power and had explored throughout the lands. Is there any place of escape?
translations.PICKTHALL: And how many a generation We destroyed before them, who were mightier than these in prowess so that they overran the lands! Had they any place of refuge (when the judgment came)?

translations.SAHIH: Indeed in that is a reminder for whoever has a heart or who listens while he is present [in mind].
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! therein verily is a reminder for him who hath a heart, or giveth ear with full intelligence.

translations.SAHIH: And We did certainly create the heavens and earth and what is between them in six days, and there touched Us no weariness.
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily We created the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, in six Days, and naught of weariness touched Us.

translations.SAHIH: So be patient, [O Muḥammad], over what they say and exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting,
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor (O Muhammad) bear with what they say, and hymn the praise of thy Lord before the rising and before the setting of the sun;

translations.SAHIH: And [in part] of the night exalt Him and after prostration [i.e., prayer].
translations.PICKTHALL: And in the night-time hymn His praise, and after the (prescribed) prostrations.

translations.SAHIH: And listen on the Day when the Caller1 will call out from a place that is near -
translations.PICKTHALL: And listen on the day when the crier crieth from a near place,

translations.SAHIH: The Day they will hear the blast [of the Horn] in truth. That is the Day of Emergence [from the graves].
translations.PICKTHALL: The day when they will hear the (Awful) Cry in truth. That is the day of coming forth (from the graves).

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and to Us is the destination
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We it is Who quicken and give death, and unto Us is the journeying.

translations.SAHIH: On the Day the earth breaks away from them [and they emerge] rapidly; that is a gathering easy for Us.
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when the earth splitteth asunder from them, hastening forth (they come). That is a gathering easy for Us (to make).

translations.SAHIH: We are most knowing of what they say, and you are not over them a tyrant.1 But remind by the Qur’ān whoever fears My threat.
translations.PICKTHALL: We are Best Aware of what they say, and thou (O Muhammad) art in no wise a compeller over them. But warn by the Qur'an him who feareth My threat.

translations.SAHIH: By the [winds] scattering [dust], dispersing [it]
translations.PICKTHALL: By those that winnow with a winnowing

translations.SAHIH: And the [clouds] carrying a load [of water]
translations.PICKTHALL: And those that bear the burden (of the rain)

translations.SAHIH: And the ships sailing with ease
translations.PICKTHALL: And those that glide with ease (upon the sea)

translations.SAHIH: And the [angels] apportioning [each] matter,
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who distribute (blessings) by command,

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, what you are promised is true.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! that wherewith ye are threatened is indeed true,

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, the recompense is to occur.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! the judgment will indeed befall.

translations.SAHIH: By the heaven containing pathways,1
translations.PICKTHALL: By the heaven full of paths,

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, you are in differing speech.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! ye, forsooth, are of various opinion (concerning the truth).

translations.SAHIH: Deluded away from it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is he who is deluded.
translations.PICKTHALL: He is made to turn away from it who is (himself) averse.

translations.SAHIH: Destroyed are the misinformers1
translations.PICKTHALL: Accursed be the conjecturers

translations.SAHIH: Who are within a flood [of confusion] and heedless.
translations.PICKTHALL: Who are careless in an abyss!

translations.SAHIH: They ask, "When is the Day of Recompense?"
translations.PICKTHALL: They ask: When is the Day of Judgment?

translations.SAHIH: [It is] the Day they will be tormented over the Fire.
translations.PICKTHALL: (It is) the day when they will be tormented at the Fire,

translations.SAHIH: [And will be told], "Taste your torment. This is that for which you were impatient."
translations.PICKTHALL: (And it will be said unto them): Taste your torment (which ye inflicted). This is what ye sought to hasten.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and springs,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who keep from evil will dwell amid gardens and watersprings,

translations.SAHIH: Accepting what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were before that doers of good.
translations.PICKTHALL: Taking that which their Lord giveth them; for lo! aforetime they were doers of good;

translations.SAHIH: They used to sleep but little of the night,1
translations.PICKTHALL: They used to sleep but little of the night,

translations.SAHIH: And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness,
translations.PICKTHALL: And ere the dawning of each day would seek forgiveness,

translations.SAHIH: And from their properties was [given] the right of the [needy] petitioner and the deprived.
translations.PICKTHALL: And in their wealth the beggar and the outcast had due share.

translations.SAHIH: And on the earth are signs for the certain [in faith]
translations.PICKTHALL: And in the earth are portents for those whose faith is sure.

translations.SAHIH: And in yourselves. Then will you not see?
translations.PICKTHALL: And (also) in yourselves. Can ye then not see?

translations.SAHIH: And in the heaven is your provision and whatever you are promised.
translations.PICKTHALL: And in the heaven is your providence and that which ye are promised;

translations.SAHIH: Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth, indeed, it is truth - just as [sure as] it is that you are speaking.
translations.PICKTHALL: And by the Lord of the heavens and the earth, it is the truth, even as (it is true) that ye speak.

translations.SAHIH: Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham?1 -
translations.PICKTHALL: Hath the story of Abraham's honoured guests reached thee (O Muhammad)?

translations.SAHIH: When they entered upon him and said, "[We greet you with] peace." He answered, "[And upon you] peace; [you are] a people unknown."
translations.PICKTHALL: When they came in unto him and said: Peace! he answered, Peace! (and thought): Folk unknown (to me).

translations.SAHIH: Then he went to his family and came with a fat [roasted] calf.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then he went apart unto his housefolk so that they brought a fatted calf;

translations.SAHIH: And placed it near them; he said, "Will you not eat?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And he set it before them, saying: Will ye not eat?

translations.SAHIH: And he felt from them apprehension.1 They said, "Fear not," and gave him good tidings of a learned boy.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then he conceived a fear of them. They said: Fear not! and gave him tidings of (the birth of) a wise son.

translations.SAHIH: And his wife approached with a cry [of alarm] and struck her face and said, "[I am] a barren old woman!"
translations.PICKTHALL: Then his wife came forward, making moan, and smote her face, and cried: A barren old woman!

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Thus has said your Lord; indeed, He is the Wise, the Knowing."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Even so saith thy Lord. Lo! He is the Wise, the Knower.

translations.SAHIH: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"
translations.PICKTHALL: (Abraham) said: And (afterward) what is your errand, O ye sent (from Allah)?

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals1
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Lo! we are sent unto a guilty folk,

translations.SAHIH: To send down upon them stones of clay,
translations.PICKTHALL: That we may send upon them stones of clay,

translations.SAHIH: Marked in the presence of your Lord for the transgressors."
translations.PICKTHALL: Marked by thy Lord for (the destruction of) the wanton.

translations.SAHIH: So We brought out whoever was in them [i.e., the cities] of the believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then we brought forth such believers as were there.

translations.SAHIH: And We found not within them other than a [single] house of Muslims.1
translations.PICKTHALL: But We found there but one house of those surrendered (to Allah).

translations.SAHIH: And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We left behind therein a portent for those who fear a painful doom.

translations.SAHIH: And in Moses [was a sign], when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And in Moses (too, there is a portent) when We sent him unto Pharaoh with clear warrant,

translations.SAHIH: But he turned away with his supporters and said, "A magician or a madman."
translations.PICKTHALL: But he withdrew (confiding) in his might, and said: A wizard or a madman.

translations.SAHIH: So We took him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea, and he was blameworthy.
translations.PICKTHALL: So We seized him and his hosts and flung them in the sea, for he was reprobate.

translations.SAHIH: And in ʿAad [was a sign], when We sent against them the barren wind.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And in (the tribe of) A'ad (there is a portent) when we sent the fatal wind against them.

translations.SAHIH: It left nothing of what it came upon but that it made it like disintegrated ruins.
translations.PICKTHALL: It spared naught that it reached, but made it (all) as dust.

translations.SAHIH: And in Thamūd, when it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a time."
translations.PICKTHALL: And in (the tribe of) Thamud (there is a portent) when it was told them: Take your ease awhile.

translations.SAHIH: But they were insolent toward the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on.
translations.PICKTHALL: But they rebelled against their Lord's decree, and so the thunderbolt overtook them even while they gazed;

translations.SAHIH: And they were unable to arise, nor could they defend themselves.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they were unable to rise up, nor could they help themselves.

translations.SAHIH: And [We destroyed] the people of Noah before; indeed, they were a people defiantly disobedient.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the folk of Noah aforetime. Lo! they were licentious folk.

translations.SAHIH: And the heaven We constructed with strength,1 and indeed, We are [its] expander.
translations.PICKTHALL: We have built the heaven with might, and We it is Who make the vast extent (thereof).

translations.SAHIH: And the earth We have spread out, and excellent is the preparer.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the earth have We laid out, how gracious is the Spreader (thereof)!

translations.SAHIH: And of all things We created two mates [i.e., counterparts]; perhaps you will remember.
translations.PICKTHALL: And all things We have created by pairs, that haply ye may reflect.

translations.SAHIH: So flee to Allāh.1 Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor flee unto Allah; lo! I am a plain warner unto you from him.

translations.SAHIH: And do not make [as equal] with Allāh another deity. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
translations.PICKTHALL: And set not any other god along with Allah; lo! I am a plain warner unto you from Him.

translations.SAHIH: Similarly, there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said, "A magician or a madman."
translations.PICKTHALL: Even so there came no messenger unto those before them but they said: A wizard or a madman!

translations.SAHIH: Did they suggest it to them?1 Rather, they [themselves] are a transgressing people.
translations.PICKTHALL: Have they handed down (the saying) as an heirloom one unto another? Nay, but they are froward folk.

translations.SAHIH: So leave them, [O Muḥammad], for you are not to be blamed.
translations.PICKTHALL: So withdraw from them (O Muhammad), for thou art in no wise blameworthy,

translations.SAHIH: And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And warn, for warning profiteth believers.

translations.SAHIH: And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.
translations.PICKTHALL: I created the jinn and humankind only that they might worship Me.

translations.SAHIH: I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.
translations.PICKTHALL: I seek no livelihood from them, nor do I ask that they should feed Me.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it is Allāh who is the [continual] Provider,1 the firm possessor of strength.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! Allah! He it is that giveth livelihood, the Lord of unbreakable might.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a portion [of punishment] like the portion of their companions [i.e., predecessors], so let them not impatiently urge Me.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! for those who (now) do wrong there is an evil day like unto the evil day (which came for) their likes (of old); so let them not ask Me to hasten on (that day).

translations.SAHIH: And woe to those who have disbelieved from their Day which they are promised.
translations.PICKTHALL: And woe unto those who disbelieve, from (that) their day which they are promised.

translations.SAHIH: By the mount
translations.PICKTHALL: By the Mount,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] a Book inscribed1
translations.PICKTHALL: And a Scripture inscribed

translations.SAHIH: In parchment spread open
translations.PICKTHALL: On fine parchment unrolled,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the frequented House1
translations.PICKTHALL: And the House frequented,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the ceiling [i.e., heaven] raised high
translations.PICKTHALL: And the roof exalted,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the sea set on fire,1
translations.PICKTHALL: And the sea kept filled,

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, the punishment of your Lord will occur.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! the doom of thy Lord will surely come to pass;

translations.SAHIH: Of it there is no preventer.
translations.PICKTHALL: There is none that can ward it off.

translations.SAHIH: On the Day the heaven will sway with circular motion
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when the heaven will heave with (awful) heaving,

translations.SAHIH: And the mountains will pass on, departing1 -
translations.PICKTHALL: And the mountains move away with (awful) movement,

translations.SAHIH: Then woe, that Day, to the deniers,
translations.PICKTHALL: Then woe that day unto the deniers

translations.SAHIH: Who are in [empty] discourse amusing themselves.
translations.PICKTHALL: Who play in talk of grave matters;

translations.SAHIH: The Day they are thrust toward the fire of Hell with a [violent] thrust, [its angels will say],
translations.PICKTHALL: The day when they are thrust with a (disdainful) thrust, into the fire of hell

translations.SAHIH: "This is the Fire which you used to deny.
translations.PICKTHALL: (And it is said unto them): This is the Fire which ye were wont to deny.

translations.SAHIH: Then is this magic, or do you not see?
translations.PICKTHALL: Is this magic, or do ye not see?

translations.SAHIH: [Enter to] burn therein; then be patient or impatient - it is all the same for you. You are only being recompensed [for] what you used to do."
translations.PICKTHALL: Endure the heat thereof, and whether ye are patient of it or impatient of it is all one for you. Ye are only being paid for what ye used to do.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and pleasure,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who kept their duty dwell in gardens and delight,

translations.SAHIH: Enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord protected them from the punishment of Hellfire.
translations.PICKTHALL: Happy because of what their Lord hath given them, and (because) their Lord hath warded off from them the torment of hell-fire.

translations.SAHIH: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."
translations.PICKTHALL: (And it is said unto them): Eat and drink in health (as a reward) for what ye used to do,

translations.SAHIH: They will be reclining on thrones lined up, and We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.
translations.PICKTHALL: Reclining on ranged couches. And we wed them unto fair ones with wide, lovely eyes.

translations.SAHIH: And those who believed and whose descendants followed them in faith - We will join with them their descendants, and We will not deprive them of anything of their deeds.1 Every person, for what he earned, is retained.2
translations.PICKTHALL: And they who believe and whose seed follow them in faith, We cause their seed to join them (there), and We deprive them of nought of their (life's) work. Every man is a pledge for that which he hath earned.

translations.SAHIH: And We will provide them with fruit and meat from whatever they desire.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We provide them with fruit and meat such as they desire.

translations.SAHIH: They will exchange with one another a cup [of wine] wherein [results] no ill speech or commission of sin.
translations.PICKTHALL: There they pass from hand to hand a cup wherein is neither vanity nor cause of sin.

translations.SAHIH: There will circulate among them [servant] boys [especially] for them, as if they were pearls well-protected.
translations.PICKTHALL: And there go round, waiting on them menservants of their own, as they were hidden pearls.

translations.SAHIH: And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.
translations.PICKTHALL: And some of them draw near unto others, questioning,

translations.SAHIH: They will say, "Indeed, we were previously among our people fearful [of displeasing Allāh].
translations.PICKTHALL: Saying: Lo! of old, when we were with our families, we were ever anxious;

translations.SAHIH: So Allāh conferred favor upon us and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.
translations.PICKTHALL: But Allah hath been gracious unto us and hath preserved us from the torment of the breath of Fire.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, we used to supplicate1 Him before. Indeed, it is He who is the Beneficent, the Merciful."
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! we used to pray unto Him of old. Lo! He is the Benign, the Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: So remind, [O Muḥammad], for you are not, by the favor of your Lord, a soothsayer or a madman.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor warn (men, O Muhammad). By the grace of Allah thou art neither soothsayer nor madman.

translations.SAHIH: Or do they say [of you], "A poet for whom we await a misfortune of time"?1
translations.PICKTHALL: Or say they: (he is) a poet, (one) for whom we may expect the accident of time?

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Wait, for indeed I am, with you, among the waiters."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (unto them): Except (your fill)! Lo! I am with you among the expectant.

translations.SAHIH: Or do their minds1 command them to [say] this, or are they a transgressing people?
translations.PICKTHALL: Do their minds command them to do this, or are they an outrageous folk?

translations.SAHIH: Or do they say, "He has made it up"? Rather, they do not believe.
translations.PICKTHALL: Or say they: He hath invented it? Nay, but they will not believe!

translations.SAHIH: Then let them produce a statement like it, if they should be truthful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then let them produce speech the like thereof, if they are truthful.

translations.SAHIH: Or were they created by nothing, or were they the creators [of themselves]?
translations.PICKTHALL: Or were they created out of naught? Or are they the creators?

translations.SAHIH: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Rather, they are not certain.
translations.PICKTHALL: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay, but they are sure of nothing!

translations.SAHIH: Or have they the depositories [containing the provision] of your Lord? Or are they the controllers [of them]?
translations.PICKTHALL: Or do they own the treasures of thy Lord? Or have they been given charge (thereof)?

translations.SAHIH: Or have they a stairway [into the heaven] upon which they listen? Then let their listener produce a clear authority [i.e., proof].
translations.PICKTHALL: Or have they any stairway (unto heaven) by means of which they overhear (decrees). Then let their listener produce some warrant manifest!

translations.SAHIH: Or has He daughters while you have sons?
translations.PICKTHALL: Or hath He daughters whereas ye have sons?

translations.SAHIH: Or do you, [O Muḥammad], ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
translations.PICKTHALL: Or askest thou (Muhammad) a fee from them so that they are plunged in debt?

translations.SAHIH: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?
translations.PICKTHALL: Or possess they the Unseen so that they can write (it) down?

translations.SAHIH: Or do they intend a plan? But those who disbelieve - they are the object of a plan.
translations.PICKTHALL: Or seek they to ensnare (the messenger)? But those who disbelieve, they are the ensnared!

translations.SAHIH: Or have they a deity other than Allāh? Exalted is Allāh above whatever they associate with Him.
translations.PICKTHALL: Or have they any god beside Allah? Glorified be Allah from all that they ascribe as partner (unto Him)!

translations.SAHIH: And if they were to see a fragment from the sky falling,1 they would say, "[It is merely] clouds heaped up."
translations.PICKTHALL: And if they were to see a fragment of the heaven falling, they would say: A heap of clouds.

translations.SAHIH: So leave them until they meet their Day in which they will be struck insensible -
translations.PICKTHALL: Then let them be (O Muhammad), till they meet their day, in which they will be thunder-stricken,

translations.SAHIH: The Day their plan will not avail them at all, nor will they be helped.
translations.PICKTHALL: A day in which their guile will naught avail them, nor will they be helped.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a punishment1 before that, but most of them do not know.
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily, for those who do wrong, there is a punishment beyond that. But most of them know not.

translations.SAHIH: And be patient, [O Muḥammad], for the decision of your Lord, for indeed, you are in Our eyes [i.e., sight]. And exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord when you arise
translations.PICKTHALL: So wait patiently (O Muhammad) for thy Lord's decree, for surely thou art in Our sight; and hymn the praise of thy Lord when thou uprisest,

translations.SAHIH: And in a part of the night exalt Him and after [the setting of] the stars.
translations.PICKTHALL: And in the night-time also hymn His praise, and at the setting of the stars.

translations.SAHIH: By the star when it descends,
translations.PICKTHALL: By the Star when it setteth,

translations.SAHIH: Your companion [i.e., Muḥammad] has not strayed, nor has he erred,
translations.PICKTHALL: Your comrade erreth not, nor is deceived;

translations.SAHIH: Nor does he speak from [his own] inclination.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nor doth he speak of (his own) desire.

translations.SAHIH: It is not but a revelation revealed,
translations.PICKTHALL: It is naught save an inspiration that is inspired,

translations.SAHIH: Taught to him by one intense in strength [i.e., Gabriel] -
translations.PICKTHALL: Which one of mighty powers hath taught him,

translations.SAHIH: One of soundness.1 And he rose to [his] true form2
translations.PICKTHALL: One vigorous; and he grew clear to view

translations.SAHIH: While he was in the higher [part of the] horizon.1
translations.PICKTHALL: When he was on the uppermost horizon.

translations.SAHIH: Then he approached and descended
translations.PICKTHALL: Then he drew nigh and came down

translations.SAHIH: And was at a distance of two bow lengths or nearer.
translations.PICKTHALL: Till he was (distant) two bows' length or even nearer,

translations.SAHIH: And he revealed to His Servant1 what he revealed [i.e., conveyed].
translations.PICKTHALL: And He revealed unto His slave that which He revealed.

translations.SAHIH: The heart1 did not lie [about] what it saw.
translations.PICKTHALL: The heart lied not (in seeing) what it saw.

translations.SAHIH: So will you dispute with him over what he saw?
translations.PICKTHALL: Will ye then dispute with him concerning what he seeth?

translations.SAHIH: And he certainly saw him in another descent1
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily he saw him yet another time

translations.SAHIH: At the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary -
translations.PICKTHALL: By the lote-tree of the utmost boundary,

translations.SAHIH: Near it is the Garden of Refuge [i.e., Paradise] -
translations.PICKTHALL: Nigh unto which is the Garden of Abode.

translations.SAHIH: When there covered the Lote Tree that which covered [it].1
translations.PICKTHALL: When that which shroudeth did enshroud the lote-tree,

translations.SAHIH: The sight [of the Prophet (ﷺ)] did not swerve, nor did it transgress [its limit].
translations.PICKTHALL: The eye turned not aside nor yet was overbold.

translations.SAHIH: He certainly saw of the greatest signs of his Lord.
translations.PICKTHALL: Verily he saw one of the greater revelations of his Lord.

translations.SAHIH: So have you considered al-Lāt and al-ʿUzzā?
translations.PICKTHALL: Have ye thought upon Al-Lat and Al-'Uzza

translations.SAHIH: And Manāt, the third - the other one?1
translations.PICKTHALL: And Manat, the third, the other?

translations.SAHIH: Is the male for you and for Him the female?
translations.PICKTHALL: Are yours the males and His the females?

translations.SAHIH: That, then, is an unjust division.1
translations.PICKTHALL: That indeed were an unfair division!

translations.SAHIH: They are not but [mere] names you have named them - you and your forefathers - for which Allāh has sent down no authority. They follow not except assumption and what [their] souls desire, and there has already come to them from their Lord guidance.
translations.PICKTHALL: They are but names which ye have named, ye and your fathers, for which Allah hath revealed no warrant. They follow but a guess and that which (they) themselves desire. And now the guidance from their Lord hath come unto them.

translations.SAHIH: Or is there for man whatever he wishes?
translations.PICKTHALL: Or shall man have what he coveteth?

translations.SAHIH: Rather, to Allāh belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].
translations.PICKTHALL: But unto Allah belongeth the after (life), and the former.

translations.SAHIH: And how many angels there are in the heavens whose intercession will not avail at all except [only] after Allāh has permitted [it] to whom He wills and approves.
translations.PICKTHALL: And how many angels are in the heavens whose intercession availeth naught save after Allah giveth leave to whom He chooseth and accepteth.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter name the angels female names,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! it is those who disbelieve in the Hereafter who name the angels with the names of females.

translations.SAHIH: And they have thereof no knowledge. They follow not except assumption, and indeed, assumption avails not against the truth at all.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they have no knowledge thereof. They follow but a guess, and lo! a guess can never take the place of the truth.

translations.SAHIH: So turn away from whoever turns his back on Our message and desires not except the worldly life.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then withdraw (O Muhammad) from him who fleeth from Our remembrance and desireth but the life of the world.

translations.SAHIH: That is their sum of knowledge. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who strays from His way, and He is most knowing of who is guided.
translations.PICKTHALL: Such is their sum of knowledge. Lo! thy Lord is Best Aware of him who strayeth, and He is Best Aware of him whom goeth right.

translations.SAHIH: And to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth - that He may recompense those who do evil with [the penalty of] what they have done and recompense those who do good with the best [reward] -
translations.PICKTHALL: And unto Allah belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth, that He may reward those who do evil with that which they have done, and reward those who do good with goodness.

translations.SAHIH: Those who avoid the major sins and immoralities, only [committing] slight ones. Indeed, your Lord is vast in forgiveness. He was most knowing of you when He produced you from the earth and when you were fetuses in the wombs of your mothers. So do not claim yourselves to be pure; He is most knowing of who fears Him.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who avoid enormities of sin and abominations, save the unwilled offences - (for them) lo! thy Lord is of vast mercy. He is Best Aware of you (from the time) when He created you from the earth, and when ye were hidden in the bellies of your mothers. Therefor ascribe not purity unto yourselves. He is Best Aware of him who wardeth off (evil).

translations.SAHIH: Have you seen the one who turned away
translations.PICKTHALL: Didst thou (O Muhammad) observe him who turned away,

translations.SAHIH: And gave a little and [then] refrained?
translations.PICKTHALL: And gave a little, then was grudging?

translations.SAHIH: Does he have knowledge of the unseen, so he sees?1
translations.PICKTHALL: Hath he knowledge of the Unseen so that he seeth?

translations.SAHIH: Or has he not been informed of what was in the scriptures of Moses
translations.PICKTHALL: Or hath he not had news of what is in the books of Moses

translations.SAHIH: And [of] Abraham, who fulfilled [his obligations] -
translations.PICKTHALL: And Abraham who paid his debt:

translations.SAHIH: That no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another
translations.PICKTHALL: That no laden one shall bear another's load,

translations.SAHIH: And that there is not for man except that [good] for which he strives
translations.PICKTHALL: And that man hath only that for which he maketh effort,

translations.SAHIH: And that his effort is going to be seen -
translations.PICKTHALL: And that his effort will be seen.

translations.SAHIH: Then he will be recompensed for it with the fullest recompense -
translations.PICKTHALL: And afterward he will be repaid for it with fullest payment;

translations.SAHIH: And that to your Lord is the finality
translations.PICKTHALL: And that thy Lord, He is the goal;

translations.SAHIH: And that it is He who makes [one] laugh and weep
translations.PICKTHALL: And that He it is who maketh laugh, and maketh weep,

translations.SAHIH: And that it is He who causes death and gives life
translations.PICKTHALL: And that He it is Who giveth death and giveth life;

translations.SAHIH: And that He creates the two mates - the male and female -
translations.PICKTHALL: And that He createth the two spouses, the male and the female,

translations.SAHIH: From a sperm-drop when it is emitted
translations.PICKTHALL: From a drop (of seed) when it is poured forth;

translations.SAHIH: And that [incumbent] upon Him is the other [i.e., next] creation.
translations.PICKTHALL: And that He hath ordained the second bringing forth;

translations.SAHIH: And that it is He who enriches and suffices
translations.PICKTHALL: And that He it is Who enricheth and contenteth;

translations.SAHIH: And that it is He who is the Lord of Sirius1.
translations.PICKTHALL: And that He it is Who is the Lord of Sirius;

translations.SAHIH: And that He destroyed the first [people of] ʿAad.
translations.PICKTHALL: And that He destroyed the former (tribe of) A'ad,

translations.SAHIH: And Thamūd - and He did not spare [them] -
translations.PICKTHALL: And (the tribe of) Thamud He spared not;

translations.SAHIH: And the people of Noah before. Indeed, it was they who were [even] more unjust and oppressing.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the folk of Noah aforetime, Lo! they were more unjust and more rebellious;

translations.SAHIH: And the overturned towns1 He hurled down.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Al-Mu'tafikah He destroyed

translations.SAHIH: And covered them by that which He covered.1
translations.PICKTHALL: So that there covered them that which did cover.

translations.SAHIH: Then which of the favors of your Lord do you doubt?
translations.PICKTHALL: Concerning which then, of the bounties of thy Lord, canst thou dispute?

translations.SAHIH: This [Prophet (ﷺ)] is a warner from [i.e., like] the former warners.
translations.PICKTHALL: This is a warner of the warners of old.

translations.SAHIH: The Approaching Day has approached.
translations.PICKTHALL: The threatened Hour is nigh.

translations.SAHIH: Of it, [from those] besides Allāh, there is no remover.
translations.PICKTHALL: None beside Allah can disclose it.

translations.SAHIH: Then at this statement do you wonder?
translations.PICKTHALL: Marvel ye then at this statement,

translations.SAHIH: And you laugh and do not weep
translations.PICKTHALL: And laugh and not weep,

translations.SAHIH: While you are proudly sporting?1
translations.PICKTHALL: While ye amuse yourselves?

translations.SAHIH: So prostrate to Allāh and worship [Him].
translations.PICKTHALL: Rather prostrate yourselves before Allah and serve Him.

translations.SAHIH: The Hour has come near, and the moon has split [in two].1
translations.PICKTHALL: The hour drew nigh and the moon was rent in twain.

translations.SAHIH: And if they see a sign [i.e., miracle], they turn away and say, "Passing magic."1
translations.PICKTHALL: And if they behold a portent they turn away and say: Prolonged illusion.

translations.SAHIH: And they denied and followed their inclinations. But for every matter is a [time of] settlement.
translations.PICKTHALL: They denied (the Truth) and followed their own lusts. Yet everything will come to a decision

translations.SAHIH: And there has already come to them of information that in which there is deterrence.
translations.PICKTHALL: And surely there hath come unto them news whereof the purport should deter,

translations.SAHIH: Extensive wisdom - but warning does not avail [them].
translations.PICKTHALL: Effective wisdom; but warnings avail not.

translations.SAHIH: So leave them, [O Muḥammad]. The Day the Caller1 calls to something forbidding,
translations.PICKTHALL: So withdraw from them (O Muhammad) on the day when the Summoner summoneth unto a painful thing.

translations.SAHIH: Their eyes humbled, they will emerge from the graves as if they were locusts spreading,
translations.PICKTHALL: With downcast eyes, they come forth from the graves as they were locusts spread abroad,

translations.SAHIH: Racing ahead toward the Caller. The disbelievers will say, "This is a difficult Day."
translations.PICKTHALL: Hastening toward the summoner; the disbelievers say: This is a hard day.

translations.SAHIH: The people of Noah denied before them, and they denied Our servant and said, "A madman," and he was repelled.
translations.PICKTHALL: The folk of Noah denied before them, yea, they denied Our slave and said: A madman; and he was repulsed.

translations.SAHIH: So he invoked his Lord, "Indeed, I am overpowered, so help."
translations.PICKTHALL: So he cried unto his Lord, saying: I am vanquished, so give help.

translations.SAHIH: Then We opened the gates of the heaven with rain pouring down
translations.PICKTHALL: Then opened We the gates of heaven with pouring water

translations.SAHIH: And caused the earth to burst with springs, and the waters met for a matter already predestined.
translations.PICKTHALL: And caused the earth to gush forth springs, so that the waters met for a predestined purpose.

translations.SAHIH: And We carried him on a [construction of] planks and nails,
translations.PICKTHALL: And We carried him upon a thing of planks and nails,

translations.SAHIH: Sailing under Our observation as reward for he who had been denied.
translations.PICKTHALL: That ran (upon the waters) in Our sight, as a reward for him who was rejected.

translations.SAHIH: And We left it as a sign, so is there any who will remember?
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily We left it as a token; but is there any that remembereth?

translations.SAHIH: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then see how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings!

translations.SAHIH: And We have certainly made the Qur’ān easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
translations.PICKTHALL: And in truth We have made the Qur'an easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth?

translations.SAHIH: ʿAad denied; and how [severe] were My punishment and warning.
translations.PICKTHALL: (The tribe of) A'ad rejected warnings. Then how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We sent upon them a screaming wind on a day of continuous misfortune,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We let loose on them a raging wind on a day of constant calamity,

translations.SAHIH: Extracting the people1 as if they were trunks of palm trees uprooted.
translations.PICKTHALL: Sweeping men away as though they were uprooted trunks of palm-trees.

translations.SAHIH: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then see how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings!

translations.SAHIH: And We have certainly made the Qur’ān easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
translations.PICKTHALL: And in truth We have made the Qur'an easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth?

translations.SAHIH: Thamūd denied the warning.
translations.PICKTHALL: (The tribe of) Thamud rejected warnings

translations.SAHIH: And said, "Is it one human being1 among us that we should follow? Indeed, we would then be in error and madness.
translations.PICKTHALL: For they said; Is it a mortal man, alone among us, that we are to follow? Then indeed we should fall into error and madness.

translations.SAHIH: Has the message been sent down upon him from among us? Rather, he is an insolent liar."
translations.PICKTHALL: Hath the remembrance been given unto him alone among us? Nay, but he is a rash liar.

translations.SAHIH: They will know tomorrow who is the insolent liar.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Unto their warner it was said): To-morrow they will know who is the rash liar.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We are sending the she-camel as trial for them, so watch them and be patient.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We are sending the she-camel as a test for them; so watch them and have patience;

translations.SAHIH: And inform them that the water is shared between them,1 each [day of] drink attended [by turn].
translations.PICKTHALL: And inform them that the water is to be shared between (her and) them. Every drinking will be witnessed.

translations.SAHIH: But they called their companion,1 and he dared2 and hamstrung [her].
translations.PICKTHALL: But they call their comrade and he took and hamstrung (her).

translations.SAHIH: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then see how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings!

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We sent upon them one shriek [i.e., blast from the sky], and they became like the dry twig fragments of an [animal] pen.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We sent upon them one Shout, and they became as the dry twigs (rejected by) the builder of a cattle-fold.

translations.SAHIH: And We have certainly made the Qur’ān easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
translations.PICKTHALL: And in truth We have made the Qur'an easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth?

translations.SAHIH: The people of Lot denied the warning.
translations.PICKTHALL: The folk of Lot rejected warnings.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We sent upon them a storm of stones, except the family of Lot - We saved them before dawn.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We sent a storm of stones upon them (all) save the family of Lot, whom We rescued in the last watch of the night,

translations.SAHIH: As favor from Us. Thus do We reward he who is grateful.
translations.PICKTHALL: As grace from Us. Thus We reward him who giveth thanks.

translations.SAHIH: And he had already warned them of Our assault, but they disputed the warning.
translations.PICKTHALL: And he indeed had warned them of Our blow, but they did doubt the warnings.

translations.SAHIH: And they had demanded from him his guests, but We obliterated their eyes, [saying], "Taste My punishment and warning."
translations.PICKTHALL: They even asked of him his guests for an ill purpose. Then We blinded their eyes (and said): Taste now My punishment after My warnings!

translations.SAHIH: And there came upon them by morning an abiding punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: And in truth the punishment decreed befell them early in the morning.

translations.SAHIH: So taste My punishment and warning.
translations.PICKTHALL: Now taste My punishment after My warnings!

translations.SAHIH: And We have certainly made the Qur’ān easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
translations.PICKTHALL: And in truth We have made the Qur'an easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth?

translations.SAHIH: And there certainly came to the people of Pharaoh warning.
translations.PICKTHALL: And warnings came in truth unto the house of Pharaoh

translations.SAHIH: They denied Our signs, all of them, so We seized them with a seizure of one Exalted in Might and Perfect in Ability.
translations.PICKTHALL: Who denied Our revelations, every one. Therefore We grasped them with the grasp of the Mighty, the Powerful.

translations.SAHIH: Are your disbelievers better than those [former ones], or have you immunity in the scriptures?
translations.PICKTHALL: Are your disbelievers better than those, or have ye some immunity in the scriptures?

translations.SAHIH: Or do they say, "We are an assembly supporting [each other]"?
translations.PICKTHALL: Or say they: We are a host victorious?

translations.SAHIH: [Their] assembly will be defeated, and they will turn their backs [in retreat].1
translations.PICKTHALL: The hosts will all be routed and will turn and flee.

translations.SAHIH: But the Hour is their appointment [for due punishment], and the Hour is more disastrous and more bitter.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but the Hour (of doom) is their appointed tryst, and the Hour will be more wretched and more bitter (than their earthly failure).

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, the criminals are in error and madness.1.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! the guilty are in error and madness.

translations.SAHIH: The Day they are dragged into the Fire on their faces [it will be said], "Taste the touch of Saqar."1
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when they are dragged into the Fire upon their faces (it is said unto them): Feel the touch of hell.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, all things We created with predestination.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We have created every thing by measure.

translations.SAHIH: And Our command is but one, like a glance of the eye.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Our commandment is but one (commandment), as the twinkling of an eye.

translations.SAHIH: And We have already destroyed your kinds,1 so is there any who will remember?
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily We have destroyed your fellows; but is there any that remembereth?

translations.SAHIH: And everything they did is in written records.
translations.PICKTHALL: And every thing they did is in the scriptures,

translations.SAHIH: And every small and great [thing] is inscribed.
translations.PICKTHALL: And every small and great thing is recorded.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and rivers,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! the righteous will dwell among gardens and rivers,

translations.SAHIH: In a seat of honor near a Sovereign, Perfect in Ability.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Firmly established in the favour of a Mighty King.

translations.SAHIH: The Most Merciful
translations.PICKTHALL: The Beneficent

translations.SAHIH: Taught the Qur’ān,
translations.PICKTHALL: Hath made known the Qur'an.

translations.SAHIH: Created man,
translations.PICKTHALL: He hath created man.

translations.SAHIH: [And] taught him eloquence.
translations.PICKTHALL: He hath taught him utterance.

translations.SAHIH: The sun and the moon [move] by precise calculation,
translations.PICKTHALL: The sun and the moon are made punctual.

translations.SAHIH: And the stars and trees prostrate.1
translations.PICKTHALL: The stars and the trees prostrate.

translations.SAHIH: And the heaven He raised and imposed the balance
translations.PICKTHALL: And the sky He hath uplifted; and He hath set the measure,

translations.SAHIH: That you not transgress within the balance.
translations.PICKTHALL: That ye exceed not the measure,

translations.SAHIH: And establish weight in justice and do not make deficient the balance.
translations.PICKTHALL: But observe the measure strictly, nor fall short thereof.

translations.SAHIH: And the earth He laid [out] for the creatures.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the earth hath He appointed for (His) creatures,

translations.SAHIH: Therein is fruit and palm trees having sheaths [of dates]
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherein are fruit and sheathed palm-trees,

translations.SAHIH: And grain having husks and scented plants.
translations.PICKTHALL: Husked grain and scented herb.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?1
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: He created man from clay like [that of] pottery.
translations.PICKTHALL: He created man of clay like the potter's,

translations.SAHIH: And He created the jinn from a smokeless flame of fire.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the jinn did He create of smokeless fire.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: [He is] Lord of the two sunrises and Lord of the two sunsets.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Lord of the two Easts, and Lord of the two Wests!

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: He released the two seas,1 meeting [one another];
translations.PICKTHALL: He hath loosed the two seas. They meet.

translations.SAHIH: Between them is a barrier so neither of them transgresses.
translations.PICKTHALL: There is a barrier between them. They encroach not (one upon the other).

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: From both of them emerge pearl and coral.
translations.PICKTHALL: There cometh forth from both of them the pearl and coral-stone.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: And to Him belong the ships [with sails] elevated in the sea like mountains.
translations.PICKTHALL: His are the ships displayed upon the sea, like banners.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: Everyone upon it [i.e., the earth] will perish,
translations.PICKTHALL: Everyone that is thereon will pass away;

translations.SAHIH: And there will remain the Face1 of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor.
translations.PICKTHALL: There remaineth but the Countenance of thy Lord of Might and Glory.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: Whoever is within the heavens and earth asks Him; every day He is in [i.e., bringing about] a matter.1
translations.PICKTHALL: All that are in the heavens and the earth entreat Him. Every day He exerciseth (universal) power.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: We will attend to you, O prominent beings.1
translations.PICKTHALL: We shall dispose of you, O ye two dependents (man and jinn).

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: O company of jinn and mankind, if you are able to pass beyond the regions of the heavens and the earth, then pass. You will not pass except by authority [from Allāh].
translations.PICKTHALL: O company of jinn and men, if ye have power to penetrate (all) regions of the heavens and the earth, then penetrate (them)! Ye will never penetrate them save with (Our) sanction.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: There will be sent upon you a flame of fire and smoke,1 and you will not defend yourselves.
translations.PICKTHALL: There will be sent, against you both, heat of fire and flash of brass, and ye will not escape.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: And when the heaven is split open and becomes rose-colored like oil1 -
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the heaven splitteth asunder and becometh rosy like red hide -

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny? -

translations.SAHIH: Then on that Day none will be asked about his sin among men or jinn.1
translations.PICKTHALL: On that day neither man nor jinni will be questioned of his sin.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: The criminals will be known by their marks, and they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet.
translations.PICKTHALL: The guilty will be known by their marks, and will be taken by the forelocks and the feet.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: This is Hell, which the criminals deny.
translations.PICKTHALL: This is hell which the guilty deny.

translations.SAHIH: They will circulate between it and scalding water, heated [to the utmost degree].
translations.PICKTHALL: They go circling round between it and fierce, boiling water.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: But for he who has feared the position of his Lord1 are two gardens -
translations.PICKTHALL: But for him who feareth the standing before his Lord there are two gardens.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: Having [spreading] branches.
translations.PICKTHALL: Of spreading branches.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: In both of them are two springs, flowing.
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherein are two fountains flowing.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: In both of them are of every fruit, two kinds.
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherein is every kind of fruit in pairs.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: [They are] reclining on beds whose linings are of silk brocade, and the fruit of the two gardens is hanging low.
translations.PICKTHALL: Reclining upon couches lined with silk brocade, the fruit of both the gardens near to hand.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: In them are women limiting [their] glances,1 untouched2 before them by man or jinnī -
translations.PICKTHALL: Therein are those of modest gaze, whom neither man nor jinni will have touched before them.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: As if they were rubies and coral.1
translations.PICKTHALL: (In beauty) like the jacynth and the coral-stone.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: Is the reward for good [anything] but good?
translations.PICKTHALL: Is the reward of goodness aught save goodness?

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: And below them both [in excellence] are two [other] gardens -
translations.PICKTHALL: And beside them are two other gardens,

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: Dark green [in color].
translations.PICKTHALL: Dark green with foliage.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: In both of them are two springs, spouting.
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherein are two abundant springs.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: In both of them are fruit and palm trees and pomegranates.
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherein is fruit, the date-palm and pomegranate.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: In them are good and beautiful women -
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherein (are found) the good and beautiful -

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny? -

translations.SAHIH: Fair ones reserved in pavilions -
translations.PICKTHALL: Fair ones, close-guarded in pavilions -

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny? -

translations.SAHIH: Untouched before them by man or jinnī -
translations.PICKTHALL: Whom neither man nor jinni will have touched before them -

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: Reclining on green cushions and beautiful fine carpets.
translations.PICKTHALL: Reclining on green cushions and fair carpets.

translations.SAHIH: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
translations.PICKTHALL: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

translations.SAHIH: Blessed is the name of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor.
translations.PICKTHALL: Blessed be the name of thy Lord, Mighty and glorious!

translations.SAHIH: When the Occurrence occurs,
translations.PICKTHALL: When the event befalleth -

translations.SAHIH: There is, at its occurrence, no denial.
translations.PICKTHALL: There is no denying that it will befall -

translations.SAHIH: It will bring down [some] and raise up [others].1
translations.PICKTHALL: Abasing (some), exalting (others);

translations.SAHIH: When the earth is shaken with convulsion
translations.PICKTHALL: When the earth is shaken with a shock

translations.SAHIH: And the mountains are broken down, crumbling
translations.PICKTHALL: And the hills are ground to powder

translations.SAHIH: And become dust dispersing,
translations.PICKTHALL: So that they become a scattered dust,

translations.SAHIH: And you become [of] three kinds:
translations.PICKTHALL: And ye will be three kinds:

translations.SAHIH: Then the companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?1
translations.PICKTHALL: (First) those on the right hand; what of those on the right hand?

translations.SAHIH: And the companions of the left - what are companions of the left?1
translations.PICKTHALL: And (then) those on the left hand; what of those on the left hand?

translations.SAHIH: And the forerunners, the forerunners1 -
translations.PICKTHALL: And the foremost in the race, the foremost in the race:

translations.SAHIH: Those are the ones brought near [to Allāh]
translations.PICKTHALL: Those are they who will be brought nigh

translations.SAHIH: In the Gardens of Pleasure,
translations.PICKTHALL: In gardens of delight;

translations.SAHIH: A [large] company of the former peoples
translations.PICKTHALL: A multitude of those of old

translations.SAHIH: And a few of the later peoples,
translations.PICKTHALL: And a few of those of later time.

translations.SAHIH: On thrones woven [with ornament],
translations.PICKTHALL: On lined couches,

translations.SAHIH: Reclining on them, facing each other.
translations.PICKTHALL: Reclining therein face to face.

translations.SAHIH: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal.
translations.PICKTHALL: There wait on them immortal youths

translations.SAHIH: With vessels, pitchers and a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring -
translations.PICKTHALL: With bowls and ewers and a cup from a pure spring

translations.SAHIH: No headache will they have therefrom, nor will they be intoxicated -
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherefrom they get no aching of the head nor any madness,

translations.SAHIH: And fruit of what they select
translations.PICKTHALL: And fruit that they prefer

translations.SAHIH: And the meat of fowl, from whatever they desire.
translations.PICKTHALL: And flesh of fowls that they desire.

translations.SAHIH: And [for them are] fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes,
translations.PICKTHALL: And (there are) fair ones with wide, lovely eyes,

translations.SAHIH: The likenesses of pearls well-protected,
translations.PICKTHALL: Like unto hidden pearls,

translations.SAHIH: As reward for what they used to do.
translations.PICKTHALL: Reward for what they used to do.

translations.SAHIH: They will not hear therein ill speech or commission of sin -
translations.PICKTHALL: There hear they no vain speaking nor recrimination

translations.SAHIH: Only a saying [of] peace, peace.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Naught) but the saying: Peace, (and again) Peace.

translations.SAHIH: The companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?
translations.PICKTHALL: And those on the right hand; what of those on the right hand?

translations.SAHIH: [They will be] among lote trees with thorns removed.
translations.PICKTHALL: Among thornless lote-trees

translations.SAHIH: And [banana] trees layered [with fruit].
translations.PICKTHALL: And clustered plantains,

translations.SAHIH: And shade extended.
translations.PICKTHALL: And spreading shade,

translations.SAHIH: And water poured out
translations.PICKTHALL: And water gushing,

translations.SAHIH: And fruit, abundant [and varied],
translations.PICKTHALL: And fruit in plenty

translations.SAHIH: Neither limited [to season] nor forbidden,
translations.PICKTHALL: Neither out of reach nor yet forbidden,

translations.SAHIH: And [upon] beds raised high.
translations.PICKTHALL: And raised couches;

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We have produced them [i.e., the women of Paradise] in a [new] creation
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We have created them a (new) creation

translations.SAHIH: And made them virgins,
translations.PICKTHALL: And made them virgins,

translations.SAHIH: Devoted [to their husbands] and of equal age,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lovers, friends,

translations.SAHIH: For the companions of the right [who are]
translations.PICKTHALL: For those on the right hand;

translations.SAHIH: A company of the former peoples
translations.PICKTHALL: A multitude of those of old

translations.SAHIH: And a company of the later peoples.
translations.PICKTHALL: And a multitude of those of later time.

translations.SAHIH: And the companions of the left - what are the companions of the left?
translations.PICKTHALL: And those on the left hand: What of those on the left hand?

translations.SAHIH: [They will be] in scorching fire and scalding water
translations.PICKTHALL: In scorching wind and scalding water

translations.SAHIH: And a shade of black smoke,
translations.PICKTHALL: And shadow of black smoke,

translations.SAHIH: Neither cool nor beneficial.
translations.PICKTHALL: Neither cool nor refreshing.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed they were, before that, indulging in affluence,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! heretofore they were effete with luxury

translations.SAHIH: And they used to persist in the great violation,1
translations.PICKTHALL: And used to persist in the awful sin.

translations.SAHIH: And they used to say, "When we die and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
translations.PICKTHALL: And they used to say: When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then, forsooth, be raised again,

translations.SAHIH: And our forefathers [as well]?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And also our forefathers?

translations.SAHIH: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Indeed, the former and later peoples
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Lo! those of old and those of later time

translations.SAHIH: Are to be gathered together for the appointment of a known Day."
translations.PICKTHALL: Will all be brought together to the tryst of an appointed day.

translations.SAHIH: Then indeed you, O those astray [who are] deniers,
translations.PICKTHALL: Then lo! ye, the erring, the deniers,

translations.SAHIH: Will be eating from trees of zaqqūm
translations.PICKTHALL: Ye verily will eat of a tree called Zaqqum

translations.SAHIH: And filling with it your bellies
translations.PICKTHALL: And will fill your bellies therewith;

translations.SAHIH: And drinking on top of it from scalding water.
translations.PICKTHALL: And thereon ye will drink of boiling water,

translations.SAHIH: And will drink as the drinking of thirsty camels.
translations.PICKTHALL: Drinking even as the camel drinketh.

translations.SAHIH: That is their accommodation on the Day of Recompense.
translations.PICKTHALL: This will be their welcome on the Day of Judgment.

translations.SAHIH: We have created you, so why do you not believe?
translations.PICKTHALL: We created you. Will ye then admit the truth?

translations.SAHIH: Have you seen that which you emit?1
translations.PICKTHALL: Have ye seen that which ye emit?

translations.SAHIH: Is it you who creates it, or are We the Creator?
translations.PICKTHALL: Do ye create it or are We the Creator?

translations.SAHIH: We have decreed death among you, and We are not to be outdone
translations.PICKTHALL: We mete out death among you, and We are not to be outrun,

translations.SAHIH: In that We will change your likenesses and produce you in that [form] which you do not know.1
translations.PICKTHALL: That We may transfigure you and make you what ye know not.

translations.SAHIH: And you have already known the first creation, so will you not remember?
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily ye know the first creation. Why, then, do ye not reflect?

translations.SAHIH: And have you seen that [seed] which you sow?
translations.PICKTHALL: Have ye seen that which ye cultivate?

translations.SAHIH: Is it you who makes it grow, or are We the grower?
translations.PICKTHALL: Is it ye who foster it, or are We the Fosterer?

translations.SAHIH: If We willed, We could make it [dry] debris, and you would remain in wonder,1
translations.PICKTHALL: If We willed, We verily could make it chaff, then would ye cease not to exclaim:

translations.SAHIH: [Saying], "Indeed, we are [now] in debt;
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! we are laden with debt!

translations.SAHIH: Rather, we have been deprived."
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but we are deprived!

translations.SAHIH: And have you seen the water that you drink?
translations.PICKTHALL: Have ye observed the water which ye drink?

translations.SAHIH: Is it you who brought it down from the clouds, or is it We who bring it down?
translations.PICKTHALL: Is it ye who shed it from the raincloud, or are We the Shedder?

translations.SAHIH: If We willed, We could make it bitter, so why are you not grateful?
translations.PICKTHALL: If We willed We verily could make it bitter. Why then, give ye not thanks?

translations.SAHIH: And have you seen the fire that you ignite?
translations.PICKTHALL: Have ye observed the fire which ye strike out;

translations.SAHIH: Is it you who produced its tree, or are We the producer?
translations.PICKTHALL: Was it ye who made the tree thereof to grow, or were We the grower?

translations.SAHIH: We have made it a reminder1 and provision for the travelers,2
translations.PICKTHALL: We, even We, appointed it a memorial and a comfort for the dwellers in the wilderness.

translations.SAHIH: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor (O Muhammad), praise the name of thy Lord, the Tremendous.

translations.SAHIH: Then I swear by the setting of the stars,1
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, I swear by the places of the stars -

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, it is an oath - if you could know - [most] great.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! that verily is a tremendous oath, if ye but knew -

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it is a noble Qur’ān.
translations.PICKTHALL: That (this) is indeed a noble Qur'an

translations.SAHIH: In a Register well-protected;1.
translations.PICKTHALL: In a Book kept hidden

translations.SAHIH: None touch it except the purified [i.e., the angels].
translations.PICKTHALL: Which none toucheth save the purified,

translations.SAHIH: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
translations.PICKTHALL: A revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.SAHIH: Then is it to this statement that you are indifferent
translations.PICKTHALL: Is it this Statement that ye scorn,

translations.SAHIH: And make [the thanks for] your provision that you deny [the Provider]?
translations.PICKTHALL: And make denial thereof your livelihood?

translations.SAHIH: Then why, when it [i.e., the soul at death] reaches the throat
translations.PICKTHALL: Why, then, when (the soul) cometh up to the throat (of the dying)

translations.SAHIH: And you are at that time looking on -
translations.PICKTHALL: And ye are at that moment looking

translations.SAHIH: And We [i.e., Our angels] are nearer to him than you, but you do not see -
translations.PICKTHALL: - And We are nearer unto him than ye are, but ye see not -

translations.SAHIH: Then why do you not, if you are not to be recompensed,
translations.PICKTHALL: Why then, if ye are not in bondage (unto Us),

translations.SAHIH: Bring it back,1 if you should be truthful?
translations.PICKTHALL: Do ye not force it back, if ye are truthful?

translations.SAHIH: And if he [i.e., the deceased] was of those brought near [to Allāh],
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus if he is of those brought nigh,

translations.SAHIH: Then [for him is] rest and bounty and a garden of pleasure.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then breath of life, and plenty, and a Garden of delight.

translations.SAHIH: And if he was of the companions of the right,
translations.PICKTHALL: And if he is of those on the right hand,

translations.SAHIH: Then [the angels will say], "Peace for you; [you are] from the companions of the right."
translations.PICKTHALL: Then (the greeting) "Peace be unto thee" from those on the right hand.

translations.SAHIH: But if he was of the deniers [who were] astray,
translations.PICKTHALL: But if he is of the rejecters, the erring,

translations.SAHIH: Then [for him is] accommodation of scalding water
translations.PICKTHALL: Then the welcome will be boiling water

translations.SAHIH: And burning in Hellfire.
translations.PICKTHALL: And roasting at hell-fire.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, this is the true certainty,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! this is certain truth.

translations.SAHIH: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor (O Muhammad) praise the name of thy Lord, the Tremendous.

translations.SAHIH: Whatever is in the heavens and earth exalts Allāh,1 and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
translations.PICKTHALL: All that is in the heavens and the earth glorifieth Allah; and He is the Mighty, the Wise.

translations.SAHIH: His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. He gives life and causes death, and He is over all things competent.
translations.PICKTHALL: His is the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth; He quickeneth and He giveth death; and He is Able to do all things.

translations.SAHIH: He is the First1 and the Last,2 the Ascendant3 and the Intimate,4 and He is, of all things, Knowing.
translations.PICKTHALL: He is the First and the Last, and the Outward and the Inward; and He is Knower of all things.

translations.SAHIH: It is He who created the heavens and earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne.1 He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein; and He is with you2 wherever you are. And Allāh, of what you do, is Seeing.
translations.PICKTHALL: He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days; then He mounted the Throne. He knoweth all that entereth the earth and all that emergeth therefrom and all that cometh down from the sky and all that ascendeth therein; and He is with you wheresoever ye may be. And Allah is Seer of what ye do.

translations.SAHIH: His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. And to Allāh are returned [all] matters.
translations.PICKTHALL: His is the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, and unto Allah (all) things are brought back.

translations.SAHIH: He causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night, and He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
translations.PICKTHALL: He causeth the night to pass into the day, and He causeth the day to pass into the night, and He is knower of all that is in the breasts.

translations.SAHIH: Believe in Allāh and His Messenger and spend out of that in which He has made you successive inheritors. For those who have believed among you and spent,1 there will be a great reward.
translations.PICKTHALL: Believe in Allah and His messenger, and spend of that whereof He hath made you trustees; and such of you as believe and spend (aright), theirs will be a great reward.

translations.SAHIH: And why do you not believe in Allāh while the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord and He has taken your covenant, if you should [truly] be believers?
translations.PICKTHALL: What aileth you that ye believe not in Allah, when the messenger calleth you to believe in your Lord, and He hath already made a covenant with you, if ye are believers?

translations.SAHIH: It is He who sends down upon His Servant [Muḥammad (ﷺ)] verses of clear evidence that He may bring you out from darknesses into the light. And indeed, Allāh is to you Kind and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: He it is Who sendeth down clear revelations unto His slave, that He may bring you forth from darkness unto light; and lo! for you, Allah is Full of Pity, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: And why do you not spend in the cause of Allāh while to Allāh belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth? Not equal among you are those who spent before the conquest [of Makkah] and fought [and those who did so after it]. Those are greater in degree than they who spent afterwards and fought. But to all Allāh has promised the best [reward]. And Allāh, of what you do, is Aware.
translations.PICKTHALL: And what aileth you that ye spend not in the way of Allah when unto Allah belongeth the inheritance of the heavens and the earth? Those who spent and fought before the victory are not upon a level (with the rest of you). Such are greater in rank than those who spent and fought afterwards. Unto each hath Allah promised good. And Allah is Informed of what ye do.

translations.SAHIH: Who is it that would loan Allāh a goodly loan so He will multiply it for him and he will have a noble reward?
translations.PICKTHALL: Who is he that will lend unto Allah a goodly loan, that He may double it for him and his may be a rich reward?

translations.SAHIH: On the Day you see the believing men and believing women, their light proceeding before them and on their right, [it will be said], "Your good tidings today are [of] gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein you will abide eternally." That is what is the great attainment.
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when thou (Muhammad) wilt see the believers, men and women, their light shining forth before them and on their right hands, (and wilt hear it said unto them): Glad news for you this day: Gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein ye are immortal. That is the supreme triumph.

translations.SAHIH: On the [same] Day the hypocrite men and hypocrite women will say to those who believed, "Wait for us that we may acquire some of your light." It will be said, "Go back behind you1 and seek light." And a wall will be placed between them with a door, its interior containing mercy, but on the outside of it is torment.
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when the hypocritical men and the hypocritical women will say unto those who believe: Look on us that we may borrow from your light! it will be said: Go back and seek for light! Then there will separate them a wall wherein is a gate, the inner side whereof containeth mercy, while the outer side thereof is toward the doom.

translations.SAHIH: They [i.e., the hypocrites] will call to them [i.e., the believers], "Were we not with you?" They will say, "Yes, but you afflicted yourselves1 and awaited [misfortune for us] and doubted, and wishful thinking deluded you until there came the command of Allāh. And the Deceiver [i.e., Satan] deceived you concerning Allāh.
translations.PICKTHALL: They will cry unto them (saying): Were we not with you? They will say: Yea, verily; but ye tempted one another, and hesitated, and doubted, and vain desires beguiled you till the ordinance of Allah came to pass; and the deceiver deceived you concerning Allah;
