translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Have ye thought: If (all) your water were to disappear into the earth, who then could bring you gushing water?

translations.SAHIH: Nūn.1 By the pen and what they inscribe,
translations.PICKTHALL: Nun. By the pen and that which they write (therewith),

translations.SAHIH: You are not, [O Muḥammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thou art not, for thy Lord's favour unto thee, a madman.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! thine verily will be a reward unfailing.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, you are of a great moral character.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! thou art of a tremendous nature.

translations.SAHIH: So you will see and they will see.
translations.PICKTHALL: And thou wilt see and they will see

translations.SAHIH: Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].
translations.PICKTHALL: Which of you is the demented.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! thy Lord is Best Aware of him who strayeth from His way, and He is Best Aware of those who walk aright.

translations.SAHIH: Then do not obey the deniers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor obey not thou the rejecters

translations.SAHIH: They wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [toward you].
translations.PICKTHALL: Who would have had thee compromise, that they may compromise.

translations.SAHIH: And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer
translations.PICKTHALL: Neither obey thou each feeble oath-monger,

translations.SAHIH: [And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -
translations.PICKTHALL: Detracter, spreader abroad of slanders,

translations.SAHIH: A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,
translations.PICKTHALL: Hinderer of the good, transgressor, malefactor

translations.SAHIH: Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Greedy therewithal, intrusive.

translations.SAHIH: Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,
translations.PICKTHALL: It is because he is possessed of wealth and children

translations.SAHIH: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
translations.PICKTHALL: That, when Our revelations are recited unto him, he saith: Mere fables of the men of old.

translations.SAHIH: We will brand him upon the snout.1
translations.PICKTHALL: We shall brand him on the nose.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We have tried them as We tried the owners of the garden when they vowed that they would pluck its fruit next morning,

translations.SAHIH: Without making exception.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And made no exception (for the Will of Allah);

translations.SAHIH: So there came upon it [i.e., the garden] an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then a visitation from thy Lord came upon it while they slept

translations.SAHIH: And it became as though reaped.
translations.PICKTHALL: And in the morning it was as if plucked.

translations.SAHIH: And they called one another at morning,
translations.PICKTHALL: And they cried out one unto another in the morning,

translations.SAHIH: [Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."
translations.PICKTHALL: Saying: Run unto your field if ye would pluck (the fruit).

translations.SAHIH: So they set out, while lowering their voices,
translations.PICKTHALL: So they went off, saying one unto another in low tones:

translations.SAHIH: [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."
translations.PICKTHALL: No needy man shall enter it to-day against you.

translations.SAHIH: And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.1
translations.PICKTHALL: They went betimes, strong in (this) purpose.

translations.SAHIH: But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;
translations.PICKTHALL: But when they saw it, they said: Lo! we are in error!

translations.SAHIH: Rather, we have been deprived."
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but we are desolate!

translations.SAHIH: The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [Allāh]?'"1
translations.PICKTHALL: The best among them said: Said I not unto you: Why glorify ye not (Allah)?

translations.SAHIH: They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Glorified be our Lord! Lo! we have been wrong-doers.

translations.SAHIH: Then they approached one another, blaming each other.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then some of them drew near unto others, self-reproaching.

translations.SAHIH: They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.
translations.PICKTHALL: They said: Alas for us! In truth we were outrageous.

translations.SAHIH: Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."1
translations.PICKTHALL: It may be that our Lord will give us better than this in place thereof. Lo! we beseech our Lord.

translations.SAHIH: Such is the punishment [of this world]. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
translations.PICKTHALL: Such was the punishment. And verily the punishment of the Hereafter is greater if they did but know.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the Gardens of Pleasure.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! for those who keep from evil are gardens of bliss with their Lord.

translations.SAHIH: Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?
translations.PICKTHALL: Shall We then treat those who have surrendered as We treat the guilty?

translations.SAHIH: What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?
translations.PICKTHALL: What aileth you? How foolishly ye judge!

translations.SAHIH: Or do you have a scripture in which you learn
translations.PICKTHALL: Or have ye a scripture wherein ye learn

translations.SAHIH: That indeed for you is whatever you choose?
translations.PICKTHALL: That ye shall indeed have all that ye choose?

translations.SAHIH: Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us, extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you is whatever you judge?
translations.PICKTHALL: Or have ye a covenant on oath from Us that reacheth to the Day of Judgment, that yours shall be all that ye ordain?

translations.SAHIH: Ask them which of them, for that [claim], is responsible.
translations.PICKTHALL: Ask them (O Muhammad) which of them will vouch for that!

translations.SAHIH: Or do they have partners?1 Then let them bring their partners, if they should be truthful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Or have they other gods? Then let them bring their other gods if they are truthful

translations.SAHIH: The Day the shin will be uncovered1 and they are invited to prostration but they [i.e., the disbelievers] will not be able,
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when it befalleth in earnest, and they are ordered to prostrate themselves but are not able,

translations.SAHIH: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.1
translations.PICKTHALL: With eyes downcast, abasement stupefying them. And they had been summoned to prostrate themselves while they were yet unhurt.

translations.SAHIH: So leave Me, [O Muḥammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies this statement [i.e., the Qur’ān]. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Leave Me (to deal) with those who give the lie to this pronouncement. We shall lead them on by steps from whence they know not.

translations.SAHIH: And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.
translations.PICKTHALL: Yet I bear with them, for lo! My scheme is firm.

translations.SAHIH: Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
translations.PICKTHALL: Or dost thou (Muhammad) ask a fee from them so that they are heavily taxed?

translations.SAHIH: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?
translations.PICKTHALL: Or is the Unseen theirs that they can write (thereof)?

translations.SAHIH: Then be patient for the decision of your Lord, [O Muḥammad], and be not like the companion of the fish [i.e., Jonah] when he called out while he was distressed.
translations.PICKTHALL: But wait thou for thy Lord's decree, and be not like him of the fish, who cried out in despair.

translations.SAHIH: If not that a favor [i.e., mercy] from his Lord overtook him, he would have been thrown onto the naked shore while he was censured.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Had it not been that favour from his Lord had reached him he surely had been cast into the wilderness while he was reprobate.

translations.SAHIH: And his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.
translations.PICKTHALL: But his Lord chose him and placed him among the righteous.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes [i.e., looks] when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! those who disbelieve would fain disconcert thee with their eyes when they hear the Reminder, and they say: Lo! he is indeed mad;

translations.SAHIH: But it is not except a reminder to the worlds.
translations.PICKTHALL: When it is naught else than a Reminder to creation.

translations.SAHIH: The Inevitable Reality -
translations.PICKTHALL: The Reality!

translations.SAHIH: What is the Inevitable Reality?
translations.PICKTHALL: What is the Reality?

translations.SAHIH: And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?
translations.PICKTHALL: Ah, what will convey unto thee what the reality is!

translations.SAHIH: Thamūd and ʿAad denied the Striking Calamity [i.e., the Resurrection].
translations.PICKTHALL: (The tribes of) Thamud and A'ad disbelieved in the judgment to come.

translations.SAHIH: So as for Thamūd, they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].
translations.PICKTHALL: As for Thamud, they were destroyed by the lightning.

translations.SAHIH: And as for ʿAad, they were destroyed by a screaming,1 violent wind
translations.PICKTHALL: And as for A'ad, they were destroyed by a fierce roaring wind,

translations.SAHIH: Which He [i.e., Allāh] imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
translations.PICKTHALL: Which He imposed on them for seven long nights and eight long days so that thou mightest have seen men lying overthrown, as they were hollow trunks of palm-trees.

translations.SAHIH: Then do you see of them any remains?
translations.PICKTHALL: Canst thou (O Muhammad) see any remnant of them?

translations.SAHIH: And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities1 with sin.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Pharaoh and those before him, and the communities that were destroyed, brought error,

translations.SAHIH: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].
translations.PICKTHALL: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, therefor did He grip them with a tightening grip.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, when the water overflowed, We carried you [i.e., your ancestors] in the sailing ship1
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! when the waters rose, We carried you upon the ship

translations.SAHIH: That We might make it for you a reminder and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.
translations.PICKTHALL: That We might make it a memorial for you, and that remembering ears (that heard the story) might remember.

translations.SAHIH: Then when the Horn is blown with one blast
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the trumpet shall sound one blast

translations.SAHIH: And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow [i.e., stroke] -
translations.PICKTHALL: And the earth with the mountains shall be lifted up and crushed with one crash,

translations.SAHIH: Then on that Day, the Occurrence [i.e., Resurrection] will occur,
translations.PICKTHALL: Then, on that day will the Event befall.

translations.SAHIH: And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is infirm.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And the heaven will split asunder, for that day it will be frail.

translations.SAHIH: And the angels are at its edges. And there will bear the Throne of your Lord above them, that Day, eight [of them].
translations.PICKTHALL: And the angels will be on the sides thereof, and eight will uphold the Throne of thy Lord that day, above them.

translations.SAHIH: That Day, you will be exhibited [for judgement]; not hidden among you is anything concealed.1
translations.PICKTHALL: On that day ye will be exposed; not a secret of you will be hidden.

translations.SAHIH: So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!
translations.PICKTHALL: Then, as for him who is given his record in his right hand, he will say: Take, read my book!

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, I was certain that I would be meeting my account."
translations.PICKTHALL: Surely I knew that I should have to meet my reckoning.

translations.SAHIH: So he will be in a pleasant life -
translations.PICKTHALL: Then he will be in blissful state

translations.SAHIH: In an elevated garden,
translations.PICKTHALL: In a high garden

translations.SAHIH: Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near.
translations.PICKTHALL: Whereof the clusters are in easy reach.

translations.SAHIH: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth1 in the days past."
translations.PICKTHALL: (And it will be said unto those therein): Eat and drink at ease for that which ye sent on before you in past days.

translations.SAHIH: But as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record
translations.PICKTHALL: But as for him who is given his record in his left hand, he will say: Oh, would that I had not been given my book

translations.SAHIH: And had not known what is my account.
translations.PICKTHALL: And knew not what my reckoning!

translations.SAHIH: I wish it [i.e., my death] had been the decisive one.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Oh, would that it had been death!

translations.SAHIH: My wealth has not availed me.
translations.PICKTHALL: My wealth hath not availed me,

translations.SAHIH: Gone from me is my authority."1
translations.PICKTHALL: My power hath gone from me.

translations.SAHIH: [Allāh will say], "Seize him and shackle him.
translations.PICKTHALL: (It will be said): Take him and fetter him

translations.SAHIH: Then into Hellfire drive him.
translations.PICKTHALL: And then expose him to hell-fire

translations.SAHIH: Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him."
translations.PICKTHALL: And then insert him in a chain whereof the length is seventy cubits.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, he did not used to believe in Allāh, the Most Great,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! He used not to believe in Allah the Tremendous,

translations.SAHIH: Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.
translations.PICKTHALL: And urged not on the feeding of the wretched.

translations.SAHIH: So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor hath he no lover here this day,

translations.SAHIH: Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;
translations.PICKTHALL: Nor any food save filth

translations.SAHIH: None will eat it except the sinners.
translations.PICKTHALL: Which none but sinners eat.

translations.SAHIH: So I swear by what you see
translations.PICKTHALL: But nay! I swear by all that ye see

translations.SAHIH: And what you do not see
translations.PICKTHALL: And all that ye see not

translations.SAHIH: [That] indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is the word of a noble Messenger.
translations.PICKTHALL: That it is indeed the speech of an illustrious messenger.

translations.SAHIH: And it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe.
translations.PICKTHALL: It is not poet's speech - little is it that ye believe!

translations.SAHIH: Nor the word of a soothsayer; little do you remember.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nor diviner's speech - little is it that ye remember!

translations.SAHIH: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
translations.PICKTHALL: It is a revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.SAHIH: And if he [i.e., Muḥammad] had made up about Us some [false] sayings,
translations.PICKTHALL: And if he had invented false sayings concerning Us,

translations.SAHIH: We would have seized him by the right hand;1
translations.PICKTHALL: We assuredly had taken him by the right hand

translations.SAHIH: Then We would have cut from him the aorta.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And then severed his life-artery,

translations.SAHIH: And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.
translations.PICKTHALL: And not one of you could have held Us off from him.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a reminder for the righteous.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! it is a warrant unto those who ward off (evil).

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! We know that some among you will deny (it).

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! it is indeed an anguish for the disbelievers.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, it is the truth of certainty.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! it is absolute truth.

translations.SAHIH: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
translations.PICKTHALL: So glorify the name of thy Tremendous Lord.

translations.SAHIH: A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen1
translations.PICKTHALL: A questioner questioned concerning the doom about to fall

translations.SAHIH: To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer.
translations.PICKTHALL: Upon the disbelievers, which none can repel,

translations.SAHIH: [It is] from Allāh, owner of the ways of ascent.
translations.PICKTHALL: From Allah, Lord of the Ascending Stairways

translations.SAHIH: The angels and the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Whereby) the angels and the Spirit ascend unto Him in a Day whereof the span is fifty thousand years.

translations.SAHIH: So be patient with gracious patience.
translations.PICKTHALL: But be patient (O Muhammad) with a patience fair to see.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, they see it [as] distant,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! they behold it afar off

translations.SAHIH: But We see it [as] near.
translations.PICKTHALL: While we behold it nigh:

translations.SAHIH: On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,1
translations.PICKTHALL: The day when the sky will become as molten copper,

translations.SAHIH: And the mountains will be like wool,1
translations.PICKTHALL: And the hills become as flakes of wool,

translations.SAHIH: And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,
translations.PICKTHALL: And no familiar friend will ask a question of his friend

translations.SAHIH: They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children.
translations.PICKTHALL: Though they will be given sight of them. The guilty man will long to be able to ransom himself from the punishment of that day at the price of his children

translations.SAHIH: And his wife and his brother
translations.PICKTHALL: And his spouse and his brother

translations.SAHIH: And his nearest kindred who shelter him.
translations.PICKTHALL: And his kin that harboured him

translations.SAHIH: And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.
translations.PICKTHALL: And all that are in the earth, if then it might deliver him.

translations.SAHIH: No!1 Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],
translations.PICKTHALL: But nay! for lo! it is the fire of hell

translations.SAHIH: A remover of exteriors.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Eager to roast;

translations.SAHIH: It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]
translations.PICKTHALL: It calleth him who turned and fled (from truth),

translations.SAHIH: And collected [wealth] and hoarded.
translations.PICKTHALL: And hoarded (wealth) and withheld it.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, mankind was created anxious:
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! man was created anxious,

translations.SAHIH: When evil touches him, impatient,
translations.PICKTHALL: Fretful when evil befalleth him

translations.SAHIH: And when good touches him, withholding [of it],
translations.PICKTHALL: And, when good befalleth him, grudging;

translations.SAHIH: Except the observers of prayer -
translations.PICKTHALL: Save worshippers.

translations.SAHIH: Those who are constant in their prayer
translations.PICKTHALL: Who are constant at their worship

translations.SAHIH: And those within whose wealth is a known right1
translations.PICKTHALL: And in whose wealth there is a right acknowledged

translations.SAHIH: For the petitioner and the deprived -
translations.PICKTHALL: For the beggar and the destitute;

translations.SAHIH: And those who believe in the Day of Recompense
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who believe in the Day of Judgment,

translations.SAHIH: And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord -
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who are fearful of their Lord's doom -

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, the punishment of their Lord is not that from which one is safe -
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! the doom of their Lord is that before which none can feel secure -

translations.SAHIH: And those who guard their private parts
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who preserve their chastity

translations.SAHIH: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess,1 for indeed, they are not to be blamed -
translations.PICKTHALL: Save with their wives and those whom their right hands possess, for thus they are not blameworthy;

translations.SAHIH: But whoever seeks beyond that, then they are the transgressors -
translations.PICKTHALL: But whoso seeketh more than that, those are they who are transgressors;

translations.SAHIH: And those who are to their trusts and promises attentive.
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who keep their pledges and their covenant,

translations.SAHIH: And those who are in their testimonies upright
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who stand by their testimony

translations.SAHIH: And those who [carefully] maintain their prayer:
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who are attentive at their worship.

translations.SAHIH: They will be in gardens,1 honored.
translations.PICKTHALL: These will dwell in Gardens, honoured.

translations.SAHIH: So what is [the matter] with those who disbelieve, hastening [from] before you, [O Muḥammad],
translations.PICKTHALL: What aileth those who disbelieve, that they keep staring toward thee (O Muhammad), open-eyed,

translations.SAHIH: [To sit] on [your] right and [your] left in separate groups?1
translations.PICKTHALL: On the right and on the left, in groups?

translations.SAHIH: Does every person among them aspire to enter a garden of pleasure?
translations.PICKTHALL: Doth every man among them hope to enter the Garden of Delight?

translations.SAHIH: No! Indeed, We have created them from that which they know.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, verily. Lo! We created them from what they know.

translations.SAHIH: So I swear by the Lord of [all] risings and settings1 that indeed We are able
translations.PICKTHALL: But nay! I swear by the Lord of the rising-places and the setting-places of the planets that We verily are Able

translations.SAHIH: To replace them with better than them; and We are not to be outdone.
translations.PICKTHALL: To replace them by (others) better than them. And we are not to be outrun.

translations.SAHIH: So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised -
translations.PICKTHALL: So let them chat and play until they meet their Day which they are promised,

translations.SAHIH: The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.1
translations.PICKTHALL: The day when they come forth from the graves in haste, as racing to a goal,

translations.SAHIH: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. That is the Day which they had been promised.
translations.PICKTHALL: With eyes aghast, abasement stupefying them: Such is the Day which they are promised.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment."
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We sent Noah unto his people (saying): Warn thy people ere the painful doom come unto them.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "O my people, indeed I am to you a clear warner -
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: O my people! Lo! I am a plain warner unto you

translations.SAHIH: To worship Allāh, fear Him and obey me.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Bidding you): Serve Allah and keep your duty unto Him and obey me,

translations.SAHIH: He [i.e., Allāh] will forgive you of your sins and delay you for a specified term. Indeed, the time [set by] Allāh, when it comes, will not be delayed, if you only knew."
translations.PICKTHALL: That He may forgive you somewhat of your sins and respite you to an appointed term. Lo! the term of Allah, when it cometh, cannot be delayed, if ye but knew.

translations.SAHIH: He said, "My Lord, indeed I invited my people [to truth] night and day.
translations.PICKTHALL: He said: My Lord! Lo! I have called unto my people night and day

translations.SAHIH: But my invitation increased them not except in flight [i.e., aversion].
translations.PICKTHALL: But all my calling doth but add to their repugnance;

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, every time I invited them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their garments,1 persisted, and were arrogant with [great] arrogance.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! whenever I call unto them that Thou mayst pardon them they thrust their fingers in their ears and cover themselves with their garments and persist (in their refusal) and magnify themselves in pride.

translations.SAHIH: Then I invited them publicly.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! I have called unto them aloud,

translations.SAHIH: Then I announced to them and [also] confided to them secretly
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! I have made public proclamation unto them, and I have appealed to them in private.

translations.SAHIH: And said, 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord. Indeed, He is ever a Perpetual Forgiver.
translations.PICKTHALL: And I have said: Seek pardon of your Lord. Lo! He was ever Forgiving.

translations.SAHIH: He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in [continuing] showers
translations.PICKTHALL: He will let loose the sky for you in plenteous rain,

translations.SAHIH: And give you increase in wealth and children and provide for you gardens and provide for you rivers.
translations.PICKTHALL: And will help you with wealth and sons, and will assign unto you Gardens and will assign unto you rivers.

translations.SAHIH: What is [the matter] with you that you do not attribute to Allāh [due] grandeur
translations.PICKTHALL: What aileth you that ye hope not toward Allah for dignity

translations.SAHIH: While He has created you in stages?1
translations.PICKTHALL: When He created you by (divers) stages?

translations.SAHIH: Do you not consider how Allāh has created seven heavens in layers1
translations.PICKTHALL: See ye not how Allah hath created seven heavens in harmony,

translations.SAHIH: And made the moon therein a [reflected] light and made the sun a burning lamp?
translations.PICKTHALL: And hath made the moon a light therein, and made the sun a lamp?

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh has caused you to grow from the earth a [progressive] growth.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Allah hath caused you to grow as a growth from the earth,

translations.SAHIH: Then He will return you into it and extract you [another] extraction.
translations.PICKTHALL: And afterward He maketh you return thereto, and He will bring you forth again, a (new) forthbringing.

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh has made for you the earth an expanse
translations.PICKTHALL: And Allah hath made the earth a wide expanse for you

translations.SAHIH: That you may follow therein roads of passage.'"
translations.PICKTHALL: That ye may thread the valley-ways thereof.

translations.SAHIH: Noah said, "My Lord, indeed they have disobeyed me and followed him whose wealth and children will not increase him except in loss.
translations.PICKTHALL: Noah said: My Lord! Lo! they have disobeyed me and followed one whose wealth and children increase him in naught save ruin;

translations.SAHIH: And they conspired an immense conspiracy
translations.PICKTHALL: And they have plotted a mighty plot,

translations.SAHIH: And said, 'Never leave your gods and never leave Wadd or Suwāʿ or Yaghūth and Yaʿūq and Nasr.'1
translations.PICKTHALL: And they have said: Forsake not your gods. Forsake not Wadd, nor Suwa', nor Yaghuth and Ya'uq and Nasr.

translations.SAHIH: And already they have misled many. And, [my Lord], do not increase the wrongdoers except in error."
translations.PICKTHALL: And they have led many astray, and Thou increasest the wrong-doers in naught save error.

translations.SAHIH: Because of their sins they were drowned and put into the Fire, and they found not for themselves besides Allāh [any] helpers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Because of their sins they were drowned, then made to enter a Fire. And they found they had no helpers in place of Allah.

translations.SAHIH: And Noah said, "My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from among the disbelievers an inhabitant.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Noah said: My Lord! Leave not one of the disbelievers in the land.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, if You leave them, they will mislead Your servants and not beget except [every] wicked one and [confirmed] disbeliever.
translations.PICKTHALL: If Thou shouldst leave them, they will mislead Thy slaves and will beget none save lewd ingrates.

translations.SAHIH: My Lord, forgive me and my parents and whoever enters my house a believer and the believing men and believing women. And do not increase the wrongdoers except in destruction."
translations.PICKTHALL: My Lord! Forgive me and my parents and him who entereth my house believing, and believing men and believing women, and increase not the wrong-doers in aught save ruin.

translations.SAHIH: Say, [O Muḥammad], "It has been revealed to me that a group of the jinn listened and said, 'Indeed, we have heard an amazing Qur’ān [i.e., recitation].
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (O Muhammad): It is revealed unto me that a company of the Jinn gave ear, and they said: Lo! we have heard a marvellous Qur'an,

translations.SAHIH: It guides to the right course, and we have believed in it. And we will never associate with our Lord anyone.
translations.PICKTHALL: Which guideth unto righteousness, so we believe in it and we ascribe no partner unto our Lord.

translations.SAHIH: And [it teaches] that exalted is the nobleness of our Lord; He has not taken a wife or a son
translations.PICKTHALL: And (we believe) that He - exalted be the glory of our Lord! - hath taken neither wife nor son,

translations.SAHIH: And that our foolish one [i.e., Iblees]1 has been saying about Allāh an excessive transgression.
translations.PICKTHALL: And that the foolish one among us used to speak concerning Allah an atrocious lie.

translations.SAHIH: And we had thought that mankind and the jinn would never speak about Allāh a lie.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! we had supposed that humankind and jinn would not speak a lie concerning Allah -

translations.SAHIH: And there were men from mankind who sought refuge in men from the jinn, so they [only] increased them in burden [i.e., sin].
translations.PICKTHALL: And indeed (O Muhammad) individuals of humankind used to invoke the protection of individuals of the jinn, so that they increased them in revolt against Allah);

translations.SAHIH: And they had thought, as you thought, that Allāh would never send anyone [as a messenger].
translations.PICKTHALL: And indeed they supposed, even as ye suppose, that Allah would not raise anyone (from the dead) -

translations.SAHIH: And we have sought [to reach] the heaven but found it filled with powerful guards and burning flames.
translations.PICKTHALL: And (the Jinn who had listened to the Qur'an said): We had sought the heaven but had found it filled with strong warders and meteors.

translations.SAHIH: And we used to sit therein in positions for hearing,1 but whoever listens now will find a burning flame lying in wait for him.
translations.PICKTHALL: And we used to sit on places (high) therein to listen. But he who listeneth now findeth a flame in wait for him;

translations.SAHIH: And we do not know [therefore] whether evil is intended for those on earth or whether their Lord intends for them a right course.
translations.PICKTHALL: And we know not whether harm is boded unto all who are in the earth, or whether their Lord intendeth guidance for them.

translations.SAHIH: And among us are the righteous, and among us are [others] not so; we were [of] divided ways.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And among us there are righteous folk and among us there are far from that. We are sects having different rules.

translations.SAHIH: And we have become certain that we will never cause failure to Allāh upon earth, nor can we escape Him by flight.
translations.PICKTHALL: And we know that we cannot escape from Allah in the earth, nor can we escape by flight.

translations.SAHIH: And when we heard the guidance [i.e., the Qur’ān], we believed in it. And whoever believes in his Lord will not fear deprivation or burden.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And when we heard the guidance, we believed therein, and whoso believeth in his Lord, he feareth neither loss nor oppression.

translations.SAHIH: And among us are Muslims [in submission to Allāh], and among us are the unjust.1 And whoever has become Muslim - those have sought out the right course.
translations.PICKTHALL: And there are among us some who have surrendered (to Allah) and there are among us some who are unjust. And whoso hath surrendered to Allah, such have taken the right path purposefully.

translations.SAHIH: But as for the unjust, they will be, for Hell, firewood.'
translations.PICKTHALL: And as for those who are unjust, they are firewood for hell.

translations.SAHIH: And [Allāh revealed] that if they had remained straight on the way, We would have given them abundant rain [i.e., provision].
translations.PICKTHALL: If they (the idolaters) tread the right path, We shall give them to drink of water in abundance

translations.SAHIH: So We might test them therein. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord1 He will put into arduous punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: That We may test them thereby, and whoso turneth away from the remembrance of his Lord; He will thrust him into ever-growing torment.

translations.SAHIH: And [He revealed] that the masjids1 are for Allāh, so do not invoke2 with Allāh anyone.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the places of worship are only for Allah, so pray not unto anyone along with Allah.

translations.SAHIH: And that when the Servant [i.e., Prophet] of Allāh stood up supplicating Him, they almost became about him a compacted mass."1
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the slave of Allah stood up in prayer to Him, they crowded on him, almost stifling.

translations.SAHIH: Say, [O Muḥammad], "I only invoke my Lord and do not associate with Him anyone."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): I pray unto Allah only, and ascribe unto Him no partner.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Indeed, I do not possess for you [the power of] harm or right direction."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Lo! I control not hurt nor benefit for you.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "Indeed, there will never protect me from Allāh anyone [if I should disobey], nor will I find in other than Him a refuge.
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: Lo! none can protect me from Allah, nor can I find any refuge beside Him

translations.SAHIH: But [I have for you] only notification from Allāh, and His messages." And whoever disobeys Allāh and His Messenger - then indeed, for him is the fire of Hell; they will abide therein forever.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Mine is) but conveyance (of the Truth) from Allah, and His messages; and whoso disobeyeth Allah and His messenger, lo! his is fire of hell, wherein such dwell for ever.

translations.SAHIH: [The disbelievers continue] until, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who is weaker in helpers and less in number.
translations.PICKTHALL: Till (the day) when they shall behold that which they are promised (they may doubt); but then they will know (for certain) who is weaker in allies and less in multitude.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "I do not know if what you are promised is near or if my Lord will grant for it a [long] period."
translations.PICKTHALL: Say (O Muhammad, unto the disbelievers): I know not whether that which ye are promised is nigh, or if my Lord hath set a distant term for it.

translations.SAHIH: [He is] Knower of the unseen, and He does not disclose His [knowledge of the] unseen to anyone
translations.PICKTHALL: (He is) the Knower of the Unseen, and He revealeth unto none His secret,

translations.SAHIH: Except whom He has approved of messengers, and indeed, He sends before him [i.e., each messenger] and behind him observers1
translations.PICKTHALL: Save unto every messenger whom He hath chosen, and then He maketh a guard to go before him and a guard behind him

translations.SAHIH: That he [i.e., Muḥammad (ﷺ)] may know1 that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord; and He has encompassed whatever is with them and has enumerated all things in number.
translations.PICKTHALL: That He may know that they have indeed conveyed the messages of their Lord. He surroundeth all their doings, and He keepeth count of all things.

translations.SAHIH: O you who wraps himself [in clothing]1
translations.PICKTHALL: O thou wrapped up in thy raiment!

translations.SAHIH: Arise [to pray] the night, except for a little -
translations.PICKTHALL: Keep vigil the night long, save a little -

translations.SAHIH: Half of it - or subtract from it a little
translations.PICKTHALL: A half thereof, or abate a little thereof

translations.SAHIH: Or add to it, and recite the Qur’ān with measured recitation.
translations.PICKTHALL: Or add (a little) thereto - and chant the Qur'an in measure,

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We will cast upon you a heavy word.1
translations.PICKTHALL: For we shall charge thee with a word of weight.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, the hours of the night are more effective for concurrence [of heart and tongue]1 and more suitable for words.2
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! the vigil of the night is (a time) when impression is more keen and speech more certain.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, for you by day is prolonged occupation.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! thou hast by day a chain of business.

translations.SAHIH: And remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with [complete] devotion.
translations.PICKTHALL: So remember the name of thy Lord and devote thyself with a complete devotion -

translations.SAHIH: [He is] the Lord of the East and the West; there is no deity except Him, so take Him as Disposer of [your] affairs.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Lord of the East and the West; there is no Allah save Him; so choose thou Him alone for thy defender -

translations.SAHIH: And be patient over what they say and avoid them with gracious avoidance.
translations.PICKTHALL: And bear with patience what they utter, and part from them with a fair leave-taking.

translations.SAHIH: And leave Me with [the matter of] the deniers, those of ease [in life], and allow them respite a little.
translations.PICKTHALL: Leave Me to deal with the deniers, lords of ease and comfort (in this life); and do thou respite them awhile.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, with Us [for them] are shackles and burning fire.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! with Us are heavy fetters and a raging fire,

translations.SAHIH: And food that chokes and a painful punishment -
translations.PICKTHALL: And food which choketh (the partaker), and a painful doom

translations.SAHIH: On the Day the earth and the mountains will convulse and the mountains will become a heap of sand pouring down.
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when the earth and the hills rock, and the hills become a heap of running sand.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness upon you just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We have sent unto you a messenger as witness against you, even as We sent unto Pharaoh a messenger.

translations.SAHIH: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a ruinous seizure.
translations.PICKTHALL: But Pharaoh rebelled against the messenger, whereupon We seized him with no gentle grip.

translations.SAHIH: Then how can you fear, if you disbelieve, a Day that will make the children white-haired?1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then how, if ye disbelieve, will ye protect yourselves upon the day which will turn children grey,

translations.SAHIH: The heaven will break apart therefrom;1 ever is His promise fulfilled.
translations.PICKTHALL: The very heaven being then rent asunder. His promise is to be fulfilled.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, this is a reminder, so whoever wills may take to his Lord a way.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! This is a Reminder. Let him who will, then, choose a way unto his Lord.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, your Lord knows, [O Muḥammad], that you stand [in prayer] almost two thirds of the night or half of it or a third of it, and [so do] a group of those with you. And Allāh determines [the extent of] the night and the day. He has known that you [Muslims] will not be able to do it1 and has turned to you in forgiveness, so recite what is easy [for you] of the Qur’ān. He has known that there will be among you those who are ill and others traveling throughout the land seeking [something] of the bounty of Allāh and others fighting for the cause of Allāh. So recite what is easy from it and establish prayer and give zakāh and loan Allāh a goodly loan.2 And whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allāh. It is better and greater in reward. And seek forgiveness of Allāh. Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! thy Lord knoweth how thou keepest vigil sometimes nearly two-thirds of the night, or (sometimes) half or a third thereof, as do a party of those with thee. Allah measureth the night and the day. He knoweth that ye count it not, and turneth unto you in mercy. Recite, then, of the Qur'an that which is easy for you. He knoweth that there are sick folk among you, while others travel in the land in search of Allah's bounty, and others (still) are fighting for the cause of Allah. So recite of it that which is easy (for you), and establish worship and pay the poor-due, and (so) lend unto Allah a goodly loan. Whatsoever good ye send before you for your souls, ye will find it with Allah, better and greater in the recompense. And seek forgiveness of Allah. Lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

translations.SAHIH: O you who covers himself [with a garment],1
translations.PICKTHALL: O thou enveloped in thy cloak,

translations.SAHIH: Arise and warn.
translations.PICKTHALL: Arise and warn!

translations.SAHIH: And your Lord glorify.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thy Lord magnify,

translations.SAHIH: And your clothing purify.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thy raiment purify,

translations.SAHIH: And uncleanliness1 avoid.
translations.PICKTHALL: Pollution shun!

translations.SAHIH: And do not confer favor to acquire more1.
translations.PICKTHALL: And show not favour, seeking wordly gain!

translations.SAHIH: But for your Lord be patient.
translations.PICKTHALL: For the sake of thy Lord, be patient!

translations.SAHIH: And when the trumpet is blown,
translations.PICKTHALL: For when the trumpet shall sound,

translations.SAHIH: That Day will be a difficult day
translations.PICKTHALL: Surely that day will be a day of anguish,

translations.SAHIH: For the disbelievers - not easy.
translations.PICKTHALL: Not of ease, for disbelievers.

translations.SAHIH: Leave Me with the one I created alone1
translations.PICKTHALL: Leave Me (to deal) with him whom I created lonely,

translations.SAHIH: And to whom I granted extensive wealth
translations.PICKTHALL: And then bestowed upon him ample means,

translations.SAHIH: And children present [with him]
translations.PICKTHALL: And sons abiding in his presence

translations.SAHIH: And spread [everything] before him, easing [his life].
translations.PICKTHALL: And made (life) smooth for him.

translations.SAHIH: Then he desires that I should add more.
translations.PICKTHALL: Yet he desireth that I should give more.

translations.SAHIH: No! Indeed, he has been toward Our verses obstinate.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay! For lo! he hath been stubborn to Our revelations.

translations.SAHIH: I will cover him with arduous torment.
translations.PICKTHALL: On him I shall impose a fearful doom.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, he thought and deliberated.1
translations.PICKTHALL: For lo! he did consider; then he planned -

translations.SAHIH: So may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Self-)destroyed is he, how he planned!

translations.SAHIH: Then may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
translations.PICKTHALL: Again (self-)destroyed is he, how he planned! -

translations.SAHIH: Then he considered [again];
translations.PICKTHALL: Then looked he,

translations.SAHIH: Then he frowned and scowled;
translations.PICKTHALL: Then frowned he and showed displeasure.

translations.SAHIH: Then he turned back and was arrogant
translations.PICKTHALL: Then turned he away in pride

translations.SAHIH: And said, "This is not but magic imitated [from others].
translations.PICKTHALL: And said: This is naught else than magic from of old;

translations.SAHIH: This is not but the word of a human being."
translations.PICKTHALL: This is naught else than speech of mortal man.

translations.SAHIH: I will drive him into Saqar.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Him shall I fling unto the burning.

translations.SAHIH: And what can make you know what is Saqar?
translations.PICKTHALL: - Ah, what will convey unto thee what that burning is! -

translations.SAHIH: It lets nothing remain and leaves nothing [unburned],
translations.PICKTHALL: It leaveth naught; it spareth naught

translations.SAHIH: Altering [i.e., blackening] the skins.
translations.PICKTHALL: It shrivelleth the man.

translations.SAHIH: Over it are nineteen [angels].
translations.PICKTHALL: Above it are nineteen.

translations.SAHIH: And We have not made the keepers of the Fire except angels. And We have not made their number except as a trial for those who disbelieve - that those who were given the Scripture will be convinced and those who have believed will increase in faith and those who were given the Scripture and the believers will not doubt and that those in whose hearts is disease [i.e., hypocrisy] and the disbelievers will say, "What does Allāh intend by this as an example?" Thus does Allāh send astray whom He wills and guide whom He wills. And none knows the soldiers of your Lord except Him. And it [i.e., mention of the Fire] is not but a reminder to humanity.
translations.PICKTHALL: We have appointed only angels to be wardens of the Fire, and their number have We made to be a stumbling-block for those who disbelieve; that those to whom the Scripture hath been given may have certainty, and that believers may increase in faith; and that those to whom the Scripture hath been given and believers may not doubt; and that those in whose hearts there is disease, and disbelievers, may say: What meaneth Allah by this similitude? Thus Allah sendeth astray whom He will, and whom He will He guideth. None knoweth the hosts of thy Lord save Him. This is naught else than a Reminder unto mortals.

translations.SAHIH: No! By the moon.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, by the Moon

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the night when it departs.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the night when it withdraweth

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the morning when it brightens,
translations.PICKTHALL: And the dawn when it shineth forth,

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it [i.e., the Fire] is of the greatest [afflictions].
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! this is one of the greatest (portents)

translations.SAHIH: As a warning to humanity -
translations.PICKTHALL: As a warning unto men,

translations.SAHIH: To whoever wills among you to proceed1 or stay behind.
translations.PICKTHALL: Unto him of you who will advance or hang back.

translations.SAHIH: Every soul, for what it has earned, will be retained1.
translations.PICKTHALL: Every soul is a pledge for its own deeds;

translations.SAHIH: Except the companions of the right,1.
translations.PICKTHALL: Save those who will stand on the right hand.

translations.SAHIH: [Who will be] in gardens, questioning each other
translations.PICKTHALL: In gardens they will ask one another

translations.SAHIH: About the criminals,
translations.PICKTHALL: Concerning the guilty:

translations.SAHIH: [And asking them], "What put you into Saqar?"
translations.PICKTHALL: What hath brought you to this burning?

translations.SAHIH: They will say, "We were not of those who prayed,
translations.PICKTHALL: They will answer: We were not of those who prayed

translations.SAHIH: Nor did we used to feed the poor.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nor did we feed the wretched.

translations.SAHIH: And we used to enter into vain discourse with those who engaged [in it],
translations.PICKTHALL: We used to wade (in vain dispute) with (all) waders,

translations.SAHIH: And we used to deny the Day of Recompense
translations.PICKTHALL: And we used to deny the Day of Judgment,

translations.SAHIH: Until there came to us the certainty [i.e., death]."
translations.PICKTHALL: Till the Inevitable came unto us.

translations.SAHIH: So there will not benefit them the intercession of [any] intercessors.
translations.PICKTHALL: The mediation of no mediators will avail them then.

translations.SAHIH: Then what is [the matter] with them that they are, from the reminder, turning away.
translations.PICKTHALL: Why now turn they away from the Admonishment,

translations.SAHIH: As if they were alarmed donkeys.
translations.PICKTHALL: As they were frightened asses

translations.SAHIH: Fleeing from a lion?
translations.PICKTHALL: Fleeing from a lion?

translations.SAHIH: Rather, every person among them desires that he1 would be given scriptures spread about.2
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but everyone of them desireth that he should be given open pages (from Allah).

translations.SAHIH: No! But they do not fear the Hereafter.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, verily. They fear not the Hereafter.

translations.SAHIH: No! Indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a reminder.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, verily. Lo! this is an Admonishment.

translations.SAHIH: Then whoever wills will remember it.
translations.PICKTHALL: So whosoever will may heed.

translations.SAHIH: And they will not remember except that Allāh wills. He is worthy of fear and adequate for [granting] forgiveness.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they will not heed unless Allah willeth (it). He is the fount of fear. He is the fount of Mercy.

translations.SAHIH: I swear by the Day of Resurrection
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, I swear by the Day of Resurrection;

translations.SAHIH: And I swear by the reproaching soul1 [to the certainty of resurrection].
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, I swear by the accusing soul (that this Scripture is true).

translations.SAHIH: Does man think that We will not assemble his bones?
translations.PICKTHALL: Thinketh man that We shall not assemble his bones?

translations.SAHIH: Yes. [We are] Able [even] to proportion his fingertips.
translations.PICKTHALL: Yea, verily. We are Able to restore his very fingers!

translations.SAHIH: But man desires to continue in sin.1
translations.PICKTHALL: But man would fain deny what is before him.

translations.SAHIH: He asks, "When is the Day of Resurrection?"
translations.PICKTHALL: He asketh: When will be this Day of Resurrection?

translations.SAHIH: So when vision is dazzled.
translations.PICKTHALL: But when sight is confounded

translations.SAHIH: And the moon darkens.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the moon is eclipsed

translations.SAHIH: And the sun and the moon are joined,
translations.PICKTHALL: And sun and moon are united,

translations.SAHIH: Man will say on that Day, "Where is the [place of] escape?"
translations.PICKTHALL: On that day man will cry: Whither to flee!

translations.SAHIH: No! There is no refuge.
translations.PICKTHALL: Alas! No refuge!

translations.SAHIH: To your Lord, that Day, is the [place of] permanence.
translations.PICKTHALL: Unto thy Lord is the recourse that day.

translations.SAHIH: Man will be informed that Day of what he sent ahead1 and kept back.2
translations.PICKTHALL: On that day man is told the tale of that which he hath sent before and left behind.

translations.SAHIH: Rather, man, against himself, will be a witness,1
translations.PICKTHALL: Oh, but man is a telling witness against himself,

translations.SAHIH: Even if he presents his excuses.
translations.PICKTHALL: Although he tender his excuses.

translations.SAHIH: Move not your tongue with it, [O Muḥammad], to hasten with it [i.e., recitation of the Qur’ān].
translations.PICKTHALL: Stir not thy tongue herewith to hasten it.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, upon Us is its collection [in your heart] and [to make possible] its recitation.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! upon Us (resteth) the putting together thereof and the reading thereof.

translations.SAHIH: So when We have recited it [through Gabriel], then follow its recitation.
translations.PICKTHALL: And when We read it, follow thou the reading;

translations.SAHIH: Then upon Us is its clarification [to you].
translations.PICKTHALL: Then lo! upon Us (resteth) the explanation thereof.

translations.SAHIH: No! But you [i.e., mankind] love the immediate
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but ye do love the fleeting Now

translations.SAHIH: And leave [i.e., neglect] the Hereafter.
translations.PICKTHALL: And neglect the Hereafter.

translations.SAHIH: [Some] faces, that Day, will be radiant,
translations.PICKTHALL: That day will faces be resplendent,

translations.SAHIH: Looking at their Lord.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Looking toward their Lord;

translations.SAHIH: And [some] faces, that Day, will be contorted,
translations.PICKTHALL: And that day will other faces be despondent,

translations.SAHIH: Expecting that there will be done to them [something] backbreaking.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thou wilt know that some great disaster is about to fall on them.

translations.SAHIH: No! When it [i.e., the soul] has reached the collar bones1
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but when the life cometh up to the throat

translations.SAHIH: And it is said, "Who will cure [him]?"
translations.PICKTHALL: And men say: Where is the wizard (who can save him now)?

translations.SAHIH: And he [i.e., the dying one] is certain that it is the [time of] separation
translations.PICKTHALL: And he knoweth that it is the parting;

translations.SAHIH: And the leg is wound about the leg,1
translations.PICKTHALL: And agony is heaped on agony;

translations.SAHIH: To your Lord, that Day, will be the procession.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Unto thy Lord that day will be the driving.

translations.SAHIH: And he [i.e., the disbeliever] had not believed, nor had he prayed.
translations.PICKTHALL: For he neither trusted, nor prayed.

translations.SAHIH: But [instead], he denied and turned away.
translations.PICKTHALL: But he denied and flouted.

translations.SAHIH: And then he went to his people, swaggering [in pride].
translations.PICKTHALL: Then went he to his folk with glee.

translations.SAHIH: Woe to you, and woe!
translations.PICKTHALL: Nearer unto thee and nearer,

translations.SAHIH: Then woe to you, and woe!
translations.PICKTHALL: Again nearer unto thee and nearer (is the doom).

translations.SAHIH: Does man think that he will be left neglected?1
translations.PICKTHALL: Thinketh man that he is to be left aimless?

translations.SAHIH: Had he not been a sperm from semen emitted?
translations.PICKTHALL: Was he not a drop of fluid which gushed forth?

translations.SAHIH: Then he was a clinging clot, and [Allāh] created [his form] and proportioned [him]
translations.PICKTHALL: Then he became a clot; then (Allah) shaped and fashioned

translations.SAHIH: And made of him two mates, the male and the female.
translations.PICKTHALL: And made of him a pair, the male and female.

translations.SAHIH: Is not that [Creator] Able to give life to the dead?
translations.PICKTHALL: Is not He (Who doeth so) Able to bring the dead to life?

translations.SAHIH: Has there [not] come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing [even] mentioned?
translations.PICKTHALL: Hath there come upon man (ever) any period of time in which he was a thing unremembered?

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We created man from a sperm-drop mixture1 that We may try him; and We made him hearing and seeing.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We create man from a drop of thickened fluid to test him; so We make him hearing, knowing.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We guided him to the way, be he grateful or be he ungrateful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We have shown him the way, whether he be grateful or disbelieving.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and shackles and a blaze.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We have prepared for disbelievers manacles and carcans and a raging fire.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of Kāfūr,1
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! the righteous shall drink of a cup whereof the mixture is of Kafur,

translations.SAHIH: A spring of which the [righteous] servants of Allāh will drink; they will make it gush forth in force [and abundance].
translations.PICKTHALL: A spring wherefrom the slaves of Allah drink, making it gush forth abundantly,

translations.SAHIH: They [are those who] fulfill [their] vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Because) they perform the vow and fear a day whereof the evil is wide-spreading,

translations.SAHIH: And they give food in spite of love for it1 to the needy, the orphan, and the captive,
translations.PICKTHALL: And feed with food the needy wretch, the orphan and the prisoner, for love of Him,

translations.SAHIH: [Saying], "We feed you only for the face [i.e., approval] of Allāh. We wish not from you reward or gratitude.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Saying): We feed you, for the sake of Allah only. We wish for no reward nor thanks from you;

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We fear from our Lord a Day austere and distressful."
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! we fear from our Lord a day of frowning and of fate.

translations.SAHIH: So Allāh will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor Allah hath warded off from them the evil of that day, and hath made them find brightness and joy;

translations.SAHIH: And will reward them for what they patiently endured [with] a garden [in Paradise] and silk [garments].
translations.PICKTHALL: And hath awarded them for all that they endured, a Garden and silk attire;

translations.SAHIH: [They will be] reclining therein on adorned couches. They will not see therein any [burning] sun or [freezing] cold.
translations.PICKTHALL: Reclining therein upon couches, they will find there neither (heat of) a sun nor bitter cold.

translations.SAHIH: And near above them are its shades, and its [fruit] to be picked will be lowered in compliance.
translations.PICKTHALL: The shade thereof is close upon them and the clustered fruits thereof bow down.

translations.SAHIH: And there will be circulated among them vessels of silver and cups having been [created] clear [as glass],
translations.PICKTHALL: Goblets of silver are brought round for them, and beakers (as) of glass

translations.SAHIH: Clear glasses [made] from silver of which they have determined the measure.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Bright as) glass but (made) of silver, which they (themselves) have measured to the measure (of their deeds).

translations.SAHIH: And they will be given to drink a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger
translations.PICKTHALL: There are they watered with a cup whereof the mixture is of Zanjabil,

translations.SAHIH: [From] a fountain within it [i.e., Paradise] named Salsabeel.
translations.PICKTHALL: (The water of) a spring therein, named Salsabil.

translations.SAHIH: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal. When you see them, you would think them [as beautiful as] scattered pearls.
translations.PICKTHALL: There wait on them immortal youths, whom, when thou seest, thou wouldst take for scattered pearls.

translations.SAHIH: And when you look there [in Paradise], you will see pleasure and great dominion.
translations.PICKTHALL: When thou seest, thou wilt see there bliss and high estate.

translations.SAHIH: Upon them [i.e., the inhabitants] will be green garments of fine silk and brocade. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.
translations.PICKTHALL: Their raiment will be fine green silk and gold embroidery. Bracelets of silver will they wear. Their Lord will slake their thirst with a pure drink.

translations.SAHIH: [And it will be said], "Indeed, this is for you a reward, and your effort has been appreciated."
translations.PICKTHALL: (And it will be said unto them): Lo! this is a reward for you. Your endeavour (upon earth) hath found acceptance.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it is We who have sent down to you, [O Muḥammad], the Qur’ān progressively.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We, even We, have revealed unto thee the Qur'an, a revelation;

translations.SAHIH: So be patient for the decision of your Lord and do not obey from among them a sinner or ungrateful [disbeliever].
translations.PICKTHALL: So submit patiently to thy Lord's command, and obey not of them any guilty one or disbeliever.

translations.SAHIH: And mention the name of your Lord [in prayer] morning and evening
translations.PICKTHALL: Remember the name of thy Lord at morn and evening.

translations.SAHIH: And during the night prostrate to Him and exalt [i.e., praise] Him a long [part of the] night.
translations.PICKTHALL: And worship Him (a portion) of the night. And glorify Him through the livelong night.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, these [disbelievers] love the immediate and leave behind them1 a grave Day.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! these love fleeting life, and put behind them (the remembrance of) a grievous day.

translations.SAHIH: We have created them and strengthened their forms, and when We will, We can change their likenesses with [complete] alteration.
translations.PICKTHALL: We, even We, created them, and strengthened their frame. And when We will, We can replace them, bringing others like them in their stead.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, this is a reminder, so he who wills may take to his Lord a way.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! this is an Admonishment, that whosoever will may choose a way unto his Lord.

translations.SAHIH: And you do not will except that Allāh wills. Indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.
translations.PICKTHALL: Yet ye will not, unless Allah willeth. Lo! Allah is Knower, Wise.

translations.SAHIH: He admits whom He wills into His mercy; but the wrongdoers - He has prepared for them a painful punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: He maketh whom He will to enter His mercy, and for evil-doers hath prepared a painful doom.

translations.SAHIH: By those [winds] sent forth in gusts
translations.PICKTHALL: By the emissary winds, (sent) one after another

translations.SAHIH: And the winds that blow violently
translations.PICKTHALL: By the raging hurricanes,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the winds that spread [clouds]
translations.PICKTHALL: By those which cause earth's vegetation to revive;

translations.SAHIH: And those [angels] who bring criterion1
translations.PICKTHALL: By those who winnow with a winnowing,

translations.SAHIH: And those [angels] who deliver a message.
translations.PICKTHALL: By those who bring down the Reminder,

translations.SAHIH: As justification or warning,
translations.PICKTHALL: To excuse or to warn,

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, what you are promised is to occur.
translations.PICKTHALL: Surely that which ye are promised will befall.

translations.SAHIH: So when the stars are obliterated
translations.PICKTHALL: So when the stars are put out,

translations.SAHIH: And when the heaven is opened
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the sky is riven asunder,

translations.SAHIH: And when the mountains are blown away
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the mountains are blown away,

translations.SAHIH: And when the messengers' time has come...1
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the messengers are brought unto their time appointed -

translations.SAHIH: For what Day was it postponed?1
translations.PICKTHALL: For what day is the time appointed?

translations.SAHIH: For the Day of Judgement.
translations.PICKTHALL: For the Day of Decision.

translations.SAHIH: And what can make you know what is the Day of Judgement?
translations.PICKTHALL: And what will convey unto thee what the Day of Decision is! -

translations.SAHIH: Woe,1 that Day, to the deniers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!

translations.SAHIH: Did We not destroy the former peoples?
translations.PICKTHALL: Destroyed We not the former folk,

translations.SAHIH: Then We will follow them with the later ones.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then caused the latter folk to follow after?

translations.SAHIH: Thus do We deal with the criminals.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus deal We ever with the guilty.

translations.SAHIH: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!

translations.SAHIH: Did We not create you from a liquid disdained?
translations.PICKTHALL: Did We not create you from a base fluid

translations.SAHIH: And We placed it in a firm lodging [i.e., the womb]
translations.PICKTHALL: Which We laid up in a safe abode

translations.SAHIH: For a known extent.
translations.PICKTHALL: For a known term?

translations.SAHIH: And We determined [it], and excellent [are We] to determine.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus We arranged. How excellent is Our arranging!

translations.SAHIH: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!

translations.SAHIH: Have We not made the earth a container
translations.PICKTHALL: Have We not made the earth a receptacle

translations.SAHIH: Of the living and the dead?
translations.PICKTHALL: Both for the living and the dead,

translations.SAHIH: And We placed therein lofty, firmly set mountains and have given you to drink sweet water.
translations.PICKTHALL: And placed therein high mountains and given you to drink sweet water therein?

translations.SAHIH: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!

translations.SAHIH: [They will be told], "Proceed to that which you used to deny.
translations.PICKTHALL: (It will be said unto them:) Depart unto that (doom) which ye used to deny;

translations.SAHIH: Proceed to a shadow [of smoke] having three columns.
translations.PICKTHALL: Depart unto the shadow falling threefold,

translations.SAHIH: [But having] no cool shade and availing not against the flame."
translations.PICKTHALL: (Which yet is) no relief nor shelter from the flame.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it throws sparks [as huge] as a fortress,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! it throweth up sparks like the castles,

translations.SAHIH: As if they were yellowish [black] camels.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Or) as it might be camels of bright yellow hue.

translations.SAHIH: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!

translations.SAHIH: This is a Day they will not speak,
translations.PICKTHALL: This is a day wherein they speak not,

translations.SAHIH: Nor will it be permitted for them to make an excuse.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nor are they suffered to put forth excuses.

translations.SAHIH: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!

translations.SAHIH: This is the Day of Judgement; We will have assembled you and the former peoples.
translations.PICKTHALL: This is the Day of Decision, We have brought you and the men of old together.

translations.SAHIH: So if you have a plan, then plan against Me.
translations.PICKTHALL: If now ye have any wit, outwit Me.

translations.SAHIH: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, the righteous will be among shades and springs
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who kept their duty are amid shade and fountains,

translations.SAHIH: And fruits from whatever they desire,
translations.PICKTHALL: And fruits such as they desire.

translations.SAHIH: [Being told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."
translations.PICKTHALL: (Unto them it is said:) Eat, drink and welcome, O ye blessed, in return for what ye did.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thus do We reward the good.

translations.SAHIH: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!

translations.SAHIH: [O disbelievers], eat and enjoy yourselves a little; indeed, you are criminals.
translations.PICKTHALL: Eat and take your ease (on earth) a little. Lo! ye are guilty.

translations.SAHIH: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!

translations.SAHIH: And when it is said to them, "Bow [in prayer]," they do not bow.
translations.PICKTHALL: When it is said unto them: Bow down, they bow not down!

translations.SAHIH: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.PICKTHALL: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!

translations.SAHIH: Then in what statement after it [i.e., the Qur’ān] will they believe?
translations.PICKTHALL: In what statement, after this, will they believe?

translations.SAHIH: About what are they asking one another?
translations.PICKTHALL: Whereof do they question one another?

translations.SAHIH: About the great news1 -
translations.PICKTHALL: (It is) of the awful tidings,

translations.SAHIH: That over which they are in disagreement.
translations.PICKTHALL: Concerning which they are in disagreement.

translations.SAHIH: No! They are going to know.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but they will come to know!

translations.SAHIH: Then, no! They are going to know.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, again, but they will come to know!

translations.SAHIH: Have We not made the earth a resting place?
translations.PICKTHALL: Have We not made the earth an expanse,

translations.SAHIH: And the mountains as stakes?1
translations.PICKTHALL: And the high hills bulwarks?

translations.SAHIH: And We created you in pairs.
translations.PICKTHALL: And We have created you in pairs,

translations.SAHIH: And made your sleep [a means for] rest
translations.PICKTHALL: And have appointed your sleep for repose,

translations.SAHIH: And made the night as clothing1.
translations.PICKTHALL: And have appointed the night as a cloak,

translations.SAHIH: And made the day for livelihood.
translations.PICKTHALL: And have appointed the day for livelihood.

translations.SAHIH: And constructed above you seven strong [heavens].
translations.PICKTHALL: And We have built above you seven strong (heavens),

translations.SAHIH: And made [therein] a burning lamp
translations.PICKTHALL: And have appointed a dazzling lamp,

translations.SAHIH: And sent down, from the rain clouds, pouring water.
translations.PICKTHALL: And have sent down from the rainy clouds abundant water,

translations.SAHIH: That We may bring forth thereby grain and vegetation.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thereby to produce grain and plant,

translations.SAHIH: And gardens of entwined growth.
translations.PICKTHALL: And gardens of thick foliage.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, the Day of Judgement is an appointed time -
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! the Day of Decision is a fixed time,

translations.SAHIH: The Day the Horn is blown and you will come forth in multitudes
translations.PICKTHALL: A day when the trumpet is blown and ye come in multitudes,

translations.SAHIH: And the heaven is opened and will become gateways.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the heaven is opened and becometh as gates,

translations.SAHIH: And the mountains are removed and will be [but] a mirage.
translations.PICKTHALL: And the hills are set in motion and become as a mirage.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, Hell has been lying in wait
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! hell lurketh in ambush,

translations.SAHIH: For the transgressors, a place of return,
translations.PICKTHALL: A home for the rebellious.

translations.SAHIH: In which they will remain for ages [unending].
translations.PICKTHALL: They will abide therein for ages.

translations.SAHIH: They will not taste therein [any] coolness or drink.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therein taste they neither coolness nor (any) drink

translations.SAHIH: Except scalding water and [foul] purulence -
translations.PICKTHALL: Save boiling water and a paralysing cold:

translations.SAHIH: An appropriate recompense.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Reward proportioned (to their evil deeds).

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, they were not expecting an account
translations.PICKTHALL: For lo! they looked not for a reckoning;

translations.SAHIH: And denied Our verses with [emphatic] denial.
translations.PICKTHALL: They called Our revelations false with strong denial.

translations.SAHIH: But all things We have enumerated in writing.
translations.PICKTHALL: Everything have We recorded in a Book.

translations.SAHIH: "So taste [the penalty], and never will We increase you except in torment."1
translations.PICKTHALL: So taste (of that which ye have earned). No increase do We give you save of torment.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, for the righteous is attainment1 -
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! for the duteous is achievement -

translations.SAHIH: Gardens and grapevines.
translations.PICKTHALL: Gardens enclosed and vineyards,

translations.SAHIH: And full-breasted [companions] of equal age.
translations.PICKTHALL: And voluptuous women of equal age;

translations.SAHIH: And a full cup.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And a full cup.

translations.SAHIH: No ill speech will they hear therein or any falsehood -
translations.PICKTHALL: There hear they never vain discourse, nor lying -

translations.SAHIH: [As] reward from your Lord, [a generous] gift [made due by] account,1
translations.PICKTHALL: Requital from thy Lord - a gift in payment -

translations.SAHIH: [From] the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Most Merciful. They possess not from Him [authority for] speech.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Lord of the heavens and the earth, and (all) that is between them, the Beneficent; with Whom none can converse.

translations.SAHIH: The Day that the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] and the angels will stand in rows, they will not speak except for one whom the Most Merciful permits, and he will say what is correct.
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when the angels and the Spirit stand arrayed, they speak not, saving him whom the Beneficent alloweth and who speaketh right.

translations.SAHIH: That is the True [i.e., certain] Day; so he who wills may take to his Lord a [way of] return.1
translations.PICKTHALL: That is the True Day. So whoso will should seek recourse unto his Lord.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We have warned you of an impending punishment on the Day when a man will observe what his hands have put forth1 and the disbeliever will say, "Oh, I wish that I were dust!"
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We warn you of a doom at hand, a day whereon a man will look on that which his own hands have sent before, and the disbeliever will cry: "Would that I were dust!"

translations.SAHIH: By those [angels] who extract with violence1
translations.PICKTHALL: By those who drag forth to destruction,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] those who remove with ease1
translations.PICKTHALL: By the meteors rushing,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] those who glide [as if] swimming1
translations.PICKTHALL: By the lone stars floating,

translations.SAHIH: And those who race each other in a race1
translations.PICKTHALL: By the angels hastening,

translations.SAHIH: And those who arrange [each] matter,1
translations.PICKTHALL: And those who govern the event,

translations.SAHIH: On the Day the blast [of the Horn] will convulse [creation],
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when the first trump resoundeth.

translations.SAHIH: There will follow it the subsequent [one].
translations.PICKTHALL: And the second followeth it,

translations.SAHIH: Hearts,1 that Day, will tremble,
translations.PICKTHALL: On that day hearts beat painfully

translations.SAHIH: Their eyes1 humbled.
translations.PICKTHALL: While eyes are downcast

translations.SAHIH: They are [presently] saying, "Will we indeed be returned to [our] former state [of life]?
translations.PICKTHALL: (Now) they are saying: Shall we really be restored to our first state

translations.SAHIH: Even if we should be decayed bones?"1
translations.PICKTHALL: Even after we are crumbled bones?

translations.SAHIH: They say, "That, then, would be a losing return."1
translations.PICKTHALL: They say: Then that would be a vain proceeding.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it will be but one shout,
translations.PICKTHALL: Surely it will need but one shout,

translations.SAHIH: And suddenly they will be [alert] upon the earth's surface.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! they will be awakened.

translations.SAHIH: Has there reached you the story of Moses? -
translations.PICKTHALL: Hath there come unto thee the history of Moses?

translations.SAHIH: When his Lord called to him in the sacred valley of Ṭuwā,
translations.PICKTHALL: How his Lord called him in the holy vale of Tuwa,

translations.SAHIH: "Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.
translations.PICKTHALL: (Saying:) Go thou unto Pharaoh - Lo! he hath rebelled -

translations.SAHIH: And say to him, 'Would you [be willing to] purify yourself
translations.PICKTHALL: And say (unto him): Hast thou (will) to grow (in grace)?

translations.SAHIH: And let me guide you to your Lord so you would fear [Him]?'"
translations.PICKTHALL: Then I will guide thee to thy Lord and thou shalt fear (Him).

translations.SAHIH: And he showed him the greatest sign,1
translations.PICKTHALL: And he showed him the tremendous token.

translations.SAHIH: But he [i.e., Pharaoh] denied and disobeyed.
