translations.PICKTHALL: But he denied and disobeyed,

translations.SAHIH: Then he turned his back, striving [i.e., plotting].1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then turned he away in haste,

translations.SAHIH: And he gathered [his people] and called out.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then gathered he and summoned

translations.SAHIH: And said, "I am your most exalted lord."
translations.PICKTHALL: And proclaimed: "I (Pharaoh) am your Lord the Highest."

translations.SAHIH: So Allāh seized him in exemplary punishment for the last and the first [transgression].1.
translations.PICKTHALL: So Allah seized him (and made him) an example for the after (life) and for the former.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed in that is a lesson [i.e., warning] for whoever would fear [Allāh].
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! herein is indeed a lesson for him who feareth.

translations.SAHIH: Are you a more difficult creation or is the heaven? He [i.e., Allāh] constructed it.
translations.PICKTHALL: Are ye the harder to create, or is the heaven that He built?

translations.SAHIH: He raised its ceiling and proportioned it.
translations.PICKTHALL: He raised the height thereof and ordered it;

translations.SAHIH: And He darkened its night and extracted its brightness.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And He made dark the night thereof, and He brought forth the morn thereof.

translations.SAHIH: And after that He spread the earth.
translations.PICKTHALL: And after that He spread the earth,

translations.SAHIH: He extracted from it its water and its pasture,
translations.PICKTHALL: And produced therefrom the water thereof and the pasture thereof,

translations.SAHIH: And the mountains He set firmly
translations.PICKTHALL: And He made fast the hills,

translations.SAHIH: As enjoyment [i.e., provision] for you and your grazing livestock.
translations.PICKTHALL: A provision for you and for your cattle.

translations.SAHIH: But when there comes the greatest Overwhelming Calamity1 -
translations.PICKTHALL: But when the great disaster cometh,

translations.SAHIH: The Day when man will remember that for which he strove,
translations.PICKTHALL: The day when man will call to mind his (whole) endeavour,

translations.SAHIH: And Hellfire will be exposed for [all] those who see -
translations.PICKTHALL: And hell will stand forth visible to him who seeth,

translations.SAHIH: So as for he who transgressed
translations.PICKTHALL: Then, as for him who rebelled

translations.SAHIH: And preferred the life of the world,
translations.PICKTHALL: And chose the life of the world,

translations.SAHIH: Then indeed, Hellfire will be [his] refuge.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! hell will be his home.

translations.SAHIH: But as for he who feared the position of his Lord1 and prevented the soul from [unlawful] inclination,
translations.PICKTHALL: But as for him who feared to stand before his Lord and restrained his soul from lust,

translations.SAHIH: Then indeed, Paradise will be [his] refuge.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! the Garden will be his home.

translations.SAHIH: They ask you, [O Muḥammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival?1
translations.PICKTHALL: They ask thee of the Hour: when will it come to port?

translations.SAHIH: In what [position] are you that you should mention it?1
translations.PICKTHALL: Why (ask they)? What hast thou to tell thereof?

translations.SAHIH: To your Lord is its finality.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Unto thy Lord belongeth (knowledge of) the term thereof.

translations.SAHIH: You are only a warner for those who fear it.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thou art but a warner unto him who feareth it.

translations.SAHIH: It will be, on the Day they see it,1 as though they had not remained [in the world] except for an afternoon or a morning thereof.
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when they behold it, it will be as if they had but tarried for an evening or the morn thereof.

translations.SAHIH: He [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ) ] frowned and turned away
translations.PICKTHALL: He frowned and turned away

translations.SAHIH: Because there came to him the blind man,1 [interrupting].
translations.PICKTHALL: Because the blind man came unto him.

translations.SAHIH: But what would make you perceive, [O Muḥammad], that perhaps he might be purified1
translations.PICKTHALL: What could inform thee but that he might grow (in grace)

translations.SAHIH: Or be reminded and the remembrance would benefit him?
translations.PICKTHALL: Or take heed and so the reminder might avail him?

translations.SAHIH: As for he who thinks himself without need,1
translations.PICKTHALL: As for him who thinketh himself independent,

translations.SAHIH: To him you give attention.
translations.PICKTHALL: Unto him thou payest regard.

translations.SAHIH: And not upon you [is any blame] if he will not be purified.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Yet it is not thy concern if he grow not (in grace).

translations.SAHIH: But as for he who came to you striving [for knowledge]
translations.PICKTHALL: But as for him who cometh unto thee with earnest purpose

translations.SAHIH: While he fears [Allāh],
translations.PICKTHALL: And hath fear,

translations.SAHIH: From him you are distracted.
translations.PICKTHALL: From him thou art distracted.

translations.SAHIH: No! Indeed, they [i.e., these verses] are a reminder;
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but verily it is an Admonishment,

translations.SAHIH: So whoever wills may remember it.1
translations.PICKTHALL: So let whosoever will pay heed to it,

translations.SAHIH: [It is recorded] in honored sheets,
translations.PICKTHALL: On honoured leaves

translations.SAHIH: Exalted and purified,
translations.PICKTHALL: Exalted, purified,

translations.SAHIH: [Carried] by the hands of messenger-angels,
translations.PICKTHALL: (Set down) by scribes

translations.SAHIH: Noble and dutiful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Noble and righteous.

translations.SAHIH: Destroyed [i.e., cursed] is man;1 how disbelieving is he.
translations.PICKTHALL: Man is (self-)destroyed: how ungrateful!

translations.SAHIH: From what thing [i.e., substance] did He create him?
translations.PICKTHALL: From what thing doth He create him?

translations.SAHIH: From a sperm-drop He created him and destined for him;1
translations.PICKTHALL: From a drop of seed. He createth him and proportioneth him,

translations.SAHIH: Then He eased the way for him;1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then maketh the way easy for him,

translations.SAHIH: Then He causes his death and provides a grave for him.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then causeth him to die, and burieth him;

translations.SAHIH: Then when He wills, He will resurrect him.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then, when He will, He bringeth him again to life.

translations.SAHIH: No! He [i.e., man] has not yet accomplished what He commanded him.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but (man) hath not done what He commanded him.

translations.SAHIH: Then let mankind look at his food -
translations.PICKTHALL: Let man consider his food:

translations.SAHIH: How We poured down water in torrents,
translations.PICKTHALL: How We pour water in showers

translations.SAHIH: Then We broke open the earth, splitting [it with sprouts],
translations.PICKTHALL: Then split the earth in clefts

translations.SAHIH: And caused to grow within it grain
translations.PICKTHALL: And cause the grain to grow therein

translations.SAHIH: And grapes and herbage
translations.PICKTHALL: And grapes and green fodder

translations.SAHIH: And olive and palm trees
translations.PICKTHALL: And olive-trees and palm-trees

translations.SAHIH: And gardens of dense shrubbery
translations.PICKTHALL: And garden-closes of thick foliage

translations.SAHIH: And fruit and grass -
translations.PICKTHALL: And fruits and grasses:

translations.SAHIH: [As] enjoyment [i.e., provision] for you and your grazing livestock.
translations.PICKTHALL: Provision for you and your cattle.

translations.SAHIH: But when there comes the Deafening Blast1
translations.PICKTHALL: But when the Shout cometh

translations.SAHIH: On the Day a man will flee from his brother
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when a man fleeth from his brother

translations.SAHIH: And his mother and his father
translations.PICKTHALL: And his mother and his father

translations.SAHIH: And his wife and his children,
translations.PICKTHALL: And his wife and his children,

translations.SAHIH: For every man, that Day, will be a matter adequate for him.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Every man that day will have concern enough to make him heedless (of others).

translations.SAHIH: [Some] faces, that Day, will be bright -
translations.PICKTHALL: On that day faces will be bright as dawn,

translations.SAHIH: Laughing, rejoicing at good news.
translations.PICKTHALL: Laughing, rejoicing at good news;

translations.SAHIH: And [other] faces, that Day, will have upon them dust.
translations.PICKTHALL: And other faces, on that day, with dust upon them,

translations.SAHIH: Blackness will cover them.
translations.PICKTHALL: Veiled in darkness,

translations.SAHIH: Those are the disbelievers, the wicked ones.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those are the disbelievers, the wicked.

translations.SAHIH: When the sun is wrapped up [in darkness]
translations.PICKTHALL: When the sun is overthrown,

translations.SAHIH: And when the stars fall, dispersing,
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the stars fall,

translations.SAHIH: And when the mountains are removed
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the hills are moved,

translations.SAHIH: And when full-term she-camels1 are neglected
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the camels big with young are abandoned,

translations.SAHIH: And when the wild beasts are gathered
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the wild beasts are herded together,

translations.SAHIH: And when the seas are filled with flame1
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the seas rise,

translations.SAHIH: And when the souls are paired1
translations.PICKTHALL: And when souls are reunited,

translations.SAHIH: And when the girl [who was] buried alive is asked
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the girl-child that was buried alive is asked

translations.SAHIH: For what sin she was killed
translations.PICKTHALL: For what sin she was slain,

translations.SAHIH: And when the pages1 are spread [i.e., made public]
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the pages are laid open,

translations.SAHIH: And when the sky is stripped away
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the sky is torn away,

translations.SAHIH: And when Hellfire is set ablaze
translations.PICKTHALL: And when hell is lighted,

translations.SAHIH: And when Paradise is brought near,
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the Garden is brought nigh,

translations.SAHIH: A soul will [then] know what it has brought [with it].1
translations.PICKTHALL: (Then) every soul will know what it hath made ready.

translations.SAHIH: So I swear by the retreating stars -
translations.PICKTHALL: Oh, but I call to witness the planets,

translations.SAHIH: Those that run [their courses] and disappear [i.e., set]
translations.PICKTHALL: The stars which rise and set,

translations.SAHIH: And by the night as it closes in1
translations.PICKTHALL: And the close of night,

translations.SAHIH: And by the dawn when it breathes [i.e., stirs]
translations.PICKTHALL: And the breath of morning

translations.SAHIH: [That] indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a word [conveyed by] a noble messenger [i.e., Gabriel]
translations.PICKTHALL: That this is in truth the word of an honoured messenger,

translations.SAHIH: [Who is] possessed of power and with the Owner of the Throne, secure [in position],
translations.PICKTHALL: Mighty, established in the presence of the Lord of the Throne,

translations.SAHIH: Obeyed there [in the heavens] and trustworthy.
translations.PICKTHALL: (One) to be obeyed, and trustworthy;

translations.SAHIH: And your companion [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) ] is not [at all] mad.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And your comrade is not mad.

translations.SAHIH: And he has already seen him [i.e., Gabriel] in the clear horizon.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Surely he beheld Him on the clear horizon.

translations.SAHIH: And he [i.e., Muḥammad (ﷺ)] is not a withholder of [knowledge of] the unseen.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And he is not avid of the Unseen.

translations.SAHIH: And it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is not the word of a devil, expelled [from the heavens].
translations.PICKTHALL: Nor is this the utterance of a devil worthy to be stoned.

translations.SAHIH: So where are you going?1
translations.PICKTHALL: Whither then go ye?

translations.SAHIH: It is not except a reminder to the worlds
translations.PICKTHALL: This is naught else than a reminder unto creation,

translations.SAHIH: For whoever wills among you to take a right course.
translations.PICKTHALL: Unto whomsoever of you willeth to walk straight.

translations.SAHIH: And you do not will except that Allāh wills - Lord of the worlds.
translations.PICKTHALL: And ye will not, unless (it be) that Allah willeth, the Lord of Creation.

translations.SAHIH: When the sky breaks apart
translations.PICKTHALL: When the heaven is cleft asunder,

translations.SAHIH: And when the stars fall, scattering,
translations.PICKTHALL: When the planets are dispersed,

translations.SAHIH: And when the seas are erupted
translations.PICKTHALL: When the seas are poured forth,

translations.SAHIH: And when the [contents of] graves are scattered [i.e., exposed],
translations.PICKTHALL: And the sepulchres are overturned,

translations.SAHIH: A soul will [then] know what it has put forth and kept back.
translations.PICKTHALL: A soul will know what it hath sent before (it) and what left behind.

translations.SAHIH: O mankind, what has deceived you concerning your Lord, the Generous,
translations.PICKTHALL: O man! What hath made thee careless concerning thy Lord, the Bountiful,

translations.SAHIH: Who created you, proportioned you, and balanced you?
translations.PICKTHALL: Who created thee, then fashioned, then proportioned thee?

translations.SAHIH: In whatever form He willed has He assembled you.
translations.PICKTHALL: Into whatsoever form He will, He casteth thee.

translations.SAHIH: No! But you deny the Recompense.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but ye deny the Judgment.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, [appointed] over you are keepers,1
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! there are above you guardians,

translations.SAHIH: Noble and recording;
translations.PICKTHALL: Generous and recording,

translations.SAHIH: They know whatever you do.
translations.PICKTHALL: Who know (all) that ye do.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! the righteous verily will be in delight.

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, the wicked will be in Hellfire.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! the wicked verily will be in hell;

translations.SAHIH: They will [enter to] burn therein on the Day of Recompense,
translations.PICKTHALL: They will burn therein on the Day of Judgment,

translations.SAHIH: And never therefrom will they be absent.
translations.PICKTHALL: And will not be absent thence.

translations.SAHIH: And what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?
translations.PICKTHALL: Ah, what will convey unto thee what the Day of Judgment is!

translations.SAHIH: Then, what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?
translations.PICKTHALL: Again, what will convey unto thee what the Day of Judgment is!

translations.SAHIH: It is the Day when a soul will not possess for another soul [power to do] a thing; and the command, that Day, is [entirely] with Allāh.
translations.PICKTHALL: A day on which no soul hath power at all for any (other) soul. The (absolute) command on that day is Allah's.

translations.SAHIH: Woe to those who give less [than due],1
translations.PICKTHALL: Woe unto the defrauders:

translations.SAHIH: Who, when they take a measure from people, take in full.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who when they take the measure from mankind demand it full,

translations.SAHIH: But if they give by measure or by weight to them, they cause loss.
translations.PICKTHALL: But if they measure unto them or weight for them, they cause them loss.

translations.SAHIH: Do they not think that they will be resurrected
translations.PICKTHALL: Do such (men) not consider that they will be raised again

translations.SAHIH: For a tremendous Day -
translations.PICKTHALL: Unto an Awful Day,

translations.SAHIH: The Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the worlds?
translations.PICKTHALL: The day when (all) mankind stand before the Lord of the Worlds?

translations.SAHIH: No! Indeed, the record of the wicked is in sijjeen.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but the record of the vile is in Sijjin -

translations.SAHIH: And what can make you know what is sijjeen?
translations.PICKTHALL: Ah! what will convey unto thee what Sijjin is! -

translations.SAHIH: It is [their destination1 recorded in] a register inscribed.
translations.PICKTHALL: A written record.

translations.SAHIH: Woe, that Day, to the deniers,
translations.PICKTHALL: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!

translations.SAHIH: Who deny the Day of Recompense.
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who deny the Day of Judgment

translations.SAHIH: And none deny it except every sinful transgressor.
translations.PICKTHALL: Which none denieth save each criminal transgressor,

translations.SAHIH: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
translations.PICKTHALL: Who, when thou readest unto him Our revelations, saith: (Mere) fables of the men of old.

translations.SAHIH: No! Rather, the stain has covered their hearts of that which they were earning.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but that which they have earned is rust upon their hearts.

translations.SAHIH: No! Indeed, from their Lord, that Day, they will be partitioned.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but surely on that day they will be covered from (the mercy of) their Lord.

translations.SAHIH: Then indeed, they will [enter and] burn in Hellfire.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then lo! they verily will burn in hell,

translations.SAHIH: Then it will be said [to them], "This is what you used to deny."
translations.PICKTHALL: And it will be said (unto them): This is that which ye used to deny.

translations.SAHIH: No! Indeed, the record of the righteous is in ʿilliyyūn.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but the record of the righteous is in 'Illiyin -

translations.SAHIH: And what can make you know what is ʿilliyyūn?
translations.PICKTHALL: Ah, what will convey unto thee what 'Illiyin is! -

translations.SAHIH: It is [their destination1 recorded in] a register inscribed
translations.PICKTHALL: A written record,

translations.SAHIH: Which is witnessed by those brought near [to Allāh].
translations.PICKTHALL: Attested by those who are brought near (unto their Lord).

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! the righteous verily are in delight,

translations.SAHIH: On adorned couches, observing.
translations.PICKTHALL: On couches, gazing,

translations.SAHIH: You will recognize in their faces the radiance of pleasure.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thou wilt know in their faces the radiance of delight.

translations.SAHIH: They will be given to drink [pure] wine1 [which was] sealed.
translations.PICKTHALL: They are given to drink of a pure wine, sealed,

translations.SAHIH: The last of it1 is musk. So for this let the competitors compete.
translations.PICKTHALL: Whose seal is musk - for this let (all) those strive who strive for bliss -

translations.SAHIH: And its mixture is of Tasneem,1
translations.PICKTHALL: And mixed with water of Tasnim,

translations.SAHIH: A spring from which those near [to Allāh] drink.
translations.PICKTHALL: A spring whence those brought near (to Allah) drink.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! the guilty used to laugh at those who believed,

translations.SAHIH: And when they passed by them, they would exchange derisive glances.
translations.PICKTHALL: And wink one to another when they passed them;

translations.SAHIH: And when they returned to their people, they would return jesting.
translations.PICKTHALL: And when they returned to their own folk, they returned jesting;

translations.SAHIH: And when they saw them, they would say, "Indeed, those are truly lost."
translations.PICKTHALL: And when they saw them they said: Lo! these have gone astray.

translations.SAHIH: But they had not been sent as guardians over them.
translations.PICKTHALL: Yet they were not sent as guardians over them.

translations.SAHIH: So Today1 those who believed are laughing at the disbelievers,
translations.PICKTHALL: This day it is those who believe who have the laugh of disbelievers,

translations.SAHIH: On adorned couches, observing.
translations.PICKTHALL: On high couches, gazing.

translations.SAHIH: Have the disbelievers [not] been rewarded [this Day] for what they used to do?
translations.PICKTHALL: Are not the disbelievers paid for what they used to do?

translations.SAHIH: When the sky has split [open]
translations.PICKTHALL: When the heaven is split asunder

translations.SAHIH: And has listened [i.e., responded]1 to its Lord and was obligated [to do so]
translations.PICKTHALL: And attentive to her Lord in fear,

translations.SAHIH: And when the earth has been extended1
translations.PICKTHALL: And when the earth is spread out

translations.SAHIH: And has cast out that within it1 and relinquished [it].
translations.PICKTHALL: And hath cast out all that was in her, and is empty

translations.SAHIH: And has listened [i.e., responded] to its Lord and was obligated [to do so] -
translations.PICKTHALL: And attentive to her Lord in fear!

translations.SAHIH: O mankind, indeed you are laboring toward your Lord with [great] exertion1 and will meet it.2
translations.PICKTHALL: Thou, verily, O man, art working toward thy Lord a work which thou wilt meet (in His presence).

translations.SAHIH: Then as for he who is given his record in his right hand,
translations.PICKTHALL: Then whoso is given his account in his right hand

translations.SAHIH: He will be judged with an easy account
translations.PICKTHALL: He truly will receive an easy reckoning

translations.SAHIH: And return to his people in happiness.
translations.PICKTHALL: And will return unto his folk in joy.

translations.SAHIH: But as for he who is given his record behind his back,
translations.PICKTHALL: But whoso is given his account behind his back,

translations.SAHIH: He will cry out for destruction
translations.PICKTHALL: He surely will invoke destruction

translations.SAHIH: And [enter to] burn in a Blaze.
translations.PICKTHALL: And be thrown to scorching fire.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, he had [once] been among his people in happiness;
translations.PICKTHALL: He verily lived joyous with his folk,

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, he had thought he would never return [to Allāh].
translations.PICKTHALL: He verily deemed that he would never return (unto Allah).

translations.SAHIH: But yes! Indeed, his Lord was ever, of him, Seeing.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but lo! his Lord is ever looking on him!

translations.SAHIH: So I swear by the twilight glow
translations.PICKTHALL: Oh, I swear by the afterglow of sunset,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the night and what it envelops
translations.PICKTHALL: And by the night and all that it enshroudeth,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the moon when it becomes full
translations.PICKTHALL: And by the moon when she is at the full,

translations.SAHIH: [That] you will surely embark upon [i.e., experience] state after state.1
translations.PICKTHALL: That ye shall journey on from plane to plane.

translations.SAHIH: So what is [the matter] with them [that] they do not believe,
translations.PICKTHALL: What aileth them, then, that they believe not

translations.SAHIH: And when the Qur’ān is recited to them, they do not prostrate [to Allāh]?
translations.PICKTHALL: And, when the Qur'an is recited unto them, worship not (Allah)?

translations.SAHIH: But those who have disbelieved deny,
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but those who disbelieve will deny;

translations.SAHIH: And Allāh is most knowing of what they keep within themselves.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Allah knoweth best what they are hiding.

translations.SAHIH: So give them tidings of a painful punishment,
translations.PICKTHALL: So give them tidings of a painful doom,

translations.SAHIH: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds. For them is a reward uninterrupted.
translations.PICKTHALL: Save those who believe and do good works, for theirs is a reward unfailing.

translations.SAHIH: By the sky containing great stars
translations.PICKTHALL: By the heaven, holding mansions of the stars,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the promised Day
translations.PICKTHALL: And by the Promised Day.

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the witness and what is witnessed,
translations.PICKTHALL: And by the witness and that whereunto he beareth testimony,

translations.SAHIH: Destroyed [i.e., cursed] were the companions of the trench1
translations.PICKTHALL: (Self-)destroyed were the owners of the ditch

translations.SAHIH: [Containing] the fire full of fuel,
translations.PICKTHALL: Of the fuel-fed fire,

translations.SAHIH: When they were sitting near it.
translations.PICKTHALL: When they sat by it,

translations.SAHIH: And they, to what they were doing against the believers, were witnesses. 1
translations.PICKTHALL: And were themselves the witnesses of what they did to the believers.

translations.SAHIH: And they resented them not except because they believed in Allāh, the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy,
translations.PICKTHALL: They had naught against them save that they believed in Allah, the Mighty, the Owner of Praise,

translations.SAHIH: To whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And Allāh, over all things, is Witness.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Him unto Whom belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is of all things the Witness.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those who have tortured1 the believing men and believing women and then have not repented will have the punishment of Hell, and they will have the punishment of the Burning Fire.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! they who persecute believing men and believing women and repent not, theirs verily will be the doom of hell, and theirs the doom of burning.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have gardens beneath which rivers flow. That is the great attainment.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who believe and do good works, theirs will be Gardens underneath which rivers flow. That is the Great Success.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, the assault [i.e., vengeance] of your Lord is severe.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! the punishment of thy Lord is stern.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it is He who originates [creation] and repeats.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! He it is Who produceth, then reproduceth,

translations.SAHIH: And He is the Forgiving, the Affectionate,
translations.PICKTHALL: And He is the Forgiving, the Loving,

translations.SAHIH: Honorable Owner of the Throne,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lord of the Throne of Glory,

translations.SAHIH: Effecter of what He intends.
translations.PICKTHALL: Doer of what He will.

translations.SAHIH: Has there reached you the story of the soldiers -
translations.PICKTHALL: Hath there come unto thee the story of the hosts

translations.SAHIH: [Those of] Pharaoh and Thamūd?
translations.PICKTHALL: Of Pharaoh and (the tribe of) Thamud?

translations.SAHIH: But they who disbelieve are in [persistent] denial,
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but those who disbelieve live in denial

translations.SAHIH: While Allāh encompasses them from behind.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And Allah, all unseen, surroundeth them.

translations.SAHIH: But this is an honored Qur’ān
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but it is a glorious Qur'an.

translations.SAHIH: [Inscribed] in a Preserved Slate.
translations.PICKTHALL: On a guarded tablet.

translations.SAHIH: By the sky and the night comer
translations.PICKTHALL: By the heaven and the Morning Star

translations.SAHIH: And what can make you know what is the night comer?
translations.PICKTHALL: - Ah, what will tell thee what the Morning Star is!

translations.SAHIH: It is the piercing star1
translations.PICKTHALL: - The piercing Star!

translations.SAHIH: There is no soul but that it has over it a protector.
translations.PICKTHALL: No human soul but hath a guardian over it.

translations.SAHIH: So let man observe from what he was created.
translations.PICKTHALL: So let man consider from what he is created.

translations.SAHIH: He was created from a fluid, ejected,
translations.PICKTHALL: He is created from a gushing fluid

translations.SAHIH: Emerging from between the backbone and the ribs.
translations.PICKTHALL: That issued from between the loins and ribs.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, He [i.e., Allāh], to return him [to life], is Able.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! He verily is Able to return him (unto life)

translations.SAHIH: The Day when secrets will be put on trial,1
translations.PICKTHALL: On the day when hidden thoughts shall be searched out.

translations.SAHIH: Then he [i.e., man] will have no power or any helper.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then will he have no might nor any helper.

translations.SAHIH: By the sky which sends back1
translations.PICKTHALL: By the heaven which giveth the returning rain,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the earth which splits,1
translations.PICKTHALL: And the earth which splitteth (with the growth of trees and plants)

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a decisive statement,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! this (Qur'an) is a conclusive word,

translations.SAHIH: And it is not amusement.
translations.PICKTHALL: It is no pleasantry.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, they are planning a plan,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! they plot a plot (against thee, O Muhammad)

translations.SAHIH: But I am planning a plan.
translations.PICKTHALL: And I plot a plot (against them).

translations.SAHIH: So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile.1
translations.PICKTHALL: So give a respite to the disbelievers. Deal thou gently with them for a while.

translations.SAHIH: Exalt the name of your Lord, the Most High,
translations.PICKTHALL: Praise the name of thy Lord the Most High,

translations.SAHIH: Who created and proportioned
translations.PICKTHALL: Who createth, then disposeth;

translations.SAHIH: And who destined and [then] guided
translations.PICKTHALL: Who measureth, then guideth;

translations.SAHIH: And who brings out the pasture
translations.PICKTHALL: Who bringeth forth the pasturage,

translations.SAHIH: And [then] makes it black stubble.
translations.PICKTHALL: Then turneth it to russet stubble.

translations.SAHIH: We will make you recite, [O Muḥammad], and you will not forget,
translations.PICKTHALL: We shall make thee read (O Muhammad) so that thou shalt not forget

translations.SAHIH: Except what Allāh should will. Indeed, He knows what is declared and what is hidden.
translations.PICKTHALL: Save that which Allah willeth. Lo! He knoweth the disclosed and that which still is hidden;

translations.SAHIH: And We will ease you toward ease.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And We shall ease thy way unto the state of ease.

translations.SAHIH: So remind, if the reminder should benefit;1
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor remind (men), for of use is the reminder.

translations.SAHIH: He who fears [Allāh] will be reminded.
translations.PICKTHALL: He will heed who feareth,

translations.SAHIH: But the wretched one will avoid it
translations.PICKTHALL: But the most hapless will flout it,

translations.SAHIH: [He] who will [enter and] burn in the greatest Fire,
translations.PICKTHALL: He who will be flung to the great Fire

translations.SAHIH: Neither dying therein nor living.
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherein he will neither die nor live.

translations.SAHIH: He has certainly succeeded who purifies himself
translations.PICKTHALL: He is successful who groweth,

translations.SAHIH: And mentions the name of his Lord and prays.
translations.PICKTHALL: And remembereth the name of his Lord, so prayeth,

translations.SAHIH: But you prefer the worldly life,
translations.PICKTHALL: But ye prefer the life of the world

translations.SAHIH: While the Hereafter is better and more enduring.
translations.PICKTHALL: Although the Hereafter is better and more lasting.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, this is in the former scriptures,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! This is in the former scrolls.

translations.SAHIH: The scriptures of Abraham and Moses.
translations.PICKTHALL: The Books of Abraham and Moses.

translations.SAHIH: Has there reached you the report of the Overwhelming [event]?
translations.PICKTHALL: Hath there come unto thee tidings of the Overwhelming?

translations.SAHIH: [Some] faces, that Day, will be humbled,
translations.PICKTHALL: On that day (many) faces will be downcast,

translations.SAHIH: Working [hard] and exhausted.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Toiling, weary,

translations.SAHIH: They will [enter to] burn in an intensely hot Fire.
translations.PICKTHALL: Scorched by burning fire,

translations.SAHIH: They will be given drink from a boiling spring.
translations.PICKTHALL: Drinking from a boiling spring,

translations.SAHIH: For them there will be no food except from a poisonous, thorny plant
translations.PICKTHALL: No food for them save bitter thorn-fruit

translations.SAHIH: Which neither nourishes nor avails against hunger.
translations.PICKTHALL: Which doth not nourish nor release from hunger.

translations.SAHIH: [Other] faces, that Day, will show pleasure.
translations.PICKTHALL: In that day other faces will be calm,

translations.SAHIH: With their effort [they are] satisfied
translations.PICKTHALL: Glad for their effort past,

translations.SAHIH: In an elevated garden,
translations.PICKTHALL: In a high Garden

translations.SAHIH: Wherein they will hear no unsuitable speech.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Where they hear no idle speech,

translations.SAHIH: Within it is a flowing spring.
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherein is a gushing spring,

translations.SAHIH: Within it are couches raised high
translations.PICKTHALL: Wherein are couches raised

translations.SAHIH: And cups put in place
translations.PICKTHALL: And goblets set at hand

translations.SAHIH: And cushions lined up
translations.PICKTHALL: And cushions ranged

translations.SAHIH: And carpets spread around.
translations.PICKTHALL: And silken carpets spread.

translations.SAHIH: Then do they not look at the camels - how they are created?
translations.PICKTHALL: Will they not regard the camels, how they are created?

translations.SAHIH: And at the sky - how it is raised?
translations.PICKTHALL: And the heaven, how it is raised?

translations.SAHIH: And at the mountains - how they are erected?
translations.PICKTHALL: And the hills, how they are set up?

translations.SAHIH: And at the earth - how it is spread out?
translations.PICKTHALL: And the earth, how it is spread?

translations.SAHIH: So remind, [O Muḥammad]; you are only a reminder.
translations.PICKTHALL: Remind them, for thou art but a remembrancer,

translations.SAHIH: You are not over them a controller.
translations.PICKTHALL: Thou art not at all a warder over them.

translations.SAHIH: However, he who turns away and disbelieves
translations.PICKTHALL: But whoso is averse and disbelieveth,

translations.SAHIH: Then Allāh will punish him with the greatest punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah will punish him with direst punishment.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, to Us is their return.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! unto Us is their return

translations.SAHIH: Then indeed, upon Us is their account.
translations.PICKTHALL: And Ours their reckoning.

translations.SAHIH: By the dawn
translations.PICKTHALL: By the Dawn

translations.SAHIH: And [by] ten nights1
translations.PICKTHALL: And ten nights,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the even [number] and the odd
translations.PICKTHALL: And the Even and the Odd,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the night when it passes,
translations.PICKTHALL: And the night when it departeth,

translations.SAHIH: Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient] for one of perception?1
translations.PICKTHALL: There surely is an oath for thinking man.

translations.SAHIH: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with ʿAad -
translations.PICKTHALL: Dost thou not consider how thy Lord dealt with (the tribe of) A'ad,

translations.SAHIH: [With] Iram1 - who had lofty pillars,2
translations.PICKTHALL: With many-columned Iram,

translations.SAHIH: The likes of whom had never been created in the land?
translations.PICKTHALL: The like of which was not created in the lands;

translations.SAHIH: And [with] Thamūd, who carved out the rocks in the valley?
translations.PICKTHALL: And with (the tribe of) Thamud, who clove the rocks in the valley;

translations.SAHIH: And [with] Pharaoh, owner of the stakes?1
translations.PICKTHALL: And with Pharaoh, firm of might,

translations.SAHIH: [All of] whom oppressed within the lands
translations.PICKTHALL: Who (all) were rebellious (to Allah) in these lands,

translations.SAHIH: And increased therein the corruption.
translations.PICKTHALL: And multiplied iniquity therein?

translations.SAHIH: So your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefore thy Lord poured on them the disaster of His punishment.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, your Lord is in observation.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! thy Lord is ever watchful.

translations.SAHIH: And as for man, when his Lord tries him and [thus] is generous to him and favors him, he says, "My Lord has honored me."1
translations.PICKTHALL: As for man, whenever his Lord trieth him by honouring him, and is gracious unto him, he saith: My Lord honoureth me.

translations.SAHIH: But when He tries him and restricts his provision, he says, "My Lord has humiliated me."
translations.PICKTHALL: But whenever He trieth him by straitening his means of life, he saith: My Lord despiseth me.

translations.SAHIH: No!1 But you do not honor the orphan
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but ye (for your part) honour not the orphan

translations.SAHIH: And you do not encourage one another to feed the poor.
translations.PICKTHALL: And urge not on the feeding of the poor.

translations.SAHIH: And you consume inheritance, devouring [it] altogether,1
translations.PICKTHALL: And ye devour heritages with devouring greed.

translations.SAHIH: And you love wealth with immense love.
translations.PICKTHALL: And love wealth with abounding love.

translations.SAHIH: No! When the earth has been leveled - pounded and crushed
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but when the earth is ground to atoms, grinding, grinding,

translations.SAHIH: And your Lord has come1 and the angels, rank upon rank,
translations.PICKTHALL: And thy Lord shall come with angels, rank on rank,

translations.SAHIH: And brought [within view], that Day, is Hell - that Day, man will remember, but how [i.e., what good] to him will be the remembrance?
translations.PICKTHALL: And hell is brought near that day; on that day man will remember, but how will the remembrance (then avail him)?

translations.SAHIH: He will say, "Oh, I wish I had sent ahead [some good] for my life."1
translations.PICKTHALL: He will say: Ah, would that I had sent before me (some provision) for my life!

translations.SAHIH: So on that Day, none will punish [as severely] as His punishment,
translations.PICKTHALL: None punisheth as He will punish on that day!

translations.SAHIH: And none will bind [as severely] as His binding [of the evildoers].
translations.PICKTHALL: None bindeth as He then will bind.

translations.SAHIH: [To the righteous it will be said], "O reassured soul,
translations.PICKTHALL: But ah! thou soul at peace!

translations.SAHIH: Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him],
translations.PICKTHALL: Return unto thy Lord, content in His good pleasure!

translations.SAHIH: And enter among My [righteous] servants
translations.PICKTHALL: Enter thou among My bondmen!

translations.SAHIH: And enter My Paradise."
translations.PICKTHALL: Enter thou My Garden!

translations.SAHIH: I swear by this city [i.e., Makkah]
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, I swear by this city -

translations.SAHIH: And you, [O Muḥammad], are free of restriction in this city
translations.PICKTHALL: And thou art an indweller of this city -

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the father1 and that which was born [of him],
translations.PICKTHALL: And the begetter and that which he begat,

translations.SAHIH: We have certainly created man into hardship.
translations.PICKTHALL: We verily have created man in an atmosphere:

translations.SAHIH: Does he think that never will anyone overcome him?
translations.PICKTHALL: Thinketh he that none hath power over him?

translations.SAHIH: He says, "I have spent wealth in abundance."
translations.PICKTHALL: And he saith: I have destroyed vast wealth:

translations.SAHIH: Does he think that no one has seen him?
translations.PICKTHALL: Thinketh he that none beholdeth him?

translations.SAHIH: Have We not made for him two eyes?
translations.PICKTHALL: Did We not assign unto him two eyes

translations.SAHIH: And a tongue and two lips?
translations.PICKTHALL: And a tongue and two lips,

translations.SAHIH: And have shown him the two ways?1
translations.PICKTHALL: And guide him to the parting of the mountain ways?

translations.SAHIH: But he has not broken through the difficult pass.1
translations.PICKTHALL: But he hath not attempted the Ascent -

translations.SAHIH: And what can make you know what is [breaking through] the difficult pass?
translations.PICKTHALL: Ah, what will convey unto thee what the Ascent is! -

translations.SAHIH: It is the freeing of a slave
translations.PICKTHALL: (It is) to free a slave,

translations.SAHIH: Or feeding on a day of severe hunger
translations.PICKTHALL: And to feed in the day of hunger.

translations.SAHIH: An orphan of near relationship
translations.PICKTHALL: An orphan near of kin,

translations.SAHIH: Or a needy person in misery
translations.PICKTHALL: Or some poor wretch in misery,

translations.SAHIH: And then being among those who believed and advised one another to patience and advised one another to compassion.
translations.PICKTHALL: And to be of those who believe and exhort one another to perseverance and exhort one another to pity.

translations.SAHIH: Those are the companions of the right.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Their place will be on the right hand.

translations.SAHIH: But they who disbelieved in Our signs - those are the companions of the left.1
translations.PICKTHALL: But those who disbelieve Our revelations, their place will be on the left hand.

translations.SAHIH: Over them will be fire closed in.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Fire will be an awning over them.

translations.SAHIH: By the sun and its brightness
translations.PICKTHALL: By the sun and his brightness,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the moon when it follows it
translations.PICKTHALL: And the moon when she followeth him,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the day when it displays it1
translations.PICKTHALL: And the day when it revealeth him,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the night when it covers [i.e., conceals] it
translations.PICKTHALL: And the night when it enshroudeth him,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the sky and He who constructed it
translations.PICKTHALL: And the heaven and Him Who built it,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the earth and He who spread it
translations.PICKTHALL: And the earth and Him Who spread it,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the soul and He who proportioned it1
translations.PICKTHALL: And a soul and Him Who perfected it

translations.SAHIH: And inspired it [with discernment of] its wickedness and its righteousness,
translations.PICKTHALL: And inspired it (with conscience of) what is wrong for it and (what is) right for it.

translations.SAHIH: He has succeeded who purifies it,
translations.PICKTHALL: He is indeed successful who causeth it to grow,

translations.SAHIH: And he has failed who instills it [with corruption].
translations.PICKTHALL: And he is indeed a failure who stunteth it.

translations.SAHIH: Thamūd denied [their prophet] by reason of their transgression,
translations.PICKTHALL: (The tribe of) Thamud denied (the truth) in their rebellious pride,

translations.SAHIH: When the most wretched of them was sent forth.1
translations.PICKTHALL: When the basest of them broke forth

translations.SAHIH: And the messenger of Allāh [i.e., Ṣāliḥ] said to them, "[Do not harm] the she-camel of Allāh or [prevent her from] her drink."
translations.PICKTHALL: And the messenger of Allah said: It is the she-camel of Allah, so let her drink!

translations.SAHIH: But they denied him and hamstrung1 her. So their Lord brought down upon them destruction for their sin and made it equal [upon all of them].
translations.PICKTHALL: But they denied him, and they hamstrung her, so Allah doomed them for their sin and rased (their dwellings).

translations.SAHIH: And He does not fear the consequence thereof.1
translations.PICKTHALL: He dreadeth not the sequel (of events).

translations.SAHIH: By the night when it covers1
translations.PICKTHALL: By the night enshrouding

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the day when it appears
translations.PICKTHALL: And the day resplendent

translations.SAHIH: And [by] He who created the male and female,
translations.PICKTHALL: And Him Who hath created male and female,

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, your efforts are diverse.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! your effort is dispersed (toward divers ends).

translations.SAHIH: As for he who gives and fears Allāh
translations.PICKTHALL: As for him who giveth and is dutiful (toward Allah)

translations.SAHIH: And believes in the best [reward],
translations.PICKTHALL: And believeth in goodness;

translations.SAHIH: We will ease him toward ease.
translations.PICKTHALL: Surely We will ease his way unto the state of ease.

translations.SAHIH: But as for he who withholds and considers himself free of need
translations.PICKTHALL: But as for him who hoardeth and deemeth himself independent,

translations.SAHIH: And denies the best [reward],
translations.PICKTHALL: And disbelieveth in goodness;

translations.SAHIH: We will ease him toward difficulty.
translations.PICKTHALL: Surely We will ease his way unto adversity.

translations.SAHIH: And what will his wealth avail him when he falls?1
translations.PICKTHALL: His riches will not save him when he perisheth.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, [incumbent] upon Us is guidance.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! Ours it is (to give) the guidance

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, to us belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! unto Us belong the latter portion and the former.

translations.SAHIH: So I have warned you of a Fire which is blazing.
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor have I warned you of the flaming Fire

translations.SAHIH: None will [enter to] burn therein except the most wretched one
translations.PICKTHALL: Which only the most wretched must endure,

translations.SAHIH: Who had denied and turned away.
translations.PICKTHALL: He who denieth and turneth away.

translations.SAHIH: But the righteous one will avoid it
translations.PICKTHALL: Far removed from it will be the righteous

translations.SAHIH: [He] who gives [from] his wealth to purify himself
translations.PICKTHALL: Who giveth his wealth that he may grow (in goodness).

translations.SAHIH: And not [giving] for anyone who has [done him] a favor to be rewarded1
translations.PICKTHALL: And none hath with him any favour for reward,

translations.SAHIH: But only seeking the face [i.e., acceptance] of his Lord, Most High.
translations.PICKTHALL: Except as seeking (to fulfil) the purpose of his Lord Most High.

translations.SAHIH: And he is going to be satisfied.
translations.PICKTHALL: He verily will be content.

translations.SAHIH: By the morning brightness
translations.PICKTHALL: By the morning hours

translations.SAHIH: And [by] the night when it covers with darkness,1
translations.PICKTHALL: And by the night when it is stillest,

translations.SAHIH: Your Lord has not taken leave of you, [O Muḥammad], nor has He detested [you].
translations.PICKTHALL: Thy Lord hath not forsaken thee nor doth He hate thee,

translations.SAHIH: And the Hereafter is better for you than the first [life].
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily the latter portion will be better for thee than the former,

translations.SAHIH: And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied.
translations.PICKTHALL: And verily thy Lord will give unto thee so that thou wilt be content.

translations.SAHIH: Did He not find you an orphan and give [you] refuge?
translations.PICKTHALL: Did He not find thee an orphan and protect (thee)?

translations.SAHIH: And He found you lost and guided [you],
translations.PICKTHALL: Did He not find thee wandering and direct (thee)?

translations.SAHIH: And He found you poor and made [you] self-sufficient.
translations.PICKTHALL: Did He not find thee destitute and enrich (thee)?

translations.SAHIH: So as for the orphan, do not oppress [him].
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor the orphan oppress not,

translations.SAHIH: And as for the petitioner,1 do not repel [him].
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor the beggar drive not away,

translations.SAHIH: But as for the favor of your Lord, report [it].
translations.PICKTHALL: Therefor of the bounty of thy Lord be thy discourse.

translations.SAHIH: Did We not expand for you, [O Muḥammad], your breast?1
translations.PICKTHALL: Have We not caused thy bosom to dilate,

translations.SAHIH: And We removed from you your burden1
translations.PICKTHALL: And eased thee of the burden

translations.SAHIH: Which had weighed upon your back
translations.PICKTHALL: Which weighed down thy back;

translations.SAHIH: And raised high for you your repute.
translations.PICKTHALL: And exalted thy fame?

translations.SAHIH: For indeed, with hardship [will be] ease [i.e., relief].
translations.PICKTHALL: But lo! with hardship goeth ease,

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, with hardship [will be] ease.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! with hardship goeth ease;

translations.SAHIH: So when you have finished [your duties], then stand up [for worship].
translations.PICKTHALL: So when thou art relieved, still toil

translations.SAHIH: And to your Lord direct [your] longing.
translations.PICKTHALL: And strive to please thy Lord.

translations.SAHIH: By the fig and the olive1
translations.PICKTHALL: By the fig and the olive,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] Mount Sinai
translations.PICKTHALL: By Mount Sinai,

translations.SAHIH: And [by] this secure city [i.e., Makkah],
translations.PICKTHALL: And by this land made safe;

translations.SAHIH: We have certainly created man in the best of stature;1
translations.PICKTHALL: Surely We created man of the best stature

translations.SAHIH: Then We return him to the lowest of the low,1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then we reduced him to the lowest of the low,

translations.SAHIH: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have a reward uninterrupted.
translations.PICKTHALL: Save those who believe and do good works, and theirs is a reward unfailing.

translations.SAHIH: So what yet causes you to deny the Recompense?1
translations.PICKTHALL: So who henceforth will give the lie to thee about the judgment?

translations.SAHIH: Is not Allāh the most just of judges?
translations.PICKTHALL: Is not Allah the most conclusive of all judges?

translations.SAHIH: Recite in the name of your Lord who created
translations.PICKTHALL: Read: In the name of thy Lord Who createth,

translations.SAHIH: Created man from a clinging substance.
translations.PICKTHALL: Createth man from a clot.

translations.SAHIH: Recite, and your Lord is the most Generous -
translations.PICKTHALL: Read: And thy Lord is the Most Bounteous,

translations.SAHIH: Who taught by the pen
translations.PICKTHALL: Who teacheth by the pen,

translations.SAHIH: Taught man that which he knew not.
translations.PICKTHALL: Teacheth man that which he knew not.

translations.SAHIH: No! [But] indeed, man transgresses
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but verily man is rebellious

translations.SAHIH: Because he sees himself self-sufficient.
translations.PICKTHALL: That he thinketh himself independent!

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, to your Lord is the return.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! unto thy Lord is the return.

translations.SAHIH: Have you seen the one who forbids
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou seen him who dissuadeth

translations.SAHIH: A servant when he prays?
translations.PICKTHALL: A slave when he prayeth?

translations.SAHIH: Have you seen if he is upon guidance
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou seen if he relieth on the guidance (of Allah)

translations.SAHIH: Or enjoins righteousness?
translations.PICKTHALL: Or enjoineth piety?

translations.SAHIH: Have you seen if he denies and turns away -
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou seen if he denieth (Allah's guidance) and is froward?

translations.SAHIH: Does he not know that Allāh sees?
translations.PICKTHALL: Is he then unaware that Allah seeth?

translations.SAHIH: No! If he does not desist, We will surely drag him by the forelock1
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but if he cease not We will seize him by the forelock -

translations.SAHIH: A lying, sinning forelock.
translations.PICKTHALL: The lying, sinful forelock -

translations.SAHIH: Then let him call his associates;
translations.PICKTHALL: Then let him call upon his henchmen!

translations.SAHIH: We will call the angels of Hell.1
translations.PICKTHALL: We will call the guards of hell.

translations.SAHIH: No! Do not obey him. But prostrate and draw near [to Allāh].
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, Obey not thou him. But prostrate thyself, and draw near (unto Allah).

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We sent it [i.e., the Qur’ān] down during the Night of Decree.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We revealed it on the Night of Predestination.

translations.SAHIH: And what can make you know what is the Night of Decree?
translations.PICKTHALL: Ah, what will convey unto thee what the Night of Power is!

translations.SAHIH: The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months.
translations.PICKTHALL: The Night of Power is better than a thousand months.

translations.SAHIH: The angels and the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] descend therein by permission of their Lord for every matter.1
translations.PICKTHALL: The angels and the Spirit descend therein, by the permission of their Lord, with all decrees.

translations.SAHIH: Peace it is1 until the emergence of dawn.
translations.PICKTHALL: (The night is) Peace until the rising of the dawn.

translations.SAHIH: Those who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists were not to be parted [from misbelief]1 until there came to them clear evidence
translations.PICKTHALL: Those who disbelieve among the People of the Scripture and the idolaters could not have left off (erring) till the clear proof came unto them,

translations.SAHIH: A Messenger from Allāh, reciting purified1 scriptures
translations.PICKTHALL: A messenger from Allah, reading purified pages

translations.SAHIH: Within which are correct writings [i.e., rulings and laws].
translations.PICKTHALL: Containing correct scriptures.

translations.SAHIH: Nor did those who were given the Scripture become divided1 until after there had come to them clear evidence.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nor were the People of the Scripture divided until after the clear proof came unto them.

translations.SAHIH: And they were not commanded except to worship Allāh, [being] sincere to Him in religion, inclining to truth, and to establish prayer and to give zakāh. And that is the correct religion.
translations.PICKTHALL: And they are ordered naught else than to serve Allah, keeping religion pure for Him, as men by nature upright, and to establish worship and to pay the poor-due. That is true religion.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, they who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists will be in the fire of Hell, abiding eternally therein. Those are the worst of creatures.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! those who disbelieve, among the People of the Scripture and the idolaters, will abide in fire of hell. They are the worst of created beings.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds - those are the best of creatures.
translations.PICKTHALL: (And) lo! those who believe and do good works are the best of created beings.

translations.SAHIH: Their reward with their Lord will be gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever, Allāh being pleased with them and they with Him. That is for whoever has feared his Lord.
translations.PICKTHALL: Their reward is with their Lord: Gardens of Eden underneath which rivers flow, wherein they dwell for ever. Allah hath pleasure in them and they have pleasure in Him. This is (in store) for him who feareth his Lord.

translations.SAHIH: When the earth is shaken with its [final] earthquake
translations.PICKTHALL: When Earth is shaken with her (final) earthquake

translations.SAHIH: And the earth discharges its burdens1
translations.PICKTHALL: And Earth yieldeth up her burdens,

translations.SAHIH: And man says,1 "What is [wrong] with it?" -
translations.PICKTHALL: And man saith: What aileth her?

translations.SAHIH: That Day, it will report its news
translations.PICKTHALL: That day she will relate her chronicles,

translations.SAHIH: Because your Lord has inspired [i.e., commanded] it.
translations.PICKTHALL: Because thy Lord inspireth her.

translations.SAHIH: That Day, the people will depart1 separated [into categories] to be shown [the result of] their deeds.
translations.PICKTHALL: That day mankind will issue forth in scattered groups to be shown their deeds.

translations.SAHIH: So whoever does an atom's weight1 of good will see it,
translations.PICKTHALL: And whoso doeth good an atom's weight will see it then,

translations.SAHIH: And whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it.
translations.PICKTHALL: And whoso doeth ill an atom's weight will see it then.

translations.SAHIH: By the racers, panting,1
translations.PICKTHALL: By the snorting courses,

translations.SAHIH: And the producers of sparks [when] striking1
translations.PICKTHALL: Striking sparks of fire

translations.SAHIH: And the chargers at dawn,1
translations.PICKTHALL: And scouring to the raid at dawn,

translations.SAHIH: Stirring up thereby [clouds of] dust,
translations.PICKTHALL: Then, therewith, with their trail of dust,

translations.SAHIH: Arriving thereby in the center1 collectively,
translations.PICKTHALL: Cleaving, as one, the centre (of the foe),

translations.SAHIH: Indeed mankind, to his Lord, is ungrateful.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! man is an ingrate unto his Lord

translations.SAHIH: And indeed, he is to that a witness.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! he is a witness unto that;

translations.SAHIH: And indeed he is, in love of wealth, intense.
translations.PICKTHALL: And lo! in the love of wealth he is violent.

translations.SAHIH: But does he not know that when the contents of the graves are scattered
translations.PICKTHALL: Knoweth he not that, when the contents of the graves are poured forth

translations.SAHIH: And that within the breasts is obtained,1
translations.PICKTHALL: And the secrets of the breasts are made known,

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, their Lord with them, that Day, is [fully] Aware.1
translations.PICKTHALL: On that day will their Lord be perfectly informed concerning them.

translations.SAHIH: The Striking Calamity -
translations.PICKTHALL: The Calamity!

translations.SAHIH: What is the Striking Calamity?
translations.PICKTHALL: What is the Calamity?

translations.SAHIH: And what can make you know what is the Striking Calamity?
translations.PICKTHALL: Ah, what will convey unto thee what the Calamity is!

translations.SAHIH: It is the Day when people will be like moths, dispersed,1
translations.PICKTHALL: A day wherein mankind will be as thickly-scattered moths

translations.SAHIH: And the mountains will be like wool, fluffed up.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And the mountains will become as carded wool.

translations.SAHIH: Then as for one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds],
translations.PICKTHALL: Then, as for him whose scales are heavy (with good works),

translations.SAHIH: He will be in a pleasant life.
translations.PICKTHALL: He will live a pleasant life.

translations.SAHIH: But as for one whose scales are light,
translations.PICKTHALL: But as for him whose scales are light,

translations.SAHIH: His refuge1 will be an abyss.2
translations.PICKTHALL: A bereft and Hungry One will be his mother,

translations.SAHIH: And what can make you know what that is?
translations.PICKTHALL: Ah, what will convey unto thee what she is! -

translations.SAHIH: It is a Fire, intensely hot.
translations.PICKTHALL: Raging Fire.

translations.SAHIH: Competition in [worldly] increase diverts you
translations.PICKTHALL: Rivalry in worldly increase distracteth you

translations.SAHIH: Until you visit the graveyards.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Until ye come to the graves.

translations.SAHIH: No! You are going to know.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but ye will come to know!

translations.SAHIH: Then, no! You are going to know.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but ye will come to know!

translations.SAHIH: No! If you only knew with knowledge of certainty...1
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, would that ye knew (now) with a sure knowledge!

translations.SAHIH: You will surely see the Hellfire.
translations.PICKTHALL: For ye will behold hell-fire.

translations.SAHIH: Then you will surely see it with the eye of certainty.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Aye, ye will behold it with sure vision.

translations.SAHIH: Then you will surely be asked that Day about pleasure.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then, on that day, ye will be asked concerning pleasure.

translations.SAHIH: By time,1
translations.PICKTHALL: By the declining day,

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, mankind is in loss,
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! man is a state of loss,

translations.SAHIH: Except for those who have believed and done righteous deeds and advised each other to truth and advised each other to patience.
translations.PICKTHALL: Save those who believe and do good works, and exhort one another to truth and exhort one another to endurance.

translations.SAHIH: Woe to every scorner and mocker
translations.PICKTHALL: Woe unto every slandering traducer,

translations.SAHIH: Who collects wealth and [continuously] counts it.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Who hath gathered wealth (of this world) and arranged it.

translations.SAHIH: He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal.
translations.PICKTHALL: He thinketh that his wealth will render him immortal.

translations.SAHIH: No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Nay, but verily he will be flung to the Consuming One.

translations.SAHIH: And what can make you know what is the Crusher?
translations.PICKTHALL: Ah, what will convey unto thee what the Consuming One is!

translations.SAHIH: It is the fire of Allāh, [eternally] fueled,
translations.PICKTHALL: (It is) the fire of Allah, kindled,

translations.SAHIH: Which mounts directed at the hearts.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Which leapeth up over the hearts (of men).

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, it [i.e., Hellfire] will be closed down upon them
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! it is closed in on them

translations.SAHIH: In extended columns.1
translations.PICKTHALL: In outstretched columns.

translations.SAHIH: Have you not considered, [O Muḥammad], how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant?1
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou not seen how thy Lord dealt with the owners of the Elephant?

translations.SAHIH: Did He not make their plan into misguidance?1
translations.PICKTHALL: Did He not bring their stratagem to naught,

translations.SAHIH: And He sent against them birds in flocks,
translations.PICKTHALL: And send against them swarms of flying creatures,

translations.SAHIH: Striking them with stones of hard clay,
translations.PICKTHALL: Which pelted them with stones of baked clay,

translations.SAHIH: And He made them like eaten straw.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And made them like green crops devoured (by cattle)?

translations.SAHIH: For the accustomed security of the Quraysh1 -
translations.PICKTHALL: For the taming of Qureysh.

translations.SAHIH: Their accustomed security [in] the caravan of winter and summer1 -
translations.PICKTHALL: For their taming (We cause) the caravans to set forth in winter and summer.

translations.SAHIH: Let them worship the Lord of this House,1
translations.PICKTHALL: So let them worship the Lord of this House,

translations.SAHIH: Who has fed them, [saving them] from hunger and made them safe, [saving them] from fear.
translations.PICKTHALL: Who hath fed them against hunger and hath made them safe from fear.

translations.SAHIH: Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?
translations.PICKTHALL: Hast thou observed him who belieth religion?

translations.SAHIH: For that is the one who drives away the orphan
translations.PICKTHALL: That is he who repelleth the orphan,

translations.SAHIH: And does not encourage the feeding of the poor.
translations.PICKTHALL: And urgeth not the feeding of the needy.

translations.SAHIH: So woe to those who pray
translations.PICKTHALL: Ah, woe unto worshippers

translations.SAHIH: [But] who are heedless of their prayer1 -
translations.PICKTHALL: Who are heedless of their prayer;

translations.SAHIH: Those who make show [of their deeds]
translations.PICKTHALL: Who would be seen (at worship)

translations.SAHIH: And withhold [simple] assistance.
translations.PICKTHALL: Yet refuse small kindnesses!

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, We have granted you, [O Muḥammad], al-Kawthar.
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! We have given thee Abundance;

translations.SAHIH: So pray to your Lord and offer sacrifice [to Him alone].
translations.PICKTHALL: So pray unto thy Lord, and sacrifice.

translations.SAHIH: Indeed, your enemy is the one cut off.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Lo! it is thy insulter (and not thou) who is without posterity.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "O disbelievers,
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: O disbelievers!

translations.SAHIH: I do not worship what you worship.
translations.PICKTHALL: I worship not that which ye worship;

translations.SAHIH: Nor are you worshippers of what I worship.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nor worship ye that which I worship.

translations.SAHIH: Nor will I be a worshipper of what you worship.
translations.PICKTHALL: And I shall not worship that which ye worship.

translations.SAHIH: Nor will you be worshippers of what I worship.
translations.PICKTHALL: Nor will ye worship that which I worship.

translations.SAHIH: For you is your religion, and for me is my religion."
translations.PICKTHALL: Unto you your religion, and unto me my religion.

translations.SAHIH: When the victory of Allāh has come and the conquest,1
translations.PICKTHALL: When Allah's succour and the triumph cometh

translations.SAHIH: And you see the people entering into the religion of Allāh in multitudes,
translations.PICKTHALL: And thou seest mankind entering the religion of Allah in troops,

translations.SAHIH: Then exalt [Him] with praise of your Lord and ask forgiveness of Him. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of Repentance.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Then hymn the praises of thy Lord, and seek forgiveness of Him. Lo! He is ever ready to show mercy.

translations.SAHIH: May the hands of Abū Lahab be ruined, and ruined is he.1
translations.PICKTHALL: The power of Abu Lahab will perish, and he will perish.

translations.SAHIH: His wealth will not avail him or that which he gained.
translations.PICKTHALL: His wealth and gains will not exempt him.

translations.SAHIH: He will [enter to] burn in a Fire of [blazing] flame
translations.PICKTHALL: He will be plunged in flaming Fire,

translations.SAHIH: And his wife [as well] - the carrier of firewood.1
translations.PICKTHALL: And his wife, the wood-carrier,

translations.SAHIH: Around her neck is a rope of [twisted] fiber.
translations.PICKTHALL: Will have upon her neck a halter of palm-fibre.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "He is Allāh, [who is] One,1
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: He is Allah, the One!

translations.SAHIH: Allāh, the Eternal Refuge.1
translations.PICKTHALL: Allah, the eternally Besought of all!

translations.SAHIH: He neither begets nor is born,
translations.PICKTHALL: He begetteth not nor was begotten.

translations.SAHIH: Nor is there to Him any equivalent."
translations.PICKTHALL: And there is none comparable unto Him.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: I seek refuge in the Lord of the Daybreak

translations.SAHIH: From the evil of that which He created
translations.PICKTHALL: From the evil of that which He created;

translations.SAHIH: And from the evil of darkness when it settles
translations.PICKTHALL: From the evil of the darkness when it is intense,

translations.SAHIH: And from the evil of the blowers in knots1
translations.PICKTHALL: And from the evil of malignant witchcraft,

translations.SAHIH: And from the evil of an envier when he envies."
translations.PICKTHALL: And from the evil of the envier when he envieth.

translations.SAHIH: Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind,
translations.PICKTHALL: Say: I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind,

translations.SAHIH: The Sovereign of mankind,
translations.PICKTHALL: The King of mankind,

translations.SAHIH: The God of mankind,
translations.PICKTHALL: The God of mankind,

translations.SAHIH: From the evil of the retreating whisperer1 -
translations.PICKTHALL: From the evil of the sneaking whisperer,

translations.SAHIH: Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind -
translations.PICKTHALL: Who whispereth in the hearts of mankind,

translations.SAHIH: From among the jinn and mankind".1
translations.PICKTHALL: Of the jinn and of mankind.
